**start section**
number
    : 00C10002
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: call attachment facility control block (the CAB) indicated that a thread was present when it should not have been present.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Collect a DSNTRACE trace stream and request a SYSABEND or SYSUDUMP dump.
problem_determination
    p: This is probably a call attachment facility error.
user_response
    p: Notify your system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c10002.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C10003
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: call attachment facility received control after a nonstandard entry that did not use the call attachment facility language interface.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: This is probably a user error.
user_response
    p: Modify or repair your application so that DSNACA00, the main call attachment facility code will receive control only through the language interface.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c10003.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00C10005
msg_text
explanation
    p: The application program passed an ECB address of 0 to the call attachment facility on a CONNECT call. The trace message preceding the abend indicates whether the ECB was a start-up or termination ECB.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: See the Explanation above.
user_response
    p: Correct the application program that makes the CONNECT call to DSNALI. Ensure that the CONNECT call uses a valid ECB address.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c10005.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C10211
msg_text
explanation
    p: The call attachment facility (CAF) failed because the requestor's authorization ID has exceeded the maximum number of concurrent sessions allowed.
system_action
    p: The connection request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the value of the USER.CSDATA.DSNMUCTL defined for the primary authorization ID in RACF® and determine if that value needs to be updated.
problem_determination
    p > span: Db2® 12 for z/OS®
    p: in a Common Criteria environment (DSN6SPRM COMCRIT= YES) restricts the number of concurrent threads for a primary authorization ID based upon the custom field USER.CSDATA.DSNMUCTL.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c10211.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C10824
msg_text
explanation
    p: The previous
    p > span: Db2®
    p: connection was reset, and cleanup processing was performed. The call attachment facility is ready to process new connection requests.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: See the explanation for message DSNA824I in
    p > a: Call attachment facility trace messages
    p: .
user_response

sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c10824.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C10831
msg_text
explanation
    p: The call attachment facility (CAF) has detected a release level incompatibility between itself and
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . Either the current CAF or
    p > span: Db2
    p: release levels do not support coexistence, or the SPE level of the lower level release does not meet the compatibility requirements for coexistence between the two releases.
system_action
    p: The connection is not successful.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If CAF trace (DSNTRACE) is active, message DSNA831E will indicate the release levels of CAF and the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem.
user_response
    p: If you used JCL or a TSO logon procedure to invoke CAF, check to ensure that the correct
    p > span: Db2
    p: libraries are defined in your JOBLIB and STEPLIB allocations. See your system programmer if you invoke CAF using procedures that are supplied by your system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c10831.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C12001
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: RRSAF attachment facility function AUTH SIGNON was invoked by a program that was not APF authorized. This condition can indicate a security violation.
system_action
    p: The application is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: This is a user error.
user_response
    p: The AUTH SIGNON function can only be invoked from an APF authorized program. Either modify your program to use the RRSAF attachment facility function SIGNON which may be invoked from a non-authorized program, or contact your security administrator to make the changes required to make your program an APF authorized program.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c12001.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C12002
msg_text
explanation
    p: An abend has occurred during an attempt to access the caller-provided subsystem name parameter while executing in the PSW key of the caller. This is probably the result of a logic error in the requesting program.
system_action
    p: The application is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: This reason code is placed in register 15 during any access to caller-provided information. When any abend occurs, this register indicates which parameter caused the error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c12002.html

system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: This reason code is placed in register 15 during any access to caller-provided information. When any abend occurs, this register indicates which parameter caused the error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c12016.html

number
    : 00C12035
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: RRSAF attachment facility function SET_REPLICATION was invoked by a program that was not APF authorized. This condition can indicate a security violation.
system_action
    p: The application is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: The SET_REPLICATION function can only be invoked from an APF authorized or supervisor state program. Either modify your program to use the RRSAF attachment facility function SIGNON which may be invoked from a non-authorized program, or contact your security administrator to make the changes required to make your program an APF authorized program or to have your program run in supervisor state.

explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: RRSAF attachment facility function FIND_DB2_SYSTEMS was invoked with a
    p > var: ssnma
    p: and
    p > var: activea
    p: array size that is not large enough to contain the information on all the defined
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems on this LPAR.
system_action

    p > var: ssnma
    p: and
    p > var: activea
    p: arrays, and change the
    p > var: arraysz
    p: parameter to indicate the new size.

    p: Determine the value of the USER.CSDATA.DSNMUCTL defined for the primary authorization ID in RACF® and determine if that value needs to be updated.
problem_determination
    p > span: Db2 12 for z/OS®
    p: in a Common Criteria environment (DSN6SPRM COMCRIT= YES) restricts the number of concurrent threads for a primary authorization ID based upon the custom field USER.CSDATA.DSNMUCTL.

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c12231.html

explanation
    div > span: Db2®
    div: stored procedure DSNACICS issues this abend code when the JCL startup procedure for the stored procedure address space in which DSNACICS runs contains a DSNDUMP DD statement. DSNACICS takes an SVC dump when it generates an error message. At the time of the dump:
    div > ul > li: Register 2 contains the address of the message that was being generated.
    div > ul > li: Register 3 contains the address of the first parameter that was passed to DSNACICS.
    div > ul > li: Register 4 contains the address of the XPL parameter area that was passed to DSNACICX.

    p > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

number
    : 00C20069
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to perform the drain function on an object (a table space, an index space, or a partition) because a
    p > span: Db2
    p: member in the data sharing group was in the process of restarting.
system_action
    p: If the problem was encountered by
    p > span: Db2
    p: when trying to automatically recover a group buffer pool recovery pending (GRECP) object following the failure of a group buffer pool (GBP), then
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message DSNB350I or DSNB351I to the console with this reason code indicating that the object cannot be automatically recovered.
    p: Otherwise, a 'resource not available' return code, reason code and object name are sent back to the requesting function. DSNT501I is sent to the console to report the condition.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If DSNB350I or DSNB351I messages were issued, wait for the failed
    p > span: Db2
    p: member to complete its restart processing and then recover the GRECP objects as indicated in the "System Programmer Response" for DSNB350I or DSNB351I.
problem_determination

number
    : 00C2006A
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: was unable to perform the drain function on an object (table space, index space, or partition) because the object was held by one or more indoubt threads.
system_action
    p: If the problem was encountered by
    p > span: Db2
    p: when trying to automatically recover a group buffer pool recovery pending (GRECP) object following the failure of a group buffer pool (GBP), then
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message DSNB350I or DSNB351I to the console with this reason code indicating that the object cannot be automatically recovered.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the
    p > span: Db2
    p: DISPLAY DB CLAIMERS command to find the indoubt threads. If the threads have been left indoubt because
    p > span: Db2
    p: or a transaction manager was unable to automatically resolve the indoubts, you can use the
    p > span: Db2
    p: RECOVER INDOUBT command to resolve the indoubt thread and remove the indoubt claimer on the object (the
    p > span: Db2
    p: RECOVER INDOUBT command should only be used when automatic resolution does not work).
    p: If DSNB350I or DSNB351I messages were issued, then after you resolve the indoubt threads, recover the GRECP objects as indicated in the "System Programmer Response" for DSNB350I or DSNB351I.
problem_determination
user_response

    p: internal error. The caller of the buffer manager (BM) is trying to get a page latch for a page that belongs to one type of page set (index or data). However, the caller already holds a page latch on another page that belongs to a different type of page set.
system_action
    p: The requesting application process is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, print the SYS1.LOGREC, and request the SVC dump.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

number
    : 00C200B0
msg_text
explanation
    p: Typically, this indicates a problem internal to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , however the problem can result from errors in other products. The buffer address passed by the buffer manager (BM) invokers does not contain the requested page. The buffer manager detected this error by comparing the information stored in the buffer control block (BB) with the information passed with the buffer manager by its invokers. The information that is compared is the page set piece block, the page number, and the buffer address.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, print the SYS1.LOGREC, and request the SVC dump.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: The following general purpose registers (GPRs) contain the indicated diagnostic information:
    div > dl > dt > strong: GPR
    div > dl > dd > strong: Content
    div > dl > dt: 7
    div > dl > dd: Address of the page buffer
    div > dl > dt: 8
    div > dl > dd: Address of the page set block (PB)
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.

number
    : 00C200B3
msg_text
explanation
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error. The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2
    p: is unable to open a page set required by the requesting function. The page size or the page set piece size passed by the buffer manager invoker is invalid. The page set piece size is expressed by n, where 2 to the power of n is the total number of pages that can be contained within a page set piece. This error was detected during open page set processing.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, print the SYS1.LOGREC, and request the SVC dump.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error. The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2
    p: is unable to open a page set required by the requesting function. During the open page set processing, the page set options passed by the buffer manager invoker were in conflict with the same page set that was opened earlier. The page set options are the writing protocol (SYSTEM or UW), the recovery option (recoverable or unrecoverable), and the page size.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.

**start section**
number
    : 00C200C1
msg_text
explanation
    div: The page version number in the database page header is outside the valid range of values. This can be caused by one of the following errors:
    div > ul > li: Copying data sets improperly from another
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: subsystem.
    div > ul > li: In a CREATE TABLESPACE statement, specifying a VCAT catalog name that is the same as the name of an object in another
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem on the same processor.
    div > ul > li: Conditionally starting
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: to a prior time with an invalid RBA range.
    div > ul > li: Incorrect use of the REPAIR utility (modifying the page RBA).
    div > ul > li: The page was damaged by a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system error.
    div > ul > li: TOD clock values are out of synch between systems in a Parallel Sysplex®.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended. If DSNB1SWS issues the ABEND, then it is preceded by a DSNT500I message indicating which page is in error and a DSNI004I message indicating the page set is put in STOPE mode.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, print the SYS1.LOGREC, and request the SVC dump.
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div: The following general purpose registers (GPRs) contain the indicated diagnostic information:
    div > dl > dt > strong: GPR
    div > dl > dd > strong: Content
    div > dl > dt: 7
    div > dl > dd: Address of the page buffer
    div > dl > dt: 8
    div > dl > dd: Address of the page set block (PB)
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Dump of the index or table space that failed.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
user_response
    div: One of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: If the data set was copied from another
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem, run DSN1COPY with the RESET option to set the log RBAs in each page to 0.
    div > ul > li: If a table space was created with the wrong VCAT catalog name, drop the object and create it again.
    div > ul > li: If
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: was conditionally started with an invalid RBA range, correct the RBA range and restart
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: with conditions again.
    div > ul > li: If the page was damaged by the REPAIR utility, restore it with the RECOVER utility using the PAGE option.
    div > ul > li: If you are running data sharing, check the connectivity of the systems to the sysplex timers. The TOD clock values of all systems in the sysplex should all be within one microsecond. TOD clock values will not drift more than one microsecond apart unless a sysplex timer is malfunctioning.
    div > ul > li: Otherwise, inform your system programmer that you suspect an error.

msg_text
explanation
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error. The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2
    p: has discovered that the BM invoker is attempting to decrease the page's write intent count (WIC), but the invoker has no write intent request outstanding.

msg_text
explanation
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error. The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2
    p: discovered that its invoker was attempting to decrease the write dependency count (WDC) for a buffer. However, the buffer contains database updates that have not yet been written back to DASD. The buffer manager makes the buffer available for reassignment.
system_action

msg_text

    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error. The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2
    p: has discovered that the BM invoker is attempting to release a page that was not held by the invoker or the page has an unbalanced write intent (for example, reset write intent has not yet been issued prior to releasing the page).

number
    : 00C200D1
msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to perform I/O processing for the requesting function. A prior abend has occurred in the buffer manager I/O termination exit routine. An attempt to retry and to continue main line processing (after completion of processing of this prior abend) resulted in recursion to the I/O termination exit routine's functional recovery routine (FRR).
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, print the SYS1.LOGREC, and request the SVC dump. Restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The FRR parameter list was recorded in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA) when the original abend occurred. Examine the VRA to determine whether the media manager request block (MMRB) is properly passed by the media manager.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

msg_text
explanation
    p: A prior abend occurred in an I/O processing window of a buffer manager (BM) function. The required data is probably missing because the functional recovery routine (FRR) that is protecting the abending I/O processing function was bypassed by MVS™.

    p > span: Db2®
    p: is abended.

    p > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00C200E0
msg_text
explanation
    p: A table space or index space cannot be accessed because
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to create the referenced  buffer pool. The referenced  buffer pool size was zero, which indicates to
    p > span: Db2
    p: that this buffer pool should not be activated.
    p > span: Db2
    p: message DSNB602I was issued to inform the operator of the error. This reason code and the table space or index space name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA.
system_action
    p: An SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user. The SVC dump and the SYS1.LOGREC recording are not requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Analyze the virtual storage content of the
    p > span > span: ssnm
    p: DBM1 address space to determine further action. If appropriate, use the ALTER TABLESPACE or ALTER INDEX statement to modify the affected table space or index to indicate a usable buffer pool. To determine a usable buffer pool, use the DISPLAY BUFFERPOOL command. If necessary, use the ALTER BUFFERPOOL command to activate the failing buffer pool by setting its VPSIZE to a nonzero value.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200e0.html
**end section**

    : 00C200E1
msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to open a data set that is required to be accessed by the requesting function. An error was returned by the media manager CONNECT function, which was invoked to open a VSAM data set.
    p > span: Db2
    p: message DSNB204I was issued to inform the operator of the error condition. This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. Abend status is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Refer to system message IEC161I and
    p > span: Db2
    p: message DSNB204I for assistance in determining the cause of the error. Correct the situation, and notify the user to invoke the application again.
problem_determination
    p: The unexpected media manager return code is saved in register 8. It may help determine the cause of the failure.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.

number
    : 00C200E2
msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to open a data set that is required by the requesting function. An error was returned by the dynamic allocation function that was invoked to allocate a VSAM data set.
    p > span: Db2
    p: message DSNB207I was issued to inform the operator of the error condition. This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. Abend status is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The error code returned from the dynamic allocation function was externalized in the DSNB207I message. Refer to the appropriate MVS™ publication for an explanation of this error code. Correct the situation, and notify the user to invoke the application again.
problem_determination
    p: The unexpected dynamic allocation return code is saved in register 8. It may help determine the cause of the failure.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. Invoke the application again after the system programmer has corrected the error.

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200e2.html

number
    : 00C200E5
msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to perform the I/O operation on a data set that is required by the requesting function. A logical I/O error was detected by the buffer manager I/O functions. The logical I/O error indicates that a requested page (read operation) resides within the error page range of the data set. This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user.
operator_response
    p: Use the -DISPLAY DB command to obtain the error page range. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The error page range can be located from the console sheet or through the -DISPLAY DB command. Correct the error pages with the recovery utility, and notify the user to invoke the application again.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. Invoke the application after the system programmer has corrected the error.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to perform the I/O operation on a data set that is required by the requesting function. A permanent I/O error was detected by the media manager during preformat processing.     div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    p: Check the MVS™ console log for an IOS (I/O subsystem) error message indicating the type of I/O error that occurred. If an IOS message was issued, follow the problem determination directions for that message.

    p: Notify the system programmer. Invoke the application after the system programmer has corrected the error.

**start section**
number
    : 00C200E8
msg_text
explanation
    p: The  buffer pool (indicated in the SQLCA) cannot be created because of insufficient virtual storage. Message DSNB603I or DSNB605I was issued to inform the operator of the error. This reason code and the buffer pool ID are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: An SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user. The SVC dump and the SYS1.LOGREC recording are not requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Analyze the virtual storage content of the
    p > span > span: ssnm
    p: DBM1 address space to determine further action. If appropriate, use the ALTER TABLESPACE or ALTER INDEX statement to indicate use of a different buffer pool. Otherwise, use ALTER BUFFERPOOL commands to balance virtual storage usage for all buffer pools.
problem_determination
user_response

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200e8.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C200E9
msg_text
explanation
    p: A buffer could not be assigned in the  buffer pool (indicated in the SQLCA) because all buffers in the  buffer pool are in a nondisplaceable state. (Buffers are in a nondisplaceable state when they contain actively referenced pages or updated pages for which writes are pending.)
    p: Message DSNB601I was issued to inform the operator of the error. This reason code and the buffer pool ID are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: An SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user. The SVC dump and the SYS1.LOGREC recording are not requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Reduce concurrent activity by reducing the number of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: threads, or, if necessary, increase the size of the failing  buffer pool by using the ALTER BUFFERPOOL command.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200e9.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C200EA
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to perform the drain function on an object (a table space, an index space, or a partition) because the object was held by other claimers and the drain request timed out waiting for the claim count to reach zero.
system_action
    p: If the problem was encountered by
    p > span: Db2
    p: when trying to automatically recover a group buffer pool recovery pending (GRECP) object following the failure of a group buffer pool (GBP), then
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message DSNB350I or DSNB351I to the console with this reason code indicating that the object cannot be automatically recovered.
    p: Otherwise, a 'resource not available' return and reason code are sent back to the requesting function.
    p > span: Db2
    p: message DSNT500I
    p > span: may be
    p: sent to the console. The reason code and the object name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in the message.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Take one of these actions:
    div > ul > li: Reevaluate the utility timeout factor on installation panel DSNTIPI and increase it, if necessary.
    div > ul > li: Find the threads holding the object through the -DISPLAY DB CLAIMERS command on the object. Either terminate those threads or wait until no one holds the object. Then invoke the application again.
    p: If DSNB350I or DSNB351I messages were issued, then after you take one of the actions above, recover the GRECP objects as indicated in the "System Programmer Response" for DSNB350I or DSNB351I.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200ea.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C200EB
msg_text
explanation
    p: A data sharing group member is not able to perform a global drain request on an object (a table space, an index space, or a partition). One or more peer members in the group hold retained locks on the object. Message DSNT501I is sent to the console to report the condition.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' return code, reason code, and object name are sent back to the requesting function.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the DISPLAY DATABASE command with the LOCKS option to display the member names owning the retained locks. You must restart those subsystems to remove the 'resource unavailable' condition.
problem_determination
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00C200EC
msg_text
explanation
    p: A member of a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: data sharing group was unable to perform a global drain request on an object (a table space, an index space, or a partition). One or more peer DB2s in the group failed to drain the object because some error occurred. Both the
    p > span: Db2
    p: running the request and the peer
    p > span: Db2
    p: send
    p > span: Db2
    p: message DSNT500I to the console to report the problem.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' return code, reason code and object name are sent back to the requesting function.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Retrieve the DSNT501I messages from the console and analyze the corresponding reason and error codes.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200ec.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C200ED
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , in a data sharing environment, detected that the requested use of a type 1 index with a SUBPAGES value greater than 1 would have caused the index to become group buffer pool dependent.
    p > span: Db2
    p: does not allow type 1 indexes with a SUBPAGES value greater than 1 to become group buffer pool dependent.
system_action
    p: The use of the index is not allowed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: If the index is to be used in group buffer pool dependent mode, then either the index should be converted to a type 2 index or it should be converted to a type 1 index with SUBPAGES 1.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200ed.html
**end section**

    p > span: "resource not available"
    p: code is returned. This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the SQLCA and in message
    p > span: DSNT500I
    p: .

number
    : 00C200F0
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: encountered an error on an IXLCACHE request while trying to write a page to the group buffer pool during physical lock (P-lock) negotiation.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit abends. The error is recorded to SYS1.LOGREC, but the dump is suppressed and the abend is retried in the functional recovery. Another group member, requesting the P-lock that caused the negotiation on this member, receives a resource not available code of 00C20252, and its P-lock request is denied.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

number
    : 00C200F1
msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to unallocate a
    p > span: Db2
    p: data set. An error was returned by the dynamic unallocation function that was invoked to unallocate a data set. This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. The SVC dump and the SYS1.LOGREC recording are requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The unexpected dynamic unallocation reason code is saved in register 8. It may help determine the cause of the failure. Refer to the appropriate MVS™ publication for an explanation of the error code.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.

    div > ul > li > span: SYSLGRNG or SYSLGRNX
    div > ul > li: recording lock on a table space
    div > ul > li: Group buffer pool dependent conversion lock on a page set or partition

**start section**
number
    : 00C200F6
msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to open a data set that is required to be accessed by the requesting function. The data set has been migrated by DFHSM and the data set must be recalled before being accessed. Since the RECALL(yes) option was selected by the installation, a recall for the migrated data set has been initiated. A recall was not complete after the amount of time specified in the RECALL option had elapsed.
    p: This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages. The data set name and the reason code indicated are the last migrated data set requested. Other migrated data sets within the table space may exist. For each one that exists, a DSNT500I message containing the data set name and reason code has been sent to the console.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. A DSNT500I message is sent to the console.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: After the data set has been restored, rerun the application program, transaction, or query. If necessary, contact the operator to find out the status of the migrated data set.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200f6.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C200F7
msg_text
explanation
    div: The page found in the buffer is not the page requested by the buffer manager. The buffer manager detected the error by comparing the page number of the page returned with the requested page number. This error may be caused by one of the problems:
    div > ul > li: Either the VTOC or VVDS is damaged, causing multiple data sets to occupy the same extents on DASD.
    div > ul > li: The page was altered incorrectly by a non-
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: facility or a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: service aid.
    div > ul > li: An internal
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: error damaged the page. The recovery log will be required for problem determination.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, print the SYS1.LOGREC, and request the SVC dump.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: The following general purpose registers (GPRs) contain the indicated diagnostic information:
    div > dl > dt > strong: GPR
    div > dl > dd > strong: Content
    div > dl > dt: 7
    div > dl > dd: Address of the page buffer
    div > dl > dt: 8
    div > dl > dd: Address of the page set block (PB)
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    div > ul > li > span: VVDS dump of the volumes that contain the data set.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: REPAIR dump of the requested page.
    div > ul > li > span: DSN1LOGP detail report that contains log records associated with the damaged page.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200f7.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C200F8
msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to perform the I/O operation on a data set. A physical I/O error was detected by the buffer manager I/O functions.
    p: This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. A DSNB224I message is issued, unless it has already been issued 10 times for the data set.
    p: If the I/O is a write operation, or if the I/O is a read operation performed during restart or rollback, then the error page range of the data set is updated. A DSNU086E message is issued indicating the data set name and its corresponding I/O error page range, unless it has already been issued 10 times for the data set.
operator_response
    p: Use the -DISPLAY DB command to obtain the error page range. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The error page range can be located from the console sheet or with the -DISPLAY DB command. Correct the error pages with the recovery utility, and notify the user to invoke the application again.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    p: Check the MVS™ console log for an IOS (I/O subsystem) error message indicating the type of I/O error that occurred. If an IOS message was issued, follow the problem determination directions for that message.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. Invoke the application after the system programmer has corrected the error.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200f8.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C200F9
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to open a data set that the requesting function must access. The data set was migrated by HSM and must be recalled before being accessed.
    p > span: Db2
    p: attempted to initiate a recall of the migrated data set but was unsuccessful.
    p: This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages. The data set name and the reason code indicated are the last requested migrated data set. Other migrated data sets might exist. For each existing data set, message DSNT500I containing the data set name and reason code was sent to the console.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. A DSNT500I message is sent to the console.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Issue the HSM command (HRECALL) to restore the migrated data set. Rerun your application program, transaction, or query after the data set is restored.

    : 00C200FA
msg_text
explanation
    p: The buffer manager (BM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to obtain an open lock to perform a physical open or close of a page set. A timeout error was detected by the IRLM LOCK request. The reason code and the database and page set names are recorded in the cursor table (CT). They are made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
    p: A common reason for this failure is when IRLMRWT is less than RECALLD, and an HSM recall for the migrated data set exceeds IRLMRWT.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response

number
    : 00C200FE
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to open a data set that the requesting function must access. The data set was migrated by DFHSM and must be recalled before being accessed. Since the RECALL(no) option was selected by the installation, recall for the migrated data set was not initiated.
    p: This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages. The data set name and the reason code indicated are the last migrated data set requested. Other migrated data sets within the table space might exist. For each existing data set, message DSNT500I containing the data set name and reason code has been sent to the console.

**start section**
number
    : 00C200FF
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempted open of a page set failed because
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has reached the MVS™ limit on concurrent open data sets.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' (SQLCODE -904) is returned to the user and the requested open is not performed. This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA. A DSNB207I message is displayed on the operator console. The SVC dump and the SYS1.LOGREC recording are not requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Reduce the number of page sets that must be kept open by
    p > span: Db2
    p: by limiting the amount of concurrent activity.
problem_determination
    div: Collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c200ff.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20101
msg_text
explanation
    p: The sharing attribute is inconsistent between the header page of a data set and the DBD. This reason code and the data set name are made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A
    p > span: "resource not available"
    p: code is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: First determine whether the database is shared, and whether it is owned by this system. This can be achieved by issuing a SELECT on the SYSIBM.SYSDATABASE catalog table, where the database name is the database you are checking, and by examining the ROSHARE column.
    p: If the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: catalog indicates that it is a ROSHARE OWNER database, the problem can be corrected by the REPAIR utility or the -STOP DATABASE command. The -STOP DATABASE command will reformat the header page and make it consistent with the DBD.
    p: If the database is ROSHARE READ on this system, then check the definition of the database on the owning system. If, on the owning system, the database is no longer defined as ROSHARE OWNER, then the table space or index should be dropped on the system on which the error was detected, since the database has been altered to nonshared by the owning system. However, if the database is defined as ROSHARE OWNER on the owning system, then issue a -STOP DATABASE with the SPACENAM parameter from the owning system, which will make the header page consistent with the owner's DBD, and force this change to DASD, making it available to other systems.
    p: If it is a nonshared database, then the sharing attribute can only be corrected via the REPAIR utility.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20101.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20102
msg_text
explanation
    p: A read-only system attempted to access an inconsistent data set. This reason code and the data set name are made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A
    p > span: "resource not available"
    p: code is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: On the system in which the database is defined as ROSHARE OWNER, perform the following tasks:
    div > ul > li: Use the -DISPLAY DATABASE command to ensure there is no exceptional state for this table space or index.
    div > ul > li: Issue the -STOP DATABASE command with the SPACENAM parameter to stop this table space or index.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

url

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to access a data set because its
    p > span: system
    p: page is inaccessible. This reason code and the data set name are available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A "resource not available" code is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine why the
    p > span: system
    p: page is inaccessible by examining any error messages that appeared on the console at the time of the error, or by issuing a -DISPLAY DATABASE command. Take the appropriate action to correct the situation.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

number
    : 00C20104
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to access a shared data set because it was down leveled by a DSN1COPY job, or a REPAIR utility with REPLACE RESET specified. This reason code and the data set name are made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A
    p > span: "resource not available"
    p: code is returned to the user.

    div > ul > li: Use the -DISPLAY DATABASE command to ensure there is no exceptional state for this table space or index.
    div > ul > li: Issue the -STOP DATABASE command with the SPACENAM parameter to stop this table space or index.

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00C20105
msg_text
explanation
    p: The page set creation timestamp is inconsistent between the header page and the DBD. This reason code and the data set name are made available to the user in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A
    p > span: "resource not available"
    p: code is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: First determine whether the database is shared, and whether it is owned by this system. This can be achieved by issuing a SELECT on the SYSIBM.SYSDATABASE catalog table, where the database name is the database you are checking, and examining the ROSHARE column.
    p: For a data set in a ROSHARE OWNER database, if the failure occurs on a CREATE TABLESPACE or CREATE INDEX, the timestamp mismatch indicates that the table space or index was previously dropped, but
    p > span: Db2®
    p: was unable to delete the data set. In this case, the data set must be deleted using AMS DELETE CLUSTER before the CREATE can take place.
    p: For a data set in a ROSHARE OWNER database at any time other than CREATE TABLESPACE or CREATE INDEX, the inconsistent timestamp can be corrected by first stopping the table space or index via the -STOP DATABASE command with the SPACENAM parameter, and then issuing the -START DATABASE command to start it. The -STOP DATABASE command will reformat the header page using the information retrieved from the DBD.
    p: For a data set in a ROSHARE READ database, a timestamp mismatch indicates that the table space or index has been dropped and re-created on the owning system, and must also be dropped and re-created on this system.
    p: For a data set in a nonshared database, the timestamp value in the header page can only be corrected via the REPAIR utility.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20105.html
**end section**

number
    : 00C2010C
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: was unable to update the high-used RBA in the VSAM volume data set (VVDS) when it was ready to close a data set. VVDS must be updated to reflect data loaded by a RECOVER, LOAD, or REORG utility job.
    p > span: Message DSNB200I
    p: is issued to the console with the VSAM media manager
    p > span: return codes.
    p: This reason code and the data set name are recorded in the cursor table (CT) and made available in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user.
    p > span: A DSNB200I
    p: message is issued to the console.
    p > span: Db2
    p: continues to close the data set.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Refer to system messages IEC161I and
    p > span: Db2
    p: message DSNB200A for assistance in determining the cause of the error. Correct the condition, and notify the user to reinvoke the application.
problem_determination
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output that shows the attributes of all active log data sets for the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: member that failed.
user_response
    p: Contact the system programmer. Restart or rerun the RECOVER, LOAD, or REORG job after the system programmer corrects the error.

**start section**
number
    : 00C20110
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: cannot access a table space, index, or partition because the highest formatted page (as recorded by
    p > span: Db2
    p: in the header page) is higher than that derived from the VSAM high-used RBA.
    p: The reason code and the data set name for this error are available in the SQLCA or in messages.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: returns a 'resource unavailable' code to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: To enable access to the object, take one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Restore the object to a consistent state with the RECOVER or REBUILD utility, DSN1COPY, or some other means.
    div > ul > li: Replace the data using the LOAD REPLACE utility.
    div > ul > li: Allow access to the data in its current state. Use the REPAIR LEVELID utility to reset the high-used page number in the header page to be consistent with the VSAM high-used RBA. This may result in inconsistent data.
problem_determination
    p: Determine the high-formatted page number in the header page by running DSN1PRNT with the FORMAT option, and checking the value of HPGHPREF.
    p: You can also determine the VSAM high-used RBA by running an IDCAMS LISTCAT on the data set.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20110.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20111
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: attempted to access a striped data set with a page size of 8 KB, 16 KB, or 32 KB. The data set is defined with a 4 KB control interval (CI) size.
    p > span: Db2
    p: does not allow this because partial writes cannot always be detected.
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 is returned. The SQLCA contains a resource-not-available reason code and the data set name.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Ensure that the data set is defined with a control interval size that matches its page size.
problem_determination
    p: Run access method services LISTCAT to determine the data set attributes.
user_response
    p: Convert the control interval size of the associated table space from 4 KB to a control interval size that matches the page size. The REORG TABLESPACE, LOAD REPLACE, or RECOVER utility can be used to convert the control interval size for the table space.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20111.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20112
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to access a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: data set which was defined with incompatible Control Interval (CI) size. A compatible CI size is either 4K or the page size.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. This reason code and the data set name are made available to the user in the SQLCA.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Ensure that the data set is defined with the compatible CI size.
problem_determination
    p: Obtain an access method services LISTCAT for the named data set's attributes.
user_response
    p: Convert the data set attribute 'control interval size' of the associated table space from 4K CI into the one matching the page size.
    p > span: Db2
    p: Utilities REORG table space, LOAD with REPLACE, and RECOVER can be used to convert the table space.

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20112.html

number
    : 00C20113
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reached the limit for concurrent open data sets. The OPEN statement fails with this reason code when the number of concurrent open data sets reaches the greater of 32,768 or the value of the DSMAX subsystem parameter.
system_action
    p: SQLCODE
    p > span: -904
    p: is issued and the requested open is not performed. Reason code
    p > span: 00C20113
    p: and the data set name are recorded in the SQLCA. SVC dump and SYS1.LOGREC recording are not requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Take one of the following actions:
    ul > li: Reduce the number of data sets that must be kept open by
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: by limiting the amount of concurrent activity.
    ul > li: Increase the value of the DSMAX parameter

**start section**
number
    : 00C20203
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: cannot connect to a group buffer pool. The group buffer pool is not usable by this release of
    p > span: Db2
    p: . This
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is a member of a data sharing group containing
    p > span: Db2
    p: members of different release levels. A later release level of
    p > span: Db2
    p: specified an option for this group buffer pool that is not supported by the previous
    p > span: Db2
    p: releases. The presence of this option makes the group buffer pool inaccessible to the previous
    p > span: Db2
    p: releases.
system_action
    div > span: Db2
    div: takes the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Unless already issued, message DSNB301E is sent to the console with this reason code to indicate that a connect failure occurred.
    div > ul > li: SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user with this reason code. The resource type and resource name are also returned.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Take one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Issue the -ALTER GROUPBUFFERPOOL command from a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: that is at the later release level to remove the new option so that previous release levels of
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: can access the group buffer pool.
    div > ul > li: Migrate the previous release levels to the current release.
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Contact the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20203.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20204
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to connect to a group buffer pool because MVS™ detected a problem on the IXLCONN request.
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) and the group buffer pool name are returned to the user. Unless already issued for the IXLCONN code, message DSNB301E, which contains this reason code and the IXLCONN code, is issued to the console.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The reason code returned by the IXLCONN request is
    p > span: given in message DSNB301E.
    p: If the connection problem was caused by insufficient storage in a coupling facility, tell the MVS system administrator to alleviate the storage constraint problem by making additional storage available to the involved coupling facility, or by changing the active MVS CFRM administrative policy to redefine the coupling facility structure to a different coupling facility. Another alternative is to have the database administrator reassign those inter-
    p > span: Db2
    p: sharing page sets to a different
    p > span: Db2
    p: buffer pool.
user_response
    p: Contact the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20204.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20205
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to access a group buffer pool because of a damage assessment pending (DAP) status against the group buffer pool.
system_action
    div: The action
    div > span: Db2
    div: takes depends on the situation, as follows:
    div > ul > li: If
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: tries to read a page from the group buffer pool and finds that the group buffer pool is in DAP status, the following actions are taken:
    div > ul > li > ul > li: SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user with this reason code. The name of the group buffer pool is also returned.
    div > ul > li: If
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: tries to read a page from the group buffer pool for rollback, backout, or restart and finds that the group buffer pool is in DAP status, the following actions are taken:
    div > ul > li > ul > li: The page is added to the logical page list (LPL) for the page set.
    div > ul > li > ul > li: Message DSNB250E is issued to the console with this reason code.
    div > ul > li: If
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: tries to write a page to the group buffer pool and finds that the group buffer pool is in DAP status, the following actions are taken:
    div > ul > li > ul > li: The page is added to the logical page list (LPL) for the page set.
    div > ul > li > ul > li: Message DSNB250E is issued to the console with this reason code.
    div > ul > li: If
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: detects DAP status when it tries to connect the group buffer pool, or if
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: detects a group buffer pool version ID mismatch after a successful connection, the following actions are taken:
    div > ul > li > ul > li: The damage assessment process is triggered for this group buffer pool.
    div > ul > li > ul > li: SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user with this reason code. The name of the group buffer pool is also returned.
    div > ul > li > ul > li: Unless already issued, message DSNB301E, which contains this reason code, is issued to the console.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Message DSNB304I is issued when the group buffer pool is entered into DAP state and message DSNB305I is issued when the DAP status is cleared. During the damage assessment process,
    p > span: Db2
    p: must determine which page sets or partitions might have had changed pages in the failed coupling facility structure and need to be recovered. Each page set/partition fitting this criteria is entered into 'group buffer pool REBUILD pending (GRECP)' status. A page set/partition in GRECP status remains unavailable for read or update until it is recovered.
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Contact the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20205.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20206
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to access a page which is currently in the logical page list (LPL). LPL pages are unavailable until recovery on the affected page set completes.
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user with this reason code. The resource name is also given.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: For those page sets in the LPL, use the RECOVER utility or the -START DATABASE command.
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Contact the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20206.html
**end section**

    p: is unable to connect to a group buffer pool because of a
    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2
    p: problem.
system_action
    p: A SYS1.LOGREC entry is produced and an SVC dump is requested for the original abend which caused this condition. After doing resource and latch recovery,
    p > span: Db2
    p: retries the abend if retry is allowed. SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user with this reason code and the group buffer pool name. Unless already issued, message DSNB301E, which contains this reason code, is issued to the console.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

number
    : 00C20208
msg_text
explanation
    p: The user attempted to access a group-buffer-pool-dependent page set or partition. However, the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: member was unable to connect to the group buffer pool because there was not enough hardware system area (HSA) storage in which to allocate the local cache vector (LCV).
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: disconnects from the group buffer pool and issues message DSNB301E with this reason code, if it has not yet been issued. DSNB301E is usually preceded by a DSNB306I message.
    p: SQLCODE -904 is returned to the user with this reason code.

problem_determination

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00C20210
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to access a page set or partition which is currently in group buffer pool recovery pending (GRECP) status.
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned with this reason code. The resource name is also given. GRECP page sets or partitions remain unavailable until recovery against the affected page set or partition is complete.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Use the START DATABASE command with the ACCESS RW option to recover the page set or partition and remove the GRECP status. In extreme or unusual circumstances, you can also remove GRECP status as follows:
    div > ul > li: RECOVER, either to currency, or to a prior point in time
    div > ul > li: REPAIR SET with NORCVRPEND
    div > ul > li: LOAD REPLACE
    div > ul > li: START DATABASE with ACCESS FORCE (Not recommended. Specifying this option can result in inconsistent data.)
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Contact the system programmer to determine when the resource will be available for use.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20210.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20211
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to access a group buffer pool because the group buffer pool is rebuilding, and the attempt to access the group buffer pool timed out waiting for the rebuild to complete.
system_action
    p: 'Resource not available' return and reason codes are sent back to the requesting function.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the
    p > span: Db2
    p: DISPLAY GROUPBUFFERPOOL command or the MVS™ D XCF,STR command to monitor the status of the rebuild. Also, monitor the status messages that the
    p > span: Db2
    p: members issue as the rebuild progresses (refer to messages DSNB331I, DSNB332I, and DSNB338I). If the rebuild is not progressing satisfactorally, you can use the MVS command SETXCF,STOP,REBUILD to stop the rebuild.
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Resubmit the request.

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: received an unexpected return and reason code from the MVS™ IXLFCOMP macro for a group buffer pool.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends the agent and requests a dump. If the group buffer pool is in duplex mode, then
    p > span: Db2
    p: may stop duplexing for the group buffer pool in response to this error.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If the group buffer pool was duplexed and is entered back into simplex mode as a result of this error, and duplexing is not automatically reestablished, then use the MVS SETXCF command to enter the group buffer pool back into duplex mode if duplexing is needed. If DUPLEX(ENABLED) is specified in the active CFRM policy for the group buffer pool, then the system attempts to automatically reestablish duplexing for the structure.

    p > var: MVS/ESA Programming: Sysplex Services Reference

**start section**
number
    : 00C20230
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: could not establish duplexing for a group buffer pool because a coupling facility with CFLEVEL = 5 functionality was not available in which to allocate the secondary group buffer pool.
system_action
    p: The group buffer pool is entered back into simplex mode. Message DSNB741I is issued indicating the reason code as the reason why the process to establish duplexing failed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Upgrade the coupling facilities to CFLEVER = 5 or above. Or change the PREFLIST for the group buffer pool to name only coupling facilities that have CFLEVER = 5 functionality.

**start section**
number
    : 00C20232
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: could not establish duplexing for a group buffer pool because the group buffer pool is defined with GBPCACHE(NO).
    p > span: Db2
    p: does not allow GBPCACHE(NO) group buffer pools to be duplexed.
system_action
    p: The group buffer pool is entered back into simplex mode. Message DSNB741I is issued indicating the reason code as the reason why the process to establish duplexing failed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If duplexing is needed for the group buffer pool, issue the
    p > span: Db2
    p: ALTER GROUPBUFFERPOOL command to specify GBPCACHE(YES) before trying to initiate duplexing.

**start section**
number
    : 00C20233
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected a version id mismatch for the secondary group buffer pool when connecting to a duplexing group buffer pool. The version ID mismatch indicates that the process to establish duplexing completed prematurely (for example due to a system failure), and the secondary group buffer pool is not in synch with the primary.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: stops duplexing for the group buffer pool. The group buffer pool is entered back into simplex mode. Message DSNB743I is issued indicating the reason code as the reason why the process to establish duplexing was stopped. If DUPLEX(AUTO) is specified for the group buffer pool in the active CFRM policy, then duplexing is automatically reinitiated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If duplexing is needed for the group buffer pool and duplexing is not automatically reinitiated, then use the MVS™ SETXCF command to initiate duplexing for the group buffer pool.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20233.html
**end section**

    p > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to acquire or upgrade a physical lock (P-lock) because of an incompatible retained lock held by one or more other
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystems in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: data sharing group. Retained locks are locks that persist across
    p > span: Db2
    p: abnormal terminations.

    p: SQLCODE -904 is returned to the user. This reason code and the resource name are returned in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA.

    div > span: Db2

    div > pre > code: F irlmproc,STATUS,ALLD
