**start section**
number
    : 00C20257
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to obtain a physical lock (P-lock) because of an 'out of record list storage' condition that IRLM detected. The record list is that part of the coupling facility lock structure that IRLM uses to record 'modify locks' (those locks that would be retained in case of a failure).
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 is returned to the user with this reason code. This reason code and the resource name are returned in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Allocate a larger coupling facility lock structure by using the
    p > samp: MVS SETXCF,REBUILD
    p: command. Make sure that the active MVS™ CFRM policy specifies a larger structure size for the IRLM coupling facility lock structure before you initiate the rebuild. You can use the
    p > samp: MVS SETXCF,STOP,POLICY
    p: and
    p > samp: SETXCF,START,POLICY
    p: commands to change the active MVS CFRM policy. If lock size is not already at the current POLICY maximum size, you can increase lock size with the
    p > samp: SETXCF START, ALTER, STRNAME=
    p > samp > var: lock_structure
    p > samp: , SIZE=
    p > samp > var: new_size
    p: command.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c20257.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C20258
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is not able to obtain a physical lock (P-lock) until a peer member restarts. Another
    p > span: Db2
    p: holds the P-lock in an incompatible state but cannot downgrade until it completes its restart.
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user. This reason code and the resource name are made available to the user in the SQLCA.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Resubmit the failing application. The P-lock becomes available after the peer member completes its restart processing.

    p > span: Db2

number

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to obtain a physical lock (P-lock), because another member holding the lock has had logging suspended for an extended amount of time. The logging has been suspended because the active logs are full, or because there is an outstanding SET LOG SUSPEND command.
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 (resource not available) is returned to the user. This reason code, as well as the resource name, are returned in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA.

    p > span: -904
    p: SQLCODE.

    ol > li: Try the update operation again.

    : 00C2026E
msg_text
explanation
    p: An update to a table or index was not allowed because the object is in basic format with 6-byte RBA or LRSN values, and the RBA or LRSN that is required for the update is near the end of the 6-byte range.     p > span: -904
    p: SQLCODE.

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C202A5
msg_text
explanation
    p: The cache coupling facility structure attributes passed back by MVS™ on an IXLCONN request were incorrect.
system_action
    p: A SYS1.LOGREC entry is written. The newly-connected group buffer pool is disconnected.
    p: If this is a non-rebuild connect, then message DSNB301E, which contains this reason code, is issued to the console (unless it has already been issued). In the message this reason code and the group buffer pool name are returned to the user in the SQLCA.
    p: If this is a rebuild connect, then message DSNB330E, which contains this reason code, is issued to the console and this reason code is used to stop the rebuild.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Check the SYS1.LOGREC variable recording area (VRA) for which bit is set in
    p > span: "VRARRK30 - Error mask"
    p: :
    dl > dt > span: X'04'
    dl > dd: If bit
    dl > dd > span: X'04'
    dl > dd: is set, the number of allocated data elements was not sufficient to hold a single data page. VRARRK31 contains the allocated number of data elements. The number of required data elements depends on the page size of the buffer pool:
    dl > dd > div > table > thead > tr > th: Page size
    dl > dd > div > table > thead > tr > th: Number of data elements
    dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 4KB
    dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 1
    dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 8KB
    dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 2
    dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 16KB
    dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 4
    dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 32KB
    dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 8
    dl > dt > span: X'10'
    dl > dd: If bit
    dl > dd > span: X'10'
    dl > dd: is set, the allocated vector was not long enough to cover the corresponding buffer pool. VRARRK31 contains the requested vector length, and VRARRK32 contains the allocated vector length.
    dl > dt > span: X'20'
    dl > dd: If bit
    dl > dd > span: X'20'
    dl > dd: is set, the data element size was not allocated as
    dl > dd > span: Db2®
    dl > dd: requested. VRARRK31 contains the requested data element size, and VRARRK32 contains the allocated data element size.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202a5.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00C202A8
msg_text
explanation
    p: In connection to a group buffer pool structure,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: determined that insufficient space is allocated to hold any data pages. For example, the group buffer pool GBP32K contains only 16 KB or four 4 KB pages, which are not large enough to support one 32 KB buffer.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: disconnects from the structure, issues a
    p > span: DSNB301E
    p: message with this reason code (if not already issued), and returns this reason code and the GBP name to the user in the SQLCA. If this is a rebuild connect, then
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message
    p > span: DSNB335I
    p: , which contains this reason code, and this reason code is used to stop the rebuild.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Modify the z/OS® coupling facility resource management (CFRM) policy to make the group buffer pool structure larger, or use the -ALTER GROUPBUFFERPOOL command to reduce the value of the RATIO option to assign more space for data.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202a8.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C202AA
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred in IRLM on a physical lock (P-lock) or change request from
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . This a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested. SQLCODE -904 is issued. This reason code and the resource name are returned in the SQLCA.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine SYS1.LOGREC for a previous error related to IRLM.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields in the VRA for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, VRARRK15, VRARRK30, and VRARRK33.
    div: The information recorded with VRARRK30 is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: IRLM return code (4 bytes)
    div > ul > li: IRLM reason code (4 bytes)
    div > ul > li: IRLM function code (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Lock state (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Flags from RLPLFLG1 (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Flags from RLPLFLG4 (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Returned cached state (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Unused (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: P-lock exit reason code (2 bytes)
    div: VRARRK33 records information from the RLPPL (mapped by DXRRLPPL) and is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: RLPHSTAT (1 byte): Current held state of the P-lock by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPCCSTA (1 byte): New cached state of the P-lock for this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPRSTAT (1 byte): Requested state of the P-lock by the other
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: that is in conflict with the state held by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: Unused (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: RLPWUID (8 bytes): Owning work unit
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202aa.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C202AB
msg_text
explanation
    p: The IRLM UNLOCK request returned an error code when
    p > span: Db2®
    p: attempted to release a physical lock (P-lock). This is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit abends. The SVC dump and SYS1.LOGREC recording are requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Request the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields in the VRA for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, VRARRK15, VRARRK30, and VRARRK33.
    div: The information recorded with VRARRK30 is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: IRLM return code (4 bytes)
    div > ul > li: IRLM reason code (4 bytes)
    div > ul > li: IRLM function code (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Lock state (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Flags from RLPLFLG1 (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Flags from RLPLFLG4 (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Returned cached state (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Unused (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: P-lock exit reason code (2 bytes)
    div: VRARRK33 records information from the RLPPL (mapped by DXRRLPPL) and is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: RLPHSTAT (1 byte): Current held state of the P-lock by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPCCSTA (1 byte): New cached state of the P-lock for this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPRSTAT (1 byte): Requested state of the P-lock by the other
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: that is in conflict with the state held by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: Unused (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: RLPWUID (8 bytes): Owning work unit
user_response
    p: Resubmit the failing application.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202ab.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C202AC
msg_text
explanation
    p: There was an error during physical lock (P-lock) negotiation. This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error.
system_action
    p: An SVC dump and SYS1.LOGREC recording are requested. A 'resource unavailable' condition is returned to the P-lock requester that caused the conflict and the subsequent negotiation.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Request the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields in the VRA for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, VRARRK15, and VRARRK33.
    div: VRARRK33 records information from the RLPPL (mapped by DXRRLPPL) and is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: RLPHSTAT (1 byte): Current held state of the P-lock by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPCCSTA (1 byte): New cached state of the P-lock for this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPRSTAT (1 byte): Requested state of the P-lock by the other
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: that is in conflict with the state held by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: Unused (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: RLPWUID (8 bytes): Owning work unit
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202ac.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C202AD
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: could not start even one castout process. A probable cause is that no virtual storage is available to acquire private buffers for the castout process.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit abends and
    p > span: Db2
    p: terminates abnormally.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: after increasing the REGION parameter value on the
    p > span > span: ssnm
    p: DBM1 startup procedure to get more virtual storage.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202ad.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C202AE
msg_text
explanation
    p: IRLM returned an invalid cached state on a physical lock (P-lock) request from
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . This is an internal error.
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 is issued. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine SYS1.LOGREC for a preceding error related to IRLM.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields in the VRA for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, VRARRK15, VRARRK30, and VRARRK33.
    div: The information recorded with VRARRK30 is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: IRLM return code (4 bytes)
    div > ul > li: IRLM reason code (4 bytes)
    div > ul > li: IRLM function code (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Lock state (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Flags from RLPLFLG1 (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Flags from RLPLFLG4 (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Returned cached state (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Unused (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: P-lock exit reason code (2 bytes)
    div: VRARRK33 records information from the RLPPL (mapped by DXRRLPPL) and is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: RLPHSTAT (1 byte): Current held state of the P-lock by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPCCSTA (1 byte): New cached state of the P-lock for this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPRSTAT (1 byte): Requested state of the P-lock by the other
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: that is in conflict with the state held by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: Unused (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: RLPWUID (8 bytes): Owning work unit
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202ae.html
**end section**

number
    : 00C202B1
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred during physical (P-lock) negotiation. This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error.
system_action
    p: An SQLCODE -904 is issued. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested. This reason code and the resource name are returned in the SQLCA.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine SYS1.LOGREC for a previous error related to IRLM.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields in the VRA for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, VRARRK15, VRARRK30, and VRARRK33.
    div: The information recorded with VRARRK30 is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: IRLM return code (4 bytes)
    div > ul > li: IRLM reason code (4 bytes)
    div > ul > li: IRLM function code (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Lock state (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Flags from RLPLFLG1 (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Flags from RLPLFLG4 (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Returned cached state (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: Unused (1 byte)
    div > ul > li: P-lock exit reason code (2 bytes)
    div: VRARRK33 records information from the RLPPL (mapped by DXRRLPPL) and is mapped as follows:
    div > ul > li: RLPHSTAT (1 byte): Current held state of the P-lock by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPCCSTA (1 byte): New cached state of the P-lock for this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: RLPRSTAT (1 byte): Requested state of the P-lock by the other
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: that is in conflict with the state held by this
    div > ul > li > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

number
    : 00C202C0
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: timed out waiting for the use count on a group buffer pool to reach zero during rebuild quiesce processing for the group buffer pool. This is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal problem.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: system agent that is processing the rebuild abends and takes a dump. The rebuild is stopped. Message DSNB335I is issued indicating this reason code as the reason why the rebuild stopped.

**start section**
number
    : 00C202C1
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: encountered a problem trying to connect to the new group buffer pool coupling facility structure while trying to rebuild the group buffer pool.
system_action
    p: Depending on the nature of the error, a dump might be generated. The rebuild is stopped. Message
    p > span: DSNB335I
    p: is issued indicating this reason code as the reason why the rebuild stopped.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
user_response
    p: Check the console log for previous error messages (for example,
    p > span: DSNB330I
    p: or
    p > span: DSNB306I
    p: ) to determine why
    p > span: Db2
    p: could not connect to the new group buffer pool structure.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202c1.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C202C2
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: received an unexpected return and reason code from the MVS™ IXLREBLD macro during rebuild processing for a group buffer pool.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: system agent that is processing the rebuild abends and takes a dump. The rebuild is stopped. Message DSNB340I will be issued indicating that the IXLREBLD request failed and message DSNB335I is issued indicating this reason code as the reason why the rebuild stopped.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: See
    p > cite > span: MVS/ESA Programming: Sysplex Services Reference
    p: for an explanation of the MVS IXLREBLD reason code.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c202c2.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C202C5
msg_text
explanation
    p: During a cold start of a member of a data sharing group,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: performed a query for retained locks in order to determine whether a group buffer pool needed to be forced off, but the query failed.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends and takes a dump. The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is abnormally terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, print the SYS1.LOGREC, and request the SVC dump.
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p: The user has entered the ABEND subcommand of the DSN command processor. This causes a X'04E' abend and a dump to be requested. In order to retain the dump, you must have previously allocated a SYSUDUMP or SYSADUMP data set. The ABEND subcommand can be useful for debugging.
    div > span: Important:
    div: The ABEND subcommand is used for diagnostic purposes only, and is intended to be used only under the direction of
    div > span: IBM® Support
    div: . Use it only when diagnosing a problem with DSN or
    div > span: Db2®
    div: .

**start section**
number
    : 00C50102
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error probably occurred in
    p > span: Db2®
    p: while it attempted to process an IDENTIFY request from the DSN command processor. DSN received an unexpected return code (FRBRC1 or FRBRC2) from
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_action

    p > span: Db2
    p: dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.

**start section**
number
    : 00C50111
msg_text
explanation
    p: Your application program made an instrumentation facility component application program interface (instrumentation facility interface) call to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: language interface module DSNELI, but your application program was not running under the DSN command processor. You must run all application programs using DSNELI under DSN. To do this, first issue the DSN command, then start your application using the RUN subcommand of the DSN command processor, and finally, when the application completes, stop DSN with an END subcommand.
system_action
    p: Control returns to the application. Your application can continue processing. Further attempts at instrumentation facility interface (IFI) calls will continue to produce this return and reason code.
operator_response
    p: Notify your system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Modify the job to invoke DSN. Initiate the application program using the RUN subcommand of the DSN command processor.
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Rerun your application under the DSN command processor.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c50111.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C60001
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: received return code
    p > span: X'20'
    p: when issuing a WTO request to display a
    p > span: Db2
    p: console message. MVS™ sets this return code when there are no message buffers for either Multiple Console Support (MCS) or JES3, or when there is a JES3 WTO staging area excess. The WTO request is terminated. The current
    p > span: Db2
    p: console message and all subsequent
    p > span: Db2
    p: informational console messages are ignored until the MVS problem is corrected.
    p: At the time of the abend, general register zero contains the return code from WTO request.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC. A retry is requested and execution continues.
    p > span: Db2
    p: resumes issuing console messages when the condition is corrected.

number
    : 00C90067
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to add or update a row in a partitioned table space, but the value of the partitioning key is higher than the highest limit for any partition.
system_action
    p: The requested action is not performed. When SQL was involved, SQLCODE -327 is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Correct the SQL. If a REORG job with SHRLEVEL CHANGE was materializing pending limit key changes that reduced the highest limit key for the table, issue the TERM UTILITY command and resubmit the REORG job and specify SHRLEVEL REFERENCE. Alternatively, run REORG and specify SHRLEVEL CHANGE while avoiding SQL activity that exceeds the new limit key values.

    div > span: Db2®
    div: . This error might indicate inconsistent data or an error in internal
    div > span: Db2
    div: control structures or code. Possible causes of this error include:
    div > ul > li: The fast log apply child task was interrupted by an unexpected error condition.
    div > ul > li: An internal abend occurred in the Data Manager component.
    div > ul > li: The job or thread was canceled.

    p > span: Db2
    p: logs, or the job output.

    div > ul > li > span: Db2

number
    : 00C9007D
msg_text
explanation
    p: The compression dictionary for the table space or partition cannot be stored in the table space or partition. Therefore, the LOAD or REORG utility cannot complete successfully.
system_action
    p: The table space or partition is implicitly stopped by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . Messages DSNT501I and DSNI004I are displayed to inform the operator that the dictionary and the object for which the dictionary is defined are unavailable. An SQLCODE -904 is returned to the SQL user.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

**start section**
number
    : 00C9007E
msg_text
explanation
    p: The compression dictionary for the table space or partition was not successfully retrieved. Therefore, the data request failed.
system_action
    p: The table space or partition is implicitly stopped by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . Messages DSNT501I and DSNI004I are displayed to inform the operator that the dictionary and the object for which the dictionary is defined are unavailable. An SQLCODE -904 is returned to the SQL user.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Correct the problem and inform the user to resubmit the request.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00C9007F
msg_text
explanation
    p: The compression dictionary for the table space or partition is invalid. Therefore, the table space or partition cannot be opened.
system_action
    p: The table space or partition is implicitly stopped by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . Messages DSNT501I and DSNI004I are displayed to inform the operator that the dictionary and the object for which the dictionary is defined are unavailable. An SQLCODE -904 is returned to the SQL user.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Recover and start the table space or partition and tell the user to resubmit the request.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c9007f.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90080
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to allocate a resource for update operations. However, the resource was already started for read-only access.
system_action
    p: The allocation process is not allowed.
operator_response
    p: If this reason code appears in message DSNT501I, determine whether the named resource should be started for read-only access.
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 is issued, and/or message DSNT501I is issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    p: Determine when the resource is started for read/write access, and rerun the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90080.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90081
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to allocate a resource that is stopped for all access.
system_action
    p: The allocation process is not allowed.
operator_response
    p: If this reason code appears in message DSNT500I or DSNT501I, determine whether the resource should be stopped.
    p: If the resource should not be stopped, then use the -START DB
    p > var: db-name
    p: SPACENAM
    p > var: space-name
    p: command to start the object for R/W access.
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 or -923 is issued, and/or message DSNT500I or message DSNT501I is issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    p: Determine when the resource is no longer stopped, and rerun the job or resubmit the command.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90081.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C90082
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to allocate a resource that is already allocated to a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: utility function.
system_action
    p: The allocation process is not allowed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 or -923 is issued, and/or message DSNT501I is issued. The resource allocated to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: utility function might be either in use by a utility or reserved for a utility. If the resource is reserved for a utility, but not currently in use, the -DISPLAY UTILITY command will indicate that no utilities are operating on that object. To access a resource that is reserved for a utility, use the -TERM UTILITY command.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the log for this period, so that additional DSN1LOGP reports can be produced for problem determination.
user_response
    p: Determine when the resource is available and rerun the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90082.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90083
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to allocate a resource for update operations. However, the resource is already allocated to a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: utility function that allows other users to have read-only access.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: determines whether there is a utility function that would prohibit allocation of the resource. If it finds an indication of a such a utility, the allocation of the resource is not allowed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 or -923 is issued, and/or message DSNT501I is issued.
    p: The resource allocated to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: utility function might be either in use by a utility or reserved for a utility. If the resource is reserved for a utility, but not currently in use, the -DISPLAY UTILITY command will indicate that no utilities are operating on that object. The -DISPLAY DATABASE command shows which restrictive states
    p > span: Db2
    p: assigned to the resource in question. Utilities set a restrictive state (for example, UTRO) on the resource that they are processing, and then remove this state when the utility successfully completes. Therefore, if the -DISPLAY DATABASE command is issued after the successful completion of the utility, the restrictive state set by the utility is not displayed. To access a resource that is reserved for a utility, use the -TERM UTILITY command.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the log for this period, so that additional DSN1LOGP reports can be produced for problem determination.
user_response
    p: Determine when the resource is no longer restricted by a utility and is started for read/write access, and rerun the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90083.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90084
msg_text
explanation
    div > span: Db2®
    div: cannot find space for creating a temporary file or for inserting data into a temporary file because the work file database is full.
    div > span: Db2
    div: cannot perform the requested actions because of one of the following reasons:
    div > ul > li: You are running a large number of concurrent transactions requiring the use of temporary files.
    div > ul > li: No space is available in any of the table spaces in the work file database.
    div > ul > li: No space is available for sorting the data.
system_action
    p: The reason code appears in a DSNT501I message, and the requested operation is not performed, and SQLCODE -904 might be issued.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 is issued, and/or message DSNT500I is issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    p: To resolve the above situation, take one of the following actions:
    ul > li: Reduce the number of concurrent transactions.
    ul > li: Increase primary/secondary quantity defined for the table spaces in the temporary file database.
    ul > li: Increase space allocated to temporary file database.
    ul > li: Limit the amount of temporary storage in the work file database that a single thread can use by setting subsystem parameter MAXTEMPS to a non-zero value.
    ul > li: Enable warnings about excessive agent-level space usage in the work file database by setting subsystem parameter WFSTGUSE_AGENT_THRESHOLD to a non-zero value.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90084.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90085
msg_text
explanation
    p: The limit of 255 extensions for an internal
    p > span: Db2®
    p: work file has been reached.
    div: One of the following situations could be the reason:
    div > ul > li: Large number of concurrent transactions requiring use of temporary files.
    div > ul > li: Small primary/secondary quantity defined for table spaces in temporary file database.
    div > ul > li: Inadequate space allocated to temporary file database.
system_action
    p: The requested operation is not performed. Message DSNT501I is issued with reason code 00C90085 and is possibly followed by SQLCODE -904.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Source listing of the failing application program.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Precompiler listing of failing application program with SOURCE(YES) and XREF(YES) specified.
user_response
    div: To resolve the above situation, do one of the following:
    div > ul > li: Reduce the number of concurrent transactions.
    div > ul > li: Increase primary/secondary quantity defined for the table space(s) in the temporary file database.
    div > ul > li: Increase space allocated to temporary file database.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90085.html
**end section**

number
    : 00C90087
msg_text
explanation
    p: A page that is marked as 'broken' has been read. The database, table space or index space, and the page number are identified in NAME.
system_action
    p: The data manager function that detected this condition returns a 'resource not available' condition to its invoker. Access to the page is not be permitted until it is repaired.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 or -923 is issued, and/or message DSNT500I is issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    p: If the TYPE is '00000300', examine the name to determine if the page is in an index space or a table space. Use the REPAIR utility to fix the broken page.

**start section**
number
    : 00C90088
msg_text
explanation
    p: The resource identified by NAME in message DSNT501I is involved in a deadlock condition.
system_action
    p: The requested operation is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If the deadlock condition becomes chronic, examine the mix of applications running to determine why the deadlock is occurring.
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -911, -913, or -923 is issued, and/or message DSNT501I is issued.
    p: If statistics trace class 3 is active, IFCID 172 contains diagnostic information.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IRLM trace output.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the IRLM procedure.
    div > ul > li > span: Results from SELECT * from SYSIBM.SYSDATABASE.
user_response
    p: Rerun the application.
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90088.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C90089
msg_text
explanation
    p: The environmental descriptor manager (EDM) function of the data manager subcomponent did not have enough storage in its pool or data space to retrieve the object. The object can be either a database descriptor (DBD), a skeleton cursor table (SKCT), or a skeleton package table (SKPT). The object is identified by a DBD ID, SKCT plan name, or SKPT package name.
system_action
    p: The requested operation is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    div: The requested operation is not performed. One ore more of the following messages are also issued:
    div > ul > li: SQLCODE -904
    div > ul > li: SQLCODE -923
    div > ul > li: DSNT500I
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    div: Invoke the application again. If, after several attempts, EDM still reports that not enough space is available, take the following actions to reduce EDM storage requirements:
    div > ul > li: Reduce the number of concurrent users that are using
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: .
    div > ul > li: Try reducing the number of SQL statements in the plan or package and rebind.
    div > ul > li: Try to simplify the database design. For example, reduce the number of partitions in the database.
    p: If EDM storage shortage is a recurring problem, change the relevant subsystem parameters on installation panel DSNTIPC to increase the EDM pool size definition. Increase the number of concurrent users and the number of currently active databases. Then, restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
    p: If a utility that uses a LISTDEF list was run and that list includes a large number of databases, the EDM DBD pool might be full. To see the size of each database DBD, use the DISPLAY DATABASE command. If the EDM DBD pool is full, decrease the size of your LISTDEF contents to eliminate this condition. If this condition occurs frequently, increase the size of your EDM DBD pool. For guidance, see
    p > a: Calculating EDM pool sizes
    p: .
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90089.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C9008A
msg_text
explanation
    p: The database procedure installation exit identified by NAME could not be loaded for execution.
system_action
    p: The requested operation is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 is issued, and/or message DSNT500I is issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    p: Determine the reason the installation exit could not be loaded, correct the problem, and rerun the job.

number

msg_text
explanation
    p: The database descriptor's size (DBD) has reached the limit of 25% of the EDM Pool size.
system_action
    p: The request to create/alter a database object is not allowed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 is issued, and/or message DSNT500I is issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div: .
user_response
    div: Create the database object in a different database or drop unused database objects from the database. If you drop an object that is an index or a table space, the space becomes available in the DBD as soon as the drop is committed. If you drop an object that is a table, the space in the DBD is made available only after all of the following events:
    div > ul > li: The DROP is committed.
    div > ul > li: The
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: REORG is run on the table space and there is no point in time recover after the REORG.
    div > ul > li: MODIFY is run to delete all image copies of data that contains rows of the dropped table, that is, copies that were taken before the REORG. Note that MODIFY will reclaim space in the DBD only if there are SYSCOPY rows to delete.
sql_state

**start section**
number
    : 00C90090
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to lock a required resource failed.
system_action
    p: The operation is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed.
    p: If the resource type is table space, table, or index, then issue the -DISPLAY DATABASE command with the LOCKS option to get a list of jobs which currently hold locks on the required resource.
    p: If the resource type is a package, then wait for BIND activity on that package to complete before reissuing the failing request.
    p: If the problem persists after jobs which hold incompatible locks complete, gather diagnostic information to pursue the problem.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
user_response
    p: Wait for all jobs which hold a lock on the resource in an incompatible lock state to complete before reissuing the failing statement.

**start section**
number
    : 00C90092
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: received an out-of-storage indication from IRLM resulting from a lock, unlock, or lock change request.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC only when an abend is issued. No dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: IRLM has exhausted the amount of virtual storage available to it to represent locks. Insufficient virtual storage remains to satisfy this request. You can use the IRLM startup procedure to determine the amount of storage space available.
    p: The current mix of transactions caused all available storage to be used. You can find the number of locks held by a particular transaction by either using the
    p > span: Db2
    p: performance trace facility or by performing IRLM tracing.
    p: Determine what transactions were running and the number of locks they held. You might want to schedule some of these transactions at a different time.
    div: You can reduce the total number of page or row locks that applications concurrently hold by changing the locking protocol on one or more table spaces. Use one of the following statements:
    div > ul > li: ALTER TABLESPACE...LOCKSIZE ANY
    div > ul > li: ALTER TABLESPACE...LOCKSIZE TABLESPACE
    div > ul > li: LOCK TABLE
    p: If application logic permits, reduce the number of page or row locks concurrently held for SELECT statements by re-binding application plans with isolation level of cursor stability instead of repeatable read or read stability.
    div: You can reduce the total number of LOB locks that applications concurrently hold by changing the locking protocol on one or more LOB table space. Use one of the following statements:
    div > ul > li: ALTER TABLESPACE...LOCKSIZE TABLESPACE
    div > ul > li: LOCK TABLE statement
problem_determination
    div: One or more of the following messages or codes might be issued:
    div > ul > li: An SQLCODE -904 or -923
    div > ul > li: Message DSNT501I
    div > ul > li: An abend
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IRLM trace output.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the IRLM procedure.

number
    : 00C90093
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred in IRLM.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine SYS1.LOGREC for a preceding error related to IRLM.
problem_determination
    div: One or more of the following might be issued:
    div > ul > li: An SQLCODE -904 or -923
    div > ul > li: Message DSNT501I
    div > ul > li: An abend
    div: SYS1.LOGREC contains the same diagnostic information in the variable recording area (VRA) as shown for abend reason code '00C90101'. The first four bytes of CTSIWHY contain the return code from the IRLM function. The fifth byte of CTSIWHY contains the request code, as follows:
    div > dl > dt: X'02'
    div > dl > dd: Lock
    div > dl > dt: X'03'
    div > dl > dd: Unlock
    div > dl > dt: X'04'
    div > dl > dd: Change
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IRLM trace output.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the IRLM procedure.
    div: .

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90093.html
