**start section**
number
    : 00C90094
msg_text
explanation
    div: A data set is in a different state than
    div > span: Db2®
    div: expects, which might occur as a result of the following situations:
    div > ul > li: A data set was deleted and redefined, but
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: does not recognize the redefined data set.
    div > ul > li: A previous
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: failure damaged the data set in some way.
system_action
    p: The requested action is not performed. If the invoker of this module abends, a record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and the invoker might initiate a dump. If the invoker does not abend, no record is written, and no dump is requested. If this occurs, an SQL return code is issued, or message DSNT500I is issued, or both. The data set is placed in a stopped status unless the invoker of the module is a utility.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If you do not have the current level of the data set, you must perform
    p > span: Db2
    p: recovery to return the data set to its expected state. See the Problem Determination section of this message to learn how to determine the name of the data set to be corrected. Use the DISPLAY command to check the status of the data set. If the data set is stopped, use the START command before performing recovery.
problem_determination
    p: This error is detected at a time when
    p > span: Db2
    p: cannot determine the specific name of the data set involved. However, the SQL return code or message DSNT500I provides the name of the table space or index space where the data set resides. When the table or index space consists of a single data set, this is specific. Otherwise, the system programmer must find the particular data set within the table or index space.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
    p: If the code was received while processing a user table,
    p > span: Db2
    p: determined that the data set is empty. A DROP TABLESPACE statement followed by a CREATE TABLESPACE statement and a CREATE TABLE statement defines the dropped table to
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Use the IDCAMS LISTCAT for the failing
    p > span: Db2
    p: data set. Check the HI-USED-RBA for this data set; if HI-USED-RBA = 0, the data set is empty.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90094.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90095
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made during
    p > span: Db2®
    p: restart to access a page in order to apply a log record but
    p > span: Db2
    p: was unable to access the page. This abend reason code appears as the reason code in message DSNI001I.
system_action
    p: The restart of the named table space, index space, or partition is deferred by the subsystem.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Correct the problem, and then use either the -START DATABASE command or the RECOVER utility to make the table space, index space, or partition available.
problem_determination
    p: Examine previous messages on the console to determine why
    p > span: Db2
    p: could not access the page. One possible reason is that a back-level pack was mounted. That is, the page to which the log record applies was not yet formatted by VSAM.
    p > span: Db2
    p: does not extend data sets during restart.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Dump of the index or table space that failed.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90095.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90096
msg_text
explanation
    p: The page or row lock on the page or subpage identified by the NAME
    p > var: resource-name
    p: value in message
    p > span: DSNT500I
    p: or
    p > span: DSNT501I
    p: caused the total number of page or row locks concurrently held to reach the installation maximum number of page or row locks (NUMLKUS) allowed for a single agent in the system.
system_action
    p: The operation that encountered this condition is not executed. If a utility job encountered this condition, the utility is stopped. Otherwise, any database updates for the statement that was executing are backed out. Any database reads for the statement that was executing are not executed. The position of the cursor is unpredictable.
operator_response
    p: If a utility job encountered this resource unavailable condition, terminate the utility and restart it after the cause of the resource unavailable condition has been corrected.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the application should be able to run with the current page or row or locking protocol and SQL statements, increase the NUMLKUS value for the installation to allow a higher limit of page or row to be concurrently held by a single application. If a utility job encountered this resource unavailable condition, the NUMLKUS value must be increased to accommodate the utility, because utilities are programmed to use the minimum number of page or row locks possible.
problem_determination
    p: An SQLCODE
    p > span: -904
    p: and message
    p > span: DSNT500I
    p: or
    p > span: DSNT501I
    p: are issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    p: Rerun the application after correcting the cause of this resource unavailable condition.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90096.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90097
msg_text
explanation
    div: An attempt was made to allocate to a table space for update operations. However, the table space was marked as 'image copy' required, and updates are not allowed. This condition occurs as a result of any of the following operations:
    div > ul > li: Running a REORG LOG NO or LOAD LOG NO utility on the table space without running a copy that specifies FULL YES.
    div > ul > li: Execution of a RECOVER utility which specifies the TORBA or TOCOPY options, without following it with the required COPY utility.
    div > ul > li: Execution of a -TERM UTILITY command on a COPY utility that failed during the copy phase or was active in the copy phase. Until the COPY utility completes, SQL updates are not allowed because the integrity of the data would be compromised.
    div > ul > li: Execution of a MODIFY RECOVERY utility after all back up copies of the table space or data set were deleted from the SYSCOPY catalog table.
    div > ul > li: Execution of an ALTER TABLESPACE LOGGED command after updates on a not logged tablespace.
system_action
    p: The allocation process is not allowed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 and/or message DSNT501I is issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    p: Run the COPY utility. However, if the table space is to be used for read-only access, or if recoverability of the data is not required, instead of taking a full image copy you can run the REPAIR utility and request that the image copy required condition be removed.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90097.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90098
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to increase read-only or write-access counts of the utility in process beyond the maximum (255) allowed.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine why active utilities are in the stopped state. Use the -TERM UTILITY command to terminate utilities and reduce the UIP (utility in process) counts. If no active utilities are indicated, then use the -DISPLAY DATABASE command to show which table spaces or partitions are in a UTRO or UTRW state.
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNT500I is issued. For more information, refer to the explanation of message DSNT500I.
user_response
    p: Use the -DISPLAY UTILITY command to determine how many utility jobs are currently active. If a number of utility jobs are active but not in the stopped state, notify the system programmer. If the utility jobs are running, resubmit your job after they complete.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90098.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90099
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to load data into a partition, but the partition is full. Based on the high key value specified in the index for each partition, utilities instructed Data Manager to load a record into the proper partition. This required Data Manager to build a new page with a page number one higher than the last page in the partition. However, this new page is in the next partition.
    p: This situation usually occurs when a very large partition undergoes inserts and updates. When the table space or partition is reorganized, the page set is deleted and redefined, and the free space and PCTFREE cause the partition to expand. It might attempt to fit more data in the partition than the partition can now hold.
system_action
    p: The requested action is not performed.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the -TERM UTILITY command to terminate the load utility and reduce the UIP (utility in process) counts.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error.
user_response
    p: Redefine the high key values in the index and retry the load.
    p: If you receive this code during a reorganization, query the catalog to check the PCTFREE and FREEPAGE values. You might be able to decrease the amount of free space to allow the REORG utility to complete successfully.
    p: Alternately, you can terminate the utility and recover the table space. This approach can be time-consuming, but does not cause additional problems. When the recovery is complete, you can alter the partition key and run the reorganization again.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90099.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C9009A
msg_text
explanation

system_action

operator_response

system_programmer_response

    p > span > span > span: Db2®

**start section**
number
    : 00C9009B
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to load data into a nonpartitioned table space, but the table space is full. A nonpartitioned table space can contain a maximum of 64 GB of data.
system_action
    p: The requested action is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error.
user_response
    p: Use the -TERM UTILITY command to terminate the LOAD utility. Use ALTER TABLE SPACE to reduce the amount of free space within a page (PCTFREE attribute) and the number of free pages within the table space (FREEPAGE attribute). Then retry the load. If it is a resume load job, reorganize the table space before rerunning the load.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c9009b.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C9009C
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: An attempt was made to place data into a partitioned table space, partition-by-growth table space, index space, or fixed hash space, but the partition is full.
    p: For a table space partition, the data to be inserted is based on the high-key value that is specified in the cluster index. For an index space partition, the index entry to be inserted is also based on the high-key value that is associated with the index.
system_action
    p: A
    p > span: "resource not available"
    p: code is returned and the requested action is not performed. The SVC dump and the SYS1.LOGREC recording are not requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Take one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: If you received this reason code with message
    div > ul > li > span: DSNT501I
    div > ul > li: , redefine the partition that is identified in that message and resubmit the job.
    div > ul > li: If you received this reason code for a hash table, new system pages cannot fit in the fixed hash space. To correct this problem, reorganize the table space that contains the hash table to make room for system pages.
    div > ul > li: If you received this reason code for a partition-by-growth table space, the problem might be that the number of partitions cannot grow beyond the limit that is specified by MAXPARTITIONS. In this case, change the limit for MAXPARTITIONS.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c9009c.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C9009D
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to take one of the following actions, but the table space or index space was full:
    ul > li: Insert data into a nonpartitioned table space or index space.
    ul > li: Create a table or complete the definition of a table in the table space. In this case,
    ul > li > span: Db2®
    ul > li: attempted to insert a system page in the table space.
    p > span: A nonpartitioned table space, index space or LOB table space can contain a maximum of 64GB of data. A LOB table space can contain as many as 254 data sets per table space.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user and the requested action is not performed. The SVC dump and the SYS1.LOGREC recording are not requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The table space, index space, or LOB table space name is identified in the DSNT501I message. If the object is a table space or LOB table space, run the REORG TABLESPACE utility to attempt to reclaim additional free space. If the object is an index space, drop and re-create the index with a fewer number of SUBPAGEs. If free space cannot be reclaimed, notify the database administrator to redistribute the data into different table spaces, LOB tables spaces, or index spaces.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer to reclaim some free space in the associated table space, index space or LOB table space and rerun the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c9009d.html

    p: The object depends on new facilities of the release and is therefore unavailable for processing.     div > ul > li: For non-data sharing systems a re-migration is required.

    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: .

**start section**
number
    : 00C900A2
msg_text
explanation
    p: A READS call for IFCID 0306 included a request to convert returned log records to the format for the table space version in which the data was written. However, the log records could not be converted.
system_action
    p: Log records are returned, but the log records are not converted to the format for the table space version in which the data was written.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: In the output from the READS call, find field QW0306DG in the IFCID 0306 record. The value in that field contains information on why data version conversion was not performed. A common reason is 00C900B0, which means that information in a system page for a table space version could not be retrieved.
user_response
    p: Correct the problem that caused data conversion to fail. Then reissue the READS request.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900a2.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C900A3
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to allocate a table space, index space, or a related index space while the table space or index space was in check pending status.
system_action
    p: The operation is not allowed.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Resolve the check pending status and retry the operation.
    p: If the object is a table space with referential relationships, then run the CHECK DATA utility to check for referential integrity violations.
    p: If the object is a base table space with LOB columns, then run the CHECK DATA utility to validate the auxiliary columns.
    p: If the object is a LOB table space, then run the CHECK LOB utility to validate the structure of the LOB table space.
    p: If the object is an index space, then run the CHECK INDEX utility to verify that the index keys are consistent with the data in the table space or table space partition.
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 or -923 is issued.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900a3.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C900A4
msg_text
explanation
    div: An attempt was made to allocate a segment for a table in a segmented table space, but there are no free segments. A segmented table space can contain a maximum of 64GB of data. A segment will be allocated under one of the following conditions:
    div > ul > li: When a table is ready to be created in a segmented table space with the CREATE TABLE statement.
    div > ul > li: When a record is inserted/loaded into a segmented table and free space is not available from existing segments.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user and the requested action is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: An SQLCODE -904 is issued, and/or message DSNT501I is issued. The segmented table space name is identified in SQLCA and/or in the DSNT501I message. If the requested function is the CREATE TABLE statement, create the table in a different segmented table space. Otherwise, run the REORG TABLESPACE utility to attempt to reclaim additional free space. If no free space can be reclaimed, then notify the database administrator to redistribute the data into different table spaces.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer to reclaim some free space in the associated segmented table space and rerun the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900a4.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C900A5
msg_text
explanation
    p: One or more temporary files are full, or the maximum number of extensions for VSAM data sets has been exceeded for all temporary files, or the volumes have no space available in which to extend.
system_action
    p: The reason code appears in a DSNT501I message, and the requested operation is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. An SQLCODE -904 or message DSNT501I is issued, and/or message DSNT501I is issued.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div: Collect definitions of the temporary files that are involved in the error.
user_response
    div: If the reason code appears in a DSNT501I message, issue -DISPLAY THREAD to determine the total number of concurrent users. If there were a large number of users using temporary files, resubmit the job when concurrent users are low. IDCAMS LISTCAT may be used to determine the VSAM data sets space allocations.
    div > ul > li: If there was no space available on a volumes, then clear space from the volume(s) or add more volumes to the STOGROUP or redefine the VSAM data set to concatenate more volumes.
    div > ul > li: If the maximum number of extensions has been exceeded for VSAM data sets, ALTER or delete and redefine the temporary data sets with a larger size.
    div > ul > li: If all the temporary files are full, then create or define more temporary files.
    p: Issue the -START DATABASE command to start the temporary file.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900a5.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem currently serves as a remote site tracker system. Users cannot have write access for tracker systems, and a tracker
    p > span: Db2
    p: will not allow the use of any SQL statement that requires write access.

    p: cannot process the operation.

    p > span: Db2
    p: does not allow the use of any SQL statement that requires write access, such as DDL, GRANT/REVOKE, INSERT, DELETE, UPDATE, or MERGE.
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues SQLCODE -904 in conjunction with this message. You can also find more information in the description for message DSNT501I, which
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues along with this reason code.

    p > span: Db2
    p: does not allow the START DATABASE command to perform LPL/GRECP recovery. If you attempt a START DATABASE command on a tracker
    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00C900B0
msg_text
explanation
    p: While formatting log records in response to a READS request for IFCID 0306, the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: database manager could not format a log record to match the row format that was current when the log record was written. This situation might occur for one of the following reasons:
    ul > li: A schema-changing ALTER TABLE statement was issued, but no subsequent insert or update operation was issued. The alter operation generates a higher version number, but there is no insert or update operation to trigger an update to the system page.
    ul > li: An ALTER TABLE statement performed an update operation, but the update was not correctly registered in the table's system pages.
    ul > li: After the REORG utility was run on a table space, a READS request for IFCID 0306 was still processing the log records that were written before REORG was run. Running REORG had removed all system pages except the system page for the current version of the table space. However, when the
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: database manager processed the READS request, it attempted to retrieve system pages that existed before REORG was run.
system_action
    p: When this code is returned in the output from a READS request for IFCID 0306, log records are returned, but the data in the log records does not reflect the table space format that was current when the log records were written.
    p: If a replication product maintains the current and previous versions of the table definition, and the PTF for
    p > span: Db2
    p: APAR PI93252 is applied, the replication program converts the log record's data to the version that was current at the time the log record was written.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If a schema change prevents replication from starting or continuing, and a replication product does not maintain the current and previous versions of the table definition, try the following actions:
    ul > li: Apply the PTF for
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: APAR PI93252, if it is not already applied.
    ul > li: Update the source table definition in the replication product.
    ul > li: Remap the source table in the replication product.
    p: Refer to the documentation for the replication product for details.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900b0.html
**end section**

msg_text
explanation
    p: A request for a drain lock for the resource identified by NAME in messages DSNT500I and DSNT501I could not be granted. The request waited for a period longer than the maximum specified by the installation.
    p: Requests for claims might also receive this code because claims sometimes need to wait for drain locks.
system_action
    p: The requested action is not performed. The Data Manager function that detected this condition returns 'resource not available' to its caller.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: See SQLCODE -913 or -911 and/or message DSNT501I, which accompany this abend reason code.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see

    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
    p: Wait for all jobs that hold a drain lock on the resource in an incompatible state to complete before reissuing the failing statement. To display drain locks, issue a DISPLAY DB LOCKS command. In order to avoid a potential deadlock, the application should either commit or roll back to the previous COMMIT.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900ba.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C900BC
msg_text
explanation
    p: The statement depleted the record identifier (RID) storage available.
system_action
    p: The requested action is not performed.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Restructure the SQL statement so that fewer RIDs are needed. The best way to do this is to split the statement into two or more SQL statements equivalent to the original statement. Also, in some cases, increasing the virtual storage might eliminate the times when storage is depleted.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

**start section**
number
    : 00C900BE
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to acquire a lock on a resource because a
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: data sharing group holds an incompatible retained lock on that resource. Retained locks are locks that persist across
    p > span: Db2
    p: abnormal terminations. After a successful restart of a
    p > span: Db2
    p: member, retained locks can continue to exist for that member until all postponed abort threads have been processed.
system_action
    p: The requested action is not performed. SQLCODE -904 is issued. A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. This reason code and the resource name are returned in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK13, VRARRK14, and VRARRK15.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900be.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C900BF
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to obtain a lock because IRLM detected an 'out of record list' storage condition. The record list is that part of the coupling facility lock structure that contains the 'modify locks' (those locks that would be retained in case of a failure).
system_action
    p: SQLCODE -904 is returned to the user with this reason code. This reason code and the resource name are returned in the cursor table (CT) and made available to the user in the SQLCA. If it is active, an IFCID 0021 trace record is written and might contain additional diagnostic information.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: If this becomes a prevalent problem, you will need to redistribute the coupling facility lock structure storage resource to make more room for the record list. You can do this in one of two ways:
    div > ul > li: Issue a rebuild.
    div > ul > li: Dynamically change the lock structure size.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900bf.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C900C0
msg_text
explanation
    p: A request for an internal lock could not be granted. The request waited for a longer period than is allowed.
system_action
    p: The request action is not performed. A 'resource not available' reason code is returned to the caller.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: See SQLCODE -911 or -913 and/or message DSNT500I, which accompany this reason code.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
user_response
    p: If the user is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: utility, rerun or restart the utility. If it is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: command, reissue the command.
    p > span: Db2
    p: applications should either commit or roll back to the previous commit, then retry from the commit point.

url

**start section**
number
    : 00C900C1
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to allocate an index that has one or more logical partitions in a rebuild pending state.
system_action
    p: Use of the object is not allowed.
operator_response
    p: Determine when the REBUILD utility should be run to complete recovering the object. Only the logical partitions marked as rebuild pending need to be recovered.
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed because the index might be in an inconsistent state. An SQLCODE -904 or message DSNT501I is issued. For more information, refer to the SQL return code in
    p > a: SQL codes
    p: , or to the description of the DSNT501I.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the log for this period, so that additional DSN1LOGP reports can be produced for problem determination.
    div: .
user_response
    p: Determine when the resource is available for use and rerun the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900c1.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C900C5
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to access a table space that is in the auxiliary check pending state (ACHKP).
system_action
    p: The operation is not allowed.
    p > span: Db2®
    p: returns 'resource not available' to its invoker.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the CHECK DATA utility to identify the invalid LOBs. Use the SQL UPDATE statement to replace the invalid LOBs or the SQL DELETE statement to remove the rows with the invalid LOBs. After rectifying all invalid LOBs, run CHECK DATA again to clear the ACHKP state from the table space.
problem_determination
    p: An SQLCODE -904 is issued. Message DSNT500I or message DSNT501I might also be issued.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900c5.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C900C6
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected an uncommitted read or write claim on an index being altered in the same commit scope. When you use the PIECESIZE or COPY clause with the ALTER INDEX statement, then you need to have the read or write claim committed BEFORE you complete the operation.
    p: PIECESIZE does not allow an uncommitted write or read claim on the index.
    p: COPY, set to YES or NO, does not allow an uncommitted write on the index.
    p: Commit or rollback all changes to the index before using ALTER INDEX with one of these clauses.
system_action
    p: The ALTER INDEX statement is not allowed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The requested operation is not performed and SQLCODE -904 is issued. For more information, refer to the SQLCODE in "Section 2. SQL Return Codes". Commit or rollback changes to the index and retry the ALTER INDEX statement.
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed and SQLCODE -904 is issued. For more information, refer to the SQL return code in "Section 2. SQL Return Codes."
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900c6.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C900C7
msg_text
explanation
    div: The requested function was either:
    div > ul > li: not supported by the current release or maintenance level of
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: , or
    div > ul > li: deactivated by a modified the system parameters.
    div: In the former case, the NAME field of the accompanying message indicates the required level of maintenance. In the latter case, the NAME field indicates the deactivating system parameter.
system_action
    p: The requested action is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: To permit the use of the function, take the appropriate actions according to the situation. Apply the indicated maintenance, migrate to the indicated release of
    p > span: Db2
    p: , or use an alternate setting for the indicated system parameter.
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Inform the system administrator.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900c7.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C900C8
msg_text
explanation
    p: Access to the index is disallowed within the same commit scope as an ALTER TABLE statement that alters the key column in the index. If the ALTER TABLE statement failed, then commit the changes to the index and retry the ALTER TABLE statement. If an INSERT, DELETE, UPDATE, MERGE or SELECT statement failed, then commit the ALTER and retry the statement.
system_action
    p: The operation is not allowed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Commit and then retry the operation.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900c8.html

    : 00C900CC

explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: does not accept the NOBACKOUT request during the rollback of a non-global transaction while the backout of catalog changes is in progress.

number
    : 00C900E0
msg_text
explanation
    p: One of the following values on the header page of the data set does not match the information in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: catalog table for the same object:
    ul > li: Database ID (DBID)
    ul > li: Table space ID (PSID)
    ul > li: Table ID (OBID)
    p: This problem usually occurs after copying data by using DSN1COPY.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: returns SQLCODE -904. You cannot access the data.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Obtain the correct database ID, table space ID, or table ID from the catalog table of the target subsystem.
    p: Find the DSN1COPY job that might have caused this error. Ensure that the SYSXLAT DD statement that is used in that DSN1COPY job contains the correct IDs for each object to be translated. Then rerun DSN1COPY.

    : 00C900E1
msg_text
explanation
    p: One of the following values on the header page of the data set does not match the information in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: catalog table for the same object:
    ul > li: Segment size (SEGSIZE)
    ul > li: Page size (PAGESIZE)
    p: This problem usually occurs after copying data by using DSN1COPY.

    p > span: Db2
    p: catalog on the source subsystem matches the value on the target subsystem. Correct any inconsistent schemas between the two subsystems and rerun DSN1COPY.

**start section**
number
    : 00C900E3
msg_text
explanation
    p: The table schema definition or the table version number in the system page does not match the information in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: catalog table for the same object.
    p: This problem usually occurs after DSN1COPY is used to copy data.
    p: This code is generated if any of the following situations occur:
    ul > li: The information in the catalog indicates that there are fewer columns in the table than are within the rows of the table.
    ul > li: The version number is the same within the page set and the catalog, one or more columns does not have the same data type or length.
    ul > li: The version of the table recorded in the catalog is higher than the version number of the row, one or more columns does not have the same data type or length as indicated in the catalog, and conversion of the column page set data rows to match the definition in the catalog is not supported.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: returns SQLCODE -904. You cannot access the data.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Find the DSN1COPY job that might have caused this error, and use it to identify the source subsystem. Run REPAIR CATALOG TEST to obtain additional information. Additional information may be obtained for diagnosing the problem by running REPAIR CATALOG TEST. Ensure that the table schema definition that is defined in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: catalog on the source subsystem matches the definition on the target subsystem. Correct any inconsistent schemas, and rerun DSN1COPY. After the data is copied to the target subsystem, run the REPAIR CATALOG utility to correct most version number inconsistencies.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c900e3.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00C90101
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an internal error within
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . Possible causes for this error include:
    ul > li: Improper migration or fall back procedures.
    ul > li: The
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: directory and
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: catalog have been restored to different points in time.
    ul > li: A table space was restored improperly.
    ul > li: An error in internal
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: control structures or code.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run for the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: If this abend occurred while processing data in one or more pages, message
    p > span: DSNI014I
    p: is issued to identify each page involved. In general, the data in these pages is valid. However, if problems are reported that repeatedly involve the same pages or if the same pages are reported by other abends, analyze the set of pages specified.
    p: Run the CHECK INDEX utility to determine the extent of index inconsistency if:
    ul > li: The page type indicated in message
    ul > li > span: DSNI014I
    ul > li: is index.
    ul > li: The page type indicated in message
    ul > li > span: DSNI014I
    ul > li: is data.
    ul > li: An index is defined on a table in the indicated page set.
    p: The LOC keyword in the dump title gives the
    p > var: load-module
    p: .
    p > var: csect-name
    p: :
    p > var: qualifier
    p: of the location where the abend occurred. The value of
    p > var: qualifier
    p: is a unique, 4-digit hexadecimal number that identifies the place within the source control module (CSECT) where the abend was issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this abend code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9. The name of the CSECT involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    p: The
    p > var: csect-name
    p: value in the associated message can indicate possible causes or actions:
    dl > dt: DSNG
    dl > dt > var: xxxx
    dl > dd: If the
    dl > dd > var: csect-name
    dl > dd: value begins with DSNG, regardless of the
    dl > dd > var: xxxx
    dl > dd: portion of the name, make a copy of DSNDB01.DBD01, DSNDB01.SCT02, and DSNDB01.DSNSCT02 on tape with DSN1COPY. This might be a large copy.
    dl > dt: DSNIDBMF:5016
    dl > dd: An object is already in UTUT status, and a utility is trying to place UTUT status on the same object. The operation is denied with an abend. Two possible causes for this condition are:
    dl > dd > ul > li: SYSUTILX was re-initialized and the pending states were not resolved for each object by running the appropriate utility.
    dl > dd > ul > li: Two utilities ran against the same object with UTUT status.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: REPAIR dump of the pages identified in DSNI014I messages.
    div > ul > li > span: CHECK utility output.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

explanation

    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.

    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains the same diagnostic information in the variable recording area (VRA) as in abend reason code '00C90101'. Refer to the table accompanying that abend reason code for details.
    div: The '00C90103' abend reason code was issued because one of the checks described in the following list failed:
    div > ul > li: Save first and last byte of the input record. On return from exit, see if either group has been modified. If so, abend.
    div > ul > li: Check length of edited data. If greater than maximum allowed for this row, or less than one, abend.
    div > ul > li: Store a special character in the first byte past the end of the output area (place for edit procedure to put edited or (original unedited) row), to make sure the exit doesn't overrun this area. On return, check if it is still the same special character. If not, abend.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9.

number
    : 00C90105
msg_text
explanation
    p: An inconsistent page was detected. This has been caused by a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, an SVC dump is requested, and the page will be scheduled for automatic recovery. If automatic recovery is successful, message DSNB215I is issued. If automatic recovery fails, message DSNI012I is issued, and an abend '04E' with reason code 00C90102 will occur.
    div > span: Note:
    div: If the resource required for automatic recovery is in use, automatic recovery will be delayed until the resource is available.
operator_response
system_programmer_response

    ul > li: VRARRK9.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c9010f.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C90110
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. This may be caused by an inconsistency in either the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: catalog or the
    p > span: Db2
    p: directory. In this case, the OBD for the requested OBID cannot be located in the database descriptor (DBD). The DBD in storage may be inconsistent. Specifically, the OBDDMAP(OBID) array element should contain an offset into the DBD where the OBD should be located. However, in this case the OBD expected was not at the indicated offset.
    p: To prevent further damage and possible loss of data, the inconsistency must be corrected before any further SQL access is attempted to this database.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine which databases were being used when the error occurred. Prevent further SQL access to the databases.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The DBD in use at the time of the abend is inconsistent in storage and may be inconsistent on DASD. Since the nature and extent of the damage done to the DBD is not immediately known, an analysis of the entire DBD must be done.
    div: The inconsistency may be due to:
    div > ul > li: Incomplete recovery of
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: catalog and/or
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: directory.
    div > ul > li: Invalid restore of
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: catalog and/or
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: directory to a prior point in time.
    div > ul > li: A conditional restart that bypassed recovery of a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: catalog page set or a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: directory page set.
    div > ul > li: A
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Unformatted DSN1PRNT output of the DSNDB01.DBD01 page set. Use the method described in Part 5 of
    div > ul > li > span > span > cite: Diagnosis Guide and Reference
    div > ul > li > span: to locate the inconsistent DBD in the DSNDB01.DBD01 page set.
    div > ul > li > span: The results of the following SQL statements, where
    div > ul > li > span > var: dbid
    div > ul > li > span: is the DBID of the damaged DBD:
    div > ul > li > pre > code: SELECT * FROM SYSIBM.SYSINDEXES   WHERE DBID=
    div > ul > li > pre > code > var: dbid
    div > ul > li > pre > code: ORDER BY OBID; SELECT * FROM SYSIBM.SYSINDEXES   WHERE DBID=
    div > ul > li > pre > code > var: dbid
    div > ul > li > pre > code: ORDER BY ISOBID; SELECT * FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLES   WHERE DBID=
    div > ul > li > pre > code > var: dbid
    div > ul > li > pre > code: ORDER BY OBID; SELECT * FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLESPACE   WHERE DBID=
    div > ul > li > pre > code > var: dbid
    div > ul > li > pre > code: ORDER BY OBID; SELECT * FROM SYSIBM.SYSTABLESPACE   WHERE DBID=
    div > ul > li > pre > code > var: dbid
    div > ul > li > pre > code: ORDER BY PSID;
    div > ul > li > p: Use the results to compare the information in the
    div > ul > li > p > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > p: catalog with the DBD. Determine which OBDs are inconsistent with the
    div > ul > li > p > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > p: catalog. Use
    div > ul > li > p > span > cite: Diagnosis Guide and Reference
    div > ul > li > p: to analyze the DBD.
    div > ul > li > span: DSN1LOGP output with DBID (1) OBID (1F) covering the period of time in which the DBD inconsistency might have occurred. This period of time is approximately from the time of the abend back to the time when the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: catalog and DBD were believed to be consistent.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the log for this period, so that additional DSN1LOGP reports can be produced for problem determination.
user_response

msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. In this case, the OBD for the requested OBID does not exist. This may be caused by an inconsistency in either the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: catalog or the
    p > span: Db2
    p: directory. Specifically, the OBDDMAP(OBID) entry is zero rather than an offset to an OBD within the DBD.
    p: To prevent further damage and possible loss of data, the inconsistency must be corrected before any further SQL access is attempted to this database.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00C90124
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to apply prior-version/release
    p > span: Db2®
    p: log records other than checkpoint records.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run for the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This abend can occur in migration/remigration when some necessary migration/remigration steps are skipped. It indicates that some
    p > span: Db2
    p: activity occurred or was pending after the last complete checkpoint on the prior system. If this was the cause of the problem, it can be corrected by falling back to the prior version/release long enough to bring
    p > span: Db2
    p: up, then bring it down while conforming to all migration/remigration steps. Pay specific attention to resolving all indoubts and to performing a stop mode quiesce.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90124.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90205
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. In this case, a row obtained from an index entry does not point to a valid row in a data page. The error is probably caused by an extra index entry, but it could also result from a table update not being redone when it should have been.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run for the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I is issued to identify the index page. It identifies the database name, table space name, and index space name. This message is issued for all pages in use at the time of the abend. Within this group of pages, at least one page is involved in the inconsistency. The other pages were present at the time of the abend.
    p: Run the CHECK utility to determine the extent of index inconsistency if:
    ul > li: The page type indicated in message DSNI013I is index
    ul > li: The page type indicated in message DSNI013I is data
    ul > li: There is an index defined on a table in the indicated page set.
    p: The LOC keyword in the dump title gives the Load-module.CSECT:qualifier of the location where the abend occurred. 'Qualifier' is a unique, 4-digit hexadecimal number that identifies the place within the source module (CSECT) where the abend was issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this abend code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9.
    p: The name of the CSECT involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div > ul > li > span: CHECK utility output.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: REPAIR dump of the pages identified in DSNI013I messages.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90205.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90206
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. In this case, a row that should be pointed to by an index does not have an index entry. The error is probably caused by a missing index entry, but it could also be caused by a table update that was not backed out when it should have been.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run for the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I is issued to identify the data pages. It identifies the database name, table space name, and index space name. This message is issued for all pages in use at the time of the abend. Within this group of pages, at least one page is involved in the inconsistency. The other pages were present at the time of the abend.
    p: Run the CHECK utility to determine the extent of index inconsistency if:
    ul > li: The page type indicated in message DSNI014I is index
    ul > li: The page type indicated in message DSNI014I is data
    ul > li: There is an index defined on a table in the indicated page set.
    p: The LOC keyword in the dump title gives the Load-module.CSECT:qualifier of the location where the abend occurred. 'Qualifier' is a unique, 4-digit hexadecimal number that identifies the place within the source module (CSECT) where the abend was issued.
    p: Refer to
    p > a: ABEND codes associated with DSN1COPY misuse
    p: for further information on DSN1COPY misuse.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this abend code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9.
    p: The name of the CSECT involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div > ul > li > span: CHECK utility output.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: REPAIR dump of the pages identified in DSNI013I messages.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

**start section**
number
    : 00C90207
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. In this case, a pointer record does not point to a valid overflow record. The pointer record, the overflow record, or the page that contains the pointer or overflow record is in error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run for the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I is issued to identify the data pages. It also identifies the database name and the table space name. This message is issued for all pages in use at the time of the abend. Within this group of pages, at least one page is involved in the inconsistency. The other pages were present at the time of the abend.
    p: The LOC keyword in the dump title gives the Load-module.CSECT: qualifier of the location where the abend occurred. 'Qualifier' is a unique, 4-digit hexadecimal number that identifies the place within the source module (CSECT) where the abend was issued.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this abend code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9.
    p: The name of the CSECT involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: REPAIR dump of the pages identified in DSNI013I messages.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

number
    : 00C90210
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. In this case, the subpage directory of an index leaf page indicates that a given search key does not belong to any of the subpages. Either this leaf page is the index tree or the nonleaf portion of the index tree lead to this leaf page as the one that should contain the given key.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I is issued to identify the index page. It also identifies the database name and index space name. This message is issued for all pages in use at the time of the abend. Within this group of pages, at least one page is involved in the inconsistency. The other pages were present at the time of the abend.
    p: The LOC keyword in the dump title gives the Load module.CSECT:qualifier of the location where the abend occurred. 'Qualifier' is a unique, 4-digit hexadecimal number that identifies the place within the source module (CSECT) where the abend was issued.
    p: Refer to
    p > a: ABEND codes associated with DSN1COPY misuse
    p: for further information on DSN1COPY misuse.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this abend code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9.
    p: The name of the CSECT involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).

    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. In this case, a row has an unexpected OBID stored in its prefix. A possible cause is that the table space was restored (via DSN1COPY or similar tool) improperly. For example, the wrong data set was copied for the given table space.

number
    : 00C90214
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected a condition of inconsistent data. The description of the index in the index OBD does not match the attributes of an index page. The problems consists of one of the following conditions:
    ul > li: IPPNUNI does not equal OBDKNUNI,
    ul > li: IPPTLTH does not equal OBDKLEN,
    ul > li: IPPOLTH does not equal OBDLENO, or
    ul > li: If the page is a leaf page, the segmentation flag or number of subpages conflict (IPPNLPG does not equal OBDINLPG or IPPSEGM conflicts with OBDINLPG).
    p: The index space may have been improperly restored by using DSN1COPY or the wrong data set may have been copied for the given index.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I will be issued for each index page. It identifies the database, and the index name. This message is issued for all pages in use at the time of the abend. Within this group of pages, at least one page is involved in the inconsistency. The other pages were present at the time of the abend.
    p: The LOC keyword in the dump title gives the Load-module.CSECT:qualifier of the location where the abend occurred. 'Qualifier' is a unique, 4-digit hexadecimal number that identifies the place within the source module (CSECT) where the abend was issued.
    p: Refer to
    p > a: ABEND codes associated with DSN1COPY misuse
    p: for further information on DSN1COPY misuse.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this abend code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9.
    p: The name of the CSECT involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
