number
    : 00C90215
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected a condition of inconsistent data. The index manager subcomponent has been passed a key with a key length not equal to the key length in pages of the index. The index space may have been improperly restored by using DSN1COPY or the wrong data set may have been copied for the given index.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: A rebuild index or recover index will restore the index to a correct condition.
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I will be issued for each index page. It identifies the database, the index name. This message is issued for all pages in use at the time of the abend. Within this group of pages, at least one page is involved in the inconsistency. The other pages were present at the time of the abend.
    p: The LOC keyword in the dump title gives the Load-module.CSECT:qualifier of the location where the abend occurred. 'Qualifier' is a unique, 4-digit hexadecimal number that identifies the place within the source module (CSECT) where the abend was issued.
    p: Refer to
    p > a: ABEND codes associated with DSN1COPY misuse
    p: for further information on DSN1COPY misuse.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this abend code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9.
    p: The name of the CSECT involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.

    div > ul > li > span: DSN1COPY-generated copy, on tape, of the page set that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: directory. Alternatively, request a dump (produced by the REPAIR utility, DSN1COPY, or DSN1PRNT) of the DBD for each database identified in the DSNI013I messages.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 and ISDASDA0.
    div > ul > li > span: DSN1COPY-generated copy of the table and index, taken before any recovery is performed.
    div: .

    p: Notify the system programmer.

**start section**
number
    : 00C90216
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager has detected an inconsistent data condition. Either the length of a record in a table space is longer than the maximum-defined record length as defined in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: directory or a variable-length column has a longer length than the length defined in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: directory.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I is issued to identify the data page that contains the record that is longer than allowed by its corresponding record definition. This could occur if the
    p > span: Db2
    p: directory was recovered to a previous point, allowing new object creations (with a shorter record length) to be created having record identifiers identical to objects previously created in the table space. Also the table space may have been improperly restored by using DSN1COPY or the wrong data set may have been copied for the given table space.
    p: Refer to
    p > a: ABEND codes associated with DSN1COPY misuse
    p: for further information on DSN1COPY misuse.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: REPAIR dump of the pages identified in DSNI013I messages.
    div > ul > li > span: DSN1COPY-generated copy, on tape, of the page set that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: directory. Alternatively, request a dump (produced by the REPAIR utility, DSN1COPY, or DSN1PRNT) of the DBD for each database identified in the DSNI013I messages.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Detailed description of events prior to the abend, such as recovery or other activity affecting DSNDB01.DBD01 or the subject table spaces.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error. The object identifiers (OBIDs) identified with each table in the table space with the error can be obtained from SYSIBM.SYSTABLES.
    div: .
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90216.html

number
    : 00C90218
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition in a segmented table space. In this case, an unallocated segment was found on a segment chain.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run for the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I is issued to identify the space map page that contains the bad segment entry. The database name and table space name will also be identified.
    p: SYS1.LOGREC contains information in the variable recording area (VRA) of the system diagnostic work area (SDWA). Significant fields for this abend code are: VRARRK5, VRARRK6, VRARRK7, VRARRK8, and VRARRK9.
    p: The name of the CSECT involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    p: Refer to
    p > a: ABEND codes associated with DSN1COPY misuse
    p: for further information on DSN1COPY misuse.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error.
    div: .

msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition in a segmented table space. In this case, an allocated segment was found on a wrong segment chain (that is, a segment chain contains a segment that belongs to a different table).

    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested.

    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run for the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition in a segmented table space. In this case, the space map page indicates a data page that is not empty exists. However, the data page is either not formatted by the data manager or it is beyond the highest VSAM formatted area.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested.

number
    : 00C9021C
msg_text
explanation
    div: While running a utility, the data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. A row was encountered that is not represented by a record OBD in the database descriptor (DBD). This abend may indicate an internal
    div > span: Db2®
    div: error, but most likely occurs due to a user error. Possible user errors may include:
    div > ul > li: Data from a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem was copied to another
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem incorrectly. This is the most common error.
    div > ul > li: DSNDB01.DBD01 was regressed to a time prior to a table being created.
    div > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    div > span > span > span: Db2
    div > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    div > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    div > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    div > span > span > span: .
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested. The dump is required in the event that the problem is determined to be a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine if improper procedures were used to restore the table space or DBD that would lead to the inconsistency.
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I will be issued.
    div: If a
    div > span: Db2
    div: internal error is indicated, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: DSN1COPY of the user table space.
    div > ul > li: DSN1COPY of DSNDB01.DBD01.
    div: Also collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

**start section**
number
    : 00C9021D
msg_text
explanation
    p: During a LOAD/REORG utility or termination of a utility, the data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. A space map page was missing from the table space. This abend may indicate an internal
    p > span: Db2®
    p: error (caused by the utilities subcomponent passing a bad start position to the data manager), but most likely occurs due to a user error. Possible causes are that the table space data set has been deleted and redefined without
    p > span: Db2
    p: knowing, or that the table space was incorrectly restored from an improper DSN1COPY of the table space.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested. The dump is required in the event that the problem is determined to be a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine if the data set was improperly restored or deleted and redefined by the user.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I will be issued. If the message information describes page 'xx0001'X of the table space, this indicates that the data set was deleted and redefined without
    p > span: Db2
    p: knowing.
    div: If a
    div > span: Db2
    div: internal error is indicated, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of table spaces, tables, and indexes involved in the error.
    div > ul > li > span: DSN1COPY-generated copy of the index space or table space identified in the DSNI013I messages on tape.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c9021d.html

explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition in a segmented table space. An invalid page was requested. The page number is outside the highest formatted RBA for the page set. msg_text
explanation

number
    : 00C90220
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an inconsistent data condition. In this case, free index page cannot be found in the index space. The problem could be caused by a problem detected by IRLM, such as out-of-storage, or some other problem.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run for the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNI013I is issued to identify the data pages. It identifies the database name, table space name, and index space name. This message is issued for all pages in use at the time of the abend. Within this group of pages, at least one page is involved in the inconsistency. The other pages were present at the time of the abend.
    div: From the console output, determine if resource unavailable message DSNT500I/DSNT501I was given prior to the abend. If there is and the reason code given is 00C90092, 00C90093, or 00C90096, then refer to the description of the appropriate message in this book for more information. Otherwise, collect the following diagnostic items listed in
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
    div: . Also collect a DSN1COPY output of the tables and indexes before any recover is performed.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90220.html

**start section**
number
    : 00C90222
msg_text
explanation
    p: While starting
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , the data manager detected a utility in process (UTUT, UTRO or UTRW) state on an object that originated from Version 2 Release 3. This abend might indicate an internal
    p > span: Db2
    p: error, but most likely occurs because of a user error. A possible user error is a result of not terminating all utilities before migrating to this release.
system_action
    p: The -START
    p > span: Db2
    p: command fails. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested. The dump is required if the problem is determined to be a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine if an improper procedure was used to migrate to this release. If the utilities were not terminated before migrating, fall back to Version 2 Release 3 and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Use the -TERM UTILITY command to terminate utilities, use the -DISPLAY UTILITY command to make sure no utility job is currently active, stop
    p > span: Db2
    p: , and remigrate to this release.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Detailed description of events immediately prior to and during the abend.
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: log output, including any
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: recovery log archive tapes.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

**start section**
number
    : 00C90224
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to allocate a resource for update operations. However, the resource was already started for read and replication only access. The requested operation is not performed. SQLCODE -904 is issued, and/or message DSNT501I is issued.
system_action
    p: The allocation process is not allowed.
operator_response
    p: If this reason code appears in message DSNT501I, determine whether the named resource should be started for read and replication only access.
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Determine when the resource is started for read/write access, and rerun the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00c90224.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00C90301
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager detected an internal error with
    p > span: Db2®
    p: during RID LIST processing. The requested RIDMAP pointer can not be found in the specified CUB control block.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Collect the console output from the system on which the job was run from the period of time spanning the failure. Save this output for use in problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.

msg_text
explanation
    : An application tried to access a declared global temporary table that is in an inconsistent state. A declared global temporary table is marked inconsistent when both of the following statements are true:
    ul > li: The table is declared with the NOT LOGGED option.
    ul > li: A must-complete operation such as ROLLBACK encounters an unexpected error while processing the table. The operation marks the table inconsistent to prevent the application from further accessing the table and continues.
system_action
    : The requested action to access the declared global temporary table (for example, FETCH or INSERT) is not completed. The statement ends with SQLCODE -904.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    ul > li: Check the console log or the job output to identify the first unexpected error, such as an abend or another SQLCODE, and resolve the error.
    ul > li: If the application does not handle the SQLCODE -904 appropriately, modify the application to do so.
    : .

number
    : 00C90635
msg_text
explanation
    : An attempt was made to allocate to a table space partition for update operations. However, the table space partition is in a Persistent Read Only (PRO) restricted status, and updates are not allowed. This condition occurs as a result of using the REPAIR utility to set the PRO restricted status for the purpose of prohibiting updates.
system_action
    : The allocation process is not allowed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    : The requested operation is not performed. SQL error code
    span: -904
    : or message
    span: DSNT501I
    : is issued.
    p > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span: Db2
    p > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span: .
    p > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    ul > li: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time spanning the failure.
    ul > li: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    ul > li: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    ul > li: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and the system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    : Check with the
    span: Db2®
    : system administrator and the database administrator. Do not remove the PRO restricted status without their consent, because updates to the data might cause data loss.

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10010
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issues this reason code. The RANGE parameter on the OPEN request specifies the address of a 12-byte area (if FORMAT=V1) or 20-byte area (if FORMAT=V2 or is not specified) containing the log RBA range to be processed by subsequent GET requests. However, the RBA specified in the second 6 bytes or 10 bytes of the RANGE parameter (which indicates the end of the log RBA) is less than or equal to the RBA specified in the first 6 bytes or 10 bytes of the RANGE parameter (which indicates the start of the log RBA).
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10010 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user application program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Correct the RANGE RBA parameter input, and resubmit the request.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10010.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10011
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN and GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. During the initial processing of a FUNC=OPEN or FUNC=GET request, storage is obtained to contain the control blocks and other information required to process this request. An MVS™ GETMAIN failed when attempting to obtain the required storage.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN or FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10011 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: In all likelihood, the REGION parameter on the EXEC statement for the user program is too small. Increase the REGION size, and resubmit the user program.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10011.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10012
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The Job Control Language (JCL) for the user program that uses the DSNJSLR macro must specify either the use of the bootstrap data set (BSDS) or, in the absence of the BSDS, the active or archive data set(s) that is used in the processing. The FUNC=OPEN request failed because the BSDS or a log data set is not allocated for the job.
    p: If ACTIVE
    p > var: n
    p: or M
    p > var: xx
    p: ACT
    p > var: n
    p: data sets are used, the supplied DD names must start with the number 1 and increment by 1. For example, you must use ACTIVE1, ACTIVE2, ACTIVE3, and so on. You cannot use ACTIVE2, ACTIVE7, and ACTIVE9.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10012 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Correct the JCL and resubmit the user program.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10012.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10013
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. A VSAM OPEN error occurred while opening the bootstrap data set (BSDS).
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10013 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the OPEN request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The VSAM OPEN error return code is placed in SLRFRG15. The ACB error code (ACBERFLG) is placed in SLRFERCD.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the meaning of the VSAM OPEN error returned in SLRFRG15, and the ACB error code returned in SLRFERCD. Take appropriate action, and resubmit the FUNC=OPEN request.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10013.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10014
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The Job Control Language (JCL) associated with the user-written application determines how access to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: log data is achieved. Access can either be through the bootstrap data set (BSDS), or through the explicit inclusion of ddnames in the JCL for the active or archive log data set(s) which are to be examined. If the BSDS method is used, the user must specify a RANGE parameter on the FUNC=OPEN call. This reason code indicates that the user used the BSDS method, but did not specify the range of RBAs to be examined.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10014 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Two choices are available:
    div > ol > li: Continue to use the BSDS method of access. If this choice is made, then the FUNC=OPEN invocation must specify a range of RBAs to be examined by use of the RANGE parameter.
    div > ol > li: Replace the use of the BSDS method of access. This can be done be using explicit archive data set ddnames and/or active log data set ddnames in the JCL used to invoke the user-written application program.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10014.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10015
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The VSAM OPEN of the bootstrap data set was successful but the record format of the BSDS is invalid. An invalid BSDS is the result of a failure during a prior attempt to run conversion program DSNJCNVB or DSNJCNVT.
system_action
    p: In response to DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10015 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must, therefore, anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The procedure for running program DSNJCNVB or DSNJCNVT includes making a copy of the BSDS before conversion. Restore the BSDS to the original pre-conversion copy, and try the conversion again. When the BSDS data set is successfully converted, rerun the original application program.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10015.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10016
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. In the job control language (JCL) associated with the user-written application, MxxARCHV and/or MxxACTn DD statements were specified for a
    p > span: Db2
    p: member while MxxBSDS was also specified for the same member. However, the specification of MxxARCHV and MxxACTn DD statements is mutually exclusive with the specification of MxxBSDS DD statement for the same member.
system_action
    p: In response to DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10016 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services, and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Correct the JCL and rerun the job. Specify either the DD statements for the log data sets (MxxARCHV and MxxACTN) or the DD statement for the BSDS (MxxBSDS) for a given member; do not specify both.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10016.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10017
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The job control language (JCL) associated with the user-written application indicated that the logs from more than one
    p > span: Db2
    p: member were to be read in CI mode. However, CI mode is allowed only when reading the log of a single
    p > span: Db2
    p: system.
system_action
    p: In response to DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10017 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services, and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Either remove the CI mode from the OPEN request to read log records of more than one member or change the JCL to specify only one system's log to read its log in CI mode.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10017.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10018
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. In the job control language (JCL) associated with the user-written application, more than one
    p > span: Db2
    p: system's logs were identified. However, on the OPEN request an RBA range was specified. When reading logs from more than one
    p > span: Db2
    p: system, you cannot specify an RBA range; you must specify an LRSN range.
system_action
    p: In response to DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10018 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services, and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Correct the range specification on the OPEN request, and rerun the job. If range is specified when reading log records from multiple members, LRSN=YES must also be specified. Also range must be specified if GROUP DD or a MxxBSDS (BSDS) DD is specified in the JCL.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10018.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D10019
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. A VSAM OPEN error occurred while opening the bootstrap data set (BSDS). The error was determined to be one which could be corrected by use of an AMS VERIFY, but the VERIFY also failed.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10019 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the OPEN request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The VSAM return code from the original VSAM OPEN error is placed in SLRFRG15. The ACB error code (ACBERFLG) from the ACB used in the original VSAM OPEN operation is placed in SLRFERCD.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the meaning of the VSAM OPEN error returned in SLRFRG15, and the ACB error code returned in SLRFERCD. take appropriate action, and resubmit the FUNC=OPEN request.

**start section**
number
    : 00D10020
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The end of data has been reached (end of the log, end of the user-specified log data set(s), or end of the log RBA range specified by the RANGE parameter).
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10020 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: This is not an error; rather, this reason code denotes a normal end of data condition. No action is necessary.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10020.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10021
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. A gap in the log RBA range has been encountered when switching log data sets, indicating missing log records.
    p: This condition may or may not be intentional on the part of the user. Normally, a continuous set of log records are supplied as input by the ACTIVEn and ARCHIVE ddnames in the user's JCL. If a log data set was intentionally (or unintentionally) removed, this condition will arise.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10021 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). A pointer to the next log record following the gap is placed in SLRFFRAD.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: As mentioned above, this may or may not be an intentional error. Check the user's JCL to ensure that a continuous string of log records has been supplied. If the BSDS method is being used, use the print log map (DSNJU004) utility to examine the RBA ranges as recorded in the BSDS, and note any RBA gaps which may have resulted from the deletion of an active log data set or an archive log data set.
    p: If it appears that a log error may have occurred, execute the log print utility (DSN1LOGP) to attempt to obtain a detailed report of the log record(s) associated with the failure.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10021.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10022
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. A gap in the log RBA range has been encountered when switching log data sets, indicating missing log records, and the log RBA of the next record following the gap is greater than the end RBA of the RBA range specified by the RANGE parameter.
    p: This condition may or may not be intentional on the part of the user. Normally, a continuous set of log records are supplied as input by the ACTIVEn and ARCHIVE ddnames in the user's JCL. If a log data set was intentionally (or unintentionally) removed, this condition will arise.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10022 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). A pointer to the next log record following the gap is placed in SLRFFRAD.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: As mentioned above, this may or may not be an intentional error. Check the RBA range specified on the RANGE parameter to determine if the end RBA value was in error. Check the user's JCL to ensure that a continuous string of log records has been supplied. If the BSDS method is being used, use the print log map (DSNJU004) utility to examine the RBA ranges as recorded in the BSDS, and note any RBA gaps which may have resulted from the deletion of an active log data set or an archive log data set.
    p: If it appears that a log error may have occurred, execute the log print utility (DSN1LOGP) to attempt to obtain a detailed report of the log record(s) associated with the failure.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10022.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10023
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. A gap in the log RBA range has been encountered, and a conditional restart record has been found beyond a conditional restart truncation point. This condition exists when a log RBA gap was intentionally forced by the user as part of log truncation during conditional restart.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10023 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The length, address, and RBA of the conditional restart record are placed in fields SLRFRCLL, SLRFFRAD and SLRFRBA, respectively.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the print log map (DSNJU004) utility to examine the conditional restart control records and the RBA ranges of log data sets. Note any RBA gaps which may have resulted from the truncation of the log during a conditional restart.
    p: If it appears that a log error may have occurred, execute the log print utility (DSN1LOGP) to attempt to obtain a detailed report of the log record(s) associated with the failure.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10023.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10024
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. A log RBA sequence error has occurred. The RBA of the previous log record is greater than the RBA of the current log record.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10024 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). A pointer to the next log record following the gap is placed in SLRFFRAD.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The DD statements in the user's Job Control Language (JCL) must specify the log data sets in ascending log RBA range order. If both ARCHIVE and ACTIVEn DD statements are included, the first archive data set must contain the lowest log RBA value.
    div: Use the print log map (DSNJU004) utility to obtain a listing of the RBA ranges associated with each archive log data set and active log data set. If necessary:
    div > ul > li: Adjust the concatenation sequence of the archive data sets in the user's JCL to ensure that the log records are read in ascending RBA sequence.
    div > ul > li: Adjust the order of the active log data sets such that the RBA range is arranged in ascending order, starting with the ACTIVE1 ddname, and progressing through the ACTIVEn ddname.
    p: Following the above adjustments, resubmit the user's JCL.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10024.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D10025
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. A VSAM error occurred while reading an active log data set.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10025 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The VSAM GET error return code is placed in SLRFRG15. The RPL error code (RPLERRCD) is placed in SLRFERCD. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.

**start section**
number
    : 00D10026
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The GET processing was unable to locate a log data set containing the requested RBA.
    div: There could be several reasons for this error:
    div > ul > li: The RBA range supplied in the RANGE parameter may have exceeded the upper or lower bound of RBAs available on all active log data sets and all archive log data sets. This will normally occur when the user has specified the bootstrap data set (BSDS) method in the JCL.
    div > ul > li: The RBA range supplied in the RANGE parameter may have exceeded the upper or lower bound of RBAs available on the active log data sets and/or archive log data sets supplied in the user's JCL. This will occur when the user has supplied log data sets using the ACTIVEn and ARCHIVE ddnames.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10026 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA for which the GET request failed is placed in SLRFRBA.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: To resolve the problem, use the print log map (DSNJU004) utility to obtain a listing of the archive and active log data sets, and their corresponding RBA ranges. Check the user's JCL and the user's RANGE parameter to ensure that they are in harmony with one another. Correct the JCL and RANGE parameters as necessary, and rerun the application.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10026.html
**end section**

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. Both LRSN range and CI mode read were specified on the OPEN request when reading the log of a
    p > span: Db2
    p: system. However, when reading the log in CI mode, range can be specified only in RBA.
system_action

**start section**
number
    : 00D10029
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The BSDS data set of a member named in the BSDS data set pointed to by the GROUP DD statement cannot be allocated.
system_action
    p: In response to DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10029 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services, and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Make sure the BSDS data set of every member named in the BSDS data set pointed to by the GROUP DD statement is available for allocation. If the missing BSDS data set belongs to a member that is no longer active and its BSDS data set does not exist any more, then do not use GROUP DD to allocate required BSDS and log data sets. To read log records of other active members, specify a MxxBSDS DD statements for each active member. The print log map (DSNJU004) utility can be used to find the name of every member's BSDS data set.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10029.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D1002A
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The GET processing has requested an RBA in an active log data set which was previously not opened. A VSAM OPEN error occurred while opening the active log data set.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D1002A in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The VSAM OPEN error return code is placed in SLRFRG15. The ACB error code (ACBERFLG) is placed in SLRFERCD. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the meaning of the VSAM OPEN error returned in SLRFRG15, and the ACB error code returned in SLRFERCD. Take appropriate action, and then resubmit the application job.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d1002a.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D1002B
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The GET processing has requested an RBA in an active log data set which was previously not opened. A VSAM OPEN error occurred while opening the active log data set. The error was determined to be one which could be corrected; however, a system error occurred while executing an MVS™ TESTCB macro to determine whether the active log data set which had just been opened was a VSAM ESDS data set or a VSAM LDS data set.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D1002B in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The VSAM return code from the original VSAM OPEN error is placed in SLRFRG15. The ACB error code (ACBERFLG) from the ACB used in the original VSAM OPEN operation is placed in SLRFERCD. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the meaning of the VSAM OPEN error returned in SLRFRG15, and the ACB error code returned in SLRFERCD. Take appropriate action, and resubmit the application job.
    p: If the SLRFERCD field contains X'1001' (decimal 4097), then the error is the result of an inconsistency between the TESTCB parmlist generated in DSNJRS03 and the level of MVS under which the application program was executed. Contact IBM® for assistance if SLRFERCD reflects this value.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d1002b.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D1002C
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The GET processing has requested an RBA in an active log data set which was previously not opened. A VSAM OPEN error occurred while opening the active log data set. The error was determined to be one which could be corrected by use of an access method services VERIFY, but the access method services VERIFY failed.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D1002C in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The VSAM return code from the original VSAM OPEN error is placed in SLRFRG15. The ACB error code (ACBERFLG) from the ACB used in the original VSAM OPEN operation is placed in SLRFERCD. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Refer to the
    p > cite > span: z/OS DFSMS: Macro Instructions for Data Sets
    p: to determine the meaning of the VSAM OPEN error returned in SLRFRG15, and the ACB error code returned in SLRFERCD. Take appropriate action, and resubmit the application job.

**start section**
number
    : 00D1002D
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The GET processing has requested an RBA in an active log data set which was previously not opened. A VSAM OPEN error occurred while opening the active log data set. The open error was corrected by use of an access method services VERIFY, but a subsequent attempt to reposition the VSAM pointer back to the beginning of the active log data set (via access method services POINT) failed.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D1002D in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The VSAM return code from the original VSAM OPEN error is placed in SLRFRG15. The ACB error code (ACBERFLG) from the ACB used in the original VSAM OPEN operation is placed in SLRFERCD. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the meaning of the VSAM OPEN error returned in SLRFRG15, and the ACB error code returned in SLRFERCD. Take appropriate action (in most cases, the problem can be solved by use of an AMS VERIFY against the active log data set named in the SLRFDDNM field of the SLRF). Once the problem is solved, resubmit the application job.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d1002d.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10030
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET and CLOSE processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The stand-alone log services uses a request block to establish communication between itself and the invoking application program. The address to the request block is returned to the application program on a FUNC=OPEN call, and is required for all subsequent stand-alone FUNC=GET and FUNC=CLOSE calls in the RBR parameter. This reason code is returned to the invoking application when the RBR does not address a valid stand-alone request block. Subsequently, the application program's request cannot be processed.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET or FUNC=CLOSE call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10030 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: On a FUNC=OPEN call, the RBR value is returned in register 1. The application program must preserve this value for all subsequent stand-alone FUNC=GET and FUNC=CLOSE calls. Due to an application program logic error in the program which invokes the stand-alone log services, the RBR value has been compromised. Repair the application program, and resubmit the application job.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10030.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10031
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The GET processing has requested an RBA in a log data set which was previously not opened. The user's Job Control Language (JCL) has specified that the bootstrap data set (BSDS) be used as the guide to determining which log data sets are required. An attempt to dynamically allocate the appropriate log data set (via MVS™ SVC 99) failed.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10031 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The SVC 99 error code (S99ERROR) and information code (S99INFO) are placed in the SLRFRC and SLRFINFO fields, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Refer to the appropriate MVS publication to determine the meaning of the SVC 99 error code (S99ERROR) returned in SLRFRG15, and SVC 99 information code (S99INFO) returned in SLRFINFO. Take the appropriate action to correct the error, and resubmit the application job.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10031.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10040
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The GET processing has requested an RBA in an archive log data set which was previously not opened. An attempt is made to open the second file on the archive log tape (the first file normally contains the bootstrap data set, while the second is normally the archive log data set). If this first attempt failed because the archive log data set was not the second file on an archive tape, then the RDJFCB macro is used to change the data set sequence number from the default value of 2 to a value of 1, before the OPEN is attempted again. This reason code is generated when an error was returned from the RDJFCB macro.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10040 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RDJFCB error code is placed in SLRFRG15. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the meaning of the RDJFCB error code returned in SLRFRG15, take the appropriate action to correct the error, and resubmit the application job.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10040.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00D10050
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The bootstrap data set (BSDS) was erroneously specified as one of the ARCHIVE data sets in the user's Job Control Language (JCL). Consequently, the GET request failed.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 8 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10050 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA of the requested log record control interval is placed in SLRFRBA.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the user's JCL, and remove the occurrence of the BSDS data set as one of the concatenated ARCHIVE data sets. Resubmit the application job.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10050.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10061
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The log record control interval (CI) requested by the application program was read successfully from an active log data set or an archive log data set. However, the physical record length returned from reading the CI is not the expected length. The GET function will complete, but will issue this reason code as a warning.
    p: The length of a log CI in an active log data set is expected to be 4089 bytes. The length of a log CI in an archive log data set is expected to be 4096 bytes.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10061 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. The GET function will complete, but will issue this reason code as a warning.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The length and address of the CI are placed in fields SLRFRCLL and SLRFFRAD, respectively. The RBA associated with the CI is placed in SLRFRBA. The 'ddname' of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The RDF/CIDF control information in the CI has been compromised. If the SLRFRCLL field indicates a value greater than expected, then the data within the CI can still be used by the application program. If the SLRFRCLL field indicates a value less than expected, then the data within the CI in all likelihood can still be used, but with caution (additional error checking routines may be required by the user program).
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10061.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10062
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The requested record was found to be a middle spanned record segment, but a preceding first record segment does not exist. The GET function will complete, but will issue this reason code as a warning.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10062 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. The GET function will complete, but will issue this reason code as a warning.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The length and address of the requested record are placed in fields SLRFRCLL and SLRFFRAD, respectively. The RBA associated with the log record segment is placed in SLRFRBA. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Several possibilities exist for the cause of this condition:
    div > ul > li: The Recovery Log Manager component of
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: did not originally construct the LRH properly.
    div > ul > li: The log record header (LRH) for the log record segment was damaged after it was written by the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem.
    div > ul > li: The application program continued to process after receipt of a 00D10021 reason code (gap in the log).
    p: If the error was caused by the application program, modifications to the application program may be required.
    p: If the error is a suspected
    p > span: Db2
    p: problem, run the log print (DSN1LOGP) utility, specifying a range of RBAs which would encompass the problem RBA. Determine if the LRH of the log record segment is truly in error by looking at the record segments directly preceding and after the record segment in question.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10062.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10063
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. The requested record was found to be a last spanned record segment, but a preceding first record segment does not exist. The GET function will complete, but will issue this reason code as a warning.
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10063 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. The GET function will complete, but will issue this reason code as a warning.
    p: Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The length and address of the requested record are placed in fields SLRFRCLL and SLRFFRAD, respectively. The RBA associated with the log record segment is placed in SLRFRBA. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must therefore anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Several possibilities exist for the cause of this condition:
    div > ul > li: The Recovery Log Manager component of
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: did not originally construct the log record header (LRH) properly.
    div > ul > li: The LRH for the log record segment was damaged after it was written by the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem.
    div > ul > li: The application program continued to process after receipt of a 00D10021 reason code (gap in the log).
    div > ul > li: Striped logs are mirrored to a remote site, individual control intervals were propagated in a different order than they were originally written, and the propagated copy did not reach a point of consistency.
    p: If the error was caused by the application program, modifications to the application program may be required.
    p: If the error is a suspected
    p > span: Db2
    p: problem, run the log print (DSN1LOGP) utility, specifying a range of RBAs which would encompass the problem RBA. Determine if the LRH of the log record segment is truly in error by looking at the record segments directly preceding and after the record segment in question.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10063.html

    : 00D10064
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: stand-alone log services OPEN processing macro (DSNJSLR) issued this reason code. During the execution of a FUNC=OPEN request, Stand-alone Log Read encountered an invalid Stand-alone Log Read Request Block (SLRB).
system_action
    p: In response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=OPEN call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 12 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10064 in register 0. No abend is issued by the stand-alone services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p: The stand-alone log services program is under the control of a user-written program that uses the DSNJSLR macro. The user program must anticipate and react to a nonzero return code and a nonzero reason code, possibly by terminating the execution of the user program.

    p: Make necessary modifications to the user program to use the updated Stand-alone Log Request Block (SLRB) and recompile the DSNJSLR macro.
