**start section**
number
    : 00D10101
msg_text
explanation
    p: The ENDRBA value specified in the control statement was either greater or less than any known RBA, but cold start was not specified for the conditional restart.
system_action
    p > span: Db2®
    p: startup is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Run the change log inventory (DSNJU003) utility with a CRESTART control statement that has an RBA value known to the system in the BSDS, or that has the ENDRBA and STARTRBA specifying the same RBA (cold start).
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: for more information.
problem_determination

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10101.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D10102
msg_text
explanation
    p: A request to disable data sharing failed.
system_action
    p > span: Db2®
    p: startup terminates.
operator_response
    p: Collect an SVC memory dump, and contact the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SVC memory dump for the return code. To disable data sharing, you must run the disable data sharing job (DSNTIJGF) and then restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
problem_determination
    div: General register 2 contains a return code. Explanation of the return code is as follows:
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: A request to disable data sharing is in the BSDS, but a conditional restart record is not present. You must use job DSNTIJGF for the correct conditional restart control record.
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: A request to disable data sharing is recorded in the BSDS, but the conditional restart record is not correct. You cannot request a normal conditional restart with a disable request. You must use job DSNTIJGF.
    div > dl > dt: 8
    div > dl > dd: Update of the BSDS failed. Data sharing was not disabled. See code 00D10411 for problem determination. After the BSDS problem is fixed, run DSNTIJGF to disable data sharing, and then restart
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2
    div > dl > dd: .
    div > dl > dt: 10
    div > dl > dd: A delete in the BSDS failed. Data sharing was not disabled. See code 00D10413 for problem determination. After the BSDS problem is fixed, run DSNTIJGF to disable data sharing, and then restart
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2
    div > dl > dd: .
    div > dl > dt: 12
    div > dl > dd: Disable data sharing request was attempted on a
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2
    div > dl > dd: with a BSDS that has not been converted by the DSNJCNVT BSDS conversion utility in a data sharing group that has at one point been in
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2 11
    div > dl > dd: new-function mode. Data sharing was not disabled. Convert the surviving
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2
    div > dl > dd: BSDS of the member, rerun job DSNTIJGF to disable data sharing, and then restart
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2
    div > dl > dd: .
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10102.html

    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.

number
    : 00D10251
msg_text
explanation
    p: An unrecoverable error occurred in the log buffer writer.
system_action
    p: The log buffer writer creates a record in SYS1.LOGREC and might request an SVC memory dump.
    p > span: Db2®
    p: then terminates abnormally. An SVC memory dump might not be requested if the previous messages fully describe the error.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC memory dump. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SYS1.LOGREC, the SVC memory dump, and the SYSLOG from the time the error occurred. This error is typically caused by a previous error that was recorded on SYS1.LOGREC and produced an SVC memory dump. Examine the SYS1.LOGREC entries and SVC memory dump to determine the primary error that occurred. The SYSLOG might contain messages that describe the error that was encountered.
problem_determination
    p: RLM standard diagnostic information is provided in
    p > a: X'D1......' codes
    p: . In addition, see abend reason code '00D10252' for a description of the information recorded in the variable recording area (VRA) of the SDWA.
    p: The ABEND can occur when the BSDS of the subsystem is in the format that supports only 6-byte RBA and LRSN values if the RBA or LRSN reaches the limit of
    p > span: X'00000000FFFFFFFFFFFF'
    p: or RBA or
    p > span: X'00FFFFFFFFFFFF000000'
    p: for LRSN. If the LRSN limit is reached, the BSDS must be converted to the format that supports 10-byte values by using the DSNJCNVT utility. Until this conversion is complete, the subsystem cannot be restarted. If the RBA limit is reached, either the RBA reset procedure can be used or the BSDS can be converted by using DSNJCNVT.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10251.html

msg_text

**start section**
number
    : 00D10261
msg_text
explanation
    p: While scanning the records and record segments in a log control interval (CI), it was discovered that the forward record chain was broken. This condition is the result of an incorrect record length in the log record header of some record in the log CI.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked 'stopped'.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10261 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET feedback area (SLRF). The RBA of the record in error is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI which contains the errant log record header are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
operator_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10261.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10262
msg_text
explanation
    p: While scanning a log control interval (CI), the offset to the last record or record segment in the CI was found to be incorrect.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked 'stopped'.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10262 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA of the beginning of the CI is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
operator_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10262.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D10263
msg_text
explanation
    p: While scanning a log control interval (CI), the VSAM RDF/CIDF control information was found to be incorrect.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked 'stopped'.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10263 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA of the beginning of the CI is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
operator_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D10264
msg_text
explanation
    p: While scanning a log control interval (CI), the beginning log RBA of the CI was not the expected RBA.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked 'stopped'.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10264 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The expected RBA of the beginning of the CI is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
operator_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.
user_response
sql_state

number
    : 00D10265
msg_text
explanation
    p: While scanning the records and record segments in a log control interval (CI), it was discovered the backward record chain was broken. This condition is the result of an incorrect record length in the log record header of some record in the log CI.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10265 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA of the record in error is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.

    p > span: Db2

    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.

    div > span: Db2

    div > ul > li: Obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00D10266
msg_text
explanation
    p: While scanning a log control interval (CI), a unit of recovery ID or LINK RBA in some record was found to be inconsistent with the beginning log RBA of the CI.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked 'stopped'.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10266 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA of the log record with the invalid RBA is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.

    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.

    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.

msg_text

**start section**
number
    : 00D10268
msg_text
explanation
    p: While scanning a log control interval (CI), a first or middle spanned record segment was not the last segment contained in the log CI.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked 'stopped'.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10268 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA of the record segment in error is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
operator_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10268.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D10269
msg_text
explanation
    p: An unrecoverable error was found in one of the buffers, while moving the current log buffer to the static write buffer ('shadow buffer') in preparation for the physical write to the active log.
system_action
    p: An execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC and requests an SVC dump. The subsystem then terminates.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.

**start section**
number
    : 00D1026A
msg_text
explanation
    p: A scan of the records and record segments in a log control interval (CI) detected that the forward record chain was broken. This condition is the result of an incorrect record length in the log record header of some record in the log CI.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked 'stopped'.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10261 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET feedback area (SLRF). The RBA of the record in error is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI which contains the errant log record header are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
operator_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d1026a.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D1026B
msg_text
explanation
    p: A scan of a log control interval (CI) detected that the last record or record segment in the CI was not terminated.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked as stopped.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10262 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA of the beginning of the CI is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
operator_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.
user_response

number
    : 00D1026C
msg_text
explanation
    p: A scan of a log control interval (CI) detected that a unit of recovery ID or LINK RBA in some record was found to be inconsistent with the beginning log RBA of the CI.
system_action
    p: This reason code can be issued by an active
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem as the log buffers are scanned before they are written to the active log, or by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing macro (DSNJSLR) as a CI is retrieved from a user-specified active or archive log data set.
    div: If the reason code is issued by an active
    div > span: Db2
    div: subsystem, then an abend is issued. A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJOFF1, then the archiving of the active log data set is terminated and the faulty active log data set is marked as stopped.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJR005, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the calling agent is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW009, then message DSNJ012I is issued and the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    div > ul > li: If the error was detected by DSNJW107 or DSNJW127, then the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is terminated.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services GET processing, no abend is issued by the stand-alone log services CSECT (DSNJRS01), and no information is written to SYS1.LOGREC data set. Rather, in response to the DSNJSLR FUNC=GET call,
    p > span: Db2
    p: places a return code of 4 in register 15 and a reason code of 00D10266 in register 0. Information about the results of the GET request is also returned in the stand-alone log GET Feedback Area (SLRF). The RBA of the log record with the invalid RBA is placed in SLRFRBA. The address and length of the CI are placed in SLRFFRAD and SLRFRCLL, respectively. The ddname of the data set on which the activity occurred is placed in SLRFDDNM.
operator_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
problem_determination
    p: If the reason code is issued by an active
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, obtain a DSN1LOGP detail report containing the log record(s) associated with the failure.
    p: If the reason code is issued upon return of an invocation of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: stand-alone log services macro (DSNJSLR), then an additional user-written exit or diagnostic routine may have to be written.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D10301
msg_text
explanation
    p: An unsuccessful completion of an OPEN LOG FOR READ has occurred. An open log read cursor already exists for this execution block (EB). Only one log read cursor per EB is permitted.
system_action
    p: An execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC and requests an SVC dump. The execution unit then terminates abnormally.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump. Scan the read cursor pool for a cursor with the same EB, or examine through the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: trace for the problem. Trace IDs 040301 and 040302 identify OPEN entries while 040303 and 040304 are for CLOSE.
problem_determination
    p: RLM standard diagnostic information is provided in
    p > a: X'D1......' codes
    p: . All log read cursors reside in a recovery log manager storage pool whose header address is in the log manager block (LMB) at LMBRCPHB. The LMB is pointed to by register 5. Register 6 contains the address of the EB.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10301.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00D10303
msg_text
explanation
    p: An unsuccessful completion of an OPEN LOG FOR READ has occurred. An invalid log RBA range was specified. HIGHRBA is less than LOWRBA.
system_action
    p: An execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC and requests an SVC dump. The execution unit then terminates abnormally.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: RLM standard diagnostic information is provided in
    p > a: X'D1......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

msg_text
explanation
    p: An unsuccessful completion of a SET READ CURSOR RANGE has occurred. The specified log read cursor was not opened by the execution block submitting this request. All input requests must be submitted under the execution block that opened the cursor.

    p: An execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC and requests an SVC dump. The execution unit then terminates abnormally.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: RLM standard diagnostic information is provided in
    p > a: X'D1......' codes
    p: . In addition, register 6 contains the address of the execution block (EB). All log read cursors reside in a recovery log manager storage pool whose header address is in the log manager block (LMB) at LMBRCPHB. The LMB is pointed to by register 5.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

    p: An unsuccessful completion of a LOG READ has occurred. The macro invocation specified that no wait was to occur because of a busy archive log data set (ADSWAIT(NO)). number
    : 00D10328
msg_text
explanation
    p: A LOG READ completed unsuccessfully, because a MODE request sequence was invalid. A read request specifying a sequential MODE (any MODE except DIRECT) must be preceded by an open log for read, a set read cursor range, or a read with the same MODE parameter value. It is invalid to intermix read requests with different sequential mode values.
system_action
    p: An execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC and requests an SVC dump. The execution unit then terminates abnormally.

**start section**
number
    : 00D1032A
msg_text
explanation
    p: An unsuccessful completion of a LOG READ has occurred. BSDS does not map the specified RBA into a log data set. The possible causes for this condition are:
    ul > li: The BSDS is in error.
    ul > li: The log data set has been deleted.
    ul > li: The log data set exists but the RBA cannot be found from this log data set. This situation can happen in a disaster recovery site if the log data set was copied before BSDS was copied.
    ul > li: The RBA cannot be found because it is beyond the earliest RBA recorded in the log data sets.
system_action
    p: An execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC and requests an SVC dump. The execution unit then terminates abnormally.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump. Also, obtain a listing of the BSDS by running the print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Review the recovery log manager standard diagnostic information in
    p > a: X'D1......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).

number
    : 00D1032E
msg_text
explanation
    p: A LOG READ completed unsuccessfully due to an internal error.
system_action
    p: An execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC and requests an SVC dump. The execution unit then terminates abnormally.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine LOGREC and SVC dump information. LOG READ was passed a bad parameter list. The field which was detected to be in error (RDPLOPT1) is the third byte of the second word traced in the log manager 311 trace entry. The RET field of this trace entry along with the MEPL may be used to determine which module issued the Log Read request. Both pieces of information are useful in isolating the failure.
problem_determination
    p: RLM standard diagnostic information is provided in
    p > a: X'D1......' codes
    p: .
    div: Collect the following diagnostic item listed in
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D10332
msg_text
explanation
    p: A log read completed unsuccessfully because a link RBA pointed to a log record with a different URID. This is an internal error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC DUMP is requested. The requesting execution unit is abnormally terminated.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: While reading the log backwards using the LRHLINK RBAs, a log record was found that contained a different URID. A link read is normally done when processing a rollback or an abort. This abend is issued to prevent a rollback of the wrong transaction. If this occurs during abort processing, the subsystem is brought down. If the abend reoccurs on the subsequent restart of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , a conditional restart is necessary to bypass the invalid log record.
problem_determination
    p: In addition to the standard RLM diagnostic information, register 6 contains the address of the execution block (EB). All log read cursors reside in a recovery log manager storage pool whose header address is in the log manager block (LMB) at LMBRCPHB. The LMB is pointed to by register 5 and described in the DSNDLMB macro.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10332.html
**end section**

msg_text
explanation
    p: A member of a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: data sharing group in a
    p > span: GDPS® Continuous Availability with zero data loss
    p: (
    p > span: GDPS Continuous Availability with zero data loss
    p: ) environment issued a proxy log read request. The operation failed for one of the following reasons:
    ul > li: The BSDS records for the data sharing member are not in extended format.
    ul > li: Installation parameter CDDS_MODE is not set to PROXY for the data sharing member.
    ul > li: The data sharing member did not start in proxy mode.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues a return code of 4 and reason code of 00D10351 to the requesting function.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Review the
    p > span: Db2
    p: console output. In particular, check for messages that were written during
    p > span: Db2
    p: startup.
problem_determination
    p: In the console output, check for messages that indicate why the data sharing member did not start in proxy mode. One possible cause is that the compression dictionary data set (CDDS) was not available.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p: The log manager command processor (DSNJC001) was entered with an invalid Tokenized Command Segment (TCS).
system_action
    p: A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested. The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump from the operator.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: RLM standard diagnostic information is provided under
    p > a: X'D1......' codes
    p: .
    p: General register 1 contains the address of the TCS as passed to log manager. The character string 'TCS' should appear at the address provided in R1, plus 4. The address of the GCPC Pool Header Block (PHB) is provided in general register 2. The value
    p > span: X'0036'
    p: should appear at the address provided in R2. If these two items are not present, then the DSNJC001 CSECT was invoked in error by an execution unit.
user_response

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d10800.html

problem_determination

    p > span: Db2®
    p: system console for possible errors relating the peer's BSDS on both the host and peer
    p > span: Db2
    p: system.
    p: See the
    p > span: Db2
    p: system console for messages DSNJ103I and DSNJ700I that are issued with this
    p > span: Db2
    p: condition code.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

msg_text
explanation
    p: There is a mismatch between the two BSDS timestamps of a peer.
system_action
    p: If this was an unconditional request, an execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC, requests an SVC dump, and terminates.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: There is a mismatch between the two BSDS system timestamps of a peer, the BSDS change log inventory (DSNJU003) timestamps of a peer, or both. The peer log environment might have changed. This must be resolved at the peer
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem by determining which BSDS is in error and recovering that BSDS.
    p: See the
    p > span: Db2
    p: system console for message DSNJ700I that is issued with this
    p > span: Db2
    p: condition code.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: could not locate a peer's active log data set in the peer's BSDS.

explanation
    p: A BLDVRP/DLVRP macro failed for the BSDS buffer.
system_action
    p: An execution unit writes a record to SYS1.LOGREC, requests an SVC dump, and then terminates.
operator_response

system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Review the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: system console for possible errors relating to the BSDS.
    p: A BLDVRP/DLVRP macro for a VSAM shared resource pool failed for the BSDS. General register 2 will contain a value of 1 for a BLDVRP macro or a value of 2 for a DLVRP macro. The macro return code is contained in general register 3. See the appropriate VSAM publication for advanced VSAM applications.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

number
    : 00D30000
msg_text
explanation
    p: The operator canceled the allied agent at the requesting location and a dump was requested, or the agent abended with a reason code that indicated a possible communication problem. In either case, the database access agent at this location abended to take a dump to assist in problem determination.
system_action
    p: The agent terminates.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The information collected as a result of this abend is related to information collected at the requesting location. Obtain a copy of the SYS1.LOGREC listing and the SVC dump. Contact the system programmer at the requesting location (the location name can be determined from the dump header) to coordinate further action.
problem_determination
    p: This abend was initiated in order to save diagnostic information that might be useful in problem determination.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

number
    : 00D30001
msg_text
explanation
    p: The DPS RALE was not initialized. The DSNLSPRR was invoked with the DPSB defined as the functional recovery routine (FRR) anchor. The DPSB is created after the DPS RALE is initialized.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested at the site of the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: abend.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine which sites the abending agent was connected to by examining the DSNL027 and DSNL028 SYSLOG console messages at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: abend. Obtain copies of the SYS1.LOGREC and SYSLOG data sets from each connected site, the SVC dump at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: failure, and any related dumps from each connected site.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.

number
    : 00D3000D
msg_text
explanation
    p: A request using application-directed access starting at site 'A' referenced an object at site 'B' that is stored at site 'A'.
system_action
    p: The application statement was not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If necessary, consult with the data base administrators at the local site and the remote server location. Inspect the remote SYSIBM.SYSTABLES catalog table to determine the object at this location being referenced in a circular manner.
user_response
    p: Recode the application to remove the alias reference at the remote server that resolves to an object stored at the local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . Objects stored at the local site must be referenced using a local name.
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3000d.html

    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably an installation error. Obtain a listing of the DSNZPARM module used.
problem_determination
    p: Ensure that DSN6FAC was installed correctly.
user_response
sql_state

    p > span: Db2
    p: failure, and any related dumps from each connected site.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

explanation

    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination

msg_text

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

msg_text
explanation
    p: A CANCEL THREAD or CANCEL DDF THREAD command naming a distributed thread caused the thread to be terminated. A dump is provided for diagnostic purposes as a result of the CANCEL command DUMP keyword.
system_action
    p > span: Db2®
    p: writes a SYS1.LOGREC record and requests an SVC dump. The execution unit abends. If the canceled distributed thread is an allied thread,
    p > span: Db2
    p: requests the cancellation of each associated database access thread at each of the server sites (refer to the explanation for 00D30000).
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The command might have been used to terminate a thread that was in a state where no processing was occurring and the thread could not continue.
    p: If you suspect an internal
    p > span: Db2
    p: error, obtain a copy of the SYS1.LOGREC listing and the SVC dump. Determine the failing environment (
    p > span: Db2
    p: , IMS™, CICS®, or TSO).
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    p: The module that was suspended while waiting for some action to be taken is the module that issued the abend.

**start section**
number
    : 00D3001B
msg_text
explanation
    p: The database access request from a remote site failed because the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain an inbound row describing what
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID should be used for the remote primary authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES specifies 'I' or 'B', requiring inbound name translation, the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries describing which
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs are to be used for each authorization ID received from the remote LU.
system_action
    p: The DSNL030I message is issued at the server. The database access agent is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES has been specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that correctly specify the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs to be used for each possible remote authorization ID.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3001b.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D3001F
msg_text
explanation
    p: ACCRDBRM received from the remote server indicates incompatible server.
system_action
    p: The TYPDEFNAM or TYPDEFOVR values returned from the remote server in the DDM ACCRDBRM reply require data type and/or code page translations that cannot be supported by the local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . The local
    p > span: Db2
    p: has disconnected the conversation with the remote server.
    p > span: Db2
    p: requests neither a SVC dump nor a SYS1.LOGREC record.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: Notify the system programmer at the remote location that the remote server may not be usable.
problem_determination
    p: Determine the server being accessed by examining the SQLCODE -30041 message text. Refer also to the DDM documentation of the ACCRDB command and the ACCRDBRM reply message.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. Invoke the application after the problem has been corrected.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3001f.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D30020
msg_text
explanation
    p: The processing of the CONNECT statement at a remote server has failed. This is because acceptable CONNECT information was not conveyed in the distributed relational database architecture (DRDA) EXCSAT command sent by the local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: to the remote server.
system_action
    p: The remote server database access agent (DBAA) sends a DRDA reply message (for example, MGRLVLRM) to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: which indicates the specific nature of the problem. The above reason code is sent in the server diagnosis area of the reply message. The DBAA awaits further DRDA commands from the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Operator will not detect this problem.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This represents a DRDA configuration mismatch between the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: and the remote server. The precise mismatch is determined from the reply message sent from the remote server to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . The reply message may be determined by examining the SQLCODE and the SQLCA tokens returned for the CONNECT statement.
    p: The remote server and local
    p > span: Db2
    p: system administrators should consult together to determine if this is a system configuration error, or if an internal error exists at either the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: or remote server.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div: Collect the following local
    div > span: Db2
    div: diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: Application source code and run time listing.
    div > ul > li: Relevant error and system logs spanning the time of the failure.
user_response
    p: The SQLCA returned in response to the CONNECT statement indicates what DRDA reply message was sent by the remote server. The user should contact the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: system administrator with this information.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30020.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D30021
msg_text
explanation
    p: The processing of the CONNECT statement at a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: remote server has failed. This is because acceptable CONNECT information was not conveyed in the distributed relational database architecture (DRDA) ACCRDB command sent by the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: to the remote server.
system_action
    p: The remote server database access agent (DBAA) sends a DRDA reply message (for example, VALNSPRM) to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: which indicates the specific nature of the problem. The above reason code is sent in the server diagnosis area of the reply message. The DBAA awaits further DRDA commands from the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Operator will not detect this problem.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: This represents a DRDA configuration mismatch between the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: and the remote server. The precise mismatch is determined from the reply message sent from the
    div > span: Db2
    div: remote server to the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: . The reply message may be determined by examining the SQLCODE and the SQLCA tokens returned for the CONNECT statement. It could indicate any one of the following problems (but is not limited to these):
    div > ul > li: The EXCSAT command was not successfully processed prior to receipt of the ACCRDB command.
    div > ul > li: The TYPDEFNAM parameter (specifies local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: data types) in the ACCRDB command is not supported.
    div > ul > li: The TYPDEFOVR parameter (specifies local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: CCSIDs) in the ACCRDB command is not supported.
    div > ul > li: The local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: product is not recognized/supported by the remote server.
    p: The system administrators for the two locations should consult together to determine if this is a system configuration error or if an internal error exists at either location.
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items at the remote server:
    div > ul > li: Console output from the system on which the job was run and a listing of SYSLOG data set for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li: The system CCSIDs.
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items at the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: :
    div > ul > li: Application source code and run time listing.
    div > ul > li: Relevant error and system logs spanning the time of the failure.
    div > ul > li: The system CCSIDs.
user_response
    p: The SQLCA returned in response to the CONNECT statement indicates what DRDA reply message was sent by the remote server. The user should contact the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: system administrator with this information.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30021.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D30022
msg_text
explanation
    p: The processing of the CONNECT statement at the remote server has failed and the local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: Data Base Access Agent (DBAA) has been abended. This is because authorization checking has failed at the remote server.
system_action
    p: The conversation with the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: is terminated by the remote server with an LU6.2 SNA sense code. The DBAA is abended. A
    p > span: DSNL030I
    p: message is written to the MVS™ console at the remote server, and an alert is generated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Either the user does not have the proper authority to execute at the remote server, or there is a security configuration mismatch in the communication database between the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: and the remote server. (For example, a row might be missing in the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table at the remote server.)
    p: Examine the
    p > span: DSNL030I
    p: message or the alert for a more specific reason code describing the failure. Consult with the two system administrators if necessary to fix the problem. No dump is generated for this abend.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30022.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3002D
msg_text
explanation
    p: The connection to the remote server failed. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain an outbound row and did not specify the remote authorization ID for the plan owner
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified as 'O' or 'B', outbound name translation is in use. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries that describe the remote authorization IDs that are used for each
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID that communicates with the LU or the TCP/IP address.
system_action
    p: A response is sent to the application to indicate that the resource is unavailable. The request is not sent to the remote site.
operator_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME or IPADDR. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that specify the remote authorization ID to be used for each possible
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID. These rows must specify 'O' in the TYPE column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3002d.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3002E
msg_text
explanation
    p: No resync list entry exists during resynchronization when one is expected to exist. This is an internal error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested at the site of the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: abend.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the sites to which the abending agent was connected by examining the DSNL027 and DSNL028 SYSLOG console messages at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: abend. Obtain copies of the SYS1.LOGREC and SYSLOG data sets from each connected site, the SVC dump at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: failure, and any related dumps from each connected site.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3003B
msg_text
explanation
    div: A distributed thread was canceled because one of the following values was exceeded:
    div > ul > li: The idle thread timeout value that is specified by
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: subsystem parameter IDTHTOIN in macro DSN6FAC
    div > ul > li: The ATTRIBUTE2 value in a row with KEYWORD value MONITOR IDLE THREADS in the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES table, for a profile that monitors the thread
system_action
    p: The execution unit abends.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The server thread was holding
    p > span: Db2
    p: resources and the requester application did not make a request to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: server thread for an extended period of time. The server thread is terminated to release resources that might affect other threads.
    p: This usually occurs for one of these reasons:
    ul > li: The ACTIVE thread option was specified in the CMTSTAT subsystem parameter, which corresponds to the DDF THREADS field of the DSNTIPR installation panel. A requester application or its user did not make a request to the
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: server for an extended period. This can happen due to a lengthy user absence. As a result, the server thread was canceled when the timeout value was exceeded.
    ul > li > p: Determine why the requester application has not made a request to the
    ul > li > p > span: Db2
    ul > li > p: server in the specified time.
    ul > li: The INACTIVE option was specified for subsystem parameter CMTSTAT. One of the following situations occurred:
    ul > li > ul > li: A requester application or its user failed to issue a commit operation before an extended dormant period, such as a user absence.
    ul > li > ul > li: A requester application or its user issued a commit operation before an extended dormant period, but database resources were still being held because of other conditions.
    ul > li > p: As a result, the server thread could not be moved to the inactive state, and was canceled when the timeout value was exceeded.
    ul > li > p: Determine why the server thread was not moved to the inactive state.
    p: If the design or use of the application requires additional time, take one of the following actions:
    ul > li: Increase the value of the IDTHTOIN subsystem parameter, or set it to zero to deactivate idle thread timeout.
    ul > li: If the server thread is monitored by profile tables, and the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES profile table contains a row with KEYWORD value MONITOR IDLE THREADS for a profile that monitors the server thread, increase the ATTRIBUTE2 value in the row, or set ATTRIBUTE2 to zero to deactivate monitoring.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3003b.html
**end section**
