**start section**
number
    : 00D3003E
msg_text
explanation
    p: A connection or thread that is running under KEEPDYNAMIC refresh rules was actively in use for more than one hour. A unit-of-work was completed and only packages bound with the KEEPDYNAMIC(YES) option are causing the thread to remain active with its connection.
    p: This condition might normal if the client connected to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: indicating that it uses KEEPDYNAMIC(YES) packages and it is enabled for either:
    ul > li: Sysplex workload balancing.
    ul > li: Seamless failover.
    p: Under the support for KEEPDYNAMIC refresh rules from the following drivers, when a client socket is closed from the server, the client attempts to reconnect back to the same server and marks that all statements managed under the connection need to be prepared.
    ul > li: IBM® Data Server Driver for Java
    ul > li: IBM Data Server Driver for ODBC/CLI/.NET
system_action
    p: The connection or thread is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    : No action is required.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3003e.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3003F
msg_text
explanation
    p: A connection or thread that is running under KEEPDYNAMIC refresh rules was actively in use for more than 20 minutes. A unit-of-work was completed and only packages bound with the KEEPDYNAMIC(YES) option are causing the thread to remain active with its connection.
    p: This condition might be normal if the client connected to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: indicating that it uses KEEPDYNAMIC(YES) packages and it is enabled for either:
    ul > li: Sysplex workload balancing.
    ul > li: Seamless failover.
    p: Under the support for KEEPDYNAMIC refresh rules from the following drivers, when a client socket is closed from the server, the client attempts to reconnect back to the same server and marks that all statements managed under the connection need to be prepared.
    ul > li: IBM® Data Server Driver for Java
    ul > li: IBM Data Server Driver for ODBC/CLI/.NET
system_action
    p: The connection or thread is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    : No action is required.

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3003f.html

number
    : 00D30041
msg_text
explanation
    p: An invalid subsystem IPv4 address was found the BSDS. The specified address does not conform to dotted decimal form.
system_action

**start section**
number
    : 00D30045
msg_text
explanation
    p: An subsystem IPv4 or IPv6 address is invalid with respect to the specified group IPv4 or IPv6 address. Data sharing members require subsystem or member and group pairs. That is, if a subsystem or member IP address is specified, a corresponding group address is also required since the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is a member of a data sharing group.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the DSNJU003 change log inventory utility to add a corresponding group address or to remove the subsystem or member address. See the GRPIPV4, GRPIPV6, NOIPV4, and NOIPV6 keywords of the DDF statement for more information.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30045.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D30046
msg_text
explanation
    p: A value was found for the IPNAME field of the BSDS DDF record but only zero values were found for the PORT and RESPORT fields in the BSDS DDF record. If an IPNAME value is specified, DDF will only attempt to activate its TCP/IP communications support which needs values for PORT and RESPORT in the BSDS DDF record.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the DSNJU003 change log inventory utility to add non-zero values for the PORT and RESPORT fields of the BSDS DDF record or to remove the IPNAME value if SNA/APPC communication is needed.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30046.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D30050
msg_text
explanation
    p: A distributed thread was aborted because a server thread held
    p > span: Db2®
    p: resources, and the requesting application did not make a request to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: server thread for an extended period of time. The amount of time that the distributed thread was idle exceeded the setting for the MONITOR IDLE THREADS keyword in a monitor profile. That monitor profile also specified an EXCEPTION_ROLLBACK action for one of the following filtering scopes:
    ul > li: LOCATION
    ul > li: PRDID
    ul > li: ROLE_AUTHID
    ul > li: ROLE
    ul > li: AUTHID
    ul > li: COLLID_PKGNAME
    ul > li: COLLID
    ul > li: PKGNAME
    ul > li: CLIENT_APPLNAME
    ul > li: CLIENT_USERID
    ul > li: CLIENT_WRKSTNNAME
system_action
    p: The server thread is aborted. The connection with the remote application is maintained.
    p: If the aborted transaction performed database updates, the application environment is placed in a must-abort state so that the application environment is made aware of the resources that have been destroyed as a result of the aborted threads.
    div > span: Important:
    div: If either of the following situations are true,
    div > span: Db2
    div: hides the EXCEPTION_ROLLBACK event from the remote application environment:
    div > div > ul > li: The aborted transaction performed only read-only operations.
    div > div > ul > li: The transaction committed or aborted, but the associated database access thread remained active before it became idle.
    div > p: Because the EXCEPTION_ROLLBACK event is not visible to the remote application environment in those cases, it might appear to the remote application environment that the database resources are unexpectedly disappearing. For example, held cursors, kept dynamic statements, and declared temporary tables that were created in the transaction are destroyed.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Review the information that is provided in the DSNL030I message. The condition usually occurs for one of the following reasons:
    ul > li: The ACTIVE option was specified for subsystem parameter CMTSTAT, which corresponds to the DDF THREADS field of the DSNTIPR installation panel. A requester application or its user did not make a request to the
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: server for an extended period. This might happen because of a lengthy user absence. As a result, the server thread was aborted when the timeout value was exceeded.
    ul > li > p: Determine why the requesting application did not make a request to the
    ul > li > p > span: Db2
    ul > li > p: server in the specified time.
    ul > li: The INACTIVE option was specified for subsystem parameter CMTSTAT. One of the following situations occurred:
    ul > li > ul > li: A requester application or its user failed to issue a commit operation before an extended dormant period, such as a user absence.
    ul > li > ul > li: A requester application or its user issued a commit operation before an extended dormant period, but database resources were still being held because of other conditions.
    ul > li > p: As a result, the thread could no be moved to the inactive state, and was aborted when the timeout value was exceeded.
    ul > li > p: Determine why the server thread was not moved to the inactive state.
    p: If the design or use of the application requires additional time, follow these steps:
    ol > li: Modify the exception threshold for the MONITOR IDLE THREADS profile in the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES table.
    ol > li: Issue the START PROFILE command to refresh the exception threshold value.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30050.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D30051
msg_text
explanation
    p: Authentication failed for a distributed thread. A remote client environment used a digital client certificate for authentication, but a required trusted context was not defined at the
    p > span: Db2® for z/OS®
    p: server.
    p: The information that is provided in the associated DSNL030I message includes the user ID and the IP address of the remote client environment. A
    p > span: Db2
    p: trusted context is required for the specified user ID. The remote client environment accesses the
    p > span: Db2
    p: server using digital certificates, through SSL client authentication. The user ID that is provided by the remote client is different from the user ID that is associated with the client digital certificate at the server. Therefore, additional authentication is required.
    p > span: Db2
    p: uses the user ID that is obtained from the certificate to search for a trusted context. When the trusted context exists,
    p > span: Db2
    p: processes the remote client user ID that is specified in the message as a trusted context switch-user request. However, the trusted context did not exist, so a switch-user request could not be performed.
system_action
    p: Authentication fails, and the connection with the remote client environment is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Review the information that is provided in the associated DSNL030I message. Create a trusted context for the user ID that is specified in the information for the remote client environment.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: Console output from the system on which the error occurred
    div > ul > li: Trusted context definition
    div > ul > li: AT-TLS policy configuration, in which HandShakeRole is set to ServerWithClientAuth
    div > ul > li: RACF® RACDCERT commands that were used to add the client certificate to the keyring at the z/OS server, including any RACDCERT MAP commands if RACF certificate name filtering is used
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30051.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D300F1
msg_text
explanation
    p: The DSNLTOKS macro was invoked to extract error information from the DTMF block using the CHECK_SQLCODE keyword and the DTMF block was either uninitialized or contained an SQL return code that was not negative. This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested. The execution unit is abnormally terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump. Determine the failing environment (
    p > span: Db2
    p: , IMS™, CICS®, or TSO).
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This name of the module that invoked the function given as the abending module name. This is not the module in error. An earlier failing module neglected to report error information in the DTMF block.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

number
    : 00D300F2
msg_text
explanation
    p: EXCSATRD reply received from a remote server indicates an incompatible server.
system_action
    p: The manager levels returned from the local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: in the DDM EXCSATRD reply were too low for the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: to support. The local
    p > span: Db2
    p: has disconnected the conversation with the remote server.
    p > span: Db2
    p: requests neither an SVC dump nor a SYS1.LOGREC record written.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: Notify the system programmer at the remote location that the remote server is not usable.
problem_determination
    p: Determine the server being accessed by inspecting the SQLCODE -30041 message text. Refer to the DDM documentation of the EXCSAT command.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. Invoke the application after the problem has been corrected.

**start section**
number
    : 00D300F3
msg_text
explanation
    p: The connection to the remote server failed. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain an outbound row and did not specify the remote authorization ID for the new user primary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified as 'O' or 'B', outbound name translation is in use. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries that describe the remote authorization IDs that are used for each
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID that communicates with the LU or the TCP/IP address.
system_action
    p: A response is sent to the application to indicate that the resource is unavailable. The request is not sent to the remote site.
operator_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME or IPADDR. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that specify the remote authorization ID to be used for each possible
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID. These rows must specify 'O' in the TYPE column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d300f3.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D300F4
msg_text
explanation
    p: A DRDA protocol error occurred. Either a reply chain is broken but there is no DDM reply with a high enough severity to break the chain, or a message chain is unbroken in spite of a high severity code, or a conversation expected to be available has been terminated. The problem, though detected by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , is believed to have originated at the remote server. The server might not be a
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem.
system_action
    p: This reason code is returned to the application. A request message has likely been sent to the remote site but the outcome is uncertain. A DSNL031I message may have been written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for more information. If this reason code is returned for an SQL 'COMMIT' statement, determine if manual recovery of the unit of work is necessary.
operator_response
    p: Notify the operator or systems programmer for the remote server.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the product type of the server. The DISPLAY THREAD command may be used. Refer to the server products' diagnostic recommendations. If the server DBMS is
    p > span: Db2
    p: , contact your IBM® representative to report the problem and open an APAR.
problem_determination
    p: The problem originated with the remote server. Follow the diagnostic recommendations published for the server DBMS product, which might not be
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d300f4.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D300F6
msg_text
explanation
    p: A valid but unexpected DDM reply was received from a remote server during a connect, commit, or abort operation. For a connect, the expected DDM reply is EXCSATRD (for EXCSAT command) or ACCRDBRM (for ACCRDB command). For a commit or abort, the expected DDM reply is ENDUOWRM. (The DDM command for a commit is RDBCMM. For a rollback, it is RDBRLLBCK).
system_action
    p: The local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: tried to access a remote server and the server replied with an unexpected DDM answer. The remote server may have suffered permanent damage. The local
    p > span: Db2
    p: may or may not subsequently disconnect the conversation to the server. This is an internal-only DDF reason code. The local
    p > span: Db2
    p: requests neither a SVC dump nor a SYS1.LOGREC record.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If the SQLCA is available, examine all fields in the SQLCA. Using this information, try to determine what DDM reply was received. Contact the system programmer at the server site with this information. This is probably a programming error at the server database system, although it may be a
    p > span: Db2
    p: error. The server database system may have recorded diagnostic information for the problem. If this is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: error, write an APAR.
problem_determination
    p: Examine the SQL return code in the SQLCA. It should give further indication of the real cause.
user_response
    p: Contact the system programmer
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d300f6.html
**end section**

    : 00D300F7

explanation
    p: A DDM reply message was too big to fit in the DTM reply buffer.

    p > span: Db2®
    p: .

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This error should never occur. Write an APAR.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.

    : 00D300F8
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to access data at a remote location that has been started in restricted access mode. When a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: system is started in restricted access mode, no remote inbound or outbound access is allowed.
system_action
    p: Remote access is not allowed.

system_programmer_response

    p > span: Db2
    p: has been restarted in full access mode.

number
    : 00D300F9
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: server was unable to allocate a database access agent since the maximum number allowed was zero (ZPARM MAXDBAT value was zero).
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: server terminates the conversation with a 084B6031 SNA sense code for application-directed access and a 00D300F9
    p > span: Db2
    p: code for system-directed access. A DSNL030I message containing this reason code is written to the MVS™ operator console at the
    p > span: Db2
    p: server site.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: At the server, currently no data base access agents are allowed because the MAXDBAT value in the ZPARM is zero. If access to this site from a remote site is desirable, change the MAXDBAT parameter in ZPARM to the maximum number of database access agents needed. Restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: at the server. Notify the user to rerun the application.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d300f9.html

number
    : 00D300FE
msg_text
explanation
    p: You executed a COMMIT statement and update operations were performed at a remote site. The success of the COMMIT operation could not be determined because a failure occurred at the remote site or in the communication link with the remote site after the request to commit the operation had been transmitted.
system_action
    p: The remote updates have been committed or backed out, depending on when the error occurred.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: After communication has been reestablished with the remote site, use SQL to query the updated data to determine whether the updates were committed. If the updates were not committed, rerun the application and perform the updates again.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d300fe.html

    : 00D30100
msg_text
explanation
    p: A COMMIT statement was chained to a set of commands sent to an remote server. The remote server stopped processing the chained commands before it reached the COMMIT. COMMIT was NOT performed.
system_action

operator_response

system_programmer_response

    div: Collect the following diagnostic items from the local
    div > span: Db2®
    div: system.

    div > ul > li: Console output and a listing of SYSLOG data set for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    p: Consult with the remote server system programmer to determine the cause of the error.
    div: The remote server system programmer may need to collect the following remote server diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: Relevant error and system logs spanning the time of the failure.
    div > ul > li: Any relevant remote server dumps.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer of the failure.
    p: After the problem causing the chain to be broken at the remote server is fixed, rerun the application and perform the updates again.

**start section**
number
    : 00D30103
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code may be returned for a failed distributed commit using DRDA protocols. It indicates that commit has failed because an ABNUOWRM reply message was received from the server for a prior SQL statement, but an abort had not been driven at the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: requester prior to this commit and after the receipt of the ABNUOWRM.
    p: An ABNUOWRM reply message is sent by the server when it has rolled back its unit-of-work in response to an unusual situation at the server (for example, deadlock or operator intervention). When an ABNUOWRM reply message is received by the requester, an abort must be driven at the requester to synchronize the distributed systems. Until an abort is driven, all subsequent SQL statements will receive an SQLCODE -906. After an abort is driven, further SQL statements will be accepted.
system_action
    p: The commit at the
    p > span: Db2
    p: requester fails.
operator_response
    p: The operator will not detect this problem.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the cause of the problem represented by the SQLCODE returned with the ABNUOWRM and if necessary, work with the system programmer at the server to resolve it.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: User's application output, including SQLCAs returned for each SQL statement.
user_response
    p: Scan backwards in your application for the first non -906 SQLCODE prior to the commit. This SQLCODE was returned with the ABNUOWRM from the server system. Use the server product reference manuals to determine and correct whatever problem this SQLCODE represents on the server and rerun your application. This may involve contacting your system programmer if the situation at the Server cannot be corrected or improved by changes to the application program.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30103.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D30104
msg_text
explanation
    p: The unit-of-work disposition (commit or rollback) received from a DRDA server is inconsistent with the command sent (commit or rollback), and the SQLCODE returned from the server. For example, if a commit is sent to the server, and the reply message indicates the unit of work (UOW) was committed, but the SQLCODE returned is negative, then this reason code will be contained in the alert sent to NetView®.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and sent to NetView. Two trace records, IFCID 0191 and IFCID 0193, may be written to the Statistics Class 4 trace, and two DSNL031I messages may be written to the console. The trace records and messages will not be written if this error was previously detected within the last 5 minutes. The Statistics Class 4 trace must be active for the trace records to be written.
    p: An SQLCODE +30100, -30020, or -30030 is returned to the application. An SQLCODE -30020 indicates a rollback was sent to the DRDA server, but a commit unit-of-work disposition was received. An SQLCODE +30100 or -30030 conveys the unit-of-work disposition reported by the server, and replaces the original SQL return code sent by the server, which was not consistent with the UOW disposition. The original SQL return code and SQLSTATE returned by the server are saved as tokens in the SQLCA.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a DRDA distributed protocol problem. Once the nature of the inconsistency is known, the server system programmer may have to be contacted to help resolve the problem.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: Listing of the user's application program output, including printouts of the SQLCAs received for all SQL statements.
    div > ul > li: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of SYSLOG data set for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li: Listing of the Statistics Class 4 trace records for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    p: If no DSNL031I messages were written at the same time as the alert, then scan the log backwards for previous DSNL031I messages. A
    p > span: Db2
    p: filter function prohibits multiple occurrences of the same problem detected within a 5 minute period from flooding the console and trace data set with diagnostic information. You will have to find an earlier occurrence of the same problem to start diagnosing it.
    p: Once you have found the two DSNL031I messages, locate the IFCID 0191 and 0193 trace records written for the problem by using the IFCID sequence numbers from the DSNL031I messages.
    p: The IFCID 0193 trace record will document the nature of the inconsistency (command sent, UOW disposition received, SQL return code received).
    p: The IFCID 0191 trace record will document the exact data stream returned from the Server. Use this information to determine if the reply message from the server was correctly converted into the UOW disposition and the SQL return code reported in the IFCID 0193 record. If the data stream was correctly converted, then the problem lies at the server and you should contact the system programmer at the server and have him or her analyze the data stream produced by the server.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30104.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D30105
msg_text
explanation
    p: A distributed commit has failed because the allied agent was canceled as a result of a STOP DDF MODE(FORCE) command during a previous execution of DDF which has terminated. When an allied agent does not issue database requests for more than 2 minutes after a STOP DDF MODE(FORCE) command is issued, DDF will come down without terminating the allied agent. The agent is canceled when it makes its next request to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
system_action
    p: The commit operation is failed and the agent is canceled. The last unit of work was rolled back at all server systems when the STOP DDF MODE(FORCE) command was processed.
operator_response

system_programmer_response
problem_determination

msg_text
explanation
    p: The result of a DRDA distributed commit could not be determined because the reply message from the server either was invalid or could not be deciphered.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and sent to NetView®. An IFCID 0191 trace record may be written to the statistics class 4 trace, and a DSNL031I message may be written to the console. The trace record and message will not be written if this error was previously detected within the last 5 minutes. The statistics class 4 trace must be active for the trace records to be written.
    p: The requester disconnects from the server system. The state of the unit of work at the server is unknown. It may have been committed, or it may have been rolled back. An SQLCA indicating the nature of the DRDA reply message distortion is given to the application.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer whenever a DSNL031I message is written to the MVS™ console.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a DRDA distributed protocol problem. Once the nature of the problem is known, the server system programmer may have to be contacted to help resolve the problem.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li: Listing of the user's application program output, including printouts of the SQLCAs received for all SQL statements.

    div > ul > li: Listing of the statistics class 4 trace records.
    p: If no DSNL031I message was written at the same time as the alert, then scan the log backwards for a previous DSNL031I message. A
    p > span: Db2
    p: filter function prohibits multiple occurrences of the same problem detected within a 5 minute period from flooding the console and trace data set with diagnostic information. You will have to find an earlier occurrence of the same problem to start diagnosing it.
    p: Once you have found the DSNL031I message, locate the IFCID 0191 trace record written for the problem by using the IFCID sequence number from the DSNL031I message.
    p: The IFCID 0191 trace record will document the exact data stream returned from the server. Use this information to determine if the reply message from the Server was correct, and if so, the error resides with the
    p > span: Db2
    p: AR.
    p: If the data stream is incorrect, then the problem lies at the server and you should contact the system programmer at the server and have he or she analyze the data stream produced by the server.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. After the problem has been resolved, re-connect to the server site to determine whether the last unit of work was committed or rolled back. Continue your application after correcting the server database (if necessary).

number
    : 00D30109
msg_text
explanation
    div: Phase 1 of a distributed commit failed. One or more remote servers did one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Voted NO
    div > ul > li: Voted heuristic mixed
    div > ul > li: Experienced a communications error
    div > ul > li: Made an error in their use of commit protocol
system_action
    p: The commit fails. The unit of work is backed out.
    p: For communication errors, message DSNL406I is written to the system console, alert A006 is generated, and trace record IFCID 0209 is produced to record the server affected (LUWID of the unit of work, and other information).
    p: For protocol errors, message DSNL413I is written to the system console, alert A005 is generated, and trace record IFCID 0208 is produced to describe the nature of each server's protocol violation.
operator_response

    p: For protocol errors, contact the system programmer for the remote site. The invalid sync point message is recorded in the IFCID 0208 trace record. The system logic error that causes the invalid sync point message must be corrected at the remote site.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
user_response

    p > span: Db2®
    p: systems programmer. If the commit failed for other than a commit protocol violation by a remote server, resubmit your application. Otherwise, wait for resolution of the protocol error.

msg_text
explanation
    p: This might occur when a version of IMS™ that does not support the COMMIT VERIFY exit is running an IMS MODE=MULTI application with one or more non-
    p > span: Db2®
    p: servers. This is probably a user error, since this scenario is not supported by
    p > span: Db2
    p: and IMS unless the IMS version is 4 or later.
    p: IMS requested a new user SIGNON without an immediately preceding commit or abort, and your application was connected to one or more remote non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: servers. In order to preserve the consistency of database updates made at several different servers, when at least one server is a non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: server, a commit or abort must precede any new user SIGNON.

    p > span > span > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00D3010B
msg_text
explanation
    p: Cached information was used to determine whether updates are allowed at the server. From the time of the execution of the CONNECT statement to the time that the first SQL statement was sent to the server, the conversation SYNC_LEVEL supported by the partner changed from a cached value of SYNC to the current of value NONE.
    p: SYNC_LEVEL NONE servers are not allowed to update in the current unit of work. Since an update might have been performed by the partner during execution of the first statement at the server, the application must roll back (abort).
    p: This reason code is returned as a token in the SQLCODE -904.
system_action
    p: The connection to the server is deallocated. The server's portion of the current unit of work is rolled back at the server. The application is placed in a must-abort state. All subsequent operations except rollback or abort fail with an SQLCODE -918. The remainder of the current unit of work is backed out when rollback or abort is performed or when the application terminates.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: If your application does not do any work at a server for a long time after issuing a CONNECT, consider rewriting it to perform the CONNECT immediately before performing any work at the server. This minimizes the possibility of the server system going down and coming back up at a different SYNC_LEVEL.
    p: Rerun your application starting with the unit of work containing the SQL statement that received an SQLCODE -904.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3010b.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3010C
msg_text
explanation
    p: Cached information was used to determine whether updates are allowed at the server. From the time of the execution of the CONNECT statement to the time that the first SQL statement was sent to the server, the partner was started with a program that does not support two-phase commit.
    p: Such servers are not allowed to update in the current unit of work. Since an update might have been performed by the partner during execution of the first statement at the server, the application must roll back.
    p: This reason code is returned as a token in the SQLCODE -904.
system_action
    p: The connection to the server is deallocated. The server's portion of the current unit of work is rolled back at the server. The application is placed in a must-abort state. All subsequent operations except rollback or abort fail with an SQLCODE -918. The remainder of the current unit of work is backed out when rollback or abort is performed or when the application terminates.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: If your application does not do any work at a server for a long time after issuing a CONNECT, consider rewriting it to perform the CONNECT immediately before performing any work at the server. This minimizes the possibility of the server system going down and coming back up at a different level.
    p: Rerun your application starting with the unit of work containing the SQL statement that received the SQLCODE -904.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3010c.html

number
    : 00D3010D
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: requested updates at multiple servers, but at least one server does not support distributed two-phase commit.
system_action
    p: If the application is using TSO or BATCH attach, then
    p > span: Db2
    p: rolls back the UOW. If the application is using CICS® or IMS™ attach, then CICS or IMS rolls back the UOW after receiving the NO commit vote from
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: In the UOW that was not committed, the first SQL statement that performed an update that was not allowed received an SQLCODE -919. All subsequent SQL statements also received an SQLCODE -919 until a ROLLBACK or a static ROLLBACK SQL statement was executed (if either occurred).
user_response
    p: Change the application so that updates to multiple servers (including the local server) are not performed within a single UOW unless all the update servers in the UOW support distributed two-phase commit.

msg_text

    p: If ICSF fails during connection processing at the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: requester, the connection attempt fails, and the failure is reported to the application with SQLCODE -904. The connection is terminated.
    p: If ICSF fails fails during connection processing at a remote
    p > span: Db2
    p: server, the connection attempt fails, and the failure is reported to the application with SQLCODE -30082. The connection is terminated.
    div: If ICSF fails at a remote
    div > span: Db2
    div: server during one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Processing of an encrypted DRDA request
    div > ul > li: Generation of an encrypted DRDA reply

    div > span: Db2
    div: server fails, and the failure is reported to the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: server. A DSNL032I message might have been written to the console. Refer to the description of the message for more information.

    div > span: Db2
    div: requester during one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Processing of an encrypted DRDA reply
    div > ul > li: Generation of an encrypted DRDA request
    div: the attempt to access the distributed resource fails, and the failure is reported to the local
    div > span: Db2

number
    : 00D30113
msg_text
explanation
    p: Authentication of a remote user was rejected by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: because the user ID that was provided by the remote system or user exceeds eight characters.
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: operating environment is restricted to no more than eight characters for user IDs. Remote client environments must be changed to comply with this restriction.
system_action
    p: The attempt to access
    p > span: Db2
    p: is rejected, and the connection is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Modify the user ID that was provided by the remote system or user to contain no more than eight characters, and try the remote request again.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

    : 00D30114
msg_text
explanation
    p: Authentication of a remote user was rejected by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: because change of password security mechanism is not allowed when
    p > span: Db2
    p: extended security support has been disabled.
    p > span: Db2
    p: extended security support is determined by the EXTSEC subsystem parameter, and the value of the parameter has been changed online to disable the support.
    p: The change of password security mechanism will remain restricted until
    p > span: Db2
    p: extended security support is enabled.
system_action
    p: The attempt to access
    p > span: Db2
    p: is rejected, and the connection is terminated.
operator_response

    p: Enable
    p > span: Db2
    p: extended security support, and try the remote request again.

**start section**
number
    : 00D30115
msg_text
explanation
    p: Authentication of a remote user was rejected by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . The TCPALVER (TCP/IP Already Verified) subsystem parameter has been changed, and the security mechanism that was provided is no longer allowed.
    p: Possible causes for this error include:
    ul > li: A user ID only (no password required) security mechanism is not allowed because the TCPALVER value has been changed to a value that requires a password.
    ul > li: A user ID and password security mechanism is not allowed because the TCPALVER value has been changed to a value that requires security credentials to be properly encrypted.
    ul > li: A change of password security mechanism is not allowed because the TCPALVER value has been changed to a value that requires security credentials to be properly encrypted.
    ul > li: DES-based encrypted security mechanisms are not allowed because the TCPALVER value has been changed to a value that requires a more secure form of encryption.
    p: The security mechanism will remain restricted unless the
    p > span: Db2
    p: TCP/IP already verified rules are modified to accommodate the security mechanism.
system_action
    p: The remote attempt to access
    p > span: Db2
    p: is rejected, and the connection is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Change the TCPALVER subsystem parameter to a value that supports the security mechanism, and try the remote request again. Or, modify the security mechanism to meet the security requirement that is defined by the TCPALVER subsystem parameter setting, and try the remote request again.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d30115.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: Authentication of a remote user was rejected by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . The TCPALVER (TCP/IP Already Verified) subsystem parameter has been set to SERVER_ENCRYPT and the user ID and password authentication that was provided is not allowed because the password could not be evaluated to be a RACF PassTicket.
    p: This error is likely to result from the following causes:
    ul > li: The RACF PTKTDATA class is inactive, or the resource (IRRPTAUTH.
    ul > li > var: application
    ul > li: .
    ul > li > var: target-userid
    ul > li: ) is not defined to z/OS.
    ul > li: The RACF PTKTDATA class is active and the resource IRRPTAUTH.
    ul > li > var: application
    ul > li: .
    ul > li > var: target-userid
    ul > li: is defined to z/OS but the user ID associated to
    ul > li > var: ssnm
    ul > li: DIST started task is not permitted to use it.
    ul > li: The password provided is not a valid RACF PassTicket.
system_action
    p: The remote access attempt to
    p > span: Db2
    p: is rejected, and the connection is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Ensure that the RACF PTKTDATA class is active, or the resource IRRPTAUTH.
    p > var: application
    p: .
    p > var: target-userid
    p: is defined and the user ID associated to
    p > var: ssnm
    p: DIST started task is permitted to access this resource, and try the remote request again.
problem_determination
    span: If you suspect an error in
    span > span: Db2
    span: , you might need to report the problem.
    span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00D31020
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to use SNA/APPC communications to create an outbound DRDA protocol connection. However, this DDF, as identified by the corresponding
    p > var: resource-type
    p: of 00001000 and its
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem ID as the corresponding
    p > var: resource-name
    p: , was started with an IPNAME value. This process caused DDF to only start its TCP/IP communications support.
system_action
    p: Notification of the failure is returned to the application. The conversation is not allocated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: An outbound DRDA protocol connection request was determined to require SNA/ APPC communications. This will occur when only a row in the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: Communications Database table has a LUNAME column value that matches to the LINKNAME column of the row in the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table that corresponds to the location requested by the application. If DDF was intended to be started with only its TCP/IP communications support, then a row must exist in the SYSIBM.IPNAMES table with a LINKNAME column value for each row in the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table that has a distinct value for its LINKNAME column. Otherwise, remove the IPNAME value from the BSDS DDF record by performing an update to the BSDS DDF record using the NOIPNAME parameter of the DDF statement of DSNJU003, the Change Log Inventory utility.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31020.html
**end section**

msg_text
explanation

    p: Notification of the failure is returned to the application. The conversation is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Add the mode name to be selected in the SYSIBM.MODESELECT table for the authorization ID, PLANNAME, and LUNAME of the service request that failed.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: AUTHORIZATION ID, PLANNAME, and LUNAME of the thread that is used to select the MODENAME in the SYSIBM.MODESELECT table.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of SYSIBM.LOCATIONS and SYSIBM.MODESELECT tables.
user_response

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31025.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D3102A
msg_text
explanation
    p: A conversation was not allocated because a VTAM® LU name contained in the LUNAME column of the SYSIBM.LULIST table was also present in the LUNAME column of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table. A given VTAM LU name can appear in only one of these two tables.
system_action
    p: The conversation is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure each remote VTAM LU is defined in the SYSIBM.LULIST table or the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table, but not in both tables.
    p: Verify that the condition did not occur because of the unintended use of a generic LU name, which would make
    p > span: Db2®
    p: aware of a partner LU name (its generic LU name) that is not specified in the LUNAME column of the SYSIBM.LULIST or SYSIBM.LUNAMES tables. Look for evidence of a
    p > span: DSNL510I
    p: or
    p > span: DSNL030I
    p: message that indicates the partner's generic LU name instead of its actual LU name. If the use of a generic LU name is indicated, use the RESET GENERICLU command to purge this generic LU affinity.
problem_determination
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: Print the contents of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table.
    div > ul > li: Print the contents of the SYSIBM.LULIST table.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3102a.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: A conversation was not allocated because the partner LU attempted to allocate a conversation using a blank mode name. Although
    p > span: Db2®
    p: tolerates CNOS requests with a blank mode name,
    p > span: Db2
    p: does not accept conversations with a blank mode name.

operator_response

system_programmer_response

msg_text
explanation
    p: The requested trusted connection was not established because the SECURITY_ OUT option in the SYSIBM.IPNAMES table in the communications database (CDB) is not defined correctly. number
    : 00D3102E
msg_text
explanation
    p: The remote server was not successfully connected. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain a row for trusted context system authorization ID translation, the TYPE column specified as 'S' describing the system authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.IPNAMES specifies 'S' requiring system authorization ID translation, the SYSIBM.USERNAMES must contain an entry describing the system authorization ID used for establishing trusted connection.
system_action
    p: A resource unavailable is returned to the application. The request is not sent to the remote site.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.USERNAMES has been specified correctly for the indicated LINKNAME for trusted connection.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response

number
    : 00D31030
msg_text
explanation
    p: A remote connection cannot be established. This problem might be caused by one of the following symptoms:
    ul > li: The LINKNAME column in the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table in the communications database (CDB) is greater than 8 bytes.
    ul > li: The LUNAME column in the SYSIBM.LULIST table in the communications database is greater than 8 bytes.
    ul > li: The MODENAME column in the SYSIBM.MODESELECT or SYSIBM.LUMODES table in the communications database is greater than 8 bytes.
    ul > li: The TPN column in the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table in the communications database is greater than 64 bytes.
    ul > li: The PORT column in the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table in the communications database is greater than 32 bytes or contains leading blanks.
    ul > li: The
    ul > li > span: Db2®
    ul > li: authorization ID used for outbound authorization ID translation is greater than 8 bytes.
    ul > li: The SYSMODENAME column in the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table in the communications database is greater than 8 bytes.
system_action
    p: Notification of the failure is returned to the application. The remote connection is unsuccessful.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Correct the column in error as indicated by the unavailable resource message.
    p: For
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID translation failure, make sure that the remote BIND OWNER option contains an authorization ID less than or equal to 8 bytes for normal connection.
problem_determination
    p: Collect a listing of the SQL that was used to configure the CDB table in the error.
user_response

explanation
    p: One of the following situations occurred:
    ul > li: The requested VTAM® function failed because the distributed data facility (DDF) at the remote location was terminating.
    ul > li: A remote TCP/IP client attempted to connect to a local
    ul > li > span: Db2® for z/OS®
    ul > li: data server after the TCP/IP listener was up, but before DDF was up on that data server.

    p: writes a SYS1.LOGREC record. If DDF terminated, no communication on the conversation is allowed.

system_programmer_response
    p: Take one of the following actions, depending on the situation that occurred:
    ul > li: If DDF at the remote location terminated, contact the communication administrator at that location.
    ul > li: If a remote TCP/IP client attempted to connect to a local
    ul > li > span: Db2 for z/OS
    ul > li: data server after the TCP/IP listener was up, but before DDF was up on that data server, no action is needed. This situation is indicated by the following events:
    ul > li > ol > li: Message DSNL519I is issued to indicate that the TCP/IP listener is up.
    ul > li > ol > li: Message DSNL030I with reason code 00D31032 is issued to indicate that the TCP/IP client is attempting to connect to the
    ul > li > ol > li > span: Db2 for z/OS

    ul > li > ol > li: Message DSNL004I is issued to indicate that DDF is up and ready to accept connections.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The maximum number of remote connections, which is set by subsystem parameter CONDBAT, was reached, and the connection was rejected. The remote requester was not allowed to connect to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .

    p > span: Db2
    p: .

    p > span: Db2

number
    : 00D31035
msg_text
explanation
    p: The requested distributed function failed. The database access agent was aborted at the remote location. Notification of the failure is returned to the requester system application however the failure is really due to an unexpected failure at the remote server system. This error is an internal error at the remote server system. Evidence of the failure should be visible as an abend in the remote server system's SYS1.LOGREC information, or, you might find the failure recorded in a dump.
system_action
    p > span: Db2®
    p: writes a SYS1.LOGREC record and requests an SVC dump at the remote
    p > span: Db2
    p: site.
    p > span: Db2
    p: server system recovery returns this reason code back to the requester system.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain copies of the SYS1.LOGREC and SYSLOG data sets or similar data from each connected site, the SVC dump at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: failure, and any related dumps from each connected site.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: A dump should be present at the server system, or evidence of an abend should be visible in SYS1.LOGREC information around the time that this reason code was returned back to the requester system application. The internal error that caused the server system abend must be corrected.

number
    : 00D31036
msg_text
explanation
    p: The LINKNAME column of the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table was invalid. Since LINKNAME is a foreign key of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table, the LINKNAME column must specify one of the values provided in the LUNAME column of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table. This error should not occur.

**start section**
number
    : 00D31037
msg_text
explanation
    p: The connection to the remote server failed. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain an outbound row and did not specify the remote authorization ID for the primary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified as 'O' or 'B', outbound name translation is in use. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries that describe the remote authorization IDs that are used for each
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID that communicates with the LU or the TCP/IP address.
system_action
    p: A response is sent to the application to indicate that the resource is unavailable. The request is not sent to the remote site.
operator_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME or IPADDR. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that specify the remote authorization ID to be used for each possible
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID. These rows must specify 'O' in the TYPE column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31037.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31038
msg_text
explanation
    div: A conversation was not allocated for one of these reasons:
    div > ul > li: The requesting LU is part of a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: sysplex. When one or more LU names within a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: sysplex appear in the SYSIBM.LULIST table at the remote site, all LU names within the sysplex must be identified in the SYSIBM.LULIST table at the remote site.
    div > ul > li > ul > li: You might have intended to list all the sysplex's LU names in the SYSIBM.LULIST table, but you did not include one or more LU names.
    div > ul > li > ul > li: You listed a subset of the LU names in SYSIBM.LULIST but none of the LU names you listed are currently available. Please note that it can take up to 3 minutes for LU availability information to be updated following START DDF at the remote site.
    div > ul > li > ul > li: The location name sent to a remote site does not match the location name recorded in the BSDS at that remote site.
    div > ul > li > ul > li: The local SYSIBM.LULIST table is incorrectly defined for the remote location.
    div > ul > li: A DSNL030I message might have been written to the console.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and the conversation is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The CDB tables and
    p > span: Db2
    p: BSDS parameters must correctly associate the LOCATION names with their corresponding LUNAME names.
    div: The cause of this error is usually one of the following problems:
    div > ul > li: The BSDS at the remote site does not have the correct LOCATION or LUNAME value, which causes the remote DBMS to respond to the wrong LOCATION name when receiving distributed database requests.
    div > ul > li: The SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table at the local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system has an incorrect value in the LINKNAME or LOCATION column for the failing LOCATION, which causes the request to be sent to the wrong remote DBMS.
    div > ul > li: The SYSIBM.LULIST table at the local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system has an incorrect value in the LUNAME column for the failing LOCATION, which causes the request to be sent to the wrong remote DBMS.
    div > ul > li: Not all LU names in the requesting
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: sysplex are defined in the SYSIBM.LULIST table at the remote site.
    div > ul > li: Not all LU names in the requesting
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: sysplex are defined in the SYSIBM.LULIST table at the server
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem. The remote LU is not allowed access to the server subsystem.
    div > ul > li > p: In general, when the requester is a member of a sysplex, each member of the requesting sysplex should be defined in SYSIBM.LULIST of the server subsystem. However, there may be causes where an LU of a remote sysplex is not defined in SYSIBM.LULIST of the local subsystem to prevent the remote LU from being a candidate member when accessing the remote sysplex. This is known as "member specific routing". If the remote sysplex LU attempts to access the local subsystem, this reason code will be returned if the remote LU is not defined in the local SYSIBM.LULIST table and is also not defined in SYSIBM.LUNAMES. Remote requesting sysplex members can be defined in SYSIBM.LULIST, or, when member specific routing requirements to the remote sysplex member are needed, the remote sysplex LU can be defined in SYSIBM.LUNAMES for inbound purposes from the remote sysplex LU that contain the appropriate inbound security characteristics.
    div > ul > li: The local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system contains a SYSIBM.LULIST row for a remote system that is not a member of a Data Sharing group. SYSIBM.LULIST rows CANNOT be defined for remote non Data Sharing server systems. Remove the SYSIBM.LULIST row for the remote systems.
problem_determination
    div > ul > li: Determine the LUNAME and LOCATION name of the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system that attempted to start a VTAM® conversation.
    div > ul > li: Print the contents of the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table at that site.
    div > ul > li: Print the contents of the SYSIBM.LULIST table at both the local site and the remote site.
    div > ul > li: Determine the LUNAME and LOCATION name of the remote DBMS involved in the failure from the BSDS at the remote site.
    div > ul > li: Issue the -DISPLAY LOCATION command to determine which LUNAMEs and LOCATIONs were active at the time of failure.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31038.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31039
msg_text
explanation
    p: The allocation of a connection to the remote system failed for one of the following reasons:
    ul > li: The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table at the requesting site did not contain an outbound row and did not specify the remote authorization ID to be used for this
    ul > li > span: Db2®
    ul > li: authorization ID.
    ul > li: The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table at the requesting site contained an outbound row, but the specified remote authorization ID, password, or both contained more than eight characters.
    p: When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified as 'O' or 'B', outbound name translation is in use.
    p > span: The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries that describe the remote authorization IDs and passwords that are used for each
    p > span > span: Db2
    p > span: authorization ID that communicates with the LU or the TCP/IP address.
system_action
    p: The connection to the remote system is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: On the requesting system, make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME or IPADDR. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that specify the remote authorization ID that is to be used for each possible
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID.
    p > span: Each authorization ID must contain eight or fewer characters. If the remote connection communicates with the LU and you intend to use remote passwords, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that specify the remote password that is to be used for each possible
    p > span > span: Db2
    p > span: authorization ID. Each password must contain eight or fewer characters.
    p: These rows must specify 'O' in the TYPE column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table.
problem_determination
    div > span: Determine the LUNAME or IPADDR and find the authorization ID, password, or both for the failing remote system.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES and SYSIBM.LUNAMES tables at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D3103A
msg_text
explanation
    p: Database access agent allocation failed because the RACROUTE REQUEST=EXTRACT macro failed to locate a user profile for the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: primary authorization ID obtained from the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table. When the ENCRYPTPSWDS column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES specifies 'Y', the requesting
    p > span: Db2
    p: system must be able to extract the encrypted password (via RACROUTE REQUEST=EXTRACT) and send this encrypted password to the responding
    p > span: Db2
    p: system for validation.
system_action
    p: The reason code is returned to the application.
operator_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the new authorization ID column in SYSIBM.USERNAMES has been specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME. If you intend to use encrypted passwords, the new authorization ID must be defined to your MVS™ security subsystem.
problem_determination
    div > ul > li: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
    div > ul > li: Verify that the names given in the NEWAUTHID column are defined to your MVS security subsystem properly.

**start section**
number
    : 00D3103B
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to allocate an LU6.2 conversation failed because the conversation limits for the requested partner LU and VTAM® MODE have been reached.
system_action
    p: This reason code is generated internally when an attempt is made to allocate an LU6.2 conversation and conversation limits have been reached for the requested partner LU and VTAM MODE. In this situation, the requesting
    p > span: Db2®
    p: system will attempt to reuse one of the existing LU6.2 conversations that have already been allocated to the agent in question.
    p: The allocate process will be retried using the existing conversation.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If you increase the LU6.2 conversation limits for the indicated partner LU and VTAM MODE, it will not be necessary for
    p > span: Db2
    p: to reclaim conversations in order to allocate additional LU6.2 conversations. The reclaiming process will reduce system throughput, since the reclaimed conversation will have to service multiple SQL statements.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3103b.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3103C
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: An attempt was made to allocate an SNA (LU 6.2) conversation, but the authentication request failed because the specified remote partner LUNAME will not allow authentication based on a user ID alone.
    p: The remote partner LUNAME is configured to require authentication using a user ID and corresponding password.
    p: A password must be provided through
    p > span: Db2®
    p: application logic or through
    p > span: Db2
    p: Communications Database (CDB) definitions. Alternately, the partner LUNAME can be configured to allow authentication based on user ID alone. For example, specify LU 6.2 SECURITY=SAME or Already-Verified.
system_action
    p: The attempt to allocate an LU6.2 conversation fails, and the error is reported to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: application that requested access to the distributed resource.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If the remote LUNAME configuration can be changed, change it to allow Already Verified (Security=Same) authentication, which does not require a password. If the target LUNAME is a
    p > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    p: system, support is declared by specifying SECACPT=ALREADYV on the
    p > span: Db2
    p: VTAM® APPL statement.
    p: If remote LUNAME configuration changes are not appropriate, or if a higher level of security is required, then the local
    p > span: Db2 for z/OS
    p: system must honor the requirements of the remote LUNAME and provide a password. It might be possible to make application changes to provide a password. If application changes are not possible, CDB changes will be required.
    p: If the local application is DRDA related, and if it is executing an explicit SQL CONNECT statement to connect to the remote system, consider changing the application to provide a password on the SQL CONNECT statement as follows:
    pre > code: CONNECT TO server USING userid USING password
    p: In the following circumstances,
    p > span: Db2
    p: Communications Database tables must be changed to provide a password:
    ul > li: The local application cannot be modified to provide a password on its SQL CONNECT statement.
    ul > li: The application is performing an implicit SQL connection. (The application refers to a three-part name, or alias, that resolves to the remote system.)
    div: In these cases, change the SYSIBM.LUNAMES rows, which are associated to the partner LUNAME, to specify 'P' (password) or 'R' (RACF® PassTicket) for SECURITY_OUT. If you specify 'P', you must also:
    div > ul > li: Add a SYSIBM.USERNAMES
    div > ul > li > span: "outbound"
    div > ul > li: row that specifies the user ID and its associated password.
    div > ul > li: Specify a SYSIBM.LUNAMES USERNAMES column value of 'O' or 'B' to satisfy referential constraints on the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: The VTAM APPL definition for the remote
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system.
    div > ul > li: The contents of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3103c.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3103D
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to allocate a VTAM® LU6.2 conversation with a remote site failed because the request did not contain the proper security information.
system_action
    p: The attempt to access the remote database resource failed and the failure is reported to the application.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: This error is usually caused by transmitting an invalid authorization ID or password in a request to the remote site. However, this is not always the case, so it is important to review the diagnostic information at the remote site to determine the cause of the failure.
    div > ul > li: If the remote site is a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: subsystem, refer to the DSNL030I message at the remote site for the cause of the security failure. Additionally, an ALERT will be recorded in NetView® (if the NetView product is available) to describe the security failure.
    div > ul > li > p: If the remote site is not a
    div > ul > li > p > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > p: subsystem, obtain any diagnostic information about the security failure at the remote site.
    div: If you suspect the authorization ID or password is not correct, the
    div > span: Db2
    div: CDB on the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: system should be examined to validate the following items:
    div > ul > li: If the remote site requires both an authorization ID and a password on LU6.ALLOCATE requests (i.e., the remote site does not accept already-verified ALLOCATE requests), the USERNAMES column of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table at the local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system must specify either 'O' or 'B'.
    div > ul > li: If the USERNAMES column of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table at the local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system specifies 'O' or 'B', the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table will be used to determine the authorization ID and password sent on the LU6.ALLOCATE request.
    div > ul > li > p: If you intend to translate the authorization IDs, ensure that the NEWAUTHID column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table contains the correct authorization ID to be used at the remote site.
    div > ul > li: If the remote site is a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system, the ENCRYPTPSWDS value in the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table must exactly match the ENCRYPTPSWDS column of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table at the remote site.
    div > ul > li: If the remote site is not a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system, the ENCRYPTPSWDS value in the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table must be set to 'N'.
    div > ul > li: If you are transmitting passwords to the remote site, the password transmitted by the local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: system must exactly match the value expected by the remote site.
    div > ul > li > ol > li: For encrypted passwords, the password sent to the remote
    div > ul > li > ol > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > ol > li: subsystem is obtained by extracting the RACF® password of the user identified by the NEWAUTHID column in the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table. This user's RACF password must exactly match the password at the remote site.
    div > ul > li > ol > li: If password encryption is not used, the password will be taken from the PASSWORD column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table. This value must exactly match the password at the remote site.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES and SYSIBM.LUNAMES tables at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
user_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3103d.html

explanation

msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to allocate a VTAM® LU6.2 conversation with a remote site failed because the server at the remote LU does not support the SNA two-phase commit process.
system_action
    p > span: Db2®
    p: starts a new conversation to the remote site that does not use two-phase commit.
    p > span: Db2
    p: does not attempt to use two-phase commit with this remote site until DDF is restarted.
operator_response

    p: This reason code is produced when the LU at the remote site supports two-phase commit, but the TPN at the remote LU does not support two-phase commit. This is a normal situation, so no system programmer action is required.
