number
    : 00D31041
msg_text
explanation
    p: The requested VTAM® function to allocate a conversation was not performed because the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table at the responding site did not contain a row whose authorization ID column matches the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID received from the requesting
    p > span: Db2
    p: system. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES specifies 'I' or 'B', inbound name translation is in effect. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries describing the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID to be used for each
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID sent by the requesting
    p > span: Db2
    p: system.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and the conversation is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES has been specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME. If you intend to use local authorization IDs that differ from the remote
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that correctly specify the local authorization ID to be used for each possible remote authorization ID. These rows must specify 'I' in the TYPE column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table.
problem_determination
    div: Determine the LUNAME and authorization ID for the failing VTAM
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES and SYSIBM.LUNAMES tables at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
user_response

msg_text
explanation
    p: A remote subsystem has attempted to allocate a VTAM® LU6.2 conversation, but the request was rejected because the request did not contain the proper security information. The FMH5 received from the remote subsystem did not contain any security subfields. This represents SECURITY=NONE in the LU6.2 architecture, which is not supported by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
system_action
    p: The attempt to access the remote database resource fails and the failure is reported to the application.
    p: A DSNL030I message may have been written to the console.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

    p: Verify that the remote subsystem is configured to send valid security subfields.
    p: If the remote subsystem is
    p > span: Db2
    p: , make sure the VTAM APPL definition does not specify SECACPT=NONE, which is the default for the VTAM APPL definition. SECACPT=NONE will cause VTAM to remove the security subfields from the FMH5.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

    : 00D31045
msg_text
explanation
    p: A remote subsystem has attempted to allocate a VTAM® LU6.2 conversation, but the request was rejected because the request did not contain the proper security information. **start section**
number
    : 00D31046
msg_text
explanation
    p: A remote subsystem has attempted to allocate a VTAM® LU6.2 conversation, but the request was rejected because the request did not contain the proper security information. The FMH5 received from the remote subsystem indicated SECURITY=SAME (also known as Already-Verified) and the subsystem in question was not authorized to send requests with SECURITY=SAME.
system_action
    p: The attempt to access the remote database resource fails and the failure is reported to the application.
    p: A DSNL030I message may have been written to the console.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The request was rejected because the SECURITY_IN column of the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table contained a 'V' in the row associated with the remote system. The value 'V' indicates that the remote system must send both a USERID and a PASSWORD, which corresponds to SECURITY_PGM in the SNA LU6.2 architecture. Users should also be aware that in the absence of a SYSIBM.LUNAMES row that specifically identifies the remote LU, a "default" SYSIBM.LUNAMES row (blank LUNAME) may be used, if defined, if the inbound connection is via DRDA protocols. This "default" row may not reflect the needed inbound security characteristics in which case a SYSIBM.LUNAMES row can be defined that explicitly identifies the remote LU.
    p: If the remote LU is a member of a remote sysplex and the local system requires access to the remote sysplex, then members of the remote sysplex to be accessed must be defined in the local SYSIBM.LULIST table. In this case, the remote sysplex LU can be defined in the local SYSIBM.LULIST table although a SYSIBM.LUNAMES definition, default row or explicit definition, is appropriate in cases where it is undesirable to define the remote LU in SYSIBM.LULIST (for example when you don't want the remote LU to be a candidate member when outbound accessing the remote SYSPLEX location).
    div: This problem can be corrected in two ways:
    div > ol > li: If you would like
    div > ol > li > span: Db2®
    div > ol > li: to accept requests that are marked with SECURITY=SAME, change the SECURITY_IN value in the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table to 'A' for the remote LU in question. Also the
    div > ol > li > span: Db2
    div > ol > li: VTAM APPL definition should specify SECACPT=ALREADYV.
    div > ol > li: If you would like
    div > ol > li > span: Db2
    div > ol > li: to continue to reject requests of this kind, the remote LU must be configured to send requests that contain both a USERID and PASSWORD (SECURITY=PGM in SNA LU6.2 terms).
    div > ol > li > p: If the remote LU is
    div > ol > li > p > span: Db2
    div > ol > li > p: , the SECURITY_OUT column in the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table must specify either 'R' or 'P' in the row associated with the local
    div > ol > li > p > span: Db2
    div > ol > li > p: subsystem.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES and SYSIBM.LUNAMES tables at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
user_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31046.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31047
msg_text
explanation
    p: A remote subsystem has attempted to allocate a VTAM® LU6.2 conversation, but the request was rejected because the request did not contain the proper security information. The FMH5 received from the remote subsystem did not contain the security subfield that supplies the PASSWORD, or the PASSWORD was not 1 to 8 bytes in length.
system_action
    p: The attempt to access the remote database resource fails and the failure is reported to the application.
    p: A DSNL032I message may have been written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Verify that the remote subsystem is configured to send valid security subfields.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00D31048
msg_text
explanation
    p: The requested VTAM® function for allocating a conversation at the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: server was not performed because the requester's LUNAME is not defined in the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table of the communication database (CDB) at the server.
system_action
    p: Notification of the failure is returned to the application. The conversation is not allocated to the specified location.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Add the requester's LUNAME to the SYSIBM.LUNAMES table at the server. If the remote LU is
    p > span: Db2
    p: , the requester's LUNAME is the label name, as opposed to the ACBNAME keyword, on the
    p > span: Db2
    p: VTAM APPL statement for the requester site. A server's SYSIBM.LUNAMES table should contain an entry for the requester's LUNAME.
    p: In the absence of a SYSIBM.LUNAMES row that specifically identifies the remote LU, a default SYSIBM.LUNAMES row (blank LUNAME) might be used, if defined, in the case where the inbound connection is through DRDA protocols. This default row might not reflect the needed inbound security characteristics, in which case a SYSIBM.LUNAMES row can be defined that explicitly identifies the remote LU.
    p: If the remote LU is a member of a remote sysplex and the local system requires access to the remote sysplex, then members of the remote sysplex to be accessed must be defined in the local SYSIBM.LULIST table. In this case, the remote sysplex LU can be defined in the local SYSIBM.LULIST table. A SYSIBM.LUNAMES definition, default row or explicit definition, is appropriate in cases where it is undesirable to define the remote LU in SYSIBM.LULIST, such as when you do not want the remote LU to be a candidate member when outbound accessing the remote SYSPLEX location.
    p: Verify that the condition did not occur because of the unintended use of a generic LU name, which would make
    p > span: Db2
    p: aware of a partner LU name (its generic LU name) that is not specified in the LUNAME column of the SYSIBM.LULIST or SYSIBM.LUNAMES tables. Look for evidence of a
    p > span: DSNL510I
    p: or
    p > span: DSNL030I
    p: message that indicates the partner's generic LU name instead of its actual LU name. If the use of a generic LU name is indicated, use the RESET GENERICLU command to purge this generic LU affinity.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES and SYSIBM.LUNAMES tables at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31048.html
**end section**

    p > span: Db2®

    p: never issues an unsolicited SNA BACKOUT. Non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: servers can send an SNA BACKOUT indication when resources required to complete the unit of work are not available. For example, a deadlock might cause the non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: server to send an SNA BACKOUT. Contact the system programmer for the remote system to determine why the unit of work had to be aborted.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2
    p: partner with the desired log name. This should cause the indoubt units of work to be resolved automatically.

    p > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00D31050
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: expected to receive security information for the remote client but a valid DRDA SECCHK command was not received for a connection request from a DRDA application requester (AR). The DRDA SECCHK command is only valid with a DRDA security manager level greater than or equal to 5.
    div: This can be the case if one of the following occurs:
    div > ul > li: The DRDA AR requested a DRDA security manager less than level 5 for an SNA connection where the APPL command for
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: was specified with the SECACPT=NONE option.
    div > ul > li: The DRDA SECCHK command did not contain the required security information.
    div > ul > li: The DRDA AR requested a DRDA security manager less than level 5 for a TCP/IP connection.
system_action
    p: The attempt to access the local database resource fails, the failure is reported to the SQL application, and the conversation is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: For SNA connections, if SECACPT=NONE and the DRDA AR does not support DRDA security manager level 5, contact the
    p > span: Db2
    p: security administrator to change the SECACPT option to ALREADYV or CONV to allow for security information in the VTAM® FMH-5 in the form of userid or userid/password fields.  If SECACPT=NONE is not changed, then
    p > span: Db2
    p: cannot accept connection requests from this remote client.
    p: For SNA connections, If SECACPT=ALREADYV or CONV, then even though userid or userid/password fields in the FMH-5 are received and validated,
    p > span: Db2
    p: must evaluate a DRDA SECCHK command if it is sent. If the DRDA AR requests this level of security but does not provide the correct information in the form of a SECCHK command, this is a DRDA protocol error committed by the DRDA AR implementation at the remote client.
    p: For TCP/IP connections, this is a DRDA protocol error committed by the DRDA AR implementation at the remote client.
problem_determination
    div > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    div > span > span > span: Db2
    div > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    div > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    div > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    div > span > span > span: .
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31050.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D31052
msg_text
explanation
    p: An application caused recursive access to a remote location, followed by access to another remote location, which is not permitted.
    p: For example, an application at location LOC1 might have connected to location LOC2 and accessed a table using an alias that resolves back to LOC1. There was a subsequent remote access from LOC1 to LOC
    p > span > span: n
    p: , which caused the error.
system_action
    p: The attempt to access the remote location fails. The SQL application receives a -904 SQLCODE.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Correct the application program so that it does not cause recursive access to a location followed by remote access from that location. The application might have used table aliases, three-part table names, stored procedures, user-defined functions, or triggers to cause the condition.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
    div > ul > li > span: Location used in the alias entry in SYSIBM.SYSTABLES.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table.

**start section**
number
    : 00D31059
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to allocate a conversation to the remote site failed because
    p > span: Db2®
    p: was unable to obtain a RACF® PassTicket. The user specified an 'R' in the SECURITY_OUT column of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES or SYSIBM.LUNAMES communications database (CDB) tables for the partner site. As a result,
    p > span: Db2
    p: invokes RACF to extract a PassTicket for the partner site. However, RACF could not provide a PassTicket, and the attempt failed.
system_action
    p: The attempt to access the remote database resource failed, and the failure is reported to the application.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The error usually occurs due to incorrect or missing RACF definitions. To avoid this error, specify the proper RACF definitions to provide for the PassTicket. Alternatively, you may avoid the use of PassTickets by changing the SECURITY_OUT column of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES and/or SYSIBM.LUNAMES CDB table for the partner site.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the contents of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES and SYSIBM.LUNAMES tables at the local
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem and the remote
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the SYSIBM.LOCATIONS table.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31059.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3105A
msg_text
explanation
    p: An SQL CONNECT statement was issued with a user ID and password to connect to a location that requires RACF® PassTicket authorization. The connection cannot be made.
    p: The entry in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES for the location that is specified on the SQL CONNECT statement indicates that a connection request must contain a user ID and RACF PassTicket.
system_action
    p: The connection request is not processed. The application is placed in the unconnected and connectable state.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Change the application to eliminate its use of SQL CONNECT with a user ID and password, or remove the RACF PassTicket requirement in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3105a.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3105B
msg_text
explanation
    p: An SQL CONNECT statement was issued with a user ID and password to connect to a location that requires RACF® encrypted password authorization. The connection cannot be made.
    p: The entry in SYSIBM.LUNAMES for the location that is specified on the SQL CONNECT statement indicates that a connection request must contain a user ID and RACF encrypted password .
system_action
    p: The connection request is not processed. The application is placed in the unconnected and connectable state.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Change the application to eliminate its use of SQL CONNECT with a user ID and password, or remove the RACF encrypted password requirement in SYSIBM.LUNAMES.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3105b.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31100
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data communications function service was invoked with a parameter list that contained one or more invalid parameters. This is an internal error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested at the site of the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: abend.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine which sites the abending agent was connected to by examining the DSNL027 and DSNL028 SYSLOG console messages at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: abend. Obtain any related diagnostic information from each connected site and the SVC dump and STS1.LOGREC at the site of a
    p > span: Db2
    p: abend.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.

number
    : 00D31102
msg_text
explanation
    p: A data communications functional service encountered an inconsistency in the requesting thread control block structure. This is an internal error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested at the site of the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: abend.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine which sites the abending agent was connected to by examining the DSNL027 and DSNL028 SYSLOG console messages at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: abend. Obtain copies of the SYS1.LOGREC and SYSLOG data sets or similar data from each connected site, the SVC dump at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: failure, and any related dumps from each connected site.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.

    p > span: Db2
    p: abend. Obtain copies of the SYS1.LOGREC and SYSLOG data sets or similar data from each connected site, the SVC dump at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: failure, and any related dumps from each connected site.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

number
    : 00D3111e
msg_text
explanation
    p: A database access thread (DBAT) meets the requirement for becoming inactive but the limit specified by the value of the MAXTYPE1 subsystem parameter has already been reached.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, DSNL027I and DSNL028I messages have beenare written to SYSLOG, and the thread is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC listing and the SVC dump.
system_programmer_response
    p: The DBAT meets the requirements for becoming inactive because a nonzero value has been specified for the MAXTYPE1 subsystem parameter. However, because the number of inactive DBATs has already reached the MAXTYPE1 limit, the DBAT is terminated with this reason code. To correct the condition, increase the value of the MAXTYPE1 subsystem parameter to allow additional inactive DBATs, or set the value to zero.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3111e.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D3111F
msg_text
explanation
    p: The maximum amount of buffered query data has been exceeded. Rather than return one block of query data, the DRDA server system elected to return multiple extra blocks. Instead of fetching all rows in all the extra blocks, the requesting application either executed an SQL statement that is not related to the query or executed a commit while a held cursor was still open.
    p > span: Db2®
    p: buffers the extra in-transit blocks, however
    p > span: Db2
    p: was not able to buffer the entire set of extra blocks and thus truncated the result set. The application then resumed fetching and attempted to fetch data beyond the point of truncation.
    p: This SQLCODE can also be returned when the DRDA server system calculates the maximum amount of storage required for processing query data, and finds the requested storage exceeds the system limit.
system_action
    p: The SQL statement fails.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing application program and consider the following resolutions:
    ul > li: The cursor definition may cause the server to return extra blocks. In this case, the cursor definition can be changed to reduce the number of rows, thus extra blocks, being returned by the server.
    ul > li > p > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    ul > li > p: systems return extra blocks for cursors defined with the
    ul > li > p > span: OPTIMIZER FOR
    ul > li > p > span > span: n
    ul > li > p > span: rows
    ul > li > p: clause and will return only enough extra blocks in order to return
    ul > li > p > var: n
    ul > li > p: rows. When a cursor is defined with
    ul > li > p > span: OPTIMIZER FOR
    ul > li > p > span > span: n
    ul > li > p > span: rows
    ul > li > p: , either in the application or in a stored procedure, this indicates an application intent to fetch all
    ul > li > p > var: n
    ul > li > p: rows before attempting to execute other SQL statements. The application is not abiding by its intent and is executing other SQL, or committing, prior to fetching all
    ul > li > p > var: n
    ul > li > p: rows. In this case, the cursor definition can be changed to reduce the value of
    ul > li > p > var: n
    ul > li > p: , or the application logic can be modified to fetch all
    ul > li > p > var: n
    ul > li > p: rows or to close the cursor before executing the statement that caused the in-transit data to be buffered.
    ul > li: The number of extra blocks returned can be controlled by
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: installation parameters. The maximum number of extra blocks requested by a
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: requester system is determined by the "Extra Blocks Req" option of the DSNTIP5
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: installation panel. This value can be reduced which prevents the server system from returning more blocks than the
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: requester system can buffer.
    ul > li > p: Similarly, the server system may also provide a method to regulate the maximum number of extra blocks that it will return to a requester. In this case, this number can also be reduced.
    ul > li > p > span: For
    ul > li > p > span > span: Db2 for z/OS
    ul > li > p > span: systems, this is determined by the EXTRA BLOCKS SRV field on the DSNTIP5
    ul > li > p > span > span: Db2
    ul > li > p > span: installation panel.
    ul > li > p: Examine the columns in the cursor select list. The columns in the select list can impact the amount of storage required by the DRDA server for processing query data. The cursor definition can be changed to reduce the number of columns in the select list, or the columns in the select list can be changed to have a smaller declared length in the table. Both can reduce the required storage at the DRDA server to handle the query data.
    p: For information about block fetching result sets, see
    p > span: Managing Performance
    p: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Source listing of the failing application program.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3111f.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31200
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: thread inactivation processing failed to inactivate a database access thread (DBAT) because the DBAT's unit of recovery state was marked as "inflight". This processing occurs only when
    p > span: Db2
    p: is configured with DDF Inactive Threads support (when the "DDF THREADS" field is set to "INACTIVE" in the DSNTIPR installation panel). This error is an internal error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is requested at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: abend.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine which sites the abending agent was connected to by examining the DSNL027 and DSNL028 SYSLOG console messages at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: abend. Obtain copies of the SYS1.LOGREC and SYSLOG data sets from each connected site, the SVC dump at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: failure, and any related dumps from each connected site. If you suspect an error in
    p > span: Db2
    p: , refer to Part 2 of
    p > span: Db2
    p: Diagnosis Guide and Reference for information on identifying and reporting the problem.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.

**start section**
number
    : 00D31201
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an inconsistency in the TCP/IP PORT configuration parameter between the DRDA and RSYNC ports. A BIND ipaddr was specified on the DRDA PORT statement in the PROFILE.TCPIP data set but the BIND ipaddr was not specified on the RSYNC PORT statement in the PROFILE.TCPIP data set. When using dynamic virtual IP addresses (VIPA),
    p > span: Db2
    p: requires both the DRDA PORT and RSYNC PORT to be configured to use a VIPA.
system_action
    p: DDF is abnormally terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If using dynamic VIPA to bind to a
    p > span: Db2
    p: PORT number, verify that a VIPA is defined for both the DRDA PORT number and RSYNC PORT number by specifying the BIND ipaddr on the PORT statement in the PROFILE.TCPIP data set used to reserve the PORTs for
    p > span: Db2
    p: . If not using dynamic VIPA to bind to
    p > span: Db2
    p: PORT, remove the BIND ipaddr option on the PORT statement in the PROFILE.TCPIP data set used to reserve the PORT numbers for
    p > span: Db2
    p: . After fixing the TCP/IP PORT configuration statements, start DDF.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31201.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31202
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an inconsistent change in the TCP/IP PORT configuration parameter for the RSYNC PORT. A BIND ipaddr specified on the RSYNC PORT statement was changed in the PROFILE.TCPIP data set since DDF was started.
system_action
    p: DDF is abnormally terminated. This change can cause outages because of invalid sysplex routing information or commit resynchronization failures due to invalid IP addresses being returned to requesters.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Verify the BIND ipaddr specified on the RSYNC PORT number in the TCP/IP PORT statement and start DDF.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31202.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31203
msg_text
explanation
    p: A conversation was not allocated for one of these reasons:
    ul > li: The LINKNAME was present in the SYSIBM.IPLIST table, but not in the SYSIBM.IPNAMES table.
    ul > li: The IP Address contained in the IPADDR column of SYSIBM.IPLIST table was also present in the IPADDR column of SYSIBM.IPNAMES table. A given IP Address can appear in only one of these two tables.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and the conversation is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the LINKNAME in SYSIBM.IPLIST table is also defined in SYSIBM.IPNAMES table. Make sure the IP Address is specified in the IPADDR column of SYSIBM.IPLIST table and a blank value is specified in the IPADDR column of SYSIBM.IPNAMES table.
problem_determination
    p: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    ul > li: Print the contents of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES table.
    ul > li: Print the contents of the SYSIBM.IPLIST table.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31203.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31204
msg_text
explanation
    p: An outbound TCP/IP connection requires the use of IPv6 addressing but TCP/IP is not configured to support IPv6 addressing.
system_action
    p: Notification of the failure is returned to the application.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The Communications Database (CDB) registration of the remote partner indicates that an IPv6 address is to be used. That is, the location name being accessed by the application SQL refers to a SYSIBM.LOCATIONS row. The SYSIBM.LOCATIONS row contains a LINKNAME that refers to a SYSIBM.IPNAMES row. The SYSIBM.IPNAMES row contains an IPADDR value that indicates the use of IPv6 addressing, either by explicitly specifying an IPv6 address or by referring to a domain name that resolves to an IPv6 address.
    div: You must choose of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Configure TCP/IP to support IPv6 addressing.
    div > ul > li: Make configuration changes to refer to only IPv4 addresses.
    p: To configure TCP/IP to support IPv6 addressing, you must first ensure that TCP/IP is configured to use a dual-mode IPv4 and IPv6 stack - the BPXPRMxx PARMLIB member must be modified to allow TCP/IP to behave as a dual-mode stack. Other TCP/IP configuration changes are also required to define the IPv6 address. You can verify that IPv6 addressing is correctly defined for
    p > span: Db2®
    p: purposes if the
    p > span: Db2
    p: Display DDF command report, issued after DDF is started, provides an IPv6 address.
    p: If TCP/IP cannot be configured to support IPv6 addressing, you can only refer to IPv4 addresses. If the IPADDR column, of the SYSIBM.IPNAMES CDB table, specifies an IPv6 address, you must change the IPADDR column to refer to an IPv4 address. If the IPADDR column specifies a domain name that resolves to an IPv6 address by the Domain Name Server (DNS), you must modify the DNS to resolve the domain name to an IPv4 address.
    p: Make the appropriate changes and rerun the application.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31204.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D31205
msg_text
explanation
    p: A secure connection could not be established using
    p > span: z/OS®
    p: Application Transparent-Transport Layer Security (AT-TLS). The reason that this code was issued depends on whether the connection attempt was inbound or outbound:
    dl > dt: Inbound connections
    dl > dd > span: Db2®
    dl > dd: has detected an invalid use of a secure port. A non-secure TCP/IP connection is attempting to access
    dl > dd > span: Db2
    dl > dd: using a secure port without an AT-TLS policy established for the connection.
    dl > dt: Outbound connections
    dl > dd > span: Db2
    dl > dd: cannot establish a secure connection with the remote location.
system_action
    p: The system action depends on whether the connection was inbound or outbound:
    dl > dt: Inbound connections
    dl > dd: The attempted connection request is terminated. If no instance of message
    dl > dd > span: DSNL030I
    dl > dd: has been written to the system console in the preceding five minutes, message
    dl > dd > span: DSNL030I
    dl > dd: is written to the system console.
    dl > dt: Outbound connections
    dl > dd: The request to connect to the remote site fails. The SQL application receives SQLCODE
    dl > dd > span: -904
    dl > dd: .
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span: z/OS
    p: AT-TLS transparently performs transport layer security (TLS) on behalf of
    p > span: Db2
    p: by invoking the
    p > span: z/OS
    p: System Secure Socket Layer (SSL) in the TCP transport layer. AT-TLS uses a policy-based configuration, and the Policy Agent application is required to define AT-TLS rules and actions to the TCP/IP stack for TCP connections.
    ol > li: Use the reports generated by the
    ol > li > span: z/OS UNIX
    ol > li: pasearch and TCP/IP NETSTAT TTLS commands to verify that an AT-TLS policy exists and has been defined for the appropriate port.
    ol > li > dl > dt: Inbound connections
    ol > li > dl > dd: The secure port that
    ol > li > dl > dd > span: Db2
    ol > li > dl > dd: uses for accepting secure TCP/IP connections.
    ol > li > dl > dt: Outbound connections
    ol > li > dl > dd: The remote port that
    ol > li > dl > dd > span: Db2
    ol > li > dl > dd: uses to establish a secure TCP/IP connection with the remote location.
    ol > li: Ensure that AT-TLS is enabled for this connection.
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Verify that the correct port number has been specified for the connection to the target server. For a secure connection, the port number should be the target
    p > span: Db2
    p > span: SECURE PORT
    p: , in which case an AT-TLS policy is required.
    p: If you want to access
    p > span: Db2
    p: without a secure connection, specify the
    p > span: Db2
    p > span: DRDA PORT
    p: .
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d31205.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: The MAXFILEPROC limit was exceeded and the thread was not allowed to connect to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
system_action
    p: The requester is not connected to
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The maximum number of sockets that can be opened concurrently is defined by the installation option MAXFILEPROC. When the MAXFILEPROC limit is exceeded, threads are not allowed to connect to
    p > span: Db2
    p: . This message will be issued by DSNLILNR if
    p > span: Db2
    p: is acting as the server listening on a socket and the conversation was abnormally deallocated or by DSNLIAAC when
    p > span: Db2
    p: is acting as the requester initiating a connection and the connection was not allocated.
    p: Make the appropriate changes and rerun the application.
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

system_programmer_response
    p: Determine which sites the abending agent was connected to by examining the DSNL027 and DSNL028 SYSLOG console messages at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: abend. Obtain copies of the SYS1.LOGREC and SYSLOG data sets or similar data from each connected site, the SVC dump at the site of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: failure, and any related dumps from each connected site.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d34411.html

number
    : 00D34418
msg_text
explanation
    p: The connection to the remote server failed. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain an outbound row and did not specify the remote authorization ID for the plan owner
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES is specified as 'O' or 'B', outbound name translation is in use. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries that describe the remote authorization IDs that are used for each
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID that communicates with the LU.
system_action
    p: A response is sent to the application to indicate that the resource is unavailable. The request is not sent to the remote site.
operator_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES is specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that specify the remote authorization ID to be used for each possible
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID. These rows must specify 'O' in the TYPE column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d34418.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: The distributed relational data system (DRDS) subcomponent has detected an inconsistency processing a request using Distributed Relational Database Architecture™ (DRDA) at the local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
    p: The local
    p > span: Db2
    p: has received an ENDUOWRM that indicates that the remote server processed a dynamic COMMIT request successfully; however, the SQLCARD that accompanies the ENDUOWRM contains a negative SQL return code.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated. If this error has not been previously detected, then message DSNL031I is written to the MVS™ console and trace record containing the reply from the remote server are written in statistics class 4. If the error was already detected, information from the previous occurrence can be used to diagnose the problem.
    p: During execution the application will receive an SQLCODE +30100 for this operation.

    p: Notify the system programmer.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

number
    : 00D3442F
msg_text
explanation
    p: The distributed relational data system (DRDS) subcomponent has detected an inconsistency processing a request using Distributed Relational Database Architecture™ (DRDA) at the local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
    div: The inconsistency may manifest itself as follows:
    div > ul > li: In the processing of an embedded SELECT SQL statement, a prior execution of this embedded SELECT SQL statement resulted in a SQLDTARD that is NOT the same as the SQLDTARD received on the current execution of this SQL statement.
    div > ul > li: In the processing of an OPEN cursor SQL statement, a prior description of the resultant data, obtained either as a result of a PREPARE or a prior execution of this SQL statement is NOT the same as the description of the resultant data that was received on the current execution of this SQL statement.
    p: The data length, the data type and CCSID of each column of resultant data is checked for consistency.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated. If this error has not been previously detected, then message DSNL031I is written to the MVS™ console and trace record containing the reply from the remote server written in statistics class 4. If the error was already detected, information from the previous occurrence can be used to diagnose the problem.
    p: During execution the application will receive an SQLCODE -30020 for this operation. Subsequent requests within this unit of work will receive an SQLCODE -900 or -906.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Examine the trace record associated with the failing request's LUWID to determine the reply message and data that was received by the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Consult with the remote server system programmer to diagnose the problem.
    div: At the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At the remote server, collect the following items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

number
    : 00D3443A
msg_text
explanation
    p: The database access request from a remote site failed because the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain an inbound row, the TYPE column specified as an 'I' describing the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID to be used for the remote plan owner authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES specifies 'I' or 'B', requiring inbound name translation, the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries describing which
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs are to be used for each remote authorization ID from the LU.
system_action
    p: The DSNL030I message is issued at the server. The database access agent is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES has been specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that correctly specify the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs to be used for every possible remote authorization ID.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3443a.html

    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
    div: Examples of inconsistencies follow:
    div > ul > li: The local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: believes that the chain is intact but the remote server believes that the chain has been severed.
    div > ul > li: The local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: believes that the chain has been severed but the remote server believes that the chain is intact.
    div > ul > li: The local
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: has received a negative SQL return code while processing a response to BEGIN BIND yet the remote server has not severed the chain.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated. If this error has not been previously detected, then message DSNL031I is written to the MVS™ console and trace record containing the reply from the remote server are written in statistics class 4. If the error was already detected, information from the previous occurrence can be used to diagnose the problem.
    p: During BIND, the application will receive a DSNT500I message. During execution the application will receive an SQLCODE -904 for this operation. Subsequent requests within this unit of work will receive an SQLCODE -900 or -906.

    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

    div > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00D3443E
msg_text
explanation
    p: The database access request from a remote site failed because the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain an inbound row, the TYPE column specified as an 'I' describing the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID to be used for the remote package owner authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES specifies 'I' or 'B' requiring inbound name translation, the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries describing which
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs are to be used for each remote authorization ID from the LU.
system_action
    p: The database access agent is not allocated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES has been specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that correctly specify the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs to be used for every possible remote authorization ID.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3443e.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D3443F
msg_text
explanation
    p: The connection to the remote server failed. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table did not contain an outbound row and did not specify the remote authorization ID for the package owner
    p > span: Db2®
    p: authorization ID. When the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified as 'O' or 'B', outbound name translation is in use. The SYSIBM.USERNAMES table must contain entries that describe the remote authorization IDs that are used for each
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID that communicates with the LU or the TCP/IP address.
system_action
    p: A response is sent to the application to indicate that the resource is unavailable. The request is not sent to the remote site.
operator_response
    p: Notify the communications database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Make sure the USERNAMES column in SYSIBM.LUNAMES or SYSIBM.IPNAMES is specified correctly for the indicated LUNAME or IPADDR. If you intend to use remote authorization IDs that differ from the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization IDs, verify that the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table has rows that specify the remote authorization ID to be used for each possible
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID. These rows must specify 'O' in the TYPE column of the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYSIBM.USERNAMES table for an incorrect or missing entry.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3443f.html
**end section**

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , acting as a DRDA server, has detected an error while parsing a DRDA command and its command data objects and has generated a DRDA exception. One of the following error conditions might have occurred:
    ul > li: An EXCSQLSTT command was received specifying a stored procedure name (PRCNAM), but the statement is not a stored procedure call.
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: returns a CMDCHKRM to the requester.
    ul > li: An EXCSQLIMM or EXCSQLSTT command was received from the requester specifying an invalid QRYINSID instance variable.
    ul > li > span: Db2

    ul > li > span: DSNL032I
    ul > li: console message.

    span: DSNL032I
    : is written to the console. A DDM reply message is returned to the requester system.

    p > span > span > span: Db2

number
    : 00D34442
msg_text
explanation
    p: The distributed relational data system (DRDS) subcomponent has detected an inconsistency processing a request using Distributed Relational Database Architecture™ (DRDA) at the local
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
    div: The local
    div > span: Db2
    div: has received an ENDUOWRM that indicates that the remote server processed a dynamic ROLLBACK request successfully; however, the server should not have processed the ROLLBACK for one of the following reasons:
    div > ul > li: The server was not available to update
    div > ul > li: The server was participating in two phase commit protocols with the current request
system_action
    p: An alert is generated. If this error has not been previously detected, then message DSNL031I is written to the MVS™ console and trace record containing the reply from the remote server are written in statistics class 4. If the error was already detected, information from the previous occurrence can be used to diagnose the problem.
    p: During execution, the application will receive an SQLCODE -904 for this operation. The connection to the server will be terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Examine the trace record associated with the LUWID of the failing request to determine the reply message and data that was received by the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Consult with the remote server system programmer to diagnose the problem.
    div: For the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: that made the request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: For the remote server that received the request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D34445
msg_text
explanation
    p: The distributed relational data system (DRDS) subcomponent detected an error while processing a DDM CNTQRY command received from a remote requester.
    p: A previous CNTQRY command specified a QRYROWSET parameter, which indicated the number of rows to be returned as a rowset. Because of the blocking limits in effect with the requester, only a partial rowset was returned to the requester. Some rows in the requested rowset are still unfetched and are pending. The DRDA rules require that this subsequent CNTQRY command must either:
    ul > li: Specify a QRYROWSET value that is equal to the number of pending rows in the rowset.
    ul > li: Reset the query blocks from the pending rowset
    p: The CNTQRY command did not specify the QRYRSTBLK parameter to reset the query blocks, so this command is assumed to completes the pending rowset. Because the requested QRYROWSET value does not equal the number of pending rows in the rowset that was requested by the previous CNTQRY, a DRDA exception occurred.
system_action
    p: Message
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: is written to the console, and a DDM reply message (PRCCNVRM) is returned to the requester system.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record that is identified by the IFCID sequence number that is enumerated in the
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: message.
    div: If the requester system is a
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2
    div: server system that generated the
    div > span: DSNL032I
    div: message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d34445.html
**end section**

msg_text
explanation
    p: The distributed relational data system (DRDS) subcomponent detected an error while processing a DDM CNTQRY command received from a remote requester. If either or both the OPNQRY command and the first CNTQRY command specified QRYROWSET parameter, then all subsequent CNTQRY commands must specify the QRYROWSET parameter explicitly. The CNTQRY command did not specify a QRYROWSET parameter as required by the DRDA rules and a DRDA exception occurred.
system_action
    p: Message
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: is written to the console, and a DDM reply message (PRCCNVRM) is returned to the requester system.

msg_text

    ul > li: The cursor is scrollable, but it is being accessed by the requester in a non-scrollable manner. (Neither the OPNQRY command nor the first CNTQRY command specified the QRYROWSET parameter.)

number
    : 00D3444A
msg_text
explanation
    p: The distributed relational data system (DRDS) subcomponent detected an error while processing a DDM CNTQRY command received from a remote requester. The CNTQRY is fetching data from a scrollable cursor which is being accessed in a scrollable manner by the requester. The CNTQRY command will return one or more LOB columns as LOB data, but the  RTNEXTDTA parameter on the CNTQRY command (indicating how LOB values are to be returned) did not specify RTNEXTALL as required by the DRDA rules. A DRDA exception is generated.
system_action
    p: Message
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: is written to the console, and a DDM reply message (PRCCNVRM) is returned to the requester system.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®

    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record that is identified by the IFCID sequence number that is enumerated in the
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: message.
    div: If the requester system is a
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.

**start section**
number
    : 00D3444C
msg_text
explanation
    p: The distributed relational data system (DRDS) subcomponent detected an error while processing a DDM CNTQRY command received from a remote requester. A previous CNTQRY command specified a QRYROWSET parameter, indicating the number of rows to be returned as a rowset. Because of the blocking limits in effect with the requester, only a partial rowset was returned to the requester and a number of rows in the requested rowset are still unfetched, and remain in pending state. The DRDA rules require that this subsequent CNTQRY command either reset the pending query blocks by means of the QRYRSTBLK parameter or must explicitly or implicitly specify a FETCH NEXT orientation (RELATIVE+1) to complete the pending rowset.The CNTQRY command did not reset the pending rowset and did not specify the FETCH NEXT orientation, resulting in a DRDA exception.
system_action
    p: The message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (PRCCNVRM) is returned to the requester system.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div > span: If the requester system is a
    div > span > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div > span: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
    div > span: At the
    div > span > span: Db2
    div > span: server system that is generating the message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d3444c.html

    p > span: Db2®

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

    div > span: Db2 for z/OS

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

    p: Acting as a DRDA server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLDTA object received from a DRDA requester system. While parsing the FDODTA constituent of the SQLDTA object, a data item has a stated or implied length that is larger than the stated length of the FDODTA object itself.
system_action
    p: The system generates an alert and returns message DSNL032I. Refer to the description of this message for further information. A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returns to the requester system.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: You should analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: DRDA server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
    div: If the requester is a
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d34450.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D34451
msg_text
explanation
    p: A remote application connected to a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: server and issued an SQL statement that contain a three-part name or alias that refers to an table or view at a remote location. However, the remote reference actually resolves to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: server location. This situation can occur when the SQL statement refers to a location alias but the package for the application was bound before the location alias was defined.
system_action
    p: The SQL statement is rejected.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Use the DISPLAY DDF command to determine the location aliases for the server. Ensure that any location alias references in the application exist at the server when the package is bound.
user_response
    p: Bind the application package at the server after the location alias is defined. For a data sharing group, ensure that the location alias is defined on all members.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d34451.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D35000
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected a DRDA exception condition. This is a generic reason code that describes a situation not covered by any other reason codes.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL031I message should be analyzed.
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items at the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: .
    div > ul > li: Statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number specified in message DSNL031I.
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items at the remote server.
    div > ul > li: Relevant error and system logs spanning the time of the failure.
    div > ul > li: Any relevant remote server trace information or dumps.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35000.html
