number
    : 00D35807
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while processing late environmental descriptors which precede the SQLDTAGRP late group descriptor, contained within the SQLDTARD late descriptor. The DDM object is a QRYDSC which spans multiple query blocks. One or more of the containing level 6b DSSs is (are) other than an object (OBJ) DSS. The descriptor is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: If the error occurs within the QRYDSC or SQLDTARD DDM objects, the application will receive SQLCODE -30000 and SQLSTATE 58008. If the error occurs within the DDM SQLDTA object, a DSCINVRM reply message will be returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL031I message should be analyzed.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D35808
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while processing late environmental descriptors which precede the SQLDTAGRP late group descriptor, contained within the SQLDTARD late descriptor. The DDM object is a QRYDSC which spans multiple query blocks. One or more of the code points of the DDM objects carrying the descriptor is (are) other than QRYDSC (X'241B'). The descriptor is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: If the error occurs within the QRYDSC or SQLDTARD DDM objects, the application will receive SQLCODE -30000 and SQLSTATE 58008. If the error occurs within the DDM SQLDTA object, a DSCINVRM reply message will be returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL031I message should be analyzed.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

**start section**
number
    : 00D35809
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while processing late environmental descriptors which precede the SQLDTAGRP late group descriptor contained within the SQLDTARD late descriptor. This late descriptor is within a QRYDSC which spans one or more query blocks. The QRYDSC contains only late environmental descriptors and is, therefore, incomplete.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: The application will receive SQLCODE -30000 and SQLSTATE 58008.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL031I message should be analyzed.
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items at this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: .
    div > ul > li: Statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number specified in message DSNL031I.
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items at the remote server.
    div > ul > li: Relevant error and system logs spanning the time of the failure.
    div > ul > li: Any relevant remote server trace information or dumps.
user_response

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command data object received from a local
    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command data object received from a local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . The DDM object is TYPDEFOVR, signaling a CCSID change from the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . This is a collection consisting of CCSIDSBC, CCSIDMBC, and CCSIDDBC. The TYPDEFOVR contains an object other than CCSIDSBC, CCSIDDBC, or CCSIDDBC. This is invalid.

    div > ul > li: Relevant error and system logs spanning the time of the failure.
    div > ul > li: Any relevant AS trace information or dumps.

explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected an error while parsing a DDM command received from the application requester (AR). The minimum level attribute of the DDM command received from the AR, (that is, the level of DDM required to support the command) exceeds the DDM level specified by the AR during CONNECT processing.

    p > span: Db2
    p: .

    p > span: Db2®

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response

number
    : 00D35926
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command or DDM command data received from a remote requester. The DDM object is a TYPDEFOVR, signaling a change in CCSIDs from the remote requester. This is a DDM collection consisting of four DDM scalars: CCSIDSBC, CCSIDMBC, CCSIDDBC and CCSIDXML. The TYPDEFOVR contains multiple instances of the CCSIDXML scalar. This is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the remote requester.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00D35A01
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command data object received from a local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . The DDM object is either an SQLSTT, SQLOBJNAM or SQLSTTVRB. These objects are described by early group descriptors, each of which contains both SBCS and mixed SDAs describing character data. In all cases, the instantiation of the SBCS and mixed elements are mutually exclusive, i.e. if the SBCS element is sent, then the mixed must not be sent and conversely. The instantiation of both the SBCS and mixed data SDAs has been sent. This is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (DTAMCHRM) will be returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this
    div > span: Db2
    div: remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35a01.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D35A02
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command data object received from a local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . The DDM object is either an SQLSTT, SQLOBJNAM, or SQLSTTVRB. These objects are described by early group descriptors, each of which contains both SBCS and mixed SDAs describing character data. In all cases, the instantiation of the SBCS and mixed elements are mutually exclusive, i.e. if the SBCS element is sent, then the mixed must not be sent and conversely. Further, either the SBCS or mixed (not both) must be instantiated. The data retrieved from the object instantiates neither the SBCS nor the mixed SDA. This is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) will be returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this
    div > span: Db2
    div: remote server, collect the following diagnostic items listed in
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35a02.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D35A03
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command data object received from a remote requester. The DDM object is either an SQLSTT, SQLOBJNAM, or SQLSTTVRB. The DDM extended length field required to support these objects is invalid.
system_action
    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console.
    p: Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the remote requester.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div: For non-
    div > span: Db2
    div: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.
user_response
sql_state

    p > span: Db2®

    p > span: Db2
    p: . The SQLDTA FDOCA descriptor, contained in the FDODSC scalar, includes late environmental descriptors, however, the SQLDTA meta data definition (MDD) is either invalid or has not been included within the SQLDTA descriptor. The descriptor is invalid.

msg_text

    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLDTA command data object received from a local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . The SQLDTA FDOCA descriptor geometry is incorrect.
    p > span: The SQLDTA RLO triplet either specifies a local identifier (LID) which is different than that defined in the previously processed SQLDTAGRP late group descriptor, or specifies a nonzero number of elements or a replication factor other than 1.
    p: The descriptor is invalid.

number
    : 00D35B09
msg_text
explanation
    p: Acting as a DRDA server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLDTA object. The SQLDTA object, or one of its constituent members, has an object length less than 4. Its constituent members are:
    ul > li: FDODSC or FDODTA, in the case of an SQLDTA in non-array format
    ul > li: FDODSC, FDOEXT, FDODTA, or FDOOFF, in the case of an SQLDTA in array format.
system_action
    p: The system generates an alert and returns message
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: . Refer to the description of this message for further information.
operator_response

    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: message.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: DRDA server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: If the requester is a
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

number
    : 00D35B0B
msg_text
explanation
    p: Acting as a DRDA server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLDTA object in array format. In this case, the SQLDTA is a DDM collection consisting of FDODSC, FDOEXT, FDODTA, and FDOOFF scalars. The last scalar within the SQLDTA is other than the FDOOFF. This procedure is invalid.
system_action
    p: The system generates an alert and returns message DSNL032I. Refer to the description of this message for further information.

    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.

    div > span: Db2 for z/OS

**start section**
number
    : 00D35B0C
msg_text
explanation
    p: Acting as a DRDA server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLDTA object. The SQLDTA object itself, or one of its constituent members has an object length that is greater than the actual length remaining in the enclosing object. The constituent members are listed below:
    div > ul > li: FDODSC or FDODTA, in the case of an SQLDTA in non-array format
    div > ul > li: FDODSC, FDOEXT, FDODTA, or FDOOFF, in the case of an SQLDTA in array format
    p: For example, a FDODSC scalar as an object length that is greater than the SQLDTA object in which it is contained, or an SQLDTA object has an object length greater than the DSS in which it is contained.
system_action
    p: The system generates an alert and returns message DSNL032I. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

    div: At the
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: DRDA server, collect the following diagnostic items:

    div > span: Db2 for z/OS

number
    : 00D35B0D
msg_text
explanation
    p: Acting as a DRDA server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLDTA object. The FDOCA geometry for an SQLDTAGRP late group descriptor, contained within the DRDA SQLDTA late descriptor, is incorrect. The SQLDTAGRP triplet is not defined as an FD:OCA nullable group. The descriptor is invalid.
system_action
    p: The system generates an alert and returns message DSNL032I. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DSCINVRM reply message is returned to the requester.

    p > span: Db2®

**start section**
number
    : 00D35B16
msg_text
explanation
    p: Acting as a DRDA server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLDTA object. While parsing the SQLDTAGRP late group descriptor contained within the SQLDTA object, the local identifier (LID) of one of the SQLDTAGRP constituent triplets was not previously defined by a late environmental descriptor and the LID is outside of the bounds of the default environmental descriptor LIDs. Note that the default LIDs are identical to the DRDA types. The descriptor is invalid.
system_action
    p: The system generates an alert and returns message DSNL032I. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DSCINVRM reply message is returned to the requester.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: You should analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: DRDA server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: If the requester is a
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

number
    : 00D35B17
msg_text
explanation
    p: Acting as a DRDA server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLDTA object. While parsing the SQLDTAGRP late group descriptor contained within the SQLDTA object, the length override value in one of the constituent SQLDTAGRP SDAs contains a placeholder length value, but the placeholder length value is an allowable value. The descriptor is invalid.
system_action
    p: The system generates an alert and returns message DSNL032I. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DSCINVRM reply message is returned to the requester.

    p: .

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM BGNBND, BNDSQLSTT, ENDBND, DRPPKG, or REBIND command received from a local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Bytes 9 through 18 of the DDM scalar, DFTRDBCOL are other than blank. While DDM defines the length of DFTRDBCOL to be 18 bytes,
    p > span: Db2
    p: supports only 8-byte collection identifiers.

number
    : 00D35C11
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM BGNBND, BNDSQLSTT, ENDBND, DRPPKG, or REBIND command received from a local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . The DDM PKGDFTCC collection consists of three DDM scalars: CCSIDSBC, CCSIDMBC, and CCSIDDBC. The PKGDFTCC collection contains multiple instances of the CCSIDSBC scalar. This is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) will be returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see

number
    : 00D35C17
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM BGNBND, BNDSQLSTT, ENDBND, DRPPKG, or REBIND command received from a local
    p > span: Db2
    p: . The DDM object PKGNAM is a mapped scalar containing RDBNAM, RDBCOLID and PKGID. Bytes 17 and 18 of the DDM scalar, RDBNAM, are other than blank. While DDM defines the length of RDBNAM to be 18 bytes,
    p > span: Db2
    p: supports only a 16 byte RDBNAM.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) will be returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .

number
    : 00D35C18
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DRDA BGNBND, BNDSQLSTT, ENDBND, DRPPKG, BNDCPY, BNDDPLY, or REBIND command received from a remote DRDA requester. The DDM object PKGNAM, PKGNAMCSN, or PKGID is invalid.
    dl > dt: PKGNAMCSN
    dl > dd: If the DDM object is PKGNAMCSN, then either the section number is nonpositive (zero or a negative number) or the DDM scalar PKGID contains a package identifier that is greater than 128 bytes in length.
    dl > dd > span: Db2
    dl > dd: supports package identifiers with a maximum length of 128 bytes.
    dl > dt: PKGNAM or PKGID
    dl > dd: If the DDM object is PKGNAM or PKGID, then the DDM scalar object PKGID contains a package identifier that is greater than 128 bytes in length.
    dl > dd > span: Db2
    dl > dd: supports package identifiers with a maximum length of 128 bytes.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: is written to the console.
    p: The DDM reply message VALNSPRM (parameter value not supported) is returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: message should be analyzed.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: .
    div: At this
    div > span: Db2
    div: remote server, collect the following diagnostic items listed in
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D35C30
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM DRPPKG command received from a remote requester.
    p > span: Db2
    p: has received a wild card instance variable RDBCOLIDANY, but neither instance variable PKGIDANY nor instance variable PKGID is received. When RDBCOLIDANY is present, PKGIDANY or PKGID must be specified. The request is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for more information.
    p: A DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) is returned to the remote requester.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

number
    : 00D35C35
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DRDA BGNBND, BNDSQLSTT, ENDBND, DRPPKG, BNDCPY, BNDDPLY, or REBIND command received from a remote DRDA requester. The DDM object RDBCOLID, PKGNAM, PKGMANCT, or PKGNAMCSN is invalid. The DDM scalar RDBCOLID contains a collection ID that is greater than 128 bytes in length.
    p > span: Db2
    p: supports collection IDs with a maximum length of 128 bytes.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: is written to the console.
    p: The DDM reply message VALNSPRM (parameter value not supported) is returned to the remote requester.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this
    div > span: Db2
    div: remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

number
    : 00D35D11
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DRDA command received from a remote DRDA requestor. The DDM object PKGNAMCSN is invalid. Either the section number is nonpositive (zero or a negative number) or the DDM scalar PKGID contains a package identifier that is greater than 128 bytes in length.
    p > span: Db2
    p: supports package identifiers with a maximum length of 128 bytes.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: is written to the console.
    p: The DDM reply message VALNSPRM (parameter value not supported) is returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .

    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request.     div > span: Db2

number
    : 00D35D24
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM EXCSQLSTT command received from a remote requester. The value of the DDM enumerated scalar NBRROW is invalid.
system_action
    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console.
    p: Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) is returned to the remote requester.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35d24.html

number
    : 00D35D25
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM CNTQRY command received from a remote requester. The value of the DDM enumerated scalar FREPRVREF is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) is returned to the remote requester.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM GETNXTCHK command received from a remote requester. The value of the DDM enumerated scalar FREREFOPT is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) is returned to the remote requester.

system_programmer_response

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM EXCSQLSTT or OPNQRY command received from a remote requester. The value of the DDM enumerated scalar DYNDTAFMT is invalid.

    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) is returned to the remote requester.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.

explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM OPNQRY command that was received from a remote requester. The value of the DDM enumerated scalar QRYCLSIMP is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console.
    p: A DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) is returned to the remote requester.

    p: Notify the system programmer.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2
    div: remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00D35D2E
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DRDA BGNBND, BNDSQLSTT, ENDBND, DRPPKG, BNDCPY, BNDDPLY, or REBIND command received from a remote DRDA requester. The DDM object RDBCOLID, PKGNAM, PKGMANCT, or PKGNAMCSN is invalid. The DDM scalar RDBCOLID contains a collection ID that is greater than 128 bytes in length.
    p > span: Db2
    p: supports collection IDs with a maximum length of 128 bytes.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: is written to the console.
    p: The DDM reply message VALNSPRM (parameter value not supported) is returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the
    p > span: DSNL032I
    p: message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this
    div > span: Db2
    div: remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35d2e.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D35E00
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command or DDM command data. An invalid RDBNAM length was sent on an ACCSEC command.
system_action
    p: If the length of the RDBNAM is greater than 18, then A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the DRDA client. If the data in characters 17-18 of the RDBNAME is non-blank, then a DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) is returned to the DRDA client.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e00.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D35E01
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command or DDM command data. An ACCSEC or SECCHK command was sent without one or more of its required DDM instance variables.
system_action
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message should be analyzed.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

**start section**
number
    : 00D35E04
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command or DDM command data. A duplicate instance variable was sent on an ACCSEC command.
system_action
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e04.html

number
    : 00D35E05
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command or DDM command data. An invalid SECMGRNM length was sent on an ACCSEC command. The SECMGRNM must be null.
system_action
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

    : 00D35E06
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM command or DDM command data. An invalid SECMEC length was sent on an ACCSEC command. Only one SECMEC can be specified.
system_action
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the local
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message should be analyzed.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

**start section**
number
    : 00D35E0E
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error in the DDM command data object or DDM reply data object received from the remote server as part of a DDM command or reply. The sum of the lengths of the constituent DDM objects within an OBJDSS is inconsistent with the length of the DSS carrier.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: The application will receive SQLCODE -30000 and SQLSTATE 58008.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL031I message.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e0e.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D35E0F
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error in the DDM command data object or DDM reply data object received from the remote server as part of a DDM command or reply. The size of the object is greater than 32KB and the DDM level 6b extended length field is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: The application will receive SQLCODE -30000 and SQLSTATE 58008.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL031I message should be analyzed.
    div: At this local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

**start section**
number
    : 00D35E10
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , acting as a DRDA client, has detected a floating point conversion error when converting a 4-byte or 8-byte floating point number in IEEE format to System/370 format.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL031I message should be analyzed.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS
    div: DRDA client, collect the following diagnostic items listed in
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: .
user_response
    p: Check the floating point value. Overflow can occur when the floating value is out of the System/370 floating point range.
    p > span: For detailed information about floating point range, see the information about data organization in
    p > span > span > a: Obtaining
    p > span > span > a > span: Db2
    p > span > span > a: Diagnosis Guide and Reference
    p > span: .
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e10.html
**end section**

    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL031I message should be analyzed.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS
    div: DRDA client, collect the following diagnostic items listed in
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: .
user_response
    p: Check the floating point value. Overflow can occur when the floating value is out of the System/370 floating point range.
    p > span: For detailed information about floating point range, see the information about data organization in
    p > span > span > a: Obtaining
    p > span > span > a > span: Db2
    p > span > span > a: Diagnosis Guide and Reference
    p > span: .

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error in the DDM SQLRSLRD reply data object received from the remote server in response to a DDM EXCSQLSTT command that generated query result sets. The value of the single element of the SQLNUMGRP, SQLNUM, defining the total number of SQLRSROW occurrences within the SQLRSLRD array, is inconsistent with the number of result sets indicated in the RSLSETRM.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: The application will receive SQLCODE -30020 and SQLSTATE 58009.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > span: Db2
    div: requester, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: If the DRDA server is
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: , then
    div > span: Db2
    div: diagnostic information is available. In this case, at the
    div > span: Db2
    div: server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00D35E34
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error in the DDM SQLRSLRD reply data object received from the remote server in response to a DDM EXCSQLSTT command that generated query result sets. Within one or more SQLRSROW occurrences, the lengths of SQLRSNAME_m and SQLRSNAME_s are both non-0, but only one of these lengths should be non-0. The data is invalid with regard to the Early SQLRSGRP group descriptor as defined by DRDA.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: The application will receive SQLCODE -30020 and SQLSTATE 58009.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number given in message DSNL031I.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2
    div: requester, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: If the DRDA server is
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: , then
    div > span: Db2
    div: diagnostic information is available. In this case, at the
    div > span: Db2
    div: server, collect the following diagnostic items:

**start section**
number
    : 00D35E35
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error in the DDM SQLCINRD reply data object received from the remote server in response to a DDM EXCSQLSTT command that generated query result sets. The value of the single element of the SQLNUMGRP, SQLNUM, defining the total number of SQLCIROW occurrences within the SQLCINRD array, is either negative or is inconsistent with the size of the SQLCINRD array.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: The application will receive SQLCODE -30020 and SQLSTATE 58009.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number given in message DSNL031I.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2
    div: requester, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: If the DRDA server is
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: , then
    div > span: Db2
    div: diagnostic information is available. In this case, at the
    div > span: Db2
    div: server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00D35E36
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error in the DDM SQLCINRD reply data object received from the remote server in response to a DDM EXCSQLSTT command that generated query result sets. Within one or more SQLCIROW occurrences, the lengths of SQLCNAME_m and SQLCNAME_s are both non-0, but only one of these lengths should be non-0. The data is invalid with regard to the Early SQLCIGRP group descriptor as defined by DRDA.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: The application will receive SQLCODE -30020 and SQLSTATE 58009.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number given in message DSNL031I.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2
    div: requester, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: If the DRDA server is
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: , then
    div > span: Db2
    div: diagnostic information is available. In this case, at the
    div > span: Db2
    div: server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At this remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e45.html

number
    : 00D35E4C
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing an SQLSTT object for an EXCSQLSET command received from a remote requester. Both a mixed-byte and a single-byte SQL statement string were received, or the mixed-byte SQL statement string is non-null, but has a zero length or the single-byte SQL statement string is not null, but has a zero length.
system_action
    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console.
    p: Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) will be returned to the remote requester. The application will receive SQLCODE -30020 and SQLSTATE 58009.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e4c.html

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , acting as a DRDA server, has detected an error in a DDM command data object received from a remote client. The DDM object is the OUTOVR object. The size of the OUTOVR is greater than 32KB and the DDM level 6b extended length field is invalid.

    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A SYNTAXRM reply message will be returned to the remote DRDA client.

system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message should be analyzed.
    div: If the remote DRDA client is a
    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: system, at the
    div > span: Db2
    div: DRDA client, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    p: For other remote DRDA clients, refer to the client product documentation for diagnostic recommendations.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2
    div: DRDA server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , acting as a DRDA server, has detected an error in a DDM command data object received from the remote client. The DDM object is the OUTOVR scalar of the SQLDTARD collection. The FDOCA descriptor geometry is incorrect. The SQLCADTA row (RLO) MDD is either invalid or has not been included within the SQLDTARD descriptor. The descriptor is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DSCINVRM reply message will be returned to the remote DRDA client.

    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    div: system, at the
    div > span: Db2
    div: DRDA client, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    p: For other remote DRDA clients, refer to the client product documentation for diagnostic recommendations.

    div > span: Db2

    div: system, at the
    div > span: Db2
    div: DRDA client, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    p: For other remote DRDA clients, refer to the client product documentation for diagnostic recommendations.
    div: At the
    div > span: Db2
    div: DRDA server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , acting as a DRDA server, has detected an error in a DDM command data object received from the remote client. The DDM object is the OUTOVR scalar of the SQLDTARD collection. The FDOCA descriptor geometry is incorrect. Either the first component of the SQLCADTA row is other than an SQLCAGRP (early) group or the number of elements taken from the SQLCAGRP or SQLCAGRP replication factor (or both) are incorrect. The descriptor is invalid.
system_action
    p: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console. Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DSCINVRM reply message will be returned to the remote DRDA client.

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , acting as a DRDA server, has detected an error in a DDM command data object received from the remote client. The DDM object is the OUTOVR scalar of the SQLDTARD collection. The FDOCA descriptor geometry is incorrect. The first component of the SQLCADTA row correctly enumerates the elements of the SQLCAGRP; however, the second component, identifying the SQLDTAGRP (late) group, is incorrect. Either the SQLDTAGRP local identifier (LID) is different from the LID of the SQLDTAGRP previously specified or the number of elements taken from the SQLDTAGRP replication factor (or both) are incorrect. The descriptor is invalid.

The descriptor is invalid.
