msg_text
explanation
    p: Acting as a requester or a server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DRDA object. The final length computed by parsing the object using its descriptor is larger than the stated length of the object itself.
system_action
    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I (if the error is detected by
    p > span > span: Db2
    p > span: acting as a requester) or message DSNL032I (if the error is detected by
    p > span > span: Db2
    p > span: acting as a server) is written to the console.
    p: Refer to the description of this message for further information.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e60.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D35E62
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected an error in a DDM command or DDM command data. An invalid interrupt token was sent on an INTRDBRQS command.
system_action
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM or INTTKNRM) is returned to the DRDA client. INTTKNRM is returned if the client is not authorized to interrupt an SQL statement or the token length is not 30 bytes. In all other cases, SYNTAXRM is returned.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message should be analyzed.
    div: At the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At the remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
    div: .
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e62.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D35E63
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected an error in a DDM command or DDM command data. An invalid RDBNAM length was sent on an INTRDBRQS command.
system_action
    p: If the length of the RDBNAM is greater than 255 (if client supports long names) or greater than 18 (if client does not support long names), then A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the DRDA client. If the data in characters 17-18 of the RDBNAME is non-blank, then a DDM reply message (VALNSPRM) is returned to the DRDA client.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message should be analyzed.
    div: At the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the following diagnostic item:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: At the remote server, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
    div: .
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e63.html

number
    : 00D35E67
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM SNDPKT command received from a remote requester. The SNDPKT command contains an invalid instance variable code point.
system_action
    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console.
    p: Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (PRMNSPRM) is returned to the remote requester.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is most likely an error at the remote requester system. If you suspect an error in
    p > span: Db2
    p: , refer to Part 2 of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: Diagnosis Guide and Reference for information on identifying and reporting the problem.
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.

    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console.

    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request.     div > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM ACCSEC command received from a remote requester. The ACCSEC command contains an invalid ENCALG instance variable - the value must be 2 bytes.
system_action
    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console.
    p: Refer to the description of this message for further information.
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the remote requester.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is most likely an error at the remote requester system. If you suspect an error in
    p > span: Db2
    p: , refer to Part 2 of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: Diagnosis Guide and Reference for information on identifying and reporting the problem.
problem_determination
    div: Analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message. For the
    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL032I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2
    div: system, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.
    p: For non-
    p > span: Db2
    p: systems, refer to the documentation specific to those products for diagnostic procedures.
    div: If any dumps were generated on any
    div > span: Db2
    div: system participating in processing the remote request, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listings of the SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1 at each connected site.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps created by this failure.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e70.html
**end section**

    p > span: Db2®

msg_text
explanation
    p: Acting as a server,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected an error while parsing an SQLSTT object. The data portion of the object has a length that is smaller than the minimum size of 4 bytes. The first four bytes of the data portion contains the length of the SQL statement.
system_action
    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL032I is written to the console.
    p: Refer to the description of this message for further information.
operator_response

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > span: Db2

    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a

explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error in the DDM reply message or DDM reply data object received from the remote server in response to a DDM command. The length of the data to be parsed is inconsistent with the descriptor. The error occurs when processing data for a rowset cursor.

    p > span: An alert is generated and message DSNL031I is written to the console.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > span: Db2
    div: system generating the DSNL031I message, collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: In addition, identify all connected systems participating in the processing of the remote request. This includes the requester system to which the application is connected and the data server which is the target of the remote request. This may also include intermediate server systems. For each system that is a
    div > span: Db2

    div > ul > li > span: Console output and the listing of the SYSLOG data set from each connected site for the period of time spanning the failure.

number
    : 00D35E75
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has detected an error while parsing a DDM SECCHK command received from a remote client. The SECCHK command contains an invalid USRREGNM instance variable value that is not supported. The value exceeded the 255 bytes limit.
system_action
    p: A DDM reply message (SYNTAXRM) is returned to the DRDA client.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is most likely an error at the remote client system.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: You should analyze the statistics class 4 trace record identified by the IFCID sequence number enumerated in the DSNL032I message.
    div: At the local
    div > span: Db2
    div: , collect the diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.
    div: If the remote client system, collect the diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d35e75.html

    : 00D35E78
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: acts as a DRDA intermediate server passing input data to another DRDA server. It has detected an error in an SQLDTA object. A NUL-terminated string was found in the FDODTA scalar where the NUL-terminator could not be located within the data field as defined by the DDM descriptor received.

    p: The system generates an alert and returns message DSNL032I. Refer to the description of this message for further information.

    p > span > span > span: .

    div > span: Db2 for z/OS®

    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Statistics Class 4 trace record for the LUWID associated with the failing request.

    div > span: Db2 for z/OS

number
    : 00D36800
msg_text
explanation
    p: To satisfy an unconditional request for storage for a RESTFul service execution reply message, the RESTful service execution function needs additional storage to expand the reply buffer. However, the RESTful service reply message buffer is already at the maximum allowed size.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

number
    : 00D36801
msg_text
explanation
    p: A
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error was detected while processing a DISPLAY, START, or STOP RESTSVC command.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If you suspect an error in
    p > span: Db2
    p: , you might need to report the problem. For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p: .
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a Db2dump is requested.
    div: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by Db2(04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

**start section**
number
    : 00D40001
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: IMS™ attachment facility
    p: detected an invalid save area chain pointer. This condition occurs only if the save area is overlaid or if the save area pointer is invalid.
system_action
    p: The task is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If the abend occurred in an
    p > span: IMS
    p: dependent region, restart the region. If the abend occurred in the
    p > span: IMS
    p: control region, restart the connection. Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the dump. Register 13 plus four bytes is the address of the invalid save area chain pointer.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS dependent region, control region dump, or both.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS system log information, for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS console log.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d40001.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D40008
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: IMS™ attachment facility
    p: command module's ESTAE routine places this reason code in the variable recording area of SYS1.LOGREC. The reason code indicates that the entry is not a standard
    p > span: Db2®
    p: entry. The reason code is followed by the current
    p > span: IMS attachment facility
    p: trace entry, the first four characters of the command, the output destination, and the authorization ID.
    p: This message records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
system_action
    p: Every attempt is made to return to RTM with the retry option. If the retry is successful, a message is sent to the originating destination to show that the command failed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the SYS1.LOGREC data. The log record contains the current
    p > span: IMS attachment facility
    p: trace entry, the first four characters of the command, the output destination, and the authorization ID for the failing command.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS dependent region, control region dump, or both.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS system log information, for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS console log.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d40008.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D40061
msg_text
explanation
    p: The IMS™ attachment facility could not establish a connection with
    p > span: Db2®
    p: because an IMS /STOP SUBSYS command was issued.
system_action
    p: The application's SQLCA is updated with an SQLCODE -924 and reason code 00D40061. Control is returned to the application.
operator_response
    p: Issue the IMS /START SUBSYS command to establish a connection with
    p > span: Db2
    p: and reenter the transaction.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine why the IMS /STOP SUBSYS command was issued.
problem_determination
    p: Analyze the application's SQLCA.
user_response
    p: Wait for the IMS /START SUBSYS command to be issued before reentering the transaction.
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d40061.html

    p > span: Db2®
    p: because IMS is shutting down.

number

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: IMS™ attachment facility received an unexpected return code from the IMS external subsystem attach facility while attempting to start the subsystem connection to
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_action
    div: The application's SQLCA is updated with an SQLCODE -924, reason code 00D40063, and the return code received from the IMS external subsystem facility. One of the following return codes may appear.
    div > ul > li: 12 -
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: connection unsuccessful. The external subsystem encountered an error processing the request.
    div > ul > li: 24 -
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: connection unsuccessful. The external subsystem responded with a 'never connect' return code from the initialization exit.
    div > ul > li: 28 -
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: connection unsuccessful. IMS resources were unavailable to process the request.
    div > ul > li: 32 -
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: connection unsuccessful. An invalid EPL was encountered.
    div > ul > li: 36 -
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: connection unsuccessful. Request rejected due to the external subsystem invoking the subsystem termination service exit.
    p: Control is returned to the application.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is an internal error. To be certain the proper diagnostic information is available, stop the region with a dump.
problem_determination
    p: The WAL control block in the dump contains an IMS attach trace table.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS dependent region, control region dump, or both.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS system log information, for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS console log.
user_response

    p > span: Db2®

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem name: 0 < SSN < 5.
    div > ul > li: LIT value < 5.
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: initialization module name = 8.
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: optional resource translation module name < 9.
    div > ul > li: Region error option value < 2.
    div > ul > li: The command recognition value < 2.
    div > ul > li: The connection name < 9.
    div > ul > li: The
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: plan name < 9.
    div > ul > li: The application program load module name < 9.
    p: Register 8 indicates the delimiter following the field in error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: IMS™
    p: attach trace table. Field WALSSID indicates the name of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem being called.
    p: The last entry in the trace table has an ID of ID00 and the CALL STATUS contains the 2-byte return code and 4-byte reason code of the failure. The 4-byte reason code might provide additional diagnostic information to help determine the cause of the failure.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p: subsystem name was specified and was available, refer to the specific reason code explanation for details about the error.

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue because the application is deadlocked or experienced a timeout.

    p > span: Db2
    p: sends a message to the MVS™ console.

    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message

    p > samp: DSNT376I

number
    : 00D44034
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue because an unrecoverable error was encountered during resolve indoubt processing between IMS™ and
    p > span: Db2
    p: . The status of the current indoubt
    p > span: Db2
    p: thread remains unchanged.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: -DL/I batch support processing is terminated, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: 04E SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Enter the DISPLAY THREAD TYPE (INDOUBT) command to determine the current status of indoubt thread processing between IMS and
    p > span: Db2
    p: at the time of the failure. Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This may be an internal protocol error between the IMS external subsystem attach facility and the
    p > span: Db2
    p: IMS attachment facility, or an execution environment error external to both IMS and
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Examine both the IMS and MVS™ console logs for any error messages or abnormal return codes associated with the DL/I batch job.
problem_determination
    p: Locate and examine any
    p > span: Db2
    p: IMS attachment snap records (code X'5501FE') that are present in the IMS log data set, and examine WAL trace table entries included in the dump.
    p: If a
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason code is provided in either the WAL trace entry, or the WALSFER2 field of the X'5501FE' log record, follow the instructions associated with this reason code for additional information concerning the failure.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS trace output.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS system log information, for the period of time spanning the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS console log.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period from the last IPL to the time of the failure.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d44034.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D44035
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue because the PSB name used as the
    p > span: Db2
    p: authorization ID begins with the character string SYSADM which is not allowed.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue and processing is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a site problem. A PSB name beginning with SYSADM is being used as the authorization ID.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The PSB= parameter of the job step execute statement indicates the PSB name used. Register 3 plus X'34' is the authorization ID specified.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the DDITV02 SYSIN data set.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the DDOTV02 output data set.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d44035.html

    : 00D44036
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue because the authorization ID has been changed by the application program.

    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue and processing is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a site problem. The application program has modified the authorization ID.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The authorization ID saved by
    p > span: Db2
    p: does not match the value in ASXBUSER. Control block modification has occurred. Register 3 plus X'34' is the changed value.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.

    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the DDOTV02 output data set.

explanation

    p > span: Db2®
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue because the stack of save areas has been exhausted. The error can occur when multiple levels of recursion have been invoked.

    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue and processing is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer
system_programmer_response
    p: This might be a multiple recursion problem caused by the execution of a changed data capture exit.
problem_determination
    p: Verify that the user exit(s) are not being recursively invoked during a database update operation.

    p > span: Db2®

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2
    p: to IMS is installed.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue because the record format (RECFM) for the DDOTV02 output data set has a format of fixed or fixed block.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue and processing is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Change the RECFM parameter in the DCB from fixed 'F' or fixed blocked 'FB' to variable 'V' or variable blocked 'VB'. Specify LRECL=4092 and a BLKSIZE of at least LRECL+4. Then rerun the job.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Check the DDOTV02 DD for the proper DCB-RECFM value of 'V' or 'VB'.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div: .

number
    : 00D44054
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue because an
    p > span: IMS™
    p: XRST call problem was detected. An XRST call, if issued, must be issued before any SQL call is issued; only one XRST call should be issued.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: -DL/I batch support cannot continue and processing is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably an application program error. Correct the application program so it will issue the XRST call before any SQL statements are processed. Then resubmit the job. Also make sure only one XRST call is issued by the application program.
    p: Check the DDOTV02 data set to see if an INDOUBT unit of recovery has been erroneously aborted.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Follow normal
    p > span: IMS
    p: debugging techniques to gather the DL/I documentation.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the DDITV02 SYSIN data set.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the DDOTV02 output data set.

number
    : 00D44056
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: IMS™
    p: detected a problem with the call to IMS ROLL or ROLB, which caused
    p > span: Db2®
    p: DL/I batch support to stop processing. One common reason for the problem is that a ROLB call was used with the BKO= parameter for procedures set to N (which is the default setting), and you used a temporary data set.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: DL/I batch support processing is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: One of two errors can result in this reason code: an incorrect ROLB call or an application program error.
    div: In most cases, the ROLB has incorrect settings and data. Complete the following actions to correct the ROLB call settings:
    div > ol > li: Validate that you are using an existing data set that is not temporary.
    div > ol > li: Validate that the BKO= parameter for procedures is set to Y.
    div > ol > li: Resubmit the job.
    div: Sometimes an application program error can cause this reason code. Complete the following actions to correct the application error:
    div > ol > li: Check the PCB status code for a non-blank value.
    div > ol > li: Validate that the PCB used for the call is correct.
    div > ol > li: Validate the that parameters passed by the call is correct.
    div > ol > li: Resubmit the job.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Follow normal
    p > span: IMS
    p: debugging techniques to gather the
    p > span: IMS
    p: documentation.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the DDITV02 SYSIN data set.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the DDOTV02 output data set.

number
    : 00D50001
msg_text
explanation
    p: The amount of space allowed for processing XML values by a user has been exceeded. The amount of space allowed per user is 2GB.
system_action
    p: The operation is not allowed.
    p > span: Db2®
    p: issues the message, "resource not available," to the invoker.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Check the SQL statements in the application for XML usage. Monitor the application using a statistics trace that includes IFCID 0002, or an accounting trace that includes IFCID 0003. Field QXSTXMLV records the maximum amount of storage that is used for XML values.
problem_determination
    p: The requested operation is not performed. SQLCODE -904 is issued. Messages DSNT500I or DSNT501I might also be issued.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d50001.html

number
    : 00D70001
msg_text
explanation
    p: Either the data space manager (DSM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: could not access some storage group definition, or the storage group contains no volume IDs. Possible sources of the error include use of an incorrect name for the storage group and removal of all volume IDs via ALTER STOGROUP without providing new ones.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the caller.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Notify the database administrator if appropriate. Otherwise, check the SQLCA for the name of the storage group. Check this storage group (via an SQL SELECT on SYSIBM.SYSSTOGROUP) to ensure that it exists. Check for associated SYSIBM.SYSVOLUMES table entries to see if any volume IDs exist for this storage group.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Obtain output listing from SELECT * FROM SYSIBM.SYSSTOGROUP and SELECT * FROM SYSIBM.SYSVOLUMES, details of the request that resulted in this code, and contents of the SQLCA. Also obtain operator's console sheet showing related messages, if any. Use this documentation to determine the cause of the problem.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: catalog tables.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
    p: If you are unable to resolve the problem yourself, notify the system programmer or database administrator.

number
    : 00D70002
msg_text
explanation
    p: The required data sets are not available to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . This is probably a user error. For example, the user might have forgotten to create the needed VSAM data clusters using access method services before issuing a CREATE TABLESPACE request with the USING VCAT parameter.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Take one or both of these actions:
    div > ul > li: Make the needed data set available.
    div > ul > li: Be sure it is cataloged in the appropriate integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog.
    p: The data set names appear in the SQLCA, in the DSNP-prefixed message that contained this code, or in an earlier DSNP-prefixed message for the same user (same connection and correlation IDs).
    p: If the data set name is correct, is cataloged, and appears in the VTOC, run the access method services DIAGNOSE command on the integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog identified by the first qualifier of the data set name.
problem_determination
    div: Obtain the following information to determine the cause of the problem:
    div > ul > li: Listings of the integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog and VTOC showing the data set
    div > ul > li: Details of the request that led to this code
    div > ul > li: The contents of the SQLCA
    div > ul > li: The operator's console sheet showing any related messages
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: catalog tables.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

**start section**
number
    : 00D70003
msg_text
explanation
    p: Some or all of the data sets already exist. The data space manager (DSM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has discovered the preexistence of a data set that has the same name as one it was about to create. The name of the data set appears in the SQLCA or in messages DSNP002I or DSNP022I.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: This may occur if a user creates a data set with VSAM access method services (intending to use it for a table space or index), then creates the table space or index via SQL CREATE statement, but forgets to specify USING VCAT.
    p: Another possibility is that the data set remained from some prior, unsuccessfully completed DROP or DELETEor backout operation of
    p > span: Db2
    p: . This failure would probably occur if the data set or integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog were unavailable at the time of the DROP or DELETE or backout. For example, packs may be offline, or other operational problems may exist. In this case, the table space would be dropped, but the data sets could remain and be brought back online at a later time.
    p: There should have been some indication of this type of failure at the time it occurred. (for example, some DSNP-prefixed message indicating the data set was not deleted). You might check recent console sheets for such a message; however, it may have happened a long time ago.
system_action
    p: Error indication is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Notify the database administrator if appropriate. Otherwise, either use access method services to delete the data set or use a different name for the table or index you are trying to create.
    p: If the data set name is correct, is cataloged, and appears in the VTOC, run the access method services DIAGNOSE command against the integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog identified by the first qualifier of the data set name.
problem_determination
    p: Information is needed concerning the history of the use of this data set; that is, of the table space/index name in conjunction with this database name. Listings of the console, integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog, and VTOC may also be needed, with details of the request that resulted in this code, and contents of the SQLCA. Also obtain operator's console sheet showing related messages, if any. Use this documentation to determine the cause of the problem.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: catalog tables.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
    p: If you are unable to resolve the problem yourself, notify the system programmer or database administrator.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70003.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D70004
msg_text
explanation
    p: Certain data sets are pending deletion. Creation of a new data set is blocked by the presence of the name on a drop list. This is usually a user error. It usually occurs when the user has dropped an old object (table space, index, and so forth) and then attempted to redefine it without committing the drop.
system_action
    p: Error indication is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The user must commit the drop of the data set on the drop list. Collect the materials listed in the Problem Determination section of this message to determine the specific cause of the problem.
problem_determination
    p: Documentation is needed showing activities from the last committed action up to and including details of the request that resulted in this code. You also need to examine the contents of the SQLCA. Also obtain operator's console sheet showing related messages, if any. Use this documentation to determine the cause of the problem.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
    p: You must commit the drop prior to redefining. Notify the system programmer or database administrator, if necessary.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70004.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D70005
msg_text
explanation
    p: The specified data set was access method services user-defined. It does not have the required
    p > span: Db2®
    p: attributes.
system_action
    p: No action is taken with the named data set. An error code is returned and a dump is not taken.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Delete the named data set and define it with the correct attributes.
problem_determination
    p: Obtain an access method services LISTCAT for the named data set's attributes.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70005.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D70006
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data sets are not owned by this
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem. The data sets backing a table space or index can be deleted only by the data space manager (DSM) subcomponent of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem that created them or by one having the same authorization ID at the time of installation. This is a safety feature to restrict DSM from deleting data sets that might have been created by the user but that have a name that matches the one we are trying to delete. This safety feature also prevents the deletion of data sets that might have been created by some other
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem and that are still needed there.
system_action
    p: The data sets remain intact.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Obtain integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog and VTOC listings, details of the request that resulted in this code, and contents of the SQLCA. Also obtain operator's console sheet showing related messages, if any. This documentation will assist you in determining the cause of the problem.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: catalog tables.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
    p: If you are unable to resolve the problem yourself, notify the system programmer or database administrator.
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70006.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D70007
msg_text
explanation
    p: The specified data set must be cataloged in an ICF catalog. It was found in a non-ICF catalog.
system_action
    p: No action is taken with the named data set. An error code is returned and a dump is not taken.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Delete the named data set, define it again, and use an ICF catalog
problem_determination
    p: Obtain an access method series LISTCAT for the named data set's catalog types.

**start section**
number
    : 00D70008
msg_text
explanation
    p: During allocation of a data set,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected that the attributes for the data set were incorrect. The data set requires the extended format and extended addressability attributes that are defined through DFSMS.
    p > span: If a key label is specified, the data set requires the extended format attribute that is defined through DFSMS.
    p: Either the data set was defined without the required attributes, or it was not defined through DFSMS.
system_action
    p: No data set is allocated. SQLCODE -904 is issued. Additional messages or codes might be issued.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    h4: System programmer or storage administrator response
    p: Data sets that are larger than 4GB must belong to a DFSMS data class that is defined with the extended format and extended addressability attributes.
    p > span: Data sets that use key label must belong to a DFSMS data class that is defined with the extended format.
    ol > li: If the diagnostic message that issued this code includes a reference to
    ol > li > samp: STOGROUP 00000001
    ol > li: , then the data set is a catalog or directory data set. Use the LISTCAT command to determine the name of the data set.
    ol > li: Update the data set class definition in DFSMS. On the DATA SET CLASS DEFINE panel, specify the following values:
    ol > li > div > table > thead > tr > th: Field
    ol > li > div > table > thead > tr > th: Value
    ol > li > div > table > tbody > tr > td: DATA SET NAME TYPE
    ol > li > div > table > tbody > tr > td: EXT
    ol > li > div > table > tbody > tr > td: EXTENDED ADDRESSABILITY
    ol > li > div > table > tbody > tr > td: Y
    ol > li: Make sure that the automatic class selection routine associates this data set with this data class.
problem_determination
    p: Obtain the data set attribute information from the corresponding SMS data class for the named data set.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer or storage administrator.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70008.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D70009
msg_text
explanation
    p: The specified data set was access method services user-defined. It does not have the required
    p > span: Db2®
    p: attributes. The data set was defined with a Control Interval (CI) size that is incompatible with the page size. A compatible CI size is either 4K or the page size. For example, if the page size is 32K, the ControlIntervalSize parameter in the Define command should be specified with either 4K or 32K.
    p > span: Db2
    p: recommends the use of the page size as the Control Interval size.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user. This reason code and the data set name are made available to the user in the SQLCA.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Ensure that the data set is defined with the compatible CI size, which is 4K or its page size.
problem_determination
    p: Obtain an access method services LISTCAT for the named data set's attributes.
user_response
    p: Delete the data set that was named and redefine it with the correct CI attributes.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70009.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00D70011
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data space manager (DSM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: has been requested to extend a table space or index space, but the table space or index space has already been extended to its maximum size. This does not mean there is no more space available in the page set for the requested insert. An additional search will be performed for space in the current table space or index space. If space cannot be found, then the data manager component will issue reason code 00C9009C for a partitioned page set or 00C9009D for a non-partitioned page set.
    p: For the name of the data set from which the name of the table space, index space, and/or partition can be derived, see message DSNP001I or DSNP007I and the SQLCA.
system_action
    p: No extension is done.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Notify the database administrator if appropriate. Otherwise, if the table space is partitioned and there is space in other partitions, you may be able to redefine the table space with new partitioning parameters so that the data that has overloaded this partition is directed to others. If the table space is not partitioned, you probably have more than one table residing in this table space. Define another table space, unload this one, then reload the tables into the separate spaces. (Be aware that this is a very large amount of data to move. Careful planning is recommended.)
problem_determination
    p: If you believe the table space or index space has not yet reached maximum size, provide listings of the console, integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog, and VTOC.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: catalog tables.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
    p: If you are unable to resolve the problem yourself, notify the system programmer or database administrator.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70011.html
**end section**

msg_text
explanation
    p: A password or security error has occurred. An attempt to access a integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog entry for a cluster (data set) failed because of some security violation. This is probably a user error. It may be caused either by the incorrect specification of a password or the changing of the password in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: catalog (via SQL ALTER) but not in the integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog (via access method services ALTER) or vice versa.
system_action
    p: A 'resource not available' code is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Notify the database administrator if appropriate. Otherwise, check the passwords and/or RACF® authorizations.

Also obtain integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog listing, details of the request that resulted in this code, and contents of the SQLCA. Also obtain operator's console sheet showing related messages, if any. This documentation will assist you in determining the cause of the problem if it is not merely an incorrect password. If you suspect an error in
    p > span: Db2
    p: ,
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00D70014
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to extend a data set failed, because a problem was detected in media manager services.
    p: One possible cause of this error is that a table was created or the definition of a table was completed in a simple table space.
    p > span: Db2®
    p: attempted to insert a system page in the table space, but there was not enough room to insert the system page.
system_action
    p: Abort the request.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer or database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Notify the database administrator if appropriate. Otherwise, check the packs available to the data set. They might merely be full or the data set might have reached its maximum allowable extents. For more information, see the description of message DSNP001I.
problem_determination
    p: Obtain console sheet that shows associated DSNP001I, DSNO007I, or DSNP011I messages and any related messages that precede them. This documentation can assist you in determining the cause of the problem. For more information, see the description of these messages.
    p: In some cases, this problem might occur because
    p > span: Db2
    p: encountered unexpected user-created catalog index definitions that interfere with the migration process. See the information about migration job DSNTIJPM and the information about creating indexes on catalog tables in the description of CREATE INDEX.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
    p: Notify the operator, system programmer, or database administrator.

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70014.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D70018
msg_text
explanation
    div: This is a
    div > span: Db2®
    div: internal error. One of the following circumstances has occurred:
    div > ul > li: A data set inquiry function was called for a partitioned table space or index space. Its function applies only to nonpartitioned table spaces or index spaces.
    div > ul > li: The reset function of data space manager (DSM) was called on a table space that had been opened incorrectly.
system_action
    p: Abort the request.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Collect the materials listed in the Problem Determination section of this message.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Request a dynamic dump. In the dump, the second parameter passed to the data set inquiry function identifies the table space or index space. The third parameter is the table space or index space object descriptor block (OBD). The OBD indicates whether or not the table space or index space is partitioned. If it is partitioned, the calling module is in error. If it is not partitioned, the test in the data set inquiry function must be at fault.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: catalog tables.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70018.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D70019
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data space manager (DSM) subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: could not release the extend lock it acquired against a data set during an attempt to extend that data set.
system_action
    p: The SQL request that led to the abend is terminated, and the unit of recovery that issued the request is backed out.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Investigate the DSM messages associated with this condition (at least message DSNP015I) for clues to the problem.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This problem is probably the result of either: (1) an attempt by DSM to free a lock it did not hold or, (2) a problem in IRLM. The IRLM return and reason codes appear in the associated DSNP015I message. For additional information, see the description of this message.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response

msg_text

    p > span: Db2®
    p: interpreter ensures a sufficient setting for the primary value.)

number
    : 00D70027
msg_text
explanation
    p: The secondary allocation value is 0. No physical extension is done. If this occurs in a create of a segmented table, the primary allocation of the table space is not big enough to allocate the first segment. The first segment consists of a number of pages which are defined in SEGSIZE.
system_action
    p: The request to extend the data set is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Notify the database administrator if appropriate. Otherwise, if you intended to allow physical extension of the data set, change its secondary value to a nonzero quantity.
problem_determination
    p: Obtain the integrated catalog facility (ICF) catalog and VTOC listings, and (if storage group-defined) the output from SELECT * FROM SYSIBM.SYSSTOGROUP. msg_text
explanation
    p: An HSM request for the recall of a migrated data set failed.
system_action
    p: The HSM recall is aborted by data space manager and control returns to the function that issued the recall request. The higher level function will not necessarily terminate processing since the data set may have already been recalled.
operator_response
    p: If processing was terminated, notify the system programmer or database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: If processing was terminated, investigate the reason for the HSM failure via messages issued to the MVS™ operator's console.

    p > span > span > span: .

    p > span: Db2

number
    : 00D70029
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: could not access a data set because the data set is on a volume that is offline.
system_action
    p: The request to access the data set is terminated.
operator_response

problem_determination
    p: Obtain the following logs to find the failing data set name:
    ul > li: The operator's console log that contains either the related DSNP012I message with CTLGRC=
    ul > li > var: 00000008
    ul > li: CTLGRSN=
    ul > li > var: xxxx0532
    ul > li: , or, message DSNT500I with REASON 00D70029.
    ul > li: The job log that contains the 00D70029 code.
    p: Use ISPF, ISMF, or other facility to locate the volumes and device numbers where the data set resides. Vary the volume, or volumes, back online.
