number
    : 00D70030
msg_text
explanation
    p: Unexpected reason code was received from some
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subcomponent invoked by data space manager (DSM).
    p: Almost any DSNP module can issue this reason code.
system_action
    p: Abort the request.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: There is not much the system programmer can do here, but see register 2 in the accompanying dump for the unexpected code. Its description may provide a clue to the type of problem.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Obtain a listing of the SQL request that resulted in this code and a listing of the contents of the SQLCA. Also obtain operator's console sheet showing related messages, if any. There should be at least one DSNP-prefixed message containing the '00D70030' code. Messages preceding it from other subcomponents (having other prefixes beginning with DSN) may provide additional details about the problem.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

number
    : 00D70042
msg_text
explanation
    div: An attempt to rename an existing data set failed, because the old and new names are not compatible. This problem might arise in one or both of the following situations:
    div > ol > li: One data set name is a
    div > ol > li > span: Db2®
    div > ol > li: page set data set name and another data set name is a non-
    div > ol > li > span: Db2
    div > ol > li: page set data set name.
    div > ol > li: Both are
    div > ol > li > span: Db2
    div > ol > li: page set data set names, but there is a mismatch in the catalog alias names, the database names, or the table space/index space names.
system_action
    p: Error indication is returned to the user.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Notify the database administrator if appropriate.
problem_determination
    p: This problem probably arises during execution of the REORG utility with SHRLEVEL REFERENCE or CHANGE. See message DSNP027I.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: catalog tables.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.

    p: Notify the system programmer or database administrator.

    : 00D70043

    p > span: Db2®

**start section**
number
    : 00D70051
msg_text
explanation
    div: One of the following is issued on a ROSHARE OWNER database:
    div > ul > li: A CREATE TABLESPACE statement
    div > ul > li: A CREATE INDEX statement, or
    div > ul > li: The REORG utility with SHRLEVEL REFERENCE or SHRLEVEL CHANGE using user-managed data sets
    div: However, the data sets are not defined with VSAM SHAREOPTIONS(1,3).
system_action
    p: An SQLCODE -731 is returned to the user (for CREATE TABLESPACE or INDEX)
    p > span: The CREATE TABLESPACE or INDEX statement or the REORG utility is not executed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Use AMS ALTER SHAREOPTIONS to alter the data set to SHAREOPTIONS(1,3) and resubmit the CREATE TABLESPACE or INDEX statement
    p > span: or the REORG utility.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70051.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D70052
msg_text
explanation
    p: An ALTER DATABASE statement is issued to convert a database to ROSHARE OWNER. But, within this database, at least one user defined data set is not defined with VSAM SHAREOPTIONS(1,3). All user-defined data sets that are within this database must be converted to SHAREOPTIONS(1,3) before the database can be altered to ROSHARE OWNER.
system_action
    p: An SQLCODE -731 is returned to the user and the ALTER DATABASE statement is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Use AMS ALTER SHAREOPTIONS to alter all user-defined data sets that are within this database to SHAREOPTIONS(1,3), and resubmit the ALTER DATABASE statement.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70052.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D70100
msg_text
explanation
    p: A requested resource is not available. Either the data space manager (DSM) or some subcomponent that it invoked discovered that some resource is not available. The name and type of the resource and the reason it is unavailable are placed in the CT control block by the subcomponent that made the discovery. This information is made available to the user in the SQLCA and/or messages. The reason code in the CT/SQLCA contains the identifier of the subcomponent that discovered the problem.
    p: Almost any DSNP module can issue this reason code.
system_action
    p: Abort the current request.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer or database administrator.
system_programmer_response
    p: Notify the database administrator if appropriate. Otherwise, determine what resource was unavailable (from SQLCA information) and, if it is something you can control, make it available.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: See the Problem Determination section in the description of the code that appears in the SQLCA or CTRURESN field of the CT and/or in the description of any associated console messages. Obtain details of the request that resulted in this code, and contents of the SQLCA. Also obtain operator's console sheet showing related messages, if any.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the results produced by the SQL statements.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Definitions of views and tables involved in the error.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d70100.html

number
    : 00D90000
msg_text
explanation
    p: A recovery manager module received control from its FRR for retry and found an invalid retry point identifier. The name of the module in which the failure occurred appears in the SYS1.LOGREC entry showing this reason code in register 15.
system_action
    p: Standard
    p > span: Db2®
    p: diagnostic information is provided. The error is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, an SVC dump is scheduled, and
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination is requested. The subsystem termination reason code reflects the function for which retry was unsuccessfully attempted.
operator_response
    p: Print SYS1.LOGREC, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a secondary subsystem error. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump for this failure and for the original failure that resulted in the retry attempt.
problem_determination
    p: Examine the SYS1.LOGREC information and the dumps from both the original failure and this second failure to determine if the recovery parameter area was damaged or if retry incorrectly restored registers for the mainline module.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d90000.html

number
    : 00D90010
msg_text
explanation
    p: During the process of re-enabling data sharing, all members, other than the surviving member, are forced to cold start. In the process of setting up the cold start for this member, an active conditional restart control record was discovered in the BSDS. This record could not have been in the BSDS when data sharing was disabled, and this
    p > span: Db2®
    p: should have been inactive since data sharing was disabled; therefore, it is unclear what the conditional restart control record is requesting.
system_action
    p: Standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested before
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination is initiated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the change log inventory (DSNJU003) utility to cancel the active conditional restart control record in this member's BSDS.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.

**start section**
number
    : 00D90013
msg_text
explanation
    p: The restart parameters for TRKRSITE are invalid. If TRKRSITE is YES on DSNZPARM and this
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem has not successfully restarted in this 'Tracker Recovery cycle',
    p > span: Db2
    p: requires special conditions before it can restart.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: startup terminates.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump, and contact the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    div: Ensure that the Conditional Restart Control Record is correct, then restart
    div > span: Db2
    div: . You can run the Print Log Map Utility (DSNJU004) to examine the current Conditional Restart record. The following conditions are correct:
    div > ul > li: BACKOUT = NO
    div > ul > li: FORWARD = NO
    div > ul > li: Either an ENDRBA value for non-data sharing or an ENDLRSN value for data sharing. In data sharing, the ENDLRSN value must be the same for all members restarting in this 'Tracker Recovery cycle'.
    div: To avoid a cold start or log skipping in a tracker site, ensure that STARTRBA has no specified value. You can create or modify the Conditional Restart parameters with the Change Log Inventory Utility (DSNJU003).
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d90013.html

**start section**
number
    : 00D91001
msg_text
explanation
    p: A thread that was participating in a global transaction attempted to issue a Begin-UR after a decision point (commit or abort) was already reached for the global transaction. This is violation of the protocol and is not allowed.
system_action
    p: The Begin-UR request is failed and a SVC dump may be scheduled. The thread requesting the Begin-UR might be abended. No resources are released because a UR is not created for the thread and no resources may be held.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a protocol error. The application controlling the global transaction thread may not request that a new unit of recovery be created after the global transaction has reached a decision point, either commit or abort.
problem_determination
    p: Obtain the UR-control log records (type '0020'x) for all the threads in the global transaction to determine the sequence of events that led to the protocol violation. Correct the application.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d91001.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D91044
msg_text
explanation
    p: An unexpected return code was received from RRS when setting the type of interest in a Unit of Recovery (UR).
system_action
    p: The application is abended.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVCDUMP, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably either an error in
    p > span: Db2®
    p: or in RRS.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: If RRS has terminated, restart RRS.
problem_determination
    p: Examine the SVCDUMP to determine the cause of the RRS failure. Register nine contains the return code from the RRS ATRSIT request.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d91044.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D92001
msg_text
explanation
    p: The checkpoint/restart serial controller (DSNRCRSC) FRR invoked
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem termination, because an unrecoverable error was detected while processing a request.
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination reason code.
    p > span: For further information, see
    p > span > a: IRLM abend codes
    p > span: .
system_action
    p: Subsystem termination is initiated. Standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested for the associated abend.
operator_response
    p: Print SYS1.LOGREC, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain a copy of the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump for the original error, and follow the instructions associated with it.
problem_determination
    p: See the original error.
user_response

number
    : 00D92011
msg_text
explanation
    p: An invalid URE was found during checkpoint processing. An overlay of the URE may have occurred.
system_action
    p: The checkpoint process will ABEND to prevent a damaged URE from being written out to the log, and the subsystem will be terminated. This is to prevent the loss or incorrect processing of a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: unit of recovery (UR).
    p > span: Db2
    p: Restart will use the previous checkpoint and apply all the
    p > span: Db2
    p: log records up to the point of failure. Standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is scheduled.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVCDUMP, and notify the system programmer. Restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Examine the SVCDUMP and the
    p > span: Db2
    p: Trace Table in the dump to determine the cause of the URE overlay.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D92021
msg_text
explanation
    p: An invalid URE was read from the log during the current status rebuild phase of restart. Restart cannot process the damaged URE.
system_action
    p: The restart processing abends, which terminates the subsystem. This is to prevent the loss or incorrect processing of a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: unit of recovery.
    p: Standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is scheduled. The first 4 digits of the RBA of the invalid log record is contained in register 3 and the last 8 digits in register 4.
operator_response
    div: Do not attempt to restart
    div > span: Db2
    div: until the error is resolved. Notify the system programmer and collect the following diagnostic items listed in
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
system_programmer_response
    p: Print the BSDS using the print log map (DSNJU004) utility. Find the checkpoint queue in the output listing from DSNJU004.
    p: Next, run the change log inventory (DSNJU003) utility to create a conditional restart record with the CHKPTRBA option specifying the Begin checkpoint RBA found in the second entry of the checkpoint queue. Restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: using the conditional restart record found. If the same failure occurs, repeat the conditional process using the next begin checkpoint RBA in the checkpoint queue.
    p: Repeat this process, going down the checkpoint queue until
    p > span: Db2
    p: restarts. This will be prior to the time when the invalid URE was written to the log. The restart process is then able to apply all the log records to the end of the log.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d92021.html
**end section**

number
    : 00D92023
msg_text
explanation
    p: An invalid record was read from the log during the current status rebuild phase of restart. Restart cannot process the damaged log record.
system_action
    p: The restart processing will abnormally terminate, which will terminate the subsystem. This is to prevent the loss or incorrect processing of a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: unit of recovery.
    p: Standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is scheduled. The first 4 digits of the RBA of the invalid log record is contained in register 3 and the last 8 digits in register 4.

**start section**
number
    : 00D92024
msg_text
explanation
    p: During restart, the state of a logged unit of recovery and the state of the global transaction which the unit of recovery is part of are incompatible.
system_action
    p: The restart processing abnormally terminates, which terminates the subsystem. This is to prevent the loss or incorrect processing of a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: unit of recovery.
    p: Standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is scheduled.
operator_response
    div: Do not attempt to restart
    div > span: Db2
    div: until the error is resolved. Notify the system programmer and collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
system_programmer_response
    p: Print the BSDS using the Print Log Map (DSNJU004) utility. Find the checkpoint queue in the output listing from DSNJU004.
    p: Next, run the Change Log Inventory (DSNJU003) utility to create a conditional restart record with the CHKPTRBA option specifying the begin checkpoint RBA found in the second entry of the checkpoint queue. Restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: using the conditional restart record found. If the same failure occurs, repeat the conditional process using the next begin checkpoint RBA in the checkpoint queue.
    p: Repeat this process, going down the checkpoint queue until
    p > span: Db2
    p: restarts. This will be prior to the time when the invalid record was written to the log. The restart process then applies all the log records to the end of the log.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The state of the logged unit of recovery is reported in register 1 and the state of the global transaction is provided in register 2. The meanings of these values are shown below.
    div: Unit of recovery state (in register 1):
    div > dl > dt: 1
    div > dl > dd: inflight
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: ensure abort
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: commit indoubt
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: ensure commit
    div: Global Transaction State (in register 2):
    div > dl > dt: 1
    div > dl > dd: inflight
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: ensure abort
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: commit indoubt
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: ensure commit
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d92024.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D92025
msg_text
explanation
    p: During restart, it was determined that at least one unit of recovery (UR) was still active at the previous termination of this
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem and that the subsystem was last started at a different release level.
    p: During migration to a new release or fallback to an older release, all activity must be quiesced and there should be no active units of recovery.
    p > span: Db2
    p: restart will fail until the situation is resolved.
system_action
    p: The restart terminates abnormally, which terminates the subsystem. This action is to prevent the loss or incorrect processing of a
    p > span: Db2
    p: unit of recovery. An SVC dump is scheduled and an entry is created in SYS1.LOGREC.
operator_response
    p: Do not attempt to restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: until the error is resolved. Notify the system programmer and collect the required items for problem determination.
system_programmer_response
    p: Because all work must be quiesced before either migration or fallback of a
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, the recommended action is to restart the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem at the release level that created the outstanding unit or units of recovery and let the units of recovery end normally.
    p: You might need to use the RECOVER INDOUBT command to resolve indoubt threads.
    p: After all units of recovery have completed processing, use the STOP
    p > span: DB2
    p: command with MODE(QUIESCE) to stop
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Then restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: at the desired release level. Using a different release level may require additional migration or fallback actions.
    p: If it is not possible to restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: at the release level that created the outstanding units of recovery, then a cold start is required.
    ol > li: Print the BSDS using the DSNJU004 (print log map) utility.
    ol > li: Find the highest written RBA using the output from DSNJU004.
    ol > li: Use the DSNJU003 (change log inventory) utility to create a conditional restart record, specifying the same value for STARTRBA and ENDRBA. The RBA value must be an even multiple of 4096 (a hexadecimal value ending in 000) and should be rounded up from the highest written RBA as indicated by the DSNJU004 output.
    p: Additional actions might be necessary to recover from possible data inconsistencies.
    p: Another option is to restore the
    p > span: Db2
    p: logs and data to a prior consistent point in time.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d92025.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00D93002
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is terminated because an unrecoverable error was detected during must-complete processing for phase 2 of a commit-UR request for an agent that is a participant in a global transaction.
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination reason code.
    p > span: For further information, see
    p > span > a: IRLM abend codes
    p > span: .
system_action
    p: Standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested for the original error before
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination is initiated.
operator_response
    p: Print SYS1.LOGREC, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably either an error in
    p > span: Db2
    p: or in the commit of the global transaction.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p: A subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: invoked commit when the agent state was invalid for commit-UR invocation. Commit-UR was requested for an agent that was modifying data. Either commit-UR or abort-UR was already in process, or the recovery structure (URE) was damaged.
system_action
    p: Abnormal termination of the agent results, including backing out (abort-UR) of its activity to the previous point of consistency. This releases all locks held by the agent for its resources.
    p: Standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is scheduled. Additional information, identified in the SDWA variable recording area by reason code '00D9CCCC', is added to the SDWA variable recording area (VRA).
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: If the agent were in a must-complete state (in-commit2 or in-abort), the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is also terminated with reason code '00D93001'. When the subsystem is next restarted, recoverable activity for this agent (such as an ensure-abort or ensure-commit UR) is handled to complete the commit or abort process.

    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem error. Collect the materials mentioned in the Problem Determination section of this message.

    p > span: Db2
    p: trace table in the dump to establish whether either commit-UR was invoked incorrectly or the control structure that reflects the state (ACEPROG, UREPROG) was damaged.

    p > span: Db2

    div > ol > li: Notify your system programmer.

    div: To restart
    div > span: Db2
    div: , you must take one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Add the missing archive log data sets back to the BSDS with the change log inventory (DSNJU003) utility and increase the MAXARCH parameter in the DSN6LOGP member of DSNZPARM to complete the rollback, or
    div > ul > li: Restart
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: with a conditional restart specifying BACKOUT=NO to bypass the unit of recovery that is in-abort.
problem_determination

    p > span: Db2
    p: must read the log back to this point to complete the ROLLBACK of this unit of recovery.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

    div > ol > li: Print SYS1.LOGREC.

    div > ol > li: Notify your system programmer.

**start section**
number
    : 00D99001
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to read the CHKPTRBA failed to return a valid checkpoint record. This abend is issued after the DSNR015I error message is issued.
system_action
    p: Restart is abended.
operator_response
    p: Inform the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Let the change log inventory (DSNJU003) utility select the checkpoint RBA when building the conditional restart record. If a specific checkpoint is desired, use DSN1LOGP to print out the checkpoint log records within a specified range. If manual selection of the checkpoint RBA is desired, use the print log map (DSNJU004) utility to print the checkpoint queue. Print the checkpoint queue by using the CHKPTRBA keyword.
problem_determination
    div > ul > li: Print the checkpoint records within the desired range using DSN1LOGP.
    div > ul > li: Print the checkpoint queue using DSNJU004.
    div > ul > li: Verify the checkpoint queue against the DSN1LOGP report.
    div > ul > li: If automatic checkpoint selection was used and the checkpoint was invalid, find the valid checkpoint RBA in the DSN1LOGP report. Use this checkpoint RBA in the CRCR using the CHKPTRBA keyword.
    div > ul > li: If an explicit checkpoint was specified and the checkpoint was invalid, let DSNJU003 automatically choose the checkpoint by not specifying a CHKPTRBA keyword.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d99001.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00D99002
msg_text
explanation
    p: Validation of the STARTRBA failed because either the end of the log was reached, or a bad log record was encountered while attempting to find the first complete log record.
system_action
    p: Restart abends.
operator_response
    p: Inform the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Check the console log for DSNJ (Log Manager) messages; these may indicate failures in the Log Manager processing, or may reveal additional useful information for diagnostic purposes. Use DSN1LOGP to find a safe STARTRBA to use for restart. If a STARTRBA is specified, the Recovery Manager will use it as a starting point. From the starting point, the Recovery Manager will attempt to find the beginning of a valid log record.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00D9AAAA
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code identifies additional data stored in the SDWA variable recording area following a failure during abort-UR.
    p: This reason code appears only in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA) and serves only to identify data (in addition to the standard
    p > span: Db2®
    p: diagnostic information that is stored in the SDWA). This reason code is the first data item of the standard information. As such, it always appears in the VRA of an SDWA for a primary error completion/reason code. If no data is added, the reason code in the SDWA VRA is the same as that associated with the completion code.
system_action
    div: Five bytes of data preceded by code VRAHEX are stored following the EBCDIC string 'RMC-COMMIT/ABORT'.
    div > dl > dt > strong: Length
    div > dl > dd > strong: Data
    div > dl > dt: 1 byte
    div > dl > dd: Retry flags
    div > dl > dt: 1 byte
    div > dl > dd: Retry id
    div > dl > dt: 1 byte
    div > dl > dd: Notification RMID
    div > dl > dt: 2 bytes
    div > dl > dd: ACE progress state (ACEPROG)
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use this information in conjunction with other information for the primary failure.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00d9aaaa.html
**end section**

    : 00D9BBBB
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code identifies additional data stored in the SDWA variable recording area following a failure during begin-UR.
    p: This reason code appears only in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA) and it serves only to identify data (in addition to the standard
    p > span: Db2®
    p: diagnostic information, stored in the SDWA). This reason code is the first data item of the standard information. As such, it always appears in the VRA of an SDWA for a primary error completion/reason code. If no data is added, the reason code in the SDWA VRA is the same as that associated with the completion code.
system_action
    div: The following data is stored preceded by code VRAHEX.
    div > dl > dt > strong: Length
    div > dl > dd > strong: Data
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: Content of ACEURE
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: URE address

    div > dl > dd: DSNWRCRD return code
    div > dl > dt: 1
    div > dl > dd: Retry flags

number
    : 00D9CCCC
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code identifies additional data stored in the SDWA variable recording area following a failure during commit-UR.
    p: This reason code appears only in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA) and serves only to identify data (in addition to the standard
    p > span: Db2®
    p: diagnostic information, stored in the SDWA). This reason code is the first data item of the standard information. As such, it always appears in the VRA of an SDWA for a primary error completion/reason code.
system_action
    div: Five bytes of data preceded by code VRAHEX are stored following the EBCDIC string 'RMC-COMMIT/ABORT'.
    div > dl > dt > strong: Length
    div > dl > dd > strong: Data
    div > dl > dt: 1 byte
    div > dl > dd: Retry id
    div > dl > dt: 1 byte
    div > dl > dd: Notification RMID
    div > dl > dt: 1 byte
    div > dl > dd: ACE progress state (ACEPROG)
    div > dl > dt: 1 bit
    div > dl > dd: In flight
    div > dl > dt: 1 bit
    div > dl > dd: In-Commit1
    div > dl > dt: 1 bit
    div > dl > dd: Indoubt
    div > dl > dt: 1 bit
    div > dl > dd: In-Commit2
    div > dl > dt: 1 bit
    div > dl > dd: End-Commit
    div > dl > dt: 1 bit
    div > dl > dd: In-Abort
    div > dl > dt: 1 bit
    div > dl > dd: End-Abort
    div > dl > dt: 1 bit
    div > dl > dd: (Reserved)
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use this information with the instructions for the specific failure.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code identifies additional data stored in the SDWA variable recording area following a failure during end-UR.
    p: This reason code appears only in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA) and serves only to identify data (in addition to the standard
    p > span: Db2®
    p: diagnostic information, stored in the SDWA). This reason code is the first data item of the standard information. As such, it always appears in the VRA of an SDWA for a primary error completion/reason code.
system_action
    div: The following data is stored preceded by code VRAHEX.
    div > dl > dt > strong: Length
    div > dl > dd > strong: Data
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: URE address
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: DSNWRCRD return code

    div > span: Db2
    div: dump is requested. The following general purpose registers contain the indicated diagnostic information:
    div > ul > li: Register 4 contains the address of the pool header block (PHB), which contains information for the current status of the pool.
    div > ul > li: Register 7 contains the value of the caller's saved register 14.
    div > ul > li: Register 3 contains the input request length.

    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).

number
    : 00E20003
msg_text
explanation
    p: In order to satisfy an unconditional request for storage, the get variable storage function needed to obtain storage from GETMAIN to expand a storage pool. However, GETMAIN indicated that sufficient storage in the private area was not available.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Increase region size.
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: dump is requested. Register 2 contains the ASID, in hexadecimal, of the private area to be printed. Register 4 contains the address of the pool header block (PHB). Register 7 contains the value of the caller's saved register 14.
    p: At offset
    p > span: X'221'
    p: in the SDWA, there is a VRACAN key of
    p > span: '3D'
    p: (in HEX), followed by the module name of the storage manager invoker.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00E2000D
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected that either the address of a block being freed (the only block or a block on a chain of blocks) was invalid or the block did not lie within an existing storage pool.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The most likely cause of the problem is a storage overlay or an invalid storage request from a
    p > span: Db2
    p: component. A product other than
    p > span: Db2
    p: could cause the storage overlay problem.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested. Register 7 contains the value of the caller's saved register 14. Register 11 contains the address of the invalid block to be freed.
    p: At offset
    p > span: X'1EF'
    p: in the SDWA, there is a VRACAN key of
    p > span: X'3D'
    p: , followed by the module name of the storage manager invoker.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response

number
    : 00E2000E
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected that a segment of storage within the pool on which the request was directed was invalid or contained an invalid 'free chain' of free blocks in the segment.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The most likely cause of the problem is a storage overlay or an invalid storage request from a
    p > span: Db2
    p: component. A product other than
    p > span: Db2
    p: could cause the storage overlay problem.
problem_determination
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested. Register 4 contains the address of the pool header block (PHB). Register 7 contains the value of the caller's saved register 14. Register 11 contains the address of the block to be freed if freeing a fixed block.
    p: At offset
    p > span: X'1EF'
    p: in the SDWA, there is a VRACAN key of
    p > span: X'3D'
    p: , followed by the module name of the Storage Manager invoker.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

number
    : 00E2000F
msg_text
explanation
    p: The free fixed block(s) function detected that the only block, or the one block on the chain of blocks, being freed did not represent an allocated block; that is, it was already free.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested. Register 4 contains the address of the pool header block (PHB). Register 7 contains the value of the caller's saved register 14. Register 11 contains the address of the free block.
    p: At offset 1EF in the SDWA, there is a VRACAN key of '3D' (in HEX), followed by the module name of the Storage Manager invoker.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

msg_text
explanation

    div > span: Db2
    div: dump is requested. The following general purpose registers contain the indicated diagnostic information:
    div > ul > li: Register 2 contains the input parameter list address.
    div > ul > li: Register 3 contains the input request block size.
    div > ul > li: Register 4 contains the input maximum pool size.
    div > ul > li: Register 5 contains the input expansion segment size.
    div: The trace information also contains the address of the invalid parameter list.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The get tracked storage from GETMAIN function was unable to obtain sufficient storage in private area to satisfy an unconditional request.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The free tracked storage function detected that the area requested to be freed was not valid. Either the address did not represent storage currently allocated (via the DSNSGETM function), or the storage class passed as input to DSNSFREM did not match the class assigned to the storage by DSNSGETM.

    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

    p > span > span > span: .

    p: dump is requested. The trace information has the address of the storage and the storage class.

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

number
    : 00E20015
msg_text
explanation
    p: The allocate stack function, which is always unconditional, requested storage from GETMAIN to obtain a stack segment. GETMAIN indicated that 8K bytes of private area storage in subpool 229 was not available.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Increase maximum private storage.
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: dump is requested. There is probably a shortage of private area storage in the address space in which the failure occurred. Register 2 contains the ASID, in hexadecimal, of the private area to be printed.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The get stack storage function detected that the amount of storage requested by the invoker was invalid. For a 31-bit request the amount was less than or equal to zero. For a 64-bit request the amount was either less than or equal to zero or it exceeded the maximum allowable request size.

    p: The thread is abended.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The purge stack function detected that one of the SKBs (stack block) is not valid and the SKB chain is possibly damaged.
system_action
    p: The SKB chain is repaired and processing continues.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested. The trace information contains the address of the EB for which the stack segments are to be purged.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e2001c.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E2001D
msg_text
explanation
    p: Either GPVT (global pool anchor) or LPVT (local pool anchor) is damaged, and no storage managed by storage manager can be accessed.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is abended. In some cases, the FRR is established by the caller of the storage manager (SM) subcomponent. When this is the case, the SVC dump is requested by the caller. When this is not the case, the SM requests the SVC dump.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: A
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested, but in some cases the dump request is made by the caller of storage manager, rather than by storage manager itself. Register 6 contains the address of the EB.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

    : 00E2001E
msg_text
explanation
    p: The get stack storage function detected that two asynchronous (unrelated) agents use the same stack storage.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested. Register 2 contains the address of the stack segment (SKB). Register 6 contains the address of the EB. In the event of an ABEND, DSNTFRCV saves information in the VRA of the SDWA.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).

**start section**
number
    : 00E2001F
msg_text
explanation
    p: In order to satisfy an unconditional request for storage, the get variable storage function needed to obtain storage (from GETMAIN) to expand a storage pool. However, GETMAIN indicated that sufficient storage in common service area (CSA) to expand the pool was not available.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Increase common service area (CSA) size.
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: dump is requested. The common service area (CSA) portion of the dump should be printed. Register 4 contains the address of the pool header block (PHB). Register 7 contains the value of the caller's saved register 14.
    p: At offset 1EF in the SDWA, there is a VRACAN key of '3D' (in HEX), followed by the module name of the Storage Manager invoker.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e2001f.html

msg_text
explanation

    p: Increase region size.

msg_text
explanation

number
    : 00E20026
msg_text
explanation
    p: Either the allocate stack storage function or the get stack storage function was unable to obtain 4KB of private area storage in subpool 229 for an all-segment table in which a record (representing a stack storage segment) was to be inserted.
system_action
    p: The invoker of the function is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Increase region size.
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: dump is requested. There is probably a shortage of private area storage in the address space in which the failure occurred. Register 2 contains the ASID, in hexadecimal, of the private area to be printed.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00E20027
msg_text
explanation
    p: The free variable storage function detected that unallocated storage in the block being freed has been modified.
system_action
    p: The agent is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested.
    div: The following general purpose registers (GPRs) contain the indicated diagnostic information:
    div > dl > dt > strong: GPR
    div > dl > dd > strong: Content
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: address of the pool header block (PHB)
    div > dl > dt: 7
    div > dl > dd: value of the caller's saved register 14
    div > dl > dt: 11
    div > dl > dd: address of the block to be freed
    p: The block to be freed includes two parts: a four word header of control information and the block itself. The second word in the header (offset of 4) is the length of the block.
    p: The third word in the header (offset of 8) is the address of the storage requester. The block is made up of two parts: allocated storage and two words of unallocated storage (padding area of '03').
    p: At offset 1EF in the SDWA, there is a VRACAN key of '3D' (in HEX), followed by the module name of the Storage Manager invoker.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e20027.html
**end section**

    p > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected an internal error during the freeing of data space storage.
system_action
    p: The requested function is not performed. A
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Diagnostic information is recorded in SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00E30003
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was returned from a data manager restore operation. This abend is issued to ensure that changes made to the catalog by a failing BIND function are backed out.
system_action
    p: The BIND function is abended. All effects of the BIND operation are rolled back. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal error. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The service controller code, using the data manager restore function, has detected an error while trying to undo the results of a BIND operation. The data manager return and reason code encountered can be found in the CTDMRETC and CTSIRCOD fields of the cursor table pointed to by register 7 in the SDWA.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

**start section**
number
    : 00E30004
msg_text
explanation
    p: This abend is issued by the service controller initialization module whenever an error return code is received from a
    p > span: database services
    p: subcomponent participating in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: startup process. This abend ensures that
    p > span: Db2
    p: is terminated.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: database services
    p: shutdown process is initiated after an SVC dump is requested, and a record is written to the SYS1.LOGREC data set.
    p > span: Db2
    p: is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump. .
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: A list of all
    div > span: database services
    div: subcomponents whose initialization process has been completed may be obtained from the SVC dump requested by this abend. Register 2 in the SDWA points to a structure that contains the following diagnostic information:
    div > dl > dt: 0 (0)
    div > dl > dd: Module qualifier that identifies the area within DSNTSTRT at which the error was detected. The qualifier should be:
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: A (10)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Error found upon return from the SCC startup initialization process
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: B (11)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Error found upon return from the SCC IRLM identify process
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: C (12)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Error found upon return from the buffer manager initialization process
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: D (13)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Error found upon return from the data manager initialization process
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: E (14)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Error found upon return from the data space manager initialization process
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: F (15)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Error found upon return from the RDS initialization process or LOB Manager initialization process.
    div > dl > dt: 2 (2)
    div > dl > dd: Error return code from the invoked subcomponent
    div > dl > dt: 4 (4)
    div > dl > dd: Error reason code from the invoked subcomponent
    div > dl > dt: 8 (8)
    div > dl > dd: Pointer to a structure containing a character string SSCM followed by a 32-bit map representing the following information:
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 0
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: 1 if
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd > span: Db2
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: has successfully 'signed on' to IRLM
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 10 (16)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Error found upon return from the SCC startup initialization process
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 1
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: 1 if the buffer manager subcomponent initialization process is completed
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 2
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: 1 if the data manager subcomponent initialization process is completed
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 3
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: 1 if the data space manager subcomponent initialization process is completed
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 4
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Not used
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 5
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: 1 if the RDS subcomponent initialization process is completed
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 6
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Not applicable
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 7
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: 1 if the SCC initialization process is completed
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bit 8
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: 1 if the LOB Manager initialization is completed
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: Bits 9 to 31
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Not used
    div > dl > dt: C (12)
    div > dl > dd: Pointer to invoked subcomponent's RMFT.
    p: From this information the appropriate subcomponent's startup process may be identified.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

    p: was executing. Message DSNT103I is generated before the abend occurs.

    p: is terminated.

    p > span: Db2
    p: with a -START
    p > span: DB2
    p: PARM= command, where the parameter block that follows the 'PARM=' parameter specifies an MVS/XA version of the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem parameters.

**start section**
number
    : 00E3000A
msg_text
explanation
    p: A bad recovery element was detected by the database services standard ESTAE and FRR recovery routines. This is probably a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem error.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested. The execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This error is detected when a module invokes the macro DSNTSFRR to disconnect a functional recovery element (FRE) from a functional recovery chain to which it is not connected. The name of the module passing the invalid FRE is the module issuing the abend.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e3000a.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E3000B
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: database services
    p: section (DSN6SPRM) in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: initialization parameter module (DSNZPARM) does not exist.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    p > span: Db2
    p: is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably an installation error. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Register 2 in the SDWA points to a structure that contains the following diagnostic information:
    div > dl > dt: 0 (0)
    div > dl > dd: Should equal X'1'
    div > dl > dt: 2 (2)
    div > dl > dd: Return code from the get descriptor function of the system parameter manager (SPM) subcomponent of
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2
    div > dl > dt: 4 (4)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    div > dl > dt: 8 (8)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    div > dl > dt: C (12)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    p: First, ensure that DSNZPARM was installed correctly. Then, using the return code from SPM, determine why the descriptor is not available.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of DSNZPARM module used.

**start section**
number
    : 00E3000C
msg_text
explanation
    p: A
    p > span: database services
    p: TCB service task that cannot be reinstated has been abnormally terminated. Entries in SYS1.LOGREC that precede this entry indicate the source of the error.
system_action
    p: The executing unit is abended. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC, and determine the cause of the problem from the information that precedes this entry.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: database services
    p: functional recovery load module, DSNTF, has an unrecognizable entry point.

    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is abended.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Register 2 in the SDWA points to a structure that contains the following diagnostic information:
    div > dl > dt: 0 (0)
    div > dl > dd: Should equal X'4'
    div > dl > dt: 2 (2)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    div > dl > dt: 4 (4)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    div > dl > dt: 8 (8)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    div > dl > dt: C (12)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    p: The abend is generated whenever the
    p > span: Db2
    p: load module DSNTFEPL is not link-edited with a load module entry point name of DSNTF. To correct this, link-edit DSNTFEPL again with the correct entry point name.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:

**start section**
number
    : 00E30010
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: database services
    p: initialization process could not read the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: bootstrap data set (BSDS).
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    p > span: Db2
    p: is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably an installation error. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This error can usually be traced to a VSAM error occurring while reading the BSDS. Before examining the dump, examine the operator console log and SYSLOG to determine if VSAM has encountered any errors on the BSDS.
    div: Register 2 in the SDWA points to a structure that contains the following diagnostic information:
    div > dl > dt: 0 (0)
    div > dl > dd: Should equal X'2'
    div > dl > dt: 2 (2)
    div > dl > dd: Return code from a BSDS read request function of the recovery log manager (RLM) subcomponent
    div > dl > dt: 4 (4)
    div > dl > dd: Abend reason code from a BSDS read request function of the recovery log manager (RLM) subcomponent
    div > dl > dt: 8 (8)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    div > dl > dt: C (12)
    div > dl > dd: Not applicable
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Contents of the BSDS (both copies if dual BSDS in use) obtained by using the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: print log map (DSNJU004) utility.
user_response

number
    : 00E30017
msg_text
explanation
    p: While loading the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: database services function recovery and emergency shutdown modules, the Service Controller function abends with this reason code. This is because it detected a load module which was loaded with an invalid addressing capability. The abend is preceded by message DSNT107E.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: database services startup is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Refer to message DSNT107E.
problem_determination
    p: Refer to message DSNT107E.

**start section**
number
    : 00E3001B
msg_text
explanation
    p: A plan could not be executed because the system from which you are attempting to run is disabled or unknown. The system type might be unknown if the attach library that you are using is from a previous release of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: that does not support the ENABLE and DISABLE options of the bind operation.
system_action
    p: The plan is not allocated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Refer to the SYSIBM.SYSPLSYSTEM table to determine the systems from which the plan can be executed, or correct the attach library.
problem_determination
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00E3001D
msg_text
explanation
    p: A DSNHDECP name, authorization exit name, signon exit name or access control exit name other than the default name is not supported in an environment executing early code from a prior release. If
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detects early code from a prior release and a DSNHDECP or exit that is not the default name
    p > span: Db2
    p: start-up will be terminated with this reason code.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: start-up is abended with reason code 00E3001D.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Reassemble and link-edit a DSNHDECP or exit with the default name.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e3001d.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E3001E
msg_text
explanation
    p: A statement in the package could not be processed successfully because it would require access to a remote location and the package was last bound with DBPROTOCOL(PRIVATE).
system_action
    p: The execution of the package section fails.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Rebind the plan or package with the DBPROTOCOL(DRDA) bind option.
    p: Run the Private Protocol to DRDA Protocol Catalog Analysis tool, DSNTP2DP to obtain a set of conversion commands to convert packages in the system to use DRDA protocol.
