**start section**
number
    : 00E30040
msg_text
explanation
    p: An internal logic error occurred while the catalog access function was being invoked.
system_action
    p: The START RLIMIT command fails. The governing status prior to issuing this command continues unchanged.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: At the time of the abend, the registers contain the following information:
    div > dl > dt > strong: Register
    div > dl > dd > strong: Contents
    div > dl > dt: 0
    div > dl > dd: Address of the catalog access package parameter list
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: Catalog access return code
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: Catalog access reason code
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: Data manager return code
    div > dl > dt: 5
    div > dl > dd: Data manager reason code
    div > dl > dt: 7
    div > dl > dd: CT address
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00E30063
msg_text
explanation
    p: The BIND PACKAGE or CREATE PROCEDURE request attempted to insert more than the maximum supported number of records for a single package into the SYSIBM.SYSPACKSTMT catalog table. The number of SYSPACKSTMT records for a single package cannot exceed 2,147,483,647.
system_action
    p: The BIND PACKAGE subcommand or the CREATE PROCEDURE SQL statement fails.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Break the application into smaller applications so that each packages requires fewer records.
sql_state
    h4: Severity
    p: 8 (error)
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30063.html
**end section**

    span: Db2®
    : detected that a resource was unavailable during the automatic rebind process or when stopping databases, table spaces, or index spaces.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
user_response
    p: If the unavailable resource is detected during an automatic rebind, issue an explicit REBIND subcommand, which either resolves the problem or provides more details about the problem in the output.

number

msg_text
explanation
    p: The service controller's BIND processor detected an error in the user's database request module (DBRM) while building the SYSDBRM record.
system_action
    p: The BIND command fails.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
    p: An invalid field in the DBRM was found while processing the BIND command. The DBRM might be bad. Rebuild the DBRM and reissue the BIND command.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The service controller's BIND processor has detected an invalid release dependency mark in the cursor table.
system_action
    p: The BIND command fails.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    p: The service controller module DSNTBBP detected an unknown value in the CTRELDEP field of the BIND CT. The BIND CT is pointed to by GPR7 at the time of the abend and is mapped by DSNDCT. The one byte CTRELDEP field should have been set by the RDS BIND processor (DSNXEPR) or one of the functions it invokes.

**start section**
number
    : 00E30067
msg_text
explanation
    p: The BIND process program abended while attempting to use a BIND parameter. This usually indicates that the parameter list provided to the service controller BIND function is invalid (such as invalid addresses or incorrect key).
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested. The BIND subcommand is terminated.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: Register 2 contains an indication of the type of parameter as follows:
    div > dl > dt: 00000101
    div > dl > dd: Input parameter list.
    div > dl > dt: 00000102
    div > dl > dd: Communication information block (CIB).
    div > dl > dt: 00000103
    div > dl > dd: Invalid BIND subcommand name. Registers 3 and 4 contain the invalid subcommand name.
    div > dl > dt: 00000104
    div > dl > dd: Subcommand information block (SIB).
    div > dl > dt: 00000201
    div > dl > dd: DBRM member name list.
    div > dl > dt: 00000202
    div > dl > dd: Plan-ID list.
    div > dl > dt: 00000203
    div > dl > dd: Message block in user storage. Other register contents are as follows:
    div > dl > dd > div > table > thead > tr > th: R3
    div > dl > dd > div > table > thead > tr > th: R4
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: <
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 4
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: Simple reference
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > ul > li: R8 = zero
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: >0
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: >4
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: MVCL
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > ul > li: R8 = From address
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > ul > li: R4 = move length
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > p: To and from lengths are equal.
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 0
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: >4
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: GETMAIN for user storage failed
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > ul > li: R4 = storage length required
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > ul > li: R8 = GETM
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > ul > li > p: To fix this problem, increase your region size.
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: <0
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: >4
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td: FREEMAIN of user storage failed
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > ul > li: R4 = length of storage of free
    div > dl > dd > div > table > tbody > tr > td > ul > li: R8 = address of storage to free
    div > dl > dt: 00000204
    div > dl > dd: Message block in user storage. R8 = Message block address.
    div: Except as indicated above, the information in the other registers is as follows:
    div > dl > dt: R3
    div > dl > dd: Parameter address
    div > dl > dt: R4
    div > dl > dd: Parameter length
    div > dl > dt: R5
    div > dl > dd: Parameter storage key
    div > dl > dt: R8
    div > dl > dd: Input parameter list address
    div > dl > dt: 00000205
    div > dl > dd: Package-list name list.
    div > dl > dt: 00000206
    div > dl > dd: ENABLE/DISABLE system list.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the DSNTRACE data set for the DSN (TSO attachment facility) session involved in the problem.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30067.html

number
    : 00E30070
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt was made to use the Internal Resource Lock Manager (IRLM) facilities, but the IRLM was not available. Either the IRLM had not been started by the operator, or the IRLM has encountered a problem causing it to terminate abnormally.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested. The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: The IRLM should be started before the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is started. If this does not resolve the problem (that is, if the IRLM actually was started before
    p > span: Db2
    p: was started) notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably not a
    p > span: Db2
    p: problem. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p > span: If IRLM abended, and if you suspect an error in
    p > span > span: Db2
    p > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span: .
    p: Otherwise, ensure that the IRLM is started before the -START
    p > span: DB2
    p: command is issued.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of DSNZPARM module used.
    div > ul > li > span: IRLM trace output.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

msg_text
explanation
    p: Either
    p > span: Db2®
    p: terminated without successfully signing off from IRLM, or another subsystem with the same SSNAME is still connected. This abend reason code accompanies message DSNT380I.

    p > span: Db2
    p: is abended.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2
    p: . Regardless, notify the system programmer.

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

    p: If you are running multiple versions of
    p > span: Db2
    p: , ensure that the SSNAME specified by the DSN6SPRM macro during the installation of the member DSNZPARM is not the same as the SSNAME in another version of
    p > span: Db2
    p: .

    p > span: Db2
    p: .

**start section**
number
    : 00E30074
msg_text
explanation
    p: A global out-of-storage condition was encountered by the Internal Resource Lock Manager (IRLM) during the processing of a LOCK or UNLOCK request.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested. The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably not a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: problem. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: The name of the module issuing the abend is recorded in the SYS1.LOGREC entry. It is also recorded in the SVC dump as the CSECT involved in the abend. A parameter in the IRLM procedure specifies the amount of the common service area (CSA) to be used by IRLM. Take one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Increase the CSA limit.
    div > ul > li: Use a local IRLM (that is, an IRLM option that causes IRLM to operate from another address space).
    div > ul > li: Using IRLM lock tracing, determine what application is acquiring so many locks that it causes the IRLM CSA limit to be exceeded.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30074.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E30075
msg_text
explanation
    p: During the normal sign-off from IRLM or during the abnormal shutdown of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: , an AUTO-STOP of IRLM using SVC 34 abnormally terminated. Message DSNT383I is issued.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
    p > span: Db2
    p: is abended.

    p > span: Db2
    p: internal error. Obtain a copy of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The name of the CSECT issuing the abend is found in both the SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump. Register 2 contains the SVC return code.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the IRLM procedure.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: In the SVC dump, register 2 contains the return code and register 3 contains the reason code from the identify function to the IRLM. Examine the reason code in register 3, either from the dump or system console log. A reason code of
    p > span: X'4004'
    p: indicates that the identify function code (51,
    p > span: X'33'
    p: ) does not exist in the IRLM SSVT. This may be due to the operator issuing a stop IRLM command followed by a start
    p > span: Db2
    p: command before the IRLM has completed termination processing. The sequence of commands can be determined from the system console log.
    p: A reason code of
    p > span: X'4008'
    p: indicates that the IRLM is unavailable, that is, IRLM is not started and the autostart is not requested by parameters in DSNZPARM.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).

msg_text

    p > span: Db2®

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: An IRLM request was made that IRLM could not honor immediately. IRLM called DSNTLSUS to suspend the request. While waiting, the request parameter list (RLPL) was changed and is no longer valid. Someone may be reusing the RLPL, or the storage may have been overlaid.
    p: Register 2 contains a pointer to the RLPL.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is unable to acquire a modify lock. Lock negotiation failed because this request was involved in lock negotiation with other
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystems and the request was denied.

    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: data sharing group is abnormally terminating.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

**start section**
number
    : 00E30097
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: encountered an IRLM error indicating that IRLM detected an 'out of record list' storage condition.
    p: The record list is a part of the coupling facility lock structured that contains the 'modify locks' (those locks that would be retained in case of a failure).
system_action
    p: DSNT500I or SQLCODE -904 is returned to the user. This reason code and the resource name are also returned.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    div: The coupling facility lock structure is declared too small. If this condition becomes a prevalent problem, you need to redistribute the coupling facility lock structure storage resource to make more room for the record list. You can make room for the record list in on of two ways:
    div > ul > li: Issue a rebuild.
    div > ul > li: Dynamically change the lock structure size.
    p: Refer to
    p > span: Db2
    p: Data Sharing: Planning and Administration for more details about these options.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30097.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E30305
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code is used by the automatic binding function to indicate that the package that is currently being allocated is not operational.
    p: If a package becomes invalid, the VALID column in the SYSIBM.SYSPACKAGE table is set to a value other than Y. The next time that the package is allocated, automatic rebinding is triggered.
    p: If automatic rebinding is successful, then the package becomes valid again. (The value in the VALID column is changed to Y.) If the rebinding is not successful, then the package remains invalid and becomes inoperative. (The value in the VALID column stays the same and the value of the OPERATIVE column is changed to N.) The allocation fails, and this code is issued.
system_action
    p: Agent allocation fails or DROP package fails.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine what made the package not operational, and issue a REBIND subcommand for the package.
problem_determination
user_response

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30305.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: A warning occurred because the length of time that a thread was idle exceeded the warning setting for the MONITOR IDLE THREADS keyword in a monitor profile for one of the following filtering scopes:
    ul > li: LOCATION
    ul > li: PRDID
    ul > li: ROLE_AUTHID
    ul > li: ROLE
    ul > li: AUTHID
    ul > li: COLLID_PKGNAME
    ul > li: COLLID
    ul > li: PKGNAME
    ul > li: CLIENT_APPLNAME
    ul > li: CLIENT_USERID
    ul > li: CLIENT_WRKSTNNAME

    p > span: Db2®
    p: resources and the requesting application did not make a request to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: server thread for an extended period of time.
system_action
    p: A warning alert is issued, but the processing continues normally.
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message
    p > span: DSNT771I
    p: .

    p > span: Db2

    ol > li: Modify the MONITOR IDLE THREADS warning threshold in the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES table.

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E30502
msg_text
explanation
    p: A thread was canceled because the length of time that a thread was idle exceeded the exception setting for the MONITOR IDLE THREADS keyword in a monitor profile for one of the following filtering scopes:
    ul > li: LOCATION
    ul > li: PRDID
    ul > li: ROLE_AUTHID
    ul > li: ROLE
    ul > li: AUTHID
    ul > li: COLLID_PKGNAME
    ul > li: COLLID
    ul > li: PKGNAME
    ul > li: CLIENT_APPLNAME
    ul > li: CLIENT_USERID
    ul > li: CLIENT_WRKSTNNAME
    p: The server thread was holding
    p > span: Db2®
    p: resources and the requesting application did not make a request to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: server thread for an extended period of time.
system_action
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message
    p > span: DSNT772I
    p: .
    p: The subsequent system action depends on the ATTRIBUTE1 column value in the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES table:
    ul > li: If the ATTRIBUTE1 value is EXCEPTION,
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: abnormally terminates the execution unit, terminates the server thread to release resources that might affect other threads, and terminates the connection with the remote application.
    ul > li: If the ATTRIBUTE1 value is EXCEPTION_ROLLBACK, the server thread is aborted. The connection with the remote application is maintained.
    ul > li > p: If the aborted transaction performed database updates, the application environment is placed in a must-abort state so that the application environment is made aware of the resources that have been destroyed as a result of the aborted threads.
    ul > li > div > span: Important:
    ul > li > div: If either of the following situations are true,
    ul > li > div > span: Db2
    ul > li > div: hides the EXCEPTION_ROLLBACK event from the remote application environment:
    ul > li > div > ul > li: The aborted transaction performed only read-only operations.
    ul > li > div > ul > li: The transaction committed or aborted, but the associated database access thread remained active before it became idle.
    ul > li > div > p: Because the EXCEPTION_ROLLBACK event is not visible to the remote application environment in those cases, it might appear to the remote application environment that the database resources are unexpectedly disappearing. For example, held cursors, kept dynamic statements, and declared temporary tables that were created in the transaction are destroyed. Use EXCEPTION_ROLLBACK only if the remote application environment can account for this apparent loss of database resources.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Review the information provided in message
    p > span: DSNT772I
    p: . Determine why the requesting application did not make a request to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: server in the specified time.
    p: This condition typically occurs for one of the following reasons:
    ul > li: The ACTIVE thread option was specified in the DDF THREADS field of the DSNTIPR installation panel, and a requester application or its user did not make a request to the
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: server for an extended period (such as a lengthy user absence). As a result, the server thread becomes susceptible to cancellation because of the timeout value.
    ul > li > p > strong: Action:
    ul > li > p: Determine why the requesting application did not make a request to the
    ul > li > p > span: Db2
    ul > li > p: server in the specified time.
    ul > li: The INACTIVE thread option was specified in the DDF THREADS field of the DSNTIPR installation panel, and a requester application or its user failed to commit before an extended dormant period (such as user absence). It is also possible that, despite committing before an extended dormant period, database resources are still held because of other existing conditions. As a result, the server thread cannot be moved to the inactive state and becomes susceptible to being canceled because of the timeout value.
    ul > li > p > strong: Action:
    ul > li > p: Determine why the server thread was not moved to the inactive state.
    p: If the application requires additional time:
    ol > li: Modify the MONITOR IDLE THREADS exception threshold in the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES table.
    ol > li: Issue the START PROFILE command to refresh the exception threshold value.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30502.html
**end section**

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E30506
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: was unable to service the connection request because the number of concurrent active threads exceeded the exception threshold for the MONITOR THREADS keyword in a monitor profile for the LOCATION filtering scope.
system_action
    p: When the MONITOR THREADS exception threshold value is set to zero, the connection is terminated.
    p: Otherwise, the connection remains active and the thread is queued until other threads deallocate or go inactive, providing an available slot. The thread resumes when a slot becomes available and the number of the concurrent active threads goes below the profile exception threshold, unless another thread is next in the queue.
    p: In both cases,
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message
    p > span: DSNT772I
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Review the information provided in message
    p > span: DSNT772I
    p: .
    p: Determine if there are sufficient threads allowed for the LOCATION filtering scope. If additional threads are required:
    ol > li: Increase the MONITOR THREADS exception threshold value in the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES table.
    ol > li: Issue the START PROFILE command to refresh the exception threshold value.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
    h4: Application programmer response
    p: If the connection is terminated, retry the connection request.
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30506.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E30507
msg_text
explanation
    p: The connection could not access
    p > span: Db2®
    p: because the number of concurrent active threads exceeded the exception threshold for the MONITOR THREADS keyword in a monitor profile for one of the following filtering scopes.
    ul > li: PRDID
    ul > li: ROLE
    ul > li: AUTHID
    ul > li: ROLE_AUTHID
    ul > li: LOCATION
system_action
    p: When the MONITOR THREADS exception threshold value is set to zero, the connection is terminated.
    p: Otherwise, the connection remains active and the thread is queued until other threads deallocate or go inactive, providing an available slot. The thread resumes when a slot becomes available and the number of the concurrent active threads goes below the profile exception threshold, unless another thread is next in the queue.
    p > span: Db2
    p: queues and suspends the number of the concurrent active threads up to the profile exception threshold. Once it is exceeded,
    p > span: Db2
    p: rejects the connection request and returns SQLCODE
    p > span: -30041
    p: .
    p: In both cases,
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message
    p > span: DSNT772I
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Review the information provided in message
    p > span: DSNT772I
    p: .
    p: Determine if there are sufficient threads allowed for the applicable filtering scope or scopes. If additional threads are required:
    ol > li: Increase the MONITOR THREADS exception threshold value in the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES table.
    ol > li: Issue the START PROFILE command to refresh the exception threshold value.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
    h4: Application programmer response
    p: If the connection is terminated, review the information provided in SQLCODE
    p > span: -30041
    p: . Retry the connection request.
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30507.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E30508
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: was unable to process the SQL statement because the number of concurrent active threads exceeded the exception threshold for the MONITOR THREADS keyword in a monitor profile for one of the following filtering scopes.
    ul > li: COLLID
    ul > li: PKGNAME
    ul > li: COLLID_PKGNAME
    ul > li: CLIENT_APPLNAME
    ul > li: CLIENT_USERID
    ul > li: CLIENT_WRKSTNNAME
system_action
    p: When the MONITOR THREADS exception threshold value is set to zero, the connection is terminated.
    p: Otherwise, the connection remains active and the thread is queued until other threads deallocate or go inactive, providing an available slot. The thread resumes when a slot becomes available and the number of the concurrent active threads goes below the profile exception threshold, unless another thread is next in the queue.
    p > span: Db2
    p: queues and suspends the number of the concurrent active threads up to the profile exception threshold. Once it is exceeded,
    p > span: Db2
    p: rejects the connection request and returns SQLCODE
    p > span: -30041
    p: .
    p: In both cases,
    p > span: Db2
    p: issues message
    p > span: DSNT772I
    p: .
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Review the information provided in message
    p > span: DSNT772I
    p: .
    p: Determine if there are sufficient threads allowed for the applicable filtering scope or scopes. If additional threads are required:
    ol > li: Increase the MONITOR THREADS exception threshold value in the SYSIBM.DSN_PROFILE_ATTRIBUTES table.
    ol > li: Issue the START PROFILE command to refresh the exception threshold value.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
    h4: Application programmer response
    p: If the connection is terminated, review the information provided in SQLCODE
    p > span: -30041
    p: . Retry the connection request.
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30508.html
**end section**

    : 00E30700

operator_response

system_programmer_response
    p: An SQL statement used too much resource space.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination

    p: See the text for the SQLCODE -905. It will specify the resource limit that was exceeded. The SQLCODE -905 text will also include the name of the resource limit specification table that was used to derive the limit. Determine why the limit was exceeded.

**start section**
number
    : 00E30806
msg_text
explanation
    p: IRLM could not successfully join its IRLM data sharing group. Message DSNT800I accompanies this abend reason code.
system_action
    p: Message DSNT800I is issued to the console, and
    p > span: Db2®
    p: abnormally terminates with this reason code. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC. No SVC dump is taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    div: Some possible reasons why IRLM could not join its data sharing group are:
    div > ul > li: The lock structure is not properly defined in the active MVS™ CFRM administrative policy. The lock structure name is a concatenation of the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: data sharing group name and the string 'LOCK1', separated by an underscore (_). For example, if the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: data sharing group name is DSNCAT, DSNCAT_LOCK1 would be the lock structure name.
    div > ul > li > p: Ensure that the lock structure is properly defined in the active MVS CFRM policy. The name of the lock structure that IRLM attempted to access is given in message DSNT800I. IRLM issues message DXR138E to indicate that the lock structure definition could not be accessed in the active MVS CFRM policy.
    div > ul > li: IRLM could not connect the lock structure. The reason for the connect failure is given in IRLM message DXR135E.
    div > ul > li: IRLM could not join its data sharing group. The reason for the join failure is given in IRLM message DXR134E.
    div > ul > li: IRLM joined the wrong group. The set of IRLMs that are connected to a given lock structure must all be members of the same group.
    div > ul > li > p: Ensure that the GROUP parameter is correctly specified in the IRLM startup procedure. If you give an incorrect group name, IRLM connects the lock structure, and then times out waiting for responses from other connectors. IRLM issues message DXR133I for the timeout.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e30806.html

explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: failed on the IRLM Identify request because no lock structure name was specified. Message DSNT810E accompanies this abend reason code.

    p > span: Db2
    p: terminates abnormally with this reason code. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC. No SVC dump is taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: This condition occurs if you are not running
    p > span: Db2
    p: in data sharing mode, but the associated IRLM is running with global scope (SCOPE=GLOBAL in the IRLM startup procedure). If you are not running
    p > span: Db2
    p: in data sharing mode, ensure that the associated IRLM startup procedure specifies SCOPE=LOCAL. Conversely, if you are running
    p > span: Db2
    p: in data sharing mode, ensure that the associated IRLM startup procedure specifies SCOPE=GLOBAL.

    p > span: Db2®

**start section**
number
    : 00E40005
msg_text
explanation
    p: A nonzero reason code was returned from MVS™ sort or DFSORT could not be loaded.
system_action
    p: Any error message generated by sort in conjunction with the nonzero reason code is directed to the device/data set identified by the UTPRINT DD statement in the utility job step.
    p: Error message DSNU044I, that contains the nonzero reason code, is directed to the device/data set identified by the SYSPRINT DD statement in the utility job step.
    p: If DFSORT cannot be loaded, the utility output contains
    p > span: DSNU1640I
    p: .
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to release the resources claimed by the stopped utility (this may not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p > span: This abend is accompanied by the utility message DSNU044I, that contains the sort reason code and an SVC dump, or by a DSNU1640I message.
    p: In most cases, the error messages from SORT that are sent to the device/data set identified by the UTPRINT DD statement identify the problem. The dump may not be needed. If SORT is unable to open the UTPRINT data set, only the message and abend are provided. In this case, correct the problem associated with the UTPRINT DD statement, and restart the job with the RESTART(PHASE) option.
    p > span: If DFSORT could not be loaded then make sure that the DFSORT program libraries are accessible by the utility job.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Determine the cause of the error. If the error can be corrected, the utility may be restarted from the beginning of the sort phase by using the 'RESTART(PHASE)' parameter. If the error prevents the utility from completing, the -TERM command should be issued to remove the stopped utility from the system. The -TERM UTILITY should seldom be used when the stopped utility is REORG.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40005.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40006
msg_text
explanation
    div: An error was detected while manipulating the utility-in-progress bits of the database exception table (DBET). The error might occur due to one of the following conditions:
    div > ul > li: The SYSIBM.SYSUTIL table and the DBET are out of sync.
    div > ul > li: The utility-in-progress condition was not properly reset after execution of a prior utility.
    div > ul > li: A resource unavailable condition exists.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended. This abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the -DISPLAY UTILITY command to display the status of any utilities in progress. Determine if another utility is active on the same table space. Use the -DISPLAY DATABASE command to determine if the table space has a utility-in-progress condition set on.
    p: The utility-in-progress bit is turned on only for table spaces. If a utility is run against an index, the utility-in-progress bit is turned on for the appropriate table space.
    p: A utility-in-progress condition set without a corresponding entry for an active or stopped utility in the SYSUTIL table is an inconsistent condition caused by a prior error. To resolve this, issue a -START DATABASE command specifying the proper table space with the ACCESS(FORCE) parameter. This causes the utility-in-progress status to be cleared.
    p: If the problem cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: Copy of the log for this period, so that additional DSN1LOGP reports can be produced for problem determination.
user_response
    p: If applicable, correct the resource unavailable condition identified by the DSNT500I message. For an explanation of resource types, see . Either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and submit it again.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code. Consult the system programmer to diagnose the problem.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40006.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40007
msg_text
explanation
    p: The COPY utility function is unable to open the table space as directed. The failure can occur because the table space is currently not available. The failure can also be an internal error.
system_action
    p: If the table space is currently not available, a DSNT500I RESOURCE UNAVAILABLE message is directed to the device or data set identified by the SYSPRINT DD statement. The utility job step is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: After the environmental information is determined, an operator with SYSOPR authority can terminate the utility job step and free the resources, but this might not be necessary.
system_programmer_response
    p: If a DSNT500I message preceded the abend, use the contents of that message for problem determination. Otherwise, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This is an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
    div: .
user_response
    p: If the abend was accompanied by a DSNT500I message, use that message to determine the cause of the resource unavailability. You can restart the utility when the resource becomes available, or you can terminate the utility job step and resubmit the job at a later time.
    p: If a DSNT500I message was not issued, an internal processing error occurred. Provide the system programmer with dumps and messages for fault analysis.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40007.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E40009
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was detected while attempting to access the target object (table space or index space).
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. The DSNT500I message might be preceded by other related messages on the console. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response

    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.

number
    : 00E4000C
msg_text
explanation
    p: This is an internal control error. The utility subcomponent that manages the function control flow associated with
    p > span: Db2®
    p: database services has been requested to perform a function that it does not recognize.
system_action
    p: The utility job step that caused the function to be requested is abended. The utility job is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to free resources (this might not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: To determine how much of the requested function within the job step was completed, examine the data set/device identified by SYSPRINT. Consult the system programmer to diagnose the problem. Determine whether the utility job step should be terminated in order to release resources.

number
    : 00E40010
msg_text
explanation
    p: A request to IRLM on behalf of a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: utility to lock a page or an entire table space has failed. This is either an internal
    p > span: Db2
    p: or an IRLM problem. The error occurred in the
    p > span: database services
    p: address space.
system_action
    p: The utility job is abended. An SVC dump is requested (with the address of the IRLM parameter list, RLPL, in register 4). The utility is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to free resources (this might not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
    p: Check the IRLM return and reason codes in the RLPL.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response

msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to extend the error range information in the database allocation table (DBAT) failed.
system_action
    p: The I/O error that did not get recorded in the DBAT table was reported in error message DSNU086E, that was directed to the device/data set identified by the SYSPRINT DD statement. The utility job step is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to release the resources claimed by the stopped utility (this might not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40014.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E40015
msg_text
explanation
    p: A RECOVER utility was initiated with the ERROR RANGE option specified. The request was rejected when it was determined that there was not a sufficient number of alternate tracks for the pages in the error range to be recovered.
system_action
    p: The abend was issued in the
    p > span: database services
    p: address space. The dumps requested are dependent upon the JCL of the utility job step. The utility job step is abended. The utility is placed in the 'stopped' state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to free resources (this might not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Recovery can be accomplished by resubmitting the RECOVER utility without the ERROR RANGE option. Recovery can be by data set or the table space as a whole.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40015.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40016
msg_text
explanation
    p: A Recover utility was initiated with the ERROR RANGE option specified. An error was detected by the media manager while processing a MMCNVT macro invocation. This is an internal error within either
    p > span: Db2®
    p: or the media manager.
system_action
    p: The utility job step that caused the function to be requested is abended. The utility job is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to free resources if that should prove necessary (this might not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
    div: The MMCNVT macro converts a VSAM RBA to its physical track address (CCHHR). At the time of abend, the following registers contain relevant information:
    div > dl > dt: R2
    div > dl > dd: Address of media manager interface block (MMIB).
    div > dl > dt: R3
    div > dl > dd: Address of field containing VSAM RBA to be converted.
    div > dl > dt: R4
    div > dl > dd: Address of area to receive CCHHR.
    div > dl > dt: R5
    div > dl > dd: MMCNVT places UCB address here.
    div > dl > dt: R8
    div > dl > dd: Return code from media manager. If you suspect an error in media manager, refer to
    div > dl > dd > cite > span: z/OS DFSMSdfp Diagnosis Reference
    div > dl > dd: .
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40016.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E40018
msg_text
explanation
    p: Either an error was detected during the execution of a restarted utility or a condition was detected that might have required restart of a utility. A message is issued prior to this abend code to indicate the type of error.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Check messages issued prior to this abend code to determine the cause of the error. Correct the error, and restart the job.
problem_determination
    p: This abend is forced to allow restart of the utility when work data sets are used and the disposition is (MOD,DELETE,CATLG).
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40018.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E4001A
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was detected while using SVC 99 to allocate, deallocate, or retrieve information dynamically on the data set.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment. If the utility is called from a stored procedure, check to see if the refresh of WLM cannot progress, for example because of an MVS™ authorization error. If the WLM refresh failed, issue a VARY command to refresh the WLM environment.
problem_determination
    p: This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: ® internal error. If the error occurs during utility execution through a stored procedure, this ABEND indicates that a failure occurred during an SVC 99 operation, and the utility cleanup (ESTAE) will attempt to refresh the WLM address space.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E4001B
msg_text
explanation
    p: A
    p > span: Db2®
    p: utility has attempted to allocate a data set to the generic unit name SYSALLDA, but the allocation has failed. This dynamic allocation was attempted because the utility had been requested to perform sorts in parallel, a DFSPARM data set was present in the job JCL, the DFSPARM data set was allocated to SYSIN, and no SORTDEVT specification was supplied in the utility control statement.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: If the failing utility was REORG, and the UNLOAD phase had completed, restart the utility after taking one of the following actions:
    ul > li: Delete the DFSPARM data set from the job JCL.
    ul > li: Create a DASD data set containing the DFSORT control statements you want to use and change the job JCL to point to that data set instead of SYSIN.
    p: If the failing utility was not REORG, or if it was REORG and the UNLOAD phase had not completed, use the -TERM command to terminate the utility. Then resubmit the job after taking one of the following actions:
    ul > li: Delete the DFSPARM data set from the job JCL.
    ul > li: Create a DASD data set containing the DFSORT control statements you want to use and change the job JCL to point to that data set instead of SYSIN.
    ul > li: Use the SORTDEVT keyword in the utility control statement to specify a generic device unit name (such as SYSDA) that can be used to do the dynamic allocation.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4001b.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E4001C
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was detected while attempting to map externals to a specific file object descriptor (OBD).
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message. Either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning. Refer to
    p > a: Resource types
    p: in for an explanation of resource type codes.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4001c.html

number
    : 00E40020
msg_text
explanation
    p: The utility batch address space attempted a resource access request (RARQ) to the database address space (DBM1) but the database address space has ended or is in the process of shutting down.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Restart the failed utility job steps or terminate and resubmit them.
problem_determination
    p: It is normal for utility jobs which began when DBM1 was running, to abend with this code if the database address space terminates while the utility is running. Diagnose the issue that caused the DBM1 address space to shut down.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

    ul > li: Resubmit the utility with the RESTART parameter.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in

msg_text
explanation
    p: The internal protocols required for utility update of table the SYSIBM.SYSUTIL have been violated. Utility modifications to SYSIBM.SYSUTIL were not committed.

    div > ul > li > span: REPAIR dump of all SYSUTIL pages.

msg_text
explanation
    p: Internal protocols required for utility serialization were violated. Specifically, utility serialization cleanup was not invoked upon completion of utility processing.
    p > span: This error can happen if during utility restart, the utility control statement is modified improperly.
system_action
    p: The utility job step is terminated, placing the utility in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the TERM UTILITY command to release the resources claimed by the stopped utility, however this action might not be necessary.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: REPAIR dump of all SYSUTIL pages.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40024.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40025
msg_text
explanation
    p: Utility processing attempted to allocate resources for this utility job step. The allocate protocol has returned a nonzero return code.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to release the resources claimed by the stopped utility, but this might not be necessary.
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message. Either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning. Refer to
    p > a: Resource types
    p: in for an explanation of resource type codes.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40025.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E40027
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error has been detected while attempting to update a row of the SYSIBM.SYSUTIL table.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response

    p > a: Resource types
    p: in for an explanation of resource type codes.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

    : 00E40030
msg_text
explanation
    p: A -DISPLAY UTILITY or -TERM UTILITY command has failed in the command subsystem.
system_action
    p: Command processing is terminated. For -TERM UTILITY, all previous actions taken by the command are backed out.
operator_response

    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This error is accompanied by additional messages and/or SVC dumps that identify the failure in the utility command subsystem. Refer to this manual under those messages and/or codes for additional problem determination.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40034
msg_text
explanation
    p: The utility message generator was unable to obtain the requested storage. The available storage used to buffer messages produced by the database memory is full and a request to obtain more storage from subpool 229 failed.
system_action
    p: Utility processing abends. No SYSABEND dump or SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Refer to the prior error messages to determine how to correct the problem.
user_response
    p: This abend occurs due to a system resource limit. It might be necessary to modify the utility control statement.
    p: If the abend occurs as a result of the LOAD utility, attempt to restart the job. If failure recurs, it might be necessary to change the discard limit or correct the situation that caused many error messages to be produced.
    p: If the abend occurs as a result of the REPAIR utility, change the beginning page number to the last page number printed plus one, or change the number of pages to be dumped to a smaller number. Resubmit the job.
    p: If the abend occurs as a result of the REBUILD INDEX utility, the unique index might have to be dropped and re-created as a nonunique index. If a unique index is required and the data contains a large number of duplicates, the duplicates must be reduced before attempting to rebuild the index again.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40034.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40035
msg_text
explanation
    p: The -START ACCESS FORCE command was issued when DSNDB01.SYSUTILX was in a pending state, which prohibits further processing. The pending state was either copy or recovery pending.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Issue a -DISPLAY DATABASE command to determine the state of DSNDB01.SYSUTILX. If the state is copy pending, do a full image copy. If the state is recovery pending, use the RECOVER utility to recover DSNDB01.SYSUTILX.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer so that the pending condition can be resolved.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40035.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40040
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was returned from the DSNILREQ protocol during page level locking. This abend code is accompanied by message DSNT500I that explains the 'resource unavailable' condition.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended and the utility is placed in a stopped state.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If the conditions identified in the DSNT500I message can not be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Refer to the description for message DSNT500I.
    p: Refer to
    p > a: Resource types
    p: in for an explanation of resource type codes.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message. Then, either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and restart it from the beginning.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40040.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: A failure has occurred during an attempt to free storage.

operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can terminate the utility job step and free the resources (this might not be necessary). However, this should not be done until after the diagnostic environment has been established.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
