    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.

**start section**
number
    : 00E40051
msg_text
explanation
    p: Invalid OTYPE was passed to DSNUGMAP.
system_action
    p: The utility job step that caused the function to be requested is abended. The utility job is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can terminate the utility job step and free up any resources (this might not be necessary). However, this should not be done until after the diagnostic environment has been established.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This is an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40051.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E40053
msg_text
explanation
    p: An invalid OBID of zero was found by the module that maps external object names to OBIDs.
system_action
    p: The utility job step that caused the function to be requested is abended. The utility job is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can terminate the utility job step and free any resources (this might not be necessary). However, this should not be done until after the diagnostic environment has been established.
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: OBIDs are extracted from the
    p > span: Db2
    p: catalog. The OBID for a table space is found in the SYSIBM.SYSTABLESPACE table. The OBID for a table is found in the SYSIBM.SYSTABLES table. The OBID for a index is found in the SYSIBM.SYSINDEXES table. If the object exists, the OBID cannot be zero.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40053.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40070
msg_text
explanation
    p: A utility data set could not be opened. The abend was issued to place the utility in the stopped state for review and correction.
system_action
    p: Utility error message DSNU036I or DSNU037I was issued. to identify the DD statement associated with the DCB that could not be opened. If neither message was issued, the SYSPRINT DD statement was omitted. The utility job step is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can terminate the utility to release the held resources, but this may not be necessary.
system_programmer_response
    p: Correct the JCL, and resubmit the job.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: If the ddname is one you submitted, review and correct it. Then resubmit the job. If the ddname is one the system provided, consult the system programmer. If neither message was issued, verify that the SYSPRINT DD statement exists.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40070.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40071
msg_text
explanation
    p: An I/O error was encountered on a required OS/VS data set. An abend was issued to place the utility in a stopped state for review and correction. Resubmit the utility.
    p: This abend might also be issued by a utility that uses subtasks, if one subtask encounters an abend B37, D37, or E37 on a data set, and another subtask tries to write to the data set.
system_action
    p: One of two utility error messages (
    p > span: DSNU032E
    p: or
    p > span: DSNU040I
    p: ) is sent to the data set or device associated with the SYSPRINT DD statement of the utility job step. The error message identifies the error and the data set in error.
    p: If the abend is issued by utility subtasks,
    p > span: DSNU016I
    p: is issued instead of
    p > span: DSNU032E
    p: or
    p > span: DSNU040I
    p: .
    p: The utility is stopped at the beginning of the phase that used the OS/VS data set.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can terminate the utility and release any held resources (this might not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Problem determination depends upon which error message was directed to the data set/device identified by the SYSPRINT DD statement.
    p: If
    p > span: DSNU032E
    p: was issued, an I/O error was encountered on a required utility work data set. The message describes the error and the data set in error.
    p: If
    p > span: DSNU040I
    p: was issued, an error has occurred during BSAM access to the data set defined by the DD statement specified in the message. The DECB provided as a hexadecimal string contains the ECB in the first four bytes. The first byte of the ECB contains status bits that indicate the cause of the error.
    p: There might be an IOS (I/O subsystem) message on the MVS™ console SYSLOG indicating the type of I/O error that occurred. If an IOS message was issued, follow the problem determination directions for the message. Refer to the appropriate MVS publication for the meaning of the status bits.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: If the utility message was
    p > span: DSNU032E
    p: , the job can be restarted if an undamaged output data set is provided. Obtain an undamaged output data set, and restart the utility job step with the RESTART(PHASE) option. The job cannot be restarted if an unload data set, during the RELOAD phase of either the LOAD or REORG, is used as input instead of output.
    p: If the utility message was
    p > span: DSNU040I
    p: , determine the problem as described in Problem Determination. Then either resubmit the utility job using the RESTART option, or terminate the utility job step.
    p: If the utility message was
    p > span: DSNU016I
    p: , determine the cause of the B37, D37, or E37 abend and take the appropriate action. Normally, you will need to either allocate more storage for the data set, or change the allocation to a volume that has more space available.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40071.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40072
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was encountered while processing a BSAM data set.
system_action
    p: A message identifying the error might have been sent to the data set/device associated with the SYSPRINT DD statement of the utility job step. If no prior message was produced, a dump was requested. The utility job step that caused the function to be requested is abended. The utility job is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
    p: Notify the user or system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Review the job output and failing environment. If a message was produced to identify the error, correct the error and resubmit or restart the job. If no message was produced, then a dump should have been requested.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Problem determination depends upon which error message, if any, was directed to the data set/device identified by the SYSPRINT DD statement. If a message was produced, it describes the type of error and data set involved. Refer to the message description for information on what action to take. If no message was produced, then this might be an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: If a message was produced to identify the error, refer to that message description for the proper action. If no message can be found, then notify the system programmer.

msg_text
explanation

system_action

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00E40076
msg_text
explanation
    p: The DYNALLOC SVC returned an unexpected return code when attempting to deallocate a data set.
system_action
    p: Processing is halted.
operator_response
    p: If necessary, an operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to release the resources claimed by the stopped utility.
system_programmer_response
    p: This error may occur for a data set allocated by a JCL DD card or by a TEMPLATE utility control statement.  If the problem determination indicates an error in the way the data set was specified, fix the JCL DD card or the TEMPLATE control statement and resubmit the job.  If a problem is indicated in the I/O subsystem, then correct the problem before resubmitting the job.
problem_determination
    p: The abend code is accompanied by message DSNU031I which provides the data set name, return code and reason code values returned from the dynamic allocation request. Refer to
    p > cite > span: MVS/ESA Programming: Authorized Assembler Services Guide
    p: for a complete description of the possible return and reason codes from DYNALLOC. Error messages in the job log might give more information about the problem. Analyze these messages to determine the source of the error and the actions required to correct the error.
user_response
    p: If the problem persists, then notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40076.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40079
msg_text
explanation
    p: A utility work data set has a block size that is too small to accommodate the data to be written. An abend is issued to place the utility job step in a stopped state. This allows the error to be reviewed and corrected, and the job step to be resubmitted.
system_action
    p: Utility error message DSNU038I is directed to the device/data set identified by the SYSPRINT DD statement. The utility job step is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Utility error message DSNU038I is directed to the device/data set identified by the SYSPRINT DD statement. It gives the name of DD statement that defines the data set with the inadequate block size and gives the minimum block size in bytes.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Delete the data set in error. Change the JCL so that the block size for the data set with the ddname nominated in error message DSNU038I is at least the indicated block size. Resubmit the utility job step with RESTART(PHASE) option.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40079.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: A utility serialization LOCK or UNLOCK request has received an error from the IRLM.
    p > span: Either message DSNU099I is issued prior to this abend code to provide information about the error or message DSNI002I is issued if the problem occurred while running the START DATABASE ACCESS(FORCE) command.
system_action
    p: Either the utility job step is terminated and the utility is placed in a stopped state or the START DATABASE command abnormally terminates.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command if the user does not want to attempt to restart the utility. For the START DATABASE command, rerun the command.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p > span: For the START DATABASE command, no response is needed.
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. An attempt can be made to restart the utility or rerun the START DATABASE command.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

problem_determination
    p: This is an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.

    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00E400AE
msg_text
explanation
    p: A DSNGDALT macro invocation returned a nonzero return code. An attempt to modify a DBD by setting the OBDPSRBAFmt or OBDPIRBAFmt bit on was unsuccessful. This state is informational, indicating whether the page set is or is not in extended RBA format.
system_action
    p: Processing is abended.
operator_response
    p: If the failing utility is a REBUILD INDEX during a Disaster Recovery, this abend might be avoided by modifying the REBUILD INDEX statement. Terminate the utility and resubmit it by specifying RBALRSN_CONVERSION NONE on the REBUILD INDEX statement. Alternatively, modify the UTILITY_OBJECT_CONVERSION system parameter (DSNZPARM) to NONE until the Disaster Recovery is completed.
system_programmer_response
    p: During some Disaster Recovery scenarios DSNDB01.DBD01, DSNDB01.SYSDBDXA or their indexes might not be available yet, causing this abend code.
problem_determination
    p: This is an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    : This abend might be caused by an unavailable resource. Check for a DSNT500I message that is being issued before the abend. A dump is suppressed in this case. If no 'resource unavailable' condition is indicated, notify the system programmer.

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e400ae.html

number
    : 00E400D5
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to retrieve restart or redo information for utility processing was unsuccessful.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing abends. The abend might be accompanied by other messages. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If the abend code was received for the BACKUP SYSTEM utility, try running BACKUP SYSTEM again. If the abend occurs repeatedly, review the checkpoint frequency of each
    p > span: Db2®
    p: member and the group bufferpool checkpoint frequency. Consider adjusting them to make them uniform with each other.
    p: If register 2 or the utility job output contains an undocumented reason code, it is an internal IBM® code.
    p > span: Collect the information that is identified in the problem determination section and contact
    p > span > span: IBM Support
    p > span: .

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
user_response
    p: Check the other messages in the utility job output to determine the cause of the error. If possible, correct the problem and restart the utility. If the error prevents the utility from completing, terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning.
    p: Register 2 or the utility job output might contain a secondary
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason code that provides more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented among the other
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason codes, notify the system programmer.

    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
user_response
    p: Correct the
    p > span: "resource unavailable"
    p: condition that was identified by the
    p > span: DSNT500I
    p: message. Either restart the utility from the last checkpoint, or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning.
    p: If
    p > span: DSNT500I
    p: was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented among the other
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason codes, notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e400e0.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E400E4
msg_text
explanation
    p: An attempt to modify the catalog information was unsuccessful. The RBA_FORMAT column in SYSINDEXPART or SYSTABLEPART could not be updated. This column is informational, indicating whether the object is or is not in extended RBA format.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing abends. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
    p: If the failing utility is a REBUILD INDEX during a Disaster Recovery, this abend might be avoided by modifying the REBUILD INDEX statement. Terminate the utility and resubmit it by specifying RBALRSN_CONVERSION NONE on the REBUILD INDEX statement. Alternatively, modify the UTILITY_OBJECT_CONVERSION subsystem parameter (DSNZPARM) to NONE until the Disaster Recovery is completed.
system_programmer_response
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued and register 2 contains an undocumented reason code, it is an internal IBM® code. Collect the information that is identified in the problem determination section and contact
    p > span: IBM Support
    p: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
user_response
    : Correct the resource unavailable condition that was identified by the DSNT500I message. Either restart the utility from the last checkpoint, or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented among the other
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason codes, notify the system programmer.

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e400e4.html

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.

    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.

    p: Notify the system programmer.

    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message. Either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning. Refer to
    p > a: Resource types
    p: for an explanation of resource type codes.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40108.html

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40114.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: The data manager subcomponent of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: failed during the execution of DSNIHDFM or DSNIHIFM.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message. Either restart the utility or terminate the utility and execute it from the beginning.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.

    : 00E40121
msg_text
explanation
    p: A RDJFCB macro invocation returned a nonzero return code.
system_action
    p: Processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination

user_response
    p: This is probably a user error. A DD statement might be missing or specified incorrectly. If the DD statements appear to be correct, there might be another cause of the error and you should notify the system programmer.

    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40125.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: A delete of SYSIBM.SYSLGRNX information failed during DROP processing.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message. Either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.

msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected an error while reading the catalog history tables.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition that is identified by the DSNT500I message, terminate the utility, and start it again from the beginning.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented here, it is an internal IBM® code.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40196.html
**end section**

explanation

    p: detected an error while deleting rows from the catalog history table.

**start section**
number
    : 00E40198
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Db2®
    p: detected an error during utility processing of SYSIBM.SYSLGRNX records for log apply. A SYSLGRNX record with a log range that is a candidate for log apply was found for a member that has been destroyed. Log apply processing for this log range is not possible because the logs and BSDS for a destroyed member are not available.
system_action
    p: The utility job abends and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Use the TERM UTIL command to terminate the utility. Run the REPORT utility on all of the objects, and review the output to determine which object has a SYSLGRNX record for the destroyed member. Choose a recovery point that will not require logs from the destroyed member to recover the identified object.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40198.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E40201
msg_text
explanation
    p: RUNSTATS was unable to reposition and continue processing after a COMMIT.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

**start section**
number
    : 00E40202
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was detected while scanning a table space or index during RUNSTATS processing.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If message DSNT500I was issued, refer to that message for problem determination. Otherwise, this is an internal error.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This is an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: If message DSNT500I was issued, assure that the indicated resource is available and resubmit the job, otherwise notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40202.html

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message, terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40211.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E40212
msg_text
explanation
    p: A 'resource unavailable' condition was detected while attempting to access a catalog table during RUNSTATS processing.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended. The abend will be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the condition identified cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment and
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message and restart the utility. If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason code that will give more information about the problem. Notify the system programmer.

    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
    div: .
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message. Either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40224.html

msg_text

    p: An error occurred during the reset of an index space or table space page set or page set partition.

    p > span: If the condition identified cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response

    p > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation

user_response

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E4030D
msg_text
explanation
    p: A LOAD or REORG utility detected an index that was potentially in a physically inconsistent state, which prohibited the LOAD or REORG utility from completing its processing for that index.
system_action
    p: The utility job is abended. No SYSABEND dump or SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Message DSNU548I is issued before this abend and specifies which index was in a 'PSRDB' (page set rebuild pending) state. The LOAD or REORG utility could not process an index in such a state and abnormally terminated. 'PSRDB' is set for secondary indexes of a partitioned table space and indicates that the index might be physically inconsistent. This occurs when a
    p > span: Db2
    p: utility physically alters such an index during utility processing (that is, during the build process for that index). If the utility is unable to complete that process, the index is left in the 'PSRDB' state and must be rebuilt before
    p > span: Db2
    p: can use it.
user_response
    p: If the abend occurred during REORG utility processing, all indexes that were not built must be rebuilt using the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: Rebuild Index utility. To determine which indexes did not complete processing, use the
    p > span: Db2
    p: -DISPLAY DATABASE command with the SPACENAM and RESTRICT options. Indexes that have not completed processing are in a 'RBDP' (rebuild pending) or 'PSRBD' (page set rebuild pending) state. Terminate the failed REORG utility using the
    p > span: Db2
    p: -TERM UTIL command. Submit a job to rebuild the inconsistent indexes using the
    p > span: Db2
    p: REBUILD or RECOVER Index utility.
    p: If the abend occurred during LOAD utility processing, the data might need to be rebuilt if one or more of the indexes not built is unique. In that case, rebuilding the indexes without first rebuilding the data could cause error messages for duplicate keys to be issued during the REBUILD utility processing.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4030d.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E4030E
msg_text
explanation
    div: In REORG with SHRLEVEL CHANGE, during processing of the log, a log record is inconsistent with the table that maps between old and new RIDs. Specifically, one of these is true:
    div > ul > li: The log record implies that before an update, the data record was a pointer data record, but the mapping table implies that the data record was a regular or overflow data record.
    div > ul > li: The log record implies that before an update, the data record was a regular or overflow data record, but the mapping table implies that the data record was a pointer data record.
system_action
    p: The utility job step that caused the function to be requested abends. The utility job is placed in the stopped state.

**start section**
number
    : 00E4030F
msg_text
explanation
    p: After the last iteration of log processing, one or more index keys in the shadow copy are not unique.
    div: REORG with SHRLEVEL CHANGE operates as follows:
    div > ol > li: Unloads data from the original copy of the area (table space or partition) being reorganized
    div > ol > li: Reloads into a shadow copy of that area
    div > ol > li: Iteratively applies the log (which records applications' writing of the original copy) to the shadow copy so that the shadow copy and the original copy contain the same data
    div: If the table space has any unique indexes, those indexes will enforce uniqueness of the relevant index keys in the original copy. Those index keys should also be unique in the shadow copy.
system_action
    p: The utility job step that caused the function to be requested abends. The utility job is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: This is an internal error. Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
user_response

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4030f.html

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.

**start section**
number
    : 00E4031B
msg_text
explanation
    p: For the area (table space or partition) being reorganized, REORG with SHRLEVEL REFERENCE or CHANGE unloads data from the original data sets and reloads data into shadow data sets. REORG then exchanges the names of the original and shadow data sets, using temporary names during the renaming.
    p: The original name of a data set is in the form
    p > samp: catname.DSNDBx.dbname.psname. I0001.Annn
    p: . The shadow name of a data set is in the form
    p > samp: catname.DSNDBx.dbname.psname. S0001.Annn
    p: . The temporary name of a data set is in the form
    p > samp: catname.DSNDBx.dbname.psname. T0001.Annn
    p: . REORG uses such data sets for indexes as well as data.
    div: To exchange the names of the original and shadow data sets, REORG performs the following renaming:
    div > dl > dt: 1
    div > dl > dd: In the switch phase, it renames the original data set from the original name to the temporary name
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: In the switch phase, it renames the shadow data set from the shadow name to the original name
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: In the utilterm phase, it renames the original data set from the temporary name to the shadow name (for user-managed data sets). It deletes the temporary for
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2®
    div > dl > dd: -managed data sets.
    div: This abend code means that during the switch phase of REORG, one of these errors was detected:
    div > dl > dt: 1
    div > dl > dd: On rename 1, a data set with a temporary name already exists.
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: On rename 2, a data set with an original name already exists.
    div: These error conditions can arise for a
    div > span: Db2
    div: -managed or user-managed data set.
    p: Message DSNU360I also appears, with the name of the data set and with a context code of 1, or 2.
system_action
    p: The utility job step that caused the function to be requested abends. The utility job is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    div: Take one of the following actions:
    div > ul > li: Delete the data set and then restart the utility.
    div > ul > li: TERM the utility. Delete the data set before trying to execute REORG again with SHRLEVEL REFERENCE or CHANGE.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4031b.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E4031C
msg_text
explanation
    p: For the area (table space or partition) being reorganized, REORG with SHRLEVEL REFERENCE or CHANGE unloads data from the original data sets and reloads data into shadow data sets. REORG then exchanges the names of the original and shadow data sets, using temporary names during the renaming.
    p: The original name of a data set is in the form
    p > samp: catname.DSNDBx.dbname.psname. I0001.Annn
    p: . The shadow name of a data set is in the form
    p > samp: catname.DSNDBx.dbname.psname. S0001.Annn
    p: . The temporary name of a data set is in the form
    p > samp: catname.DSNDBx.dbname.psname. T0001.Annn
    p: . REORG uses such data sets for indexes as well as data.
    div: To exchange the names of the original and shadow data sets, REORG performs the following renaming:
    div > dl > dt: 1
    div > dl > dd: In the switch phase, it renames the original data set from the original name to the temporary name
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: In the switch phase, it renames the shadow data set from the shadow name to the original name
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: In the utilterm phase, it renames the original data set from the temporary name to the shadow name (for user-managed data sets). It deletes the temporary for
    div > dl > dd > span: Db2®
    div > dl > dd: -managed data sets.
    div: If a -TERM UTILITY is issued after any renaming, the -TERM UTILITY undoes the renaming that the REORG performed by renaming:
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: The original data set from the shadow name to the temporary name
    div > dl > dt: 5
    div > dl > dd: The shadow data set from the original name to the shadow name
    div > dl > dt: 6
    div > dl > dd: The original data set from the temporary name to the original name
    p: During REORG, or during -TERM UTILITY, an attempt to rename a data set failed due to a system problem. This error condition can arise for a
    p > span: Db2
    p: -managed or user-managed data set.
    p: Message DSNP027I also appears, with the old and new names of the data set and with other information.
system_action
    p: The job step that caused the function to be requested abends. The utility job or the -TERM UTILITY command is placed in the stopped state.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: This is an internal error. Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: IDCAMS LISTCAT output for the ICF (VSAM) catalog that contains the
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: subsystem catalog that defined the failing index or table.
    div > ul > li > span: VTOC listing of the disk volume on which the failing operation occurred.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
    div: If this condition arises during renaming 1, 2, or 3, and you can correct the problem. Choose between these actions:
    div > ul > li: Correct the problem and then RESTART the utility.
    div > ul > li: TERM the utility.
    p: If this condition arises during renaming 1, 2, or 3, and you cannot correct the problem, TERM the utility and notify the system programmer.
    p: If this condition arises during renaming 4, 5, or 6, notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4031c.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E40322
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred while attempting to add an entry to an index.
system_action
    p: Processing of the index for which the error occurred is terminated. The index is internally identified as an unavailable resource. A utility error message identifies the index for which the error occurred. An SVC dump of the database services storage is requested but will be suppressed if a previous 'resource unavailable' message has been issued to document the condition. The processing of index entries for other indexes proceeds.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.

**start section**
number
    : 00E40323
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred during the execution of a LOAD or REORG utility. Prior to this abend, error messages identifying the specific problem were issued. The abend is issued so that work data sets, which will be needed if the utility is restarted, are saved.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended. No SYSABEND dump or SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: When work data sets are used and the disposition is MOD, DELETE, and CATLG, (DISP=(MOD,DELETE,CATLG)), this abend still allows you to restart the utility. Refer to the prior error messages to determine how to correct the problem.
user_response
    p: Respond to the error messages issued prior to the abend. Correct the input and either -TERM the utility and resubmit it or resubmit the utility with the RESTART parameter.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

**start section**
number
    : 00E40324
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred during the construction of an index entry. The error occurred while extracting the key from the table space.
system_action
    p: The utility job is abended. A SYSABEND dump of batch storage and an SVC dump of the database services storage are requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This is an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

number

msg_text
explanation
    p: LOAD or REORG utility processing was attempting to retrieve COLUMN information from the SYSIBM.SYSFIELDS catalog table when an error was detected.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended. An SDUMP is requested unless this abend is accompanied by a DSNT500I message written to the SYSPRINT data set.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Correct the indicated error, if possible, and resubmit the terminated utility job with the RESTART parameter. If the problem can not be corrected, and if you suspect an error in
    p > span: Db2®
    p: ,
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: If this abend is due to an unavailable resource, message DSNT500I provides sufficient problem determination and correction information. Register 2 contains a secondary reason code that might provide additional information.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40345
msg_text
explanation
    p: The subtask performing an MVS™ sort terminated abnormally.
system_action
    p: Any error message generated by sort in conjunction with the abend is directed to the device/data set identified by the UTPRINT DD statement in the utility job step.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to release the resources claimed by the stopped utility (this might not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: This error can be caused by abend 00E40005 and error message DSNU044I issued from the subtask. If this is the case, correct the error causing the subtask to abend. In most cases, the error messages from SORT that are sent to the device/data set identified by the UTPRINT DD statement identify the problem. The dump might not be needed. If SORT is unable to open the UTPRINT data set, only the message and abend are provided. In this case, correct the problem associated with the UTPRINT DD statement, and restart the job with the RESTART(PHASE) option.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Determine the cause of the error. If the error can be corrected, the utility can be restarted from the beginning of the reload phase by using the 'RESTART(PHASE)' parameter. If the error prevents the utility from completing, the -TERM command should be issued to remove the stopped utility from the system.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40345.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40346
msg_text
explanation
    p: The LOAD or REORG subtask creating a COPY data set terminated abnormally.
system_action
    p: Any error message generated by the subtask in conjunction with the abend is directed to the device and data set identified by the SYSPRINT DD statement in the utility job step.
operator_response
    p: An operator with SYSOPR authority can issue the -TERM UTILITY command to release the resources claimed by the stopped utility (this might not be necessary).
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: This error can be caused by out of space situations on the data sets identified by the COPYDDN and RECOVERYDDN keywords. If this is the case, correct the data set allocations and restart the job with the RESTART(PHASE) option.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2®

    div: ,

msg_text

**start section**
number
    : 00E40351
msg_text
explanation
    p: LOAD RESUME YES for a table space containing a table with CLOB, BLOB or DBCLOB columns cannot be restarted in the RELOAD phase with the RESTART(PHASE) parameter.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Either terminate or restart the utility.
    p: To restart the utility: Specify the RESTART parameter on the utility job to restart at the last commit point.
    p: To terminate the utility: Use the -TERM UTILITY command to terminate the utility, then run the CHECK LOB utility to identify any LOBs in the LOB table space that are not associated with a row in the base table.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40351.html
**end section**

msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was returned by the reset function, DSNPRSPS or DSNPREST.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This abend might be accompanied by one or more DSN messages to the operator's console. The DSN messages might indicate a user error that can be corrected. If DSN messages do not accompany this message, the likely cause of the abend is an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40500.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E40517
msg_text
explanation
    p: An object descriptor block (OBD) could not be found for the object identifier (OBID) that is associated with the object descriptor. The failure occurred accessing the object descriptor for the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: Catalog.
system_action
    p: The utility job is abended. A SYSABEND dump of batch storage is requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This code identifies an internal error. The name of the control section (CSECT) that is involved is given in VRARRK5. The full CSECT name given in the dump title.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li: The DBID and OBID shown in the abend diagnostics that precede the
    div > ul > li > span: DSNU016I
    div > ul > li: message in the failing utility job step.
user_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.

explanation
