    p > span: Db2®
    p: . This abend can be issued by either the CATMAINT or the REPAIR DBD utility. The utility terminates and all work up to the time of abend is backed out.

operator_response

    p > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

number
    : 00E40601
msg_text
explanation
    p: There was a utility abend in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: database services address space (
    p > var: ssnm
    p: DBM1).
    p: This abend can be issued by either the CATMAINT or the REPAIR DBD utility. The utility terminates and all work up to the time of abend is backed out.
    p > span: This error occurs when CATMAINT receives a non-zero SQL code when issuing SQL statements to alter the catalog.
system_action
    p: The execution unit driving this function proceeds normally.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, request the SVC dump, and print the SYS1.LOGREC, and the BSDS.
system_programmer_response
    p: Check the
    p > span: DSNU778I
    p: message in the job output.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of running the CATMAINT job during a migration effort, and it is accompanied by SQL code -601, perform the following steps:
    ol > li: Terminate the CATMAINT job.
    ol > li: Fall back to the previous version of
    ol > li > span: Db2 for z/OS®
    ol > li: .
    ol > li: Drop the object name that is identified by SQL code -601.
    ol > li: Redefine the object name that is identified by SQL code -601 with IDCAMS.
    ol > li: Update to the version of
    ol > li > span: Db2 for z/OS
    ol > li: that you are migrating to.
    ol > li: Run the CATMAINT job again.
    p: If this reason code is issued as the result of running a REPAIR DBD DIAGNOSE job, you might need to report the error to IBM® software support.
problem_determination
    p: The following general purpose registers (GPRs) contain the indicated diagnostic information:
    dl > dt > strong: GPR
    dl > dd > strong: Content
    dl > dt: 2
    dl > dd: Address of the error message
    dl > dt: 7
    dl > dd: Address of CT
    p: Check the utility job output for detailed error messages and resolve them.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40601.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E40609
msg_text
explanation
    p: A DBD was encountered which is noncontiguous in the EDM pool due to prior operations and the DBD is currently accessed by users. The utility requires the DBD to be contiguous in the EDM pool.
system_action
    p: The utility that detected this condition returns
    p > span: "RESOURCE NOT AVAILABLE"
    p: to its invoker.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Allow all SQL access to this database to cease; this will allow the DBD to be flushed from the EDM pool. After all users have finished accessing the database, invoke the utility again. A contiguous DBD will be brought into the EDM pool.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40609.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00E4070A
msg_text
explanation
    p: The CHECK DATA utility detected an error during insert records processing. The data manager protocol DSNISRT returned an error.
system_action
    p: Utility processing abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: If the errors listed in the User Response section are not the cause, this is an internal error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
    div: Review the definition of the exception tables involved to determine if the following conditions are causing the error:
    div > ul > li: The exception table has referential constraints.
    div > ul > li: The exception table has unique indexes.
    div > ul > li: The exception table "table-name2" is identical with "table-name1" in the FOR EXCEPTION keyword.
    div: If none of these is the cause, notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4070a.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E4070D
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was detected while attempting to update the EPOCH column of SYSIBM.SYSTABLEPART table.
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended. The abend might be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP might be taken.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the condition cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message. Either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning. Refer to
    p > a: Resource types
    p: in for an explanation of resource type codes.
    p: If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2®
    p: reason code that gives more information about the problem. If the secondary reason code is not documented in this manual, it is an internal IBM® code.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4070d.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E4070F
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was detected during the execution of a restarted utility. A message is issued prior to this abend code to indicate the type of error.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: This abend is forced to allow restart of the utility when work data sets are used and the disposition is (MOD,DELETE,CATLG).
user_response
    p: Check messages issued prior to this abend code to determine the cause of the error. Correct the error, and restart the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e4070f.html
**end section**

    : 00E40800
msg_text
explanation
    p: When the utility performs dynamic allocation of sort data sets, the total number of data sets in each sort group must be less than 255. This reason code might be issued after message
    p > span: DSNU3341I
    p: .
system_action
    p: Utility processing abends.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Provide more disk space for sort work data sets by either adding volumes to the sort pool or by defragmenting the existing sort volumes. Then resubmit the job.
problem_determination
    p: Sort work data sets are allocated in primary quantities only, so this error occurs when the sort volumes are very fragmented or are used to their full capacity.
    p: Verify the number of free tracks and the size of the largest contiguous block of tracks on your sort volumes to see whether more volumes need to be added to the sort pool or if defragmentation is necessary. Defragmentation might be  required if many tracks are still available on each volume but the largest contiguous block is very small.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40800.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40900
msg_text
explanation
    p: The DIAGNOSE utility forced an ABEND. The specified instance of the specified utility TRACEID or message, from the DIAGNOSE ABEND utility input statement, was encountered during utility processing while DIAGNOSE mode was on.
system_action
    p: The utility is abended as requested.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The ABEND option of the DIAGNOSE utility was invoked to force an abend on a particular instance of a specified utility TRACEID or message. The instance of that TRACEID or message was encountered during utility processing while DIAGNOSE mode was active and an abend was forced to occur at that point.
user_response
    p: Continue with the diagnosis procedure in progress.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40900.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E40901
msg_text
explanation
    p: The DIAGNOSE utility failed while attempting to set the batch utility address space nonswappable.
system_action
    p: Utility processing is abended.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Determine the environment for the SYSEVENT TRANSWAP failure.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The DIAGNOSE utility attempted to set the batch utility address space nonswappable by issuing a SYSEVENT TRANSWAP operation. The operation failed to set the address space nonswappable.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output. Availability of these dumps is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Terminate the utility and restart it from the beginning. If the problem persists, wait until fewer applications are running on the system before resubmitting the job.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e40901.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: An error has been detected while attempting to map externals to a specific database descriptor (DBD).
system_action
    p: Utilities processing is abended. The abend may be accompanied by message DSNT500I. An SDUMP may be taken.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If the condition identified cannot be corrected, determine the failing environment.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: See message DSNT500I in this manual. Refer to
    p > a: Resource types
    p: in for an explanation of resource type codes.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
    div > ul > li > span: UTPRINT output, produced by utility invocation of SORT.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (for 04E and 04F abends). Availability of this dump is dependent on the failing environment.
user_response
    p: Correct the 'resource unavailable' condition identified by the DSNT500I message and either restart the utility from the last commit point or terminate the utility and start it again from the beginning. If DSNT500I was not issued, register 2 contains a secondary
    p > span: Db2
    p: reason code that will give more information about the problem.

msg_text

    p: This abend is issued by the following
    p > span: Db2®
    p: -supplied utility stored procedures:
    ul > li: DSNUTILS

**start section**
number
    : 00E50001
msg_text
explanation
    p: A latch acquisition request violates latch deadlock prevention protocols. If the request was unconditional, the execution unit owns a latch at a level equal to or greater than the level of the requested latch. If the request was conditional, the execution unit already owns a latch at the requested level. This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem error.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer of the abend.
system_programmer_response
    p: Collect the necessary diagnostic material.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This abend is issued by the in-line expansions of the latch acquisition macros DSNVLTHS and DSNVLTHX.
    div: At the time of the abend, diagnostic information has been placed in general registers 2 through 5.
    div > dl > dt > strong: Register
    div > dl > dd > strong: Contents
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: Latch class number (1-32).
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: Address of the latch.
    div > dl > dt: 4, 5
    div > dl > dd: Latch class name (1 to 8 characters, left-justified).
    p: Registers 2-12 of the invoking module were saved in the save area pointed to by register 13 at the time the error was detected.
    p: It is the responsibility of the requesting resource manager to have functional recovery in place before requesting a latch. It is expected that a record will be written to SYS1.LOGREC and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump will be requested. Examine SYS1.LOGREC and, if available, the SVC dump to determine the subcomponent and module requesting the latch.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50001.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50002
msg_text
explanation
    p: A release latch request was issued for a latch not held by the requesting execution unit. This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem error.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer of the abend.
system_programmer_response
    p: Collect the necessary diagnostic material.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This abend is issued from within the in-line expansions of the latch release macros DSNVUNLS and DSNVUNLX and from module DSNVXUL0.
    p: At the time of the abend, diagnostic information is placed in general registers 2 through 5.
    div: If the abend is issued from the in-line expansion macros, then the registers are set as follows:
    div > dl > dt > strong: Register
    div > dl > dd > strong: Contents
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: Latch class number (1-32)
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: Address of the latch
    div > dl > dt: 4, 5
    div > dl > dd: Latch class name (1-8 characters, left justified)
    div: If the abend is issued from DSNVXUL0, then the registers are set as follows:
    div > dl > dt > strong: Register
    div > dl > dd > strong: Contents
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: Latch class number (1-32)
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: Address of the latch
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: Address of the holder of the latch
    div > dl > dt: 5
    div > dl > dd: First waiter for the latch
    p: Registers 2-12 of the abending module were saved in the save area pointed to by register 13 at the time the error was detected.
    p: It is the responsibility of the requesting resource manager to have functional recovery in place while holding a latch. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump is requested. Examine SYS1.LOGREC and, if available, the SVC dump to determine the subcomponent and module requesting the latch.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50002.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50003
msg_text
explanation
    p: An execution unit that is requesting a latch already owns that latch. This is a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem error.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Collect the necessary diagnostic materials.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump is requested.

    : 00E50004
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was found while attempting to resume a waiter after a latch was released. This abend is issued when the next resource options block (ROB) to be resumed is the same as the immediately previous ROB. That is, the ROBCHNA of a ROB points to itself.
system_action
    p: The current execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Collect the necessary diagnostic materials.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    p > span: Db2

msg_text

msg_text
explanation
    p: A
    p > span: Db2®
    p: execution unit has been abended. This abend code must ultimately be issued by resource managers when the CANCEL exit is driven as a result of a suspend request.

    p: The agent cancel processing continues.
    p: Normally, this situation does not result in a dump. However, a dump might result if the situation is encountered by other resource managers, outside of
    p > span: Db2
    p: . When that happens, the dump can be ignored or suppressed.

    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem.

    p: MODE(FORCE) command. No further action is required.

    p > span > span > span: .

    p > span: Db2
    p: abends, examine the SVC dump to determine the suspended resource manager and the state of the failing subcomponent. For example, the ACEMC (must complete) bit should be off.

    p > span: Db2
    p: encountered unexpected user-created catalog index definitions that interfere with the migration process. See the information about migration job DSNTIJPM and the information about creating indexes on catalog tables in the description of CREATE INDEX.

msg_text
explanation
    p: Either the execution block (EB) or the agent services global communication area (VGCA) was invalid. The error was detected when the agent services resume function attempted to resume a TCB in an address space other than the primary of the resume requester. This is a subsystem error.

system_programmer_response

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: An entry is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump is requested by the FRR DSNVSRR. Examine the SVC dump and determine the resource manager module requesting the resume operation. Register 3 contains the SRB address. Register 5 contains the EB address. If the VGCA is invalid, its address is in register 8. The EB in question is that of the target TCB.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

number
    : 00E50015
msg_text
explanation
    p: The MVS™ control block (either RB or STSV - SRB Status Save Area) that was the intended object of a resume request was invalid. The RB or STSV address was obtained from the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: EB (execution block) at offset
    p > span: X'1C'
    p: This is a subsystem error.
system_action
    p: If the CSECT that abends is DSNVRSRB, the error is percolated (passed) to the recovery routine for the TCB that was to have been resumed. If the CSECT that abends is DSNVSR, the error is percolated to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: SRB recovery task DSNVRCT. Ultimately, the subsystem may be terminated abnormally. If the CSECT that abends is DSNVSDC0, the error will be retried one time and, if unsuccessful, the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated with a 00E50054 reason code.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: A SYS1.LOGREC entry and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump are requested by the FRR DSNVSRR and by the recovery routine in DSNVSDC0. Register 6 contains the target EB address.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

msg_text
explanation
    p: A CANCEL THREAD command caused the thread to be terminated. A dump is provided for diagnostic purposes as a result of the CANCEL command DUMP keyword.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested. Register 1 at entry to the module normally contains the ACE address. However, if register 1 at entry to DSNVTRTH is zero, then the address at register 6 is the ACE address to be terminated. That address points to the EBROB which, in turn, points to the ROBACE.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated.

    p > span: Db2
    p: .

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2

number
    : 00E50042
msg_text
explanation
    p: An execution unit which, according to tracking information, is currently suspended on a latch waiter chain is in the agent termination process. This may indicate that a latch manager request is still incomplete or has not been serviced properly. This is probably a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem error.
system_action
    p: The current execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: At the time of the abend, general register zero contains the address of the latch upon which the execution unit is supposedly waiting and general register two contains the address of the resource options block (ROB) which was put on the latch waiter chain.
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and a
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump is requested.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00E50050
msg_text
explanation
    p: The MVS™ cross-memory lock (CML) of the system services address space was held by the invoking resource manager execution unit during invocation of the cancel, suspend, resume, or SRB redispatch functions. This violates the entry protocols for these functions.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
    p: Because resource manager serialization cannot be maintained without the use of this lock, normal recovery is not possible for this abend. The recovery routine terminates the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem through invocation of the agent services subsystem termination protocol.
    p: An '00E50054' recovery reason code is placed in the SDWACOMU field of the SDWA, indicating that synchronization services was responsible for
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Internal protocols specify that no MVS locks may be held at DSNVSR or DSNVSDC0 invocation Determine the invoking resource manager, the function requested, and the current owner (ASCB) of the CML lock at the time of the error. Diagnostic information for this error may be obtained through the SYS1.LOGREC and
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump materials provided.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50050.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50051
msg_text
explanation
    p: The resource manager requesting the resume function specified the TCTL=YES option while executing in TCB mode. This violates the entry protocols for this function. This is a subsystem error.
system_action
    p: Mainline processing is abended with an '04E' abend code and this reason code.
    p: Because this error is an internal resource manager protocol violation, normal recovery is not possible for this abend. The recovery routine terminates the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem through invocation of the agent services subsystem termination protocol. An '00E50054' recovery reason code is placed in the SDWACOMU field of the SDWA indicating that synchronization services was responsible for
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Internal protocol documentation specifies that the TCTL=YES option is valid only for resource managers executing in SRB mode at time of invocation. Determine the invoking resource manager at time of error. Diagnostic information for this error may be obtained through the SYS1.LOGREC and
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump materials provided.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50051.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50052
msg_text
explanation
    p: The MVS™ cross-memory lock (CML) of the system services address space could not be released during termination processing of the cancel, suspend, resume, or SRB redispatch functions.
system_action
    p: Mainline processing is abended with an '04E' abend code and this reason code.
    p: Because resource manager serialization can no longer be maintained without the use of this lock, normal recovery is not possible for this abend. The recovery routine terminates the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem through invocation of the agent services subsystem termination function.
    p: An '00E50054' recovery reason code is placed in the SDWACOMU field of the SDWA indicating that synchronization services was responsible for
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: For this abend to occur, the CML lock must have been successfully obtained at some point during mainline processing. Determine the invoking resource manager, the function requested, and the current owner (ASCB) of the CML lock at the time of the error. Diagnostic information for this error may be obtained through the SYS1.LOGREC and
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump materials provided.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Link pack area map (LPAMAP) and nucleus load module map, obtained by executing AMBLIST.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50052.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50054
msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is abended by the synchronization services recovery routine when an unrecoverable error is encountered during recovery processing for the suspend, cancel, resume, or SRB redispatch functions. This is a subsystem termination reason code.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated. This reason code is associated with an '04F' abend code indicating that synchronization services was responsible for termination.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Scan the MVS™ system log and the contents of SYS1.LOGREC for
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends occurring immediately before the system termination message DSNV086E. Follow the failure analysis procedures for the specific abends. Refer to the appropriate CICS® documentation for information about about
    p > span: X'04F'
    p: and
    p > span: X'04E'
    p: abend completion codes.
    div: One of the following conditions was encountered during recovery processing for the requested function:
    div > ul > li: Unable to complete resume processing for an SRB mode execution unit that was suspended at time of error.
    div > ul > li: Errors were encountered during primary recovery processing causing entry to the secondary recovery routine.
    div > ul > li: Recovery initiated retry to mainline Suspend/Resume code caused retry recursion entry into the functional recovery routine.
    div > ul > li: Unable to obtain or release the cross-memory lock (CML) of the system services address space either during mainline processing or during functional recovery processing (for example, reason code '00E50051' or '00E50052').
    div > ul > li: The invoking resource manager requested the TCTL=YES option of the resume function while executing in TCB mode (for example, reason code '00E50051').
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50054.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50055
msg_text
explanation
    p: The synchronization services functional recovery routine was unable to successfully complete resume processing for a suspended TCB mode execution unit. The resume processing was requested by the cancel or resume functions. This reason code is placed in the SDWACOMU field of an SDWA.
system_action
    p: Because the suspended TCB mode execution unit must not be permitted to remain in a suspended state, the recovery routine invokes the MVS™ CALLRTM (TYPE=ABTERM) service to abend the execution unit with an '04F' completion code. Depending upon which execution unit was terminated, the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem may be abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: if necessary.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Scan the MVS system log and the contents of SYS1.LOGREC for
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends occurring immediately before the abend of the execution unit. Follow the failure analysis procedures for the specific abends. Refer to the appropriate CICS® documentation for information about X'04F' and X'04E' abend completion codes.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Link pack area map (LPAMAP) and nucleus load module map, obtained by executing AMBLIST.
user_response

number
    : 00E50059
msg_text
explanation
    p: When preparing to resume an SRB, the target EB (execution block) was validated by checking the EB identifier code in the first halfword of the control block. The identifier code was in error.
system_action
    p: If the CSECT detecting the error is DSNVSR, the error is percolated (passed) to the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: SRB recovery task DSNVRCT. Ultimately,
    p > span: Db2
    p: is terminated abnormally.
    p: If the CSECT detecting the error is DSNVSDC0, the code detecting the error will be retried once. If validation fails, the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated abnormally with a 00E50054 reason code.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .

    p > span > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    p > span: Db2
    p: dump are requested by the FRR DSNVSRR and by the recovery routine in DSNVSDC0. Register 6 contains the address of the invalid EB.

**start section**
number
    : 00E50062
msg_text
explanation
    p: An application request (RARQ) was issued to a resource access list (RAL). At the time of the request, the RAL had the RAL suppress (RALSUPPR) flag on, and the function vector list entry (FVLE) that was accessed (through FRBFVLE) did not have FVLEBIT0 on. This is not allowed. That is, the FVLE function is not allowed during RAL suppress.
    p: This error may indicate that an IMS™/VS or CICS® caller had completed Commit Phase 1 and that the next request was not Commit Phase 2, Abort, or Terminate with the Commit or Abort option. This abend is the result of an internal system problem, possibly the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: attachment facility or the requesting IMS/VS or CICS subsystem.
    p: This abend reason code is issued by the following macro: DSNARARQ
system_action
    p: The allied task requesting the RARQ is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The recovery routines of the module invoking the DSNARARQ macro should have requested SYS1.LOGREC recording and either an SVC or application dump (or both.) The FRB contains the FRBRALE and FRBFVLE entries. It also contains the pointers to the RAL and to the execution block address (FRBEB). Register 3 contains the address of the RAL from FRBRAL. Register 4 contains the address of the RALE as located by the FRBRAL pointer (and as indexed by FRBRALE). Register 6 contains the address of the EB from FRBEB.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: CICS trace listing.
    div > ul > li > span: CICS attachment facility MVS™ SNAP dump.
    div > ul > li > span: CICS transaction dump.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS trace output.
    div > ul > li > span: IMS dependent region, control region dump, or both.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50062.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E50063
msg_text
explanation
    p: A resource access request (RARQ) was issued to a function vector list entry (FVLE) that is valid but unauthorized for this allied user at this time. This abend occurs if a request is issued out of sequence. For example, two consecutive CREATE THREAD requests would give this result. This abend also occurs if a request is issued that is never authorized for the caller. For example, it occurs if a BATCH protocol user issues a PREPARE request. A program call (PC) is issued to module DSN3ABND, which issues the X'04E' abend with this reason code.
system_action
    p: The task issuing the RARQ is abended. However,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: recovery may translate this abend to a return code 256 with this reason code.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: This is a user error. The issuer of the RARQ was not authorized to use the requested function at this time. The following diagnostic information is available:
    div > ul > li: An entry in the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: trace table is made for entry to module DSN3ABND. The items traced are the RALE and the FVLE of the intended DSNARARQ request. To determine the sequence of DSNARARQ requests, examine the previous trace table entries for the same execution block (EB).
    div > ul > li: An application dump is requested with
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: -supplied control blocks. This includes the FRB associated with the intended DSNARARQ request. Fields FRBRALE and FRBFVLE contains the indexes for the intended request.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50063.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E50069
msg_text
explanation
    p: This abend code is issued during recovery processing for the suspend function when executing in SRB mode under the recovery routine established by the MVS™ SRBSTAT(SAVE) service. Because the recovery routine established by this service is the only routine in the FRR stack at the time of error, normal RTM percolation to the invoking resource manager recovery routine is not possible.
    p: After recovery processing for the initial mainline error has successfully completed, the RTM environment is exited through retry to a routine that restores the original FRR stack. This routine then issues an '04E' abend with this reason code. This causes entry into the original recovery routine established during suspend initialization.
system_action
    p: After this abend is intercepted by the original suspend recovery routine, a SYS1.LOGREC entry and
    p > span: Db2®
    p: SVC dump are requested to document the original error. The original recovery reason code is placed in the SDWACOMU field of the SDWA indicating the actions performed during recovery processing of the initial error. Control is then returned to the invoking resource manager's recovery routine through RTM percolation.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Because this abend is used only to permit the transfer of the initial recovery reason code to the invoking resource manager's recovery routine, no further recovery actions are required for this abend. Diagnostic information for the initial error encountered during mainline processing may be obtained through the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump materials provided.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50069.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E50070
msg_text
explanation
    p: This abend reason code is issued in response to a delete service task request specifying purge. Additionally, any service task not deleted by the owning resource manager at subsystem shutdown is abended with this reason code.
system_action
    p: This abend usually occurs through MVS™ CALLRTM and, in certain cases, is issued by the service task dispatcher executing under the TCB being abended. The service task is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
problem_determination
    p: If the service task is abended with a completion code of X'04F', no
    p > span: Db2
    p: SVC dump is taken. Some resource managers have elected to terminate their service tasks with the purge option. Consequently, the abend may or may not be an actual error. At the time of the abend, register 6 points to the execution block (EB) of the execution unit that was active when the abend occurred. The EBSQH field in turn contains a pointer to the service queue header associated with the abending service task.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

msg_text
explanation
    p: A deadlock condition was encountered. A request was made to either delete or synchronously execute a service task already participating in a chain of service tasks leading to the current request. This is an internal subsystem protocol error.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Using the SYS1.LOGREC entry and the associated SVC dump, determine the resource manager module that requested the function. If the recording FRR is EUS1FRRE, then the deadlock was detected by the execution unit switch service. Otherwise, the error was found during a delete service task request.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

number
    : 00E50078
msg_text
explanation
    p: A request was received to create a service task, but the service task controller is terminating. This code is also a subsystem termination reason code if the abend was issued by module DSNVCST0.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is terminated. The entire subsystem may also be terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Using the SYS1.LOGREC entry and associated SVC dump, determine the resource manager requesting the creation of a service task.
    p > span: Db2
    p: was probably already terminating when this error was encountered. New service tasks cannot be created during subsystem termination.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50078.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E50079
msg_text
explanation
    p: An invalid address space (ASCE) was specified as the target of an execution unit switch request. This can occur if the target is an allied address space or if the address space was concurrently undergoing termination.
    p: This abend code may also be issued when a passed agent services control block is determined to be invalid.
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
problem_determination
    p: Using the SYS1.LOGREC entry and the associated SVC dump, determine the resource manager module that requested the execution unit switch, suspend, resume, cancel, or SRB dispatch function. Using register 6 as a pointer to the execution block (EB), verify that the agent services control blocks (the execution block, and the ROB, or resource options block) are valid.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50079.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50080
msg_text
explanation
    p: An execution unit (SRB or TCB) processor determined that the current MVS™ Functional Recovery Routine (FRR) stack contained one or more entries for FRR's which should not exist. This check is made at the conclusion of a resource manager function executing under the SRB or TCB.
system_action
    p: An SVC dump is requested specifying an abend code of X'04E' and this reason code. The extraneous FRR entries are deleted from the stack. Execution continues. The application is not notified.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer of the SVC dump.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: MVS console data is logged and the SVC dump is taken. No record is written to SYS1.LOGREC.
    p: One or more resource manager functions created an FRR which was not deleted. Examine the current FRR stack in the PSA of the active CPU. The only valid stack entries are those established by
    p > span: Db2
    p: and MVS Dump Services and, if DSNVEUS2, an entry established by that module. The format of the FRR stack is provided as data area FRRS in the appropriate MVS debugging guides.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50080.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50081
msg_text
explanation
    p: A TCB execution unit processor determined that the list of active ESTAE exits associated with the TCB contained one or more entries for ESTAEs which should not be active. This check is made at the conclusion of a resource manager function executing under the TCB.
system_action
    p: An SVC dump is requested specifying an abend code of X'04E' and this reason code. The extraneous ESTAE entries are deleted. Execution continues. The application is not notified.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer of the SVC dump.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: MVS™ console is logged and the SVC dump is taken. No record is written to SYS1.LOGREC.
    p: One or more resource manager functions created an ESTAE exit which was not deleted. Locate the TCB requesting the dump (It will be a
    p > span: Db2
    p: service task in the home address space at the time the dump was requested.) Field TCBSTABB points to a chain of ESTAE Control Blocks (SCB) for active exits. The only valid SCBs are for the ESTAE exit established (with a token) by DSNVEUS3 and an ESTAI exit established when the task was created. SCBs are located in LSQA. The SCB format is provided as a data area in the appropriate MVS debugging guides.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50081.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50094
msg_text
explanation
    p: The macro service to get a resource options block (ROB) determined that a ROB taken from the ROB cache was not formatted properly. This can occur if the queue which controls the ROB cache was overlaid, if the ROB itself was overlaid, or if there is a programming error in
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Register zero, which should appear in the SYS1.LOGREC entry for this abend, contains the address which should have pointed to a ROB but apparently did not.
    p: Use the SYS1.LOGREC entry and the associated dump to examine the area which should have been a ROB. It may also be helpful to examine the chain of ROBs in the cache. This chain is anchored in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: DSNDVGCA control block.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    : 00E50101
msg_text
explanation
    p: The agent cancel function was unable to establish an ESTAE while preparing to cancel all active allied agents during processing of the -STOP
    p > span: DB2
    p: MODE(FORCE) command.
system_action
    p: The abend is passed on to a subsystem support subcomponent (SSS) ESTAE. Probably,
    p > span: Db2®
    p: is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: The inability to establish an ESTAE is normally due to insufficient free space in the local system queue area (LSQA) for an ESTAE control block (SCB). If necessary, increase the size of the system services address space.

number
    : 00E50500
msg_text
explanation
    p: An MVS™ LOCAL or CML lock could not be obtained during
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem abnormal termination processing.
system_action
    p: The execution unit is abended. The error is recorded on SYS1.LOGREC, and abnormal
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem termination is completed under a different execution unit if possible.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .

    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:

number
    : 00E50704
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: Service Task Controller which could not be recovered.
system_action
    p: The subsystem is terminated with this reason code. Additionally, if no SDWA was provided to the recovery routine, a subsystem termination dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: Scan the SYS1.LOGREC entries looking for one or more
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends immediately prior to the subsystem termination.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: If an SDWA was available, a
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump of the original failure was requested and should be analyzed to determine the nature of the original error. If no SDWA was available, the standard MVS™ SVC dump taken by subsystem termination must be analyzed. The Service Task Controller is the first descendent TCB of the job step TCB in the failing home address space. Refer to the appropriate CICS® documentation for information about X'04F' and X'04E' abend completion codes.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00E50705
msg_text
explanation
    div: A subsystem termination was requested for one of the following reasons:
    div > ol > li: An agent was flagged as executing in 'must complete' mode,
    div > ol > li: An execution unit holds a latch,
    div > ol > li: An agent is marked as being on a latch waiter queue, when none of these conditions should be true. Additionally, the subsystem termination may have been preceded by an abend with this reason code.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: Scan the SYS1.LOGREC entries looking for one or more
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends immediately prior to the subsystem termination.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
problem_determination
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information may be obtained through SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump materials generated at the time of the original error. Refer to the accompanying abend code to determine the failure while in 'must complete' state. Refer to
    p > a > span: Db2
    p > a: abend completion codes (X'04E' and X'04F)
    p: for information about X'04F' and X'04E' abend completion codes.
    p: If subsystem termination was requested by module DSNVEUS2, a standard MVS™ SVC dump will be generated.
    p: The 'must complete' indicator is bit ACEMC. Latch-held indicators are in field EBLTCHLD. Latch waiter status information is in field EBLWSI.
    p: Usually these conditions occur as the result of a prior failure where the associated recovery routine did not perform correct resource cleanup. The condition may also occur if a resource manager function does not release all latches and/or reset the 'must complete' bit before returning control to either DSNVEUS2 or DSNVEUS3.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50705.html

    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).

    p > span: Db2
    p: resource managers may have abended. Refer to the appropriate CICS® documentation for information about X'04F' and X'04E' abend completion codes.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred in a latch manager function and the status of one or more execution units waiting for a latch is indoubt. The latch manager functional recovery routine could not determine whether all waiting execution units had been resumed.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem terminates with this reason code.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer of the failure and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: Scan the SYS1.LOGREC entries looking for one or more
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends immediately prior to the subsystem termination.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: A
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump of the original error was requested and a record entered into SYS1.LOGREC. Refer to the appropriate CICS® documentation for information about X'04F' and X'04E' abend completion codes.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50711.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E50712
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred in a latch manager function attempting to terminate the holder of a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: latch. The holder's TCB has been set nondispatchable by MVS™ and a CALLRTM to terminate this TCB has failed.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated with this reason code.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer of the failure and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: Scan the SYS1.LOGREC entries for one or more
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends immediately prior to the subsystem termination.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: A
    p > span: Db2
    p: dump of the error is requested and a record entered into SYS1.LOGREC. Register 3 at time of error contains the latch-holder's TCB address in the home address space and register 4 contains the return code from CALLRTM. Refer to
    p > a > span: Db2
    p > a: abend completion codes (X'04E' and X'04F)
    p: for information about X'04E' and X'04F' abend completion codes.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50712.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E50713
msg_text
explanation
    p: The agent services recovery control task was entered in the suspend CANCEL exit. Subsystem termination was requested with this reason code.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem abnormally terminates.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: Scan the SYS1.LOGREC entries for one or more
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends occurring immediately prior to the subsystem termination. It may be necessary to analyze the MVS™ SVC dump requested by the subsystem termination processor.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: An MVS SVC dump was requested by the subsystem termination processor.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state

    : 00E50715
msg_text
explanation
    p: Subsystem termination was requested following an unrecoverable error in a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: SRB mode execution unit.
system_action
    p: The SRB-related task was abended as a result of SRB to TCB percolation. The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response

    p > span: Db2
    p: abends occurring immediately prior to the subsystem termination.

    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information may be obtained through SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump materials generated at the time of the original error. Refer to the appropriate CICS® documentation for information about about
    p > span: X'04F'
    p: and
    p > span: X'04E'
    p: abend completion codes.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    p > span: Db2®

    p > span > span > span: .

**start section**
number
    : 00E50719
msg_text
explanation
    p: A failure occurred in a service task, the service task controller, or the recovery control task and was not recovered by the ESTAE of the failing task. No SDWA was provided to the ESTAE exit. This is a subsystem termination reason code.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem abnormally terminates.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: Scan the SYS1.LOGREC entries for one or more
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends occurring immediately prior to the subsystem termination. Register 3 contains the abend code of the original error.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Module DSNVSTAI was unable to generate a standard
    p > span: Db2
    p: SYS1.LOGREC entry and SVC dump, because system diagnostic work area (SDWA) was not provided by the recovery termination management (RTM) facility of MVS™. An MVS SVC dump was requested by system termination. To determine the location of the error, examine the RB structure of the failing TCB.
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information may have been obtained by other recovery routines if an abend preceded the subsystem termination request. Refer to the appropriate CICS® documentation for information about X'04F' and X'04E' abend completion codes.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50719.html
**end section**

number
    : 00E50725
msg_text
explanation
    p > span: Subsystem termination was requested because of an unrecoverable error in a
    p > span > span: Db2®
    p > span: scheduled SRB-mode execution unit.
system_action
    p: The SRB-related task DSNVRCT abnormally terminated due to SRB to TCB percolation; therefore the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem abnormally terminates.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer, and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p: Scan the SYS1.LOGREC entries for one or more
    p > span: Db2
    p: abends occurring immediately prior to the subsystem termination. If necessary, analyze the MVS™ SVC dump requested by subsystem termination.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p > span: Db2
    p: diagnostic information may be obtained through SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump materials obtained as a result of abends occurring prior to subsystem termination. Refer to the appropriate CICS® documentation for information about X'04F' and X'04E' abend completion codes.
    p: An MVS SVC dump was requested by system termination. To determine the location of the error, examine the RB structure of the failing TCB. Register 1 contains the original SRB abend code.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

    ul > li: Suspend and resume
system_action
    p: The requesting execution unit terminates abnormally. A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC and an SVC dump is generated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span: Collect the information that is identified in the problem determination section and contact
    p > span > span: IBM® Support
    p > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e50ea1.html
**end section**
