**start section**
number
    : 00E60008
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code is used to indicate that MVS™ and
    p > span: Db2®
    p: dispatching units do not match. There is an internal
    p > span: Db2
    p: dispatching unit problem which should not occur.
system_action
    p: The function being traced is abended. The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem remains operational and the functional recovery of TRACE will retry if possible.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The problem is either the ASID of EB primary (EBPASCE->ASCE->ASID) did not match the EPAR ASID, or the ASID of the EB home (EBHASCE->ASCE->ASID) did not match the MVS home dispatching unit (PSAAOLD->ASCB->ASID), or the PSATOLD did not match the EBEXU field. Analyze the dump and previous SYS1.LOGREC entries do isolate the cause of the problem.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60008.html

    p: The abend is issued on the occurrence of a specified trace event. A SVC dump is taken to the
    p > span: SUS1.DUMP
    p > span > var: xx
    p: data set. Problem determination methods depend on the condition that IBM service personnel are attempting to trap.

    : 00E60154
msg_text
explanation
    p: The reason codes 00E60100 through 00E60199 are used by the instrumentation facility component (IFC) when a trace event occurs for which IBM service personnel have requested a dump using the DSN1SDMP utility.
system_action
    p: The abending agent might be retried or terminated, depending upon the serviceability dump request.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: The abend is issued on the occurrence of a specified trace event. A SVC dump is taken to the
    p > span: SUS1.DUMP
    p > span > var: xx
    p: data set. Problem determination methods depend on the condition that IBM service personnel are attempting to trap.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60154.html
**end section**

    p > span: SUS1.DUMP
    p > span > var: xx
    p: data set. Problem determination methods depend on the condition that IBM service personnel are attempting to trap.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60185.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E60800
msg_text
explanation
    p: The command was completed, but the return area was not large enough to accommodate all the output messages. The return area contains the last complete message segment that fit. The IFCABM field in the IFCA indicates the number of bytes moved to the return area. The IFCABNM field in the IFCA indicates the number of bytes which were not moved because the return area was too small.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Allocate more storage for the return area, if desired, and reissue the request.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60800.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E60802
msg_text
explanation
    p: The instrumentation facility request was partially completed, but the return area was not large enough to accommodate all the output. The return area contains the last complete record that fit. The IFCABM field in the IFCA indicates the number of bytes moved to the return area for the READS or READA request. The IFCABNM field in the IFCA indicates the number of bytes that could not fit in the return area.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Allocate more return area storage and reissue the request.

**start section**
number
    : 00E60803
msg_text
explanation
    p: No data was returned from the READA request because none was available. Either the OPn storage buffer was empty or the application program had already retrieved all the trace records.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60803.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E60804
msg_text
explanation
    div: No data was returned from the READS or READA request, or no data was returned for at least one of the requested IFCIDs on a READS request for multiple IFCIDs. This can happen for one of these reasons:
    div > ul > li: The destination OPx value specified in the IFCA was not active for a READA request.
    div > ul > li: The qualification information specified did not match a process for a READS request.
    div > ul > li: No information was available for a READS request.
    div > ul > li: The user return area on a READS or READA request was too small to receive even a single record.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: If the OPn destination was not active, then activate the OPn destination or issue the request using an OPn destination that is active.
    p: If the IFCABNM field (number of bytes not moved) is nonzero, then the user return area is too small. Increase the size of the user return area, and resubmit the request.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60804.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E60805
msg_text
explanation
    p: The request for information resulted in an abend.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: See EREP log record in SYS1.LOGREC. See the Environmental Record Editing and Printing program (EREP) User's Guide and Reference for instructions on how to print SYS1.LOGREC.
user_response
    p: Dependent upon the abend code in the log record.
    p > span: Refer to the IFCABM field in the IFCA (the number of bytes moved to the return area) to determine if partial information was returned.
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60805.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E60806
msg_text
explanation
    p: The request for information resulted in an abend, perhaps because one of the parameters on the call was invalid. If a SYSUDUMP or SYSABEND DD statement is present in your JCL, you will receive an abend dump.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: See abend code in abend dump or EREP log record in SYS1.LOGREC. Examine the parameter list. Among other possible causes, the high-order bit of the last parameter must be on in order to indicate the end of the parameter list. See the Environmental Record Editing and Printing program (EREP) User's Guide and Reference for instructions on how to print SYS1.LOGREC.
user_response
    p: Dependent upon the abend code.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60806.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E60807
msg_text
explanation
    p: The request for information resulted in an abend, possibly because either the ACE token passed was invalid or became invalid during processing. In this case, no SDUMP is taken and control returns to the application program.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the application program passes an ACE token, the token is probably invalid.
user_response
    p: If your application program does not pass a token, you can reissue the previous IFI request from the application program.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60807.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E60808
msg_text
explanation
    p: The request for information resulted in an abend. Perhaps a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: structure became invalid while your application program was using it.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: To reduce the chance of this occurring, issue requests from a task with a higher priority than
    p > span: Db2
    p: and its users. Certain requests (for example, a READS for IFCIDs 0147 and 0148) are more likely to encounter this type of problem. The request may be reissued. No SDUMP is taken and control is returned to the application program.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60808.html

    : 00E60809
msg_text
explanation
    p: An IFI READS request for the IDCID 129 record was only partially successful. The request attempted to obtain CIs that have yet to be written. All available complete CIs were returned.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: Examine the WQALLRBA and WQALLNUM fields of the READS request. (WQALLRBA + (WQALLNUM * 4KB)) > ending RBA of the last complete CI in the log.
user_response
    p: No response is needed. All available CI's were returned.

**start section**
number
    : 00E6080C
msg_text
explanation
    p: On a READS request for IFCID 316, no data was returned because no statements matched the qualification criteria. This reason code can occur when WQALFLTR = X'02' and no cached statements exceed the threshold specified in WQALFVAL. This reason code can also occur if the dynamic statement cached but no statements have yet been inserted into the cache.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Adjust the qualification criteria and reissue the request.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e6080c.html
**end section**

**start section**
number
    : 00E60812
msg_text
explanation
    p: On a READS request for IFCID 0306, log records are returned. The end-of-scope log point has been reached and no position is held in the log. The end-of-scope log point is returned in field QW0306ES, and the number of records is returned in field QW0306CT from the QW0306 section.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: A WQALMODT request to terminate the log position might be necessary to release held resources, or a WQALMODF request after a pause to initiate a first call.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60812.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E60813
msg_text
explanation
    p: On a READS request for IFCID 0306, no data is returned because no log records were found that met the criteria. No position is held in the log. The end-of-scope log point is returned in field QW0306ES and zero is returned in field QW0306CT from the QW0306 section.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: If this is caused by a WQALMODN call, issue a WQALMODF call after a pause to initiate a first call. However, there is still no guarantee that log records will be returned that meet the criteria.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60813.html
**end section**

problem_determination

    : 00E60815
msg_text
explanation
    p: On a READA or READS request for multiple members of a data sharing group, the return area was not large enough to hold all the data returned from other members. This reason code is returned in field IFCAGRSN of the IFCA.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Increase the size of the return area.

**start section**
number
    : 00E60820
msg_text
explanation
    div: The command request did not complete normally. Check the IFCABM field in the IFCA to see if any message segments have been returned. There are many reasons for this condition, including:
    div > ul > li: Command authorization failure
    div > ul > li: Command processor abend
    div > ul > li: Command syntax error
    div > ul > li: Command output limit being exceeded.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: To determine the reason for the failure, analyze the message or messages that are returned.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60820.html

**start section**

    : 00E60821
msg_text
explanation
    p: The request was not processed because a specified IFCID is not valid for the READS or WRITE function.

**start section**
number
    : 00E60828
msg_text
explanation
    p: On a READS request for IFCID 149 or 150, IRLM was not able to return all the data that was applicable to the queried agent or resource. IRLM can return a maximum of 32KB of lock data about a given agent or resource. If IRLM notifies
    p > span: Db2®
    p: that more than 32KB of lock data is applicable for a given agent or resource, then
    p > span: Db2
    p: does not request the information from IRLM. No data is returned, and reason code 00E60828 is issued by IFI.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: The READS request for IFCID 149 OR 150 continues to return code 00E60828 until less than 32KB of lock data is applicable to the given agent or resource that the READS request for IFCID 149 or 150 is querying. You can continue to issue READS requests for IFCID 149 or 150 with no guarantee that the volume of lock data has decreased.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60828.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E60849
msg_text
explanation
    p: The parameters are specified incorrectly on the IFI command request.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: If the selective dump function is not being used, check that the parameters are correctly specified on the command request. Among other possible causes, the high-order bit of the last parameter must be on in order to indicate the end of the parameter list. For assembler users, this can be done by using the VL option on the call. Another possible cause is the sixth parameter is specified on the IFI request. The sixth parameter is reserved for the selective dump function.
user_response
    p: If the selective dump function is not being used, check that the parameters are specified correctly on the IFI request. If the selective dump function is being used, notify the system programmer.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60849.html

**start section**
number
    : 00E60857
msg_text
explanation
    p: This code indicates that an IFI READS request for IFCID 185 contained an invalid WQALCDCD value.
system_action
    p: Control returns to the user program with return code 0000000C in field IFCARC1 and reason code 00E60857 in field IFCARC2.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: WQALCDCD is a user-specified field in the QUAL_AREA of an IFI READS for IFCID 185. Reissue the request with a valid WQALCDCD value. For IFI READS requests for IFCID 185, the valid values are A, Y, and N. If a value is not specified, a value of A is used as the default.

    p > span: Db2®
    p: system. The system parameter field SPRMCDC is set to 'no'.

    p: Control returns to the user program with return code 0000000C in field IFCARC1 and reason code 00E60858 in field IFCARC2.

system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Inspect system parameter SPRMCDC. If change data capture is not allowed on this system, consult with the database administrator to determine if the system parameter should be changed to 'yes' to allow
    p > span: Db2
    p: data capture processing.

msg_text
explanation
    p: On a READS request for IFCID 0254, an error was encountered while collecting statistics for a group buffer pool.

problem_determination

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    div > ul > li: An IFI proxy READS request for IFCID 0306 was issued on a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2®
    div > ul > li: data sharing member that detected that the compression dictionary data set (CDDS) is stopped for all access.
    div > ul > li: An IFI proxy READS request for IFCID 0306 was issued on a

    ol > li: Issues a message that indicates that the CDDS is logically damaged, and online CDDS recovery is needed.
    ol > li: After the CDDS is recovered, establishes a new starting log point, and restart processing of log records.

msg_text
explanation
    p: An IFI READS request for IFCID 0306 was issued on a member of a proxy
    p > span: Db2®
    p: data sharing group. The CDDS might be logically damaged.
system_action
    : The READS request fails.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: The application that issued the IFI call or the user takes these actions on a member of the proxy
    p > span: Db2
    p: data sharing group:
    ol > li: The application stops the READS request for replication.
    ol > li: The application uses the secondary reason code that was returned on the failed READS request to determine the type of CDDS access error.
    ol > li: The user collects the following information:
    ol > li > ul > li: The
    ol > li > ul > li > span: Db2
    ol > li > ul > li: console log for the member of the proxy data sharing group where capture is running.
    ol > li > ul > li: Any diagnostic dumps that are generated.
    ol > li > ul > li: The capture job log for the application that issued the IFI 306 READS request.
    ol > li: The application issues a message that indicates that online CDDS recovery is needed, if the secondary reason code indicates that the CDDS is logically damaged.
    ol > li: After the CDDS error is resolved, the user restarts the READS request for replication.

**start section**
number
    : 00E60887
msg_text
explanation
    p: The reason code is set by the Instrumentation Statistics Facility FRR routine when an abend condition occurs during statistics gathering. The reason code only appears in the VRA data of SYS1.LOGREC to indicate the WWAB block exists in the variable recording area following the standard
    p > span: Db2®
    p: information.
system_action
    p: Depending on the number of errors the Instrumentation Statistics Facility may be turned off. The FRR will attempt a retry to RTM to keep the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem operational.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: Normally the standard SYS1.LOGREC entries provide the necessary information to isolate the failing module. The WWAB control block in the variable recording area provides the resource manager RMID last called (WWABRMID) and the RMID of which resource manager Instrumentation Statistics Facility called when the failure occurred (WWABFRMS). If WWABFRMS is binary zero, then the error occurred in the Instrumentation Statistics Facility.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60887.html

msg_text

system_action
    p: All successfully retrieved data rows defined with DATA CAPTURE CHANGES are returned in the return area. number
    : 00E60903
msg_text
explanation
    p: One or more data rows marked with DATA CAPTURE CHANGES were not retrieved. In addition, there is insufficient space in the return area to hold all the data in an IFI READS request for IFCID 0185. This is a combination code for 00E60900 and 00E60802.
system_action
    p: As many complete 0185 records as can fit are returned in the return area. Also, one 0185 header record is returned for each failed data row. The reason code in field QW0185RC in the header indicates the reason for the failure.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Refer to the description of reason codes 00E60900 and 00E60802 for details.

**start section**
number
    : 00E60904
msg_text
explanation
    p: The IFI READS request for IFCID 0185 could not be executed successfully because a resource was not available. Some 0185 record instances might have been returned to the return area before the problem occurred.
system_action
    div: The last 0185 record instance returned is type D (QW0185TP = D). Field QW0185RC contains a reason code for the specific unavailable resource. In addition, the data portion (QW0185DR) of this record instance contains the following message:
    div > pre > code: UNSUCCESSFUL EXECUTION CAUSED BY AN UNAVAILABLE RESOURCE. REASON reason, TYPE OF RESOURCE type, AND RESOURCE NAME name
    div: In the message,
    div > var: reason
    div: is identical to field QW0185RC. The variables
    div > var: type
    div: and
    div > var: name
    div: identify the specific resource that is unavailable at the time.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Retrieve all returned record instances. Examine the reason code (QW0185RC) for each instance for other possible errors or warnings. Use the reason code in QW0185RC and the error message in QW0185DR to determine why the resource is unavailable.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60904.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E60A00
msg_text
explanation
    p: An outdated data description was detected. A requester specified no data description to be returned in an IFI READS request for IFCID 0185. That is, the WQALCDCD field of the qualification area is set to N, but a description change (ALTER TABLE ADD) that requires a refresh of the data description occurred.
    p: This reason code does not apply to the success or failure of the IFI request, but rather to the status of the data in the IFCID 0185 record.
system_action
    p: The system returns an IFI record with this reason code. The 0185 record instance that contains the reason code has the header portion only, and the timestamp, log RBA, and operation code fields in the header contain only zeros.
    p: This reason code is issued one time only for each table within each SQL scope.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Either use an SQL DESCRIBE statement to get the new description, or consider changing the
    p > span: IMS DataPropagator
    p: exit routine to set WQALCDCD to A or Y.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60a00.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E60A01
msg_text
explanation
    p: The data row marked with DATA CAPTURE CHANGES is rejected by the installation-defined edit procedure 'proc-name' for the object table. This reason code does not apply to the success or failure of the IFI request, but rather the status of the data in the IFCID 0185 record.
system_action
    div: The following message is returned in the data area of 0185:
    div > pre > code: VIOLATION OF INSTALLATION DEFINED EDIT PROCEDURE proc-name. REASON CODE: reason-code
    div: In the message,
    div > var: proc-name
    div: is the edit procedure name and
    div > var: reason-code
    div: is EXPLRC2 returned by the edit procedure.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Examine the edit procedure for any errors. If it is not an edit procedure error, determine the requirements imposed by the edit procedure.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e60a01.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E60A08
msg_text
explanation
    p: The following message is returned in the data portion of the data row area in the 0185 trace record:
    p > samp: COLUMN column_name ON TABLE table_name IN VIOLATION OF INSTALLATION DEFINED FIELD PROCEDURE. RT: return_code, RS: reason_code, MSG: message_token.
    div: An installation field procedure returned an error indicated by
    div > var: return_code
    div: for column
    div > var: column_name
    div: on table
    div > var: table_name
    div: . Use
    div > var: return_code
    div: to determine the problem. The
    div > var: return code
    div: can be:
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: Invalid value on decode
    div > dl > dt: 8
    div > dl > dd: Invalid parameter value
    div > dl > dt: 12
    div > dl > dd: Field procedure error on any function
    div: Use
    div > var: reason_code
    div: and
    div > var: message_token
    div: for additional information. This reason code does not apply to the success or failure of the IFI request, but to the status of the data in the IFCID 0185 record.
system_action
    p: Whenever this reason code is present in the QW0185RC field in the record header, no record is returned in the data row section for this table. The message listed above takes its place. The length of the record corresponds to the message length.

msg_text
explanation
    p: This is a warning code, and does not represent an error. For the corresponding data row with this reason code in field QW0185RC, a date or time column value was returned in the ISO format, even though the date/time installation option was specified as LOCAL. Invocation of local date and time exits is not supported for captured data. This reason code does not apply to the success or failure of the IFI request, but to the status of the data in the IFCID 0185 record.

    p: A date or time column value was returned in the ISO format even though the installation option was specified as LOCAL.

msg_text

    p > span: Db2®
    p: to IMS. Since the invalid data type cannot be returned to the Data Propagator (DPROP) exit routine, processing is terminated abnormally. This is an internal
    p > span: Db2
    p: error.
system_action
    p: An execution unit requests an SVC dump, and terminates abnormally.

    p > span: Db2
    p: table that was defined with DATA CAPTURE CHANGES. The captured data changes are reflected in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: log.
    p: Check the captured table data information returned to DPROP for propagation to determine which data type is invalid.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data

    p > span > span > a: Diagnosis Guide and Reference

    p: Register 7 is the cursor table pointer and is always restricted entirely over the relational data system (RDS) subcomponent.

msg_text
explanation

    p > span: Db2®
    p: functional recovery. If EXPLRC1=12, then the Access Control Authorization exit routine is no longer invoked and authorization checking is performed by
    p > span: Db2
    p: .

system_programmer_response
    p: If message DSNX210I has been issued to the System Console, retrieve the return code (EXPLRC1) and reason code (EXPLRC2) from this message and refer to the exit routine's documentation to determine the course of action to be taken.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: The abend with this reason code is issued because the access control authorization exit routine returned an invalid value in one of the return fields or returned a return code (EXPLRC1) of 12. The register contents at the time of abend are set as follows:
    div > ul > li: Register 3 points to the field that has the invalid value. This field may be in the EXPL or XAPL control block. The control block eye catcher will enable you to distinguish between the two.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

**start section**
number
    : 00E7000C
msg_text
explanation
    p: The application program supplied an invalid address.
system_action
    p: The application program abends.
operator_response
    p: Notify the user or system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Assist the user in determining the invalid address.
problem_determination
    div: At the time of abend the register contents are:
    div > dl > dt: R2
    div > dl > dd: A decimal code identifying the bad data:
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 1  (1)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: The bad FRB address used to locate the FRBPARM.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 2  (2)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: FRBPARM has the bad address used to locate the RDIIN.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 3  (3)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIVPARM has the bad address used to locate the SQLDA length.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 4  (4)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIVPARM has the bad address used to locate the SQLDABC.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 5  (5)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIVPARM has the bad address used to locate the SQLDA length.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 6  (6)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIAUXPA has the bad address used to locate the SQLDA length.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 7  (7)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIAUXPA has the bad address used to locate the SQLDABC.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 8  (8)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: PVDPTR has the bad address used to locate the data variable.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 9  (9)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: PVINFO has the bad address used to locate the indicator variable.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 10  (A)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: Either RDIVPARM or RDIAUXPA has the bad address used to locate the PVARS structure.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 11  (B)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIAUXPA has the bad address used to locate the SQLN.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 12  (C)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIAUXPA has the bad address used to locate the SQLDAID.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 13  (D)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIAUXPA has the bad address used to locate the SQLDABC.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 14  (E)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIAUXPA has the bad address used to locate the SQLD.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 15  (F)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: RDIAUXPA has the bad address used to locate the SQLVAR.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 16 (10)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: PVINFO has the bad address used to locate the indicator variable.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 17 (11)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: PVDPTR has the bad address used to locate the data variable.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 18 (12)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: PVDPTR has the bad address used to locate the data variable.
    div > dl > dd > dl > dt: 19 (13)
    div > dl > dd > dl > dd: PVDPTR has the bad address used to locate the data variable.
    div > dl > dt: R3
    div > dl > dd: The bad data address.
    div > dl > dt: R4
    div > dl > dd: The length of the data.
    div > dl > dt: R5
    div > dl > dd: The key of the data.
    div > dl > dt: R8
    div > dl > dd: If register 2 = 8 or 9, R8 contains the address of the RDIVPARM. If register 2 = 16 or 17, R8 contains the address of the RDIAUXPA. Otherwise, R8 contains the address of the RDIIN. This is the application's invocation parameter list. The address of the RDIIN may not be valid if the RDIIN could not be located (Register 2 = 1 or 2).
    p: The program name identifies the failing program. The statement number refers to the statement number in the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: precompiler listing. The SQL statement executed can then be found in the application program's compiler/assembler listing. For example, if the statement number is X'00E6', refer to statement number 230 in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: precompiler listing. This precompiler statement number can be cross-referenced to the program's compiler/assembler listing.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: CICS® attachment facility MVS™ SNAP dump.
    p: Use the following offsets to trace through the control blocks.
    div > strong: PVARS:
    div > div > table > thead > tr > th: Offsets
    div > div > table > thead > tr > th: Len
    div > div > table > thead > tr > th: Description
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 0 (0)
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 4
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: LENGTH OF BLOCK
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 4 (4)
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 12
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: PVENTY, OCCURS ONCE FOR EACH HOST VARIABLE IN THE SQL STATEMENT
    div > strong: PVENTRY:
    div > div > table > thead > tr > th: Offsets
    div > div > table > thead > tr > th: Len
    div > div > table > thead > tr > th: Description
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 0 (0)
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 2
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: COLUMN TYPE
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 2 (2)
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 2
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: COLUMN LENGTH
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 4 (4)
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 4
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: PVDPTR, POINTER TO HOST VARIABLE DATA
    div > div > table > tbody > tr > td: 8 (8)

msg_text
explanation
    p: During an authorization check for plan or command authorization, an execution unit switch took place to a new execution unit and the new execution unit abended.
system_action
    p: The calling execution unit is also abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. Print SYS1.LOGREC. Also print the dump from any previous dump data set if the failing module name is DSNXACKP or the dump title is 'RDS AUTHCHK'.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: See problem determination.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The module issuing this abend reason code has invoked the DSNXCHK macro to perform an authorization check for either the application plan or the command authorization. The DSNXCHK macro does a cross-memory execution unit switch to module DSNXACKP. Look for a previous dump in which the failing module name is DSNXACKP, the dump title is RDS AUTHCHK, or the failure is an allocation failure.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div: At the time of abend the register contents are:
    div > ul > li: R2 contains the first 4 characters of the exit routine name.
    div > ul > li: R3 contains the next 4 characters of the exit routine name.
    p: If the exit routine name is DSNXVDTX then DECPDLEN contains the LOCAL DATE LENGTH specified on the
    p > span: Db2
    p: Installation Application Programming Defaults Panel. The exit routine wrote beyond this length in returning a local date format to
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
    p: If the exit routine name is DSNXVTMX then DECPTLEN contains the LOCAL DATE LENGTH specified on the
    p > span: Db2
    p: Installation Application Programming Defaults Panel. The exit routine wrote beyond this length in returning a local time format to
    p > span: Db2
    p: .

number
    : 00E70020
msg_text
explanation
    p: The table name is specified using a LIKE predicate for the audit policy in the SYSIBM.SYSAUDITPOLICIES table. More than one table name match the specified LIKE predicate and at least one of these tables is not defined in the supported table space types. Only the following table space types are supported for auditing:
    ul > li: Universal table spaces
    ul > li: Traditional partitioned table spaces
    ul > li: Segmented table spaces
system_action
    p: The audit policy is started, but the table defined in the unsupported table space is not audited.
    p: This reason code is in the IFCID 0362 trace record.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: To identify the tables that are not being audited, join the SYSIBM.SYSAUDITPOLICIES, SYSIBM.SYSTABLES, and SYSIBM.SYSTABLESPACE tables on the basis of the table name (OBJECTSCHEMA and OBJECTNAME values from SYSIBM.SYSAUDITPOLICIES), excluding supported table space types.

number

msg_text
explanation
    p: Either no category is specified for the audit policy or the specified category value is invalid for the audit policy.
system_action
    p: The audit policy is not started.
    p: This reason code is in the IFCID 0362 trace record.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: If no category is defined, specify at least one category for the audit policy.
    p: If the category value is invalid, correct the category value for the specified audit policy:
    dl > dt: COLLID
    dl > dd: Specify that PACKADM authority is to be audited.
    dl > dt: DBNAME
    dl > dd: Specify that DBCTRL, DBADM, or DBMAINT authority is to be audited.
    p: If the length of the DBNAME value is greater than 8, correct the length to 8 characters or fewer.
    p: Specify the correct values and then start the audit policy.

msg_text
explanation

msg_text
explanation
    : PROGAUTH(ENABLE) was specified when the plan was bound to enable program authorization. One or more of the following objects are not defined correctly:
    ul > li: Table SYSIBM.DSNPROGAUTH
    ul > li: Index SYSIBM.DSNPROGAUTH_INDX1
system_action
    p: The request to allocate a plan to the program is denied.
operator_response

problem_determination
user_response
    p: Take the following actions:
    ol > li: If the table definition is in error, drop table SYSIBM.DSNPROGAUTH, and create SYSIBM.DSNPROGAUTH with the correct definition. Use the definition in installation job DSNTIJSG as a model.
    ol > li: Add rows to table SYSIBM.DSNPROGAUTH for programs for which you need to do program authorization.
    ol > li: If the index definition is in error, drop index SYSIBM.DSNPROGAUTH_INDX1, and create SYSIBM.DSNPROGAUTH_INDX1 with the correct definition. Use the definition in installation job DSNTIJSG as a model.
    ol > li: Rerun the program.

    div > span: Db2®
    div: for your CICS transaction. This error can be caused by the following situations:
    div > ul > li: The current CICS transaction identifier was not found in any of the resource control table (RCT) entries.
    div > ul > li: A valid authorization name was not found using the RCT entry for this CICS transaction. The AUTH= parameter in the RCT specifies up to three sources for authorization checking. None of these yielded a valid name for checking. For example, the RACF® group might have been specified, but the user was not a member of any RACF group. Or terminal identifier might have been specified, but the transaction was being run without a terminal.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Check the RCT table specifications for this transaction to determine if they are missing or incorrect. If modification is needed, change the RCT source and install the RCT again.
problem_determination
    p: You might be able to use the DSNC DISPLAY command to check for the existence of an RCT entry for this transaction. If an entry exists, refer to the RCT source. Look at the AUTH= parameter list and determine why CICS was unable to establish a valid authorization name for checking.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e70069.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00E7006A
msg_text

    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem. The
    p > span: Db2
    p: identification must be defined to the IMS control region, the DL/I batch region, and any dependent region accessing the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem.
system_action
    p: The connection is not established.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: To make the identification to the IMS regions, you must create a subsystem member (SSM) in the IMSVS.PROCLIB library and identify the SSM to the applicable IMS regions.
problem_determination
user_response

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e7006a.html

number
    : 00E70081
msg_text
explanation
    p: An SQL statement was issued, but the object that was referenced by the statement cannot be created, altered, renamed, or dropped. The object is referenced by a prepared dynamic SQL statement that is currently stored in the dynamic statement cache and is in use by an application.
system_action
    p: The requested operation is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
    p: An SQLCODE -904 is issued. The message tokens for that message report the name and type of the object that was referenced.
    p: The resource name is in the form
    p > var: statement-ID
    p: or
    p > var: member-name
    p: .
    p > var: statement-ID
    p: .
    p > var: statement-ID
    p: is the statement identifier of the statement in the dynamic statement cache that has a claim on an object that cannot be created, altered, renamed, or dropped. If the application is running in a data sharing environment,
    p > var: member-name
    p: is the name of the data sharing member on which the statement is running.
    p: If you are unable to identify the statement that is causing the error, see
    p > a: Collecting data to find a statement in the dynamic statement cache that caused another statement to fail with SQLCODE -904 with reason code 00E70081
    p: for information on how to collect the data that is necessary for identification of that statement.
user_response

    p: The application was the victim in a deadlock or experienced a timeout. RC00E70913 is the same as the SQLCODE -913. For information, refer to the SQL return code.

    p: The statement cannot be executed.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response

msg_text
explanation
    div > span > span: Db2®
    div > span: received an SQL CALL statement for a stored procedure or an SQL statement containing an invocation of a user-defined function. The statement
    div: was not accepted because the routine was stopped. Possible reasons are:
    div > ul > li: the STOP PROCEDURE ACTION(REJECT) command was issued for this procedure, or
    div > ul > li: the STOP FUNCTION ACTION(REJECT) command was issued for this user-defined function, or
    div > ul > li: there was a previous abnormal termination of the routine.
system_action
    p: The statement cannot be executed.

system_programmer_response

**start section**
number
    : 00E79002
msg_text
explanation
    div > span > span: Db2®
    div > span: received an SQL CALL statement for a stored procedure or an SQL statement containing an invocation of a user-defined function. The statement
    div: was not accepted because the procedure could not be scheduled before the installation-defined time limit expired. This can happen for any of the following reasons:
    div > ul > li: The
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: STOP PROCEDURE(name) or STOP FUNCTION SPECIFIC command was in effect. When this command is in effect, a user-written routine cannot be scheduled until a
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: START PROCEDURE or START FUNCTION SPECIFIC command is issued.
    div > ul > li: The dispatching priority assigned by WLM to the caller of the user-written routine was low, which resulted in WLM not assigning the request to a TCB in a WLM-established stored procedure address space before the installation-defined time limit expired.
    div > ul > li: The WLM application environment is quiesced so WLM will not assign the request to a WLM-established stored procedure address space.
system_action
    p: The statement cannot be executed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e79002.html
**end section**

    p: ACCESS (MAINT) is specified or, START
    p > span: DB2
    p: LIGHT (YES) is specified.

    p: stored procedure or UDF invocation failed because the host language specified in the LANGUAGE
    p > span: clause of CREATE PROCEDURE or CREATE FUNCTION
    p: did not match the language reported by Language Environment®.

    p: The attempt to call the stored procedure fails, and the procedure is marked STOP-REJ.

    p: Java routines must be run in a WLM application environment that has been set up to run Java routines. This application environment cannot be used to run non-Java routines.

operator_response

    p: Use the ALTER PROCEDURE statement if you need to change the WLM application environment.
    p: To set up a WLM application environment to run LANGUAGE JAVA routines, add a JAVAENV DD statement to the startup procedure for the stored procedure address space. The JAVAENV DD statement specifies a data set that contains environment variables for running Java routines.

    p: . The

    p: value can range from DSN00001 to
    p > span: DSN
    p > span > var: nnnnn
    p: , where
    p > var: nnnnn
    p: is the maximum value of the sequence SYSIBM.DSNSEQ_IMPLICITDB, with a default value of 10000.

    ul > li: A lock timeout exists.
    ul > li: A deadlock condition exists.
    ul > li > span: Db2
    ul > li: was unable to access catalog pages.
    ul > li: On systems that contain a large number of databases:

    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).

    p: Probable cause is that the MVS auxiliary storage management has inhibited the starting of new address spaces because of a shortage of real storage.

number
    : 00E80051
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was detected in the command that was used to start the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem. There are two conditions that can cause this error. If the -START
    p > span: DB2
    p: command is in error, this abend results.
    p: Secondly, if the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is not running (had never been started, or had been stopped), any
    p > span: Db2
    p: command that is entered is interpreted as being a -START
    p > span: DB2
    p: command. In this second case, the subsystem starts just long enough to discover that the command actually is not a -START
    p > span: DB2
    p: command and then issues the abend.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Reenter the command if it was entered in error; otherwise advise the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
    p: This error does not cause a SYS1.LOGREC record to be written or an SVC dump to be requested. A diagnostic tool (for example, MVS™ SLIP) is required to get subcomponent diagnostic information.
problem_determination
    p: Register 9 contains the address of a 12-byte field that contains the following diagnostic information: bytes 1 through 4, the address of the buffer that contains the command used to start
    p > span: Db2
    p: ; bytes 5 through 8, the general command processor return code; bytes 9 through 12, the IPC command processor return code, or 'FFFFFFFF' if bytes 5 through 8 contain a positive value.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e80051.html

number

msg_text
explanation
    p: A resource manager initialization table (RMIT) that has an invalid format was detected.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is terminated.

    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
problem_determination
    p: Register 9 contains the address of an 8-byte field that contains the name of the load module in which the invalid resource manager initialization table (RMIT) format exists.
    p: Probable cause is that the load module does not contain an RMIT or, the linkage editor entry control statement does not specify the RMIT as the module entry point.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).

    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is unable to determine the cause of the error.

number
    : 00E80150
msg_text
explanation
    p: An initialization entry point list having an invalid format was detected.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
problem_determination
    p: Register 9 contains the address of an 8-byte field that holds the name of the load module in which the invalid initialization entry point list exists.
    p: Probable cause is that the module does not contain an initialization entry point list or the linkage editor entry control statement does not specify the initialization entry point list as the module entry point.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

**start section**
number
    : 00E80151
msg_text
explanation
    p: An invalid module entry point address was detected in an initialization entry point list entry.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: The recovery routine for the CSECT issuing this reason code records information in the variable recording area (VRA).
problem_determination
    p: Register 9 contains the address of a 12-byte field that contains the following diagnostic information: bytes 1 through 8, the name of the load module that contains the initialization entry point list with the invalid entry; bytes 9 through 12, and the entry number of the initialization entry point list entry. Probable cause is that the initialization entry point list entry defines an invalid module entry point or defines a valid entry point for a module that has not been included in the loaded module.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

**start section**
number
    : 00E80170
msg_text
explanation
    p: You requested a facility that was not loaded or started at the time
    p > span: Db2®
    p: started. Whether or not to load or start a facility is contained in the DSN6FAC member in ZPARMS.
    p: This reason code is returned to the calling CSECTs by DSNYNFAC along with a return code of 8.
    p: This is not an error in DSNYNFAC. If an error exists, it might be in the calling CSECT or in the DSN6FAC member in ZPARMS.
system_action
    p: This is determined by the caller of DSNYNFAC.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: If it can be determined that DSN6FAC is in error, assemble DSN6FAC with corrections and re-link-edit the DSNZPARM load module.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of DSNZPARM module used.

**start section**
number
    : 00E90101
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code is issued when a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: directory cannot be opened. This is probably a
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem error.
    p: This abend reason code is issued by the module identified in the SYS1.LOGREC entry for this abend code.
system_action
    p: A record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain a print of SYS1.LOGREC and the SVC dump.
problem_determination
    p: This abend results when any one of a number of
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal directories cannot be opened. One customer-usable directory can also cause this abend if it cannot be opened. This is the DSNZPARM directory that is established at installation.
    p: This directory may have a name different from that specified at installation, because the customer has the option of changing the name during installation. Ensure that the DSNZPARM directory (or its equivalent) is available to be opened.
    p: If the DSNZPARM directory (or its equivalent) is available, the problem is a
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem problem.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: This abend is intercepted by an FRR or ESTAE for the subcomponent or module that issued the DSNZOPEN request. The module containing the abended request is identified in the SYS1.LOGREC entry. This information may be useful in communicating with IBM® about the problem.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of the JCL procedures used to initialize DB2 address spaces.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of DSNZPARM module used.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSPRINT output, including JCL, for the application program or batch job, and system messages that were issued. Make sure that MSGLEVEL=(1,1) on the JOB statement so that all diagnostic information is sent to SYSPRINT.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00e90101.html

    p: was attempting to create a service task during -SET SYSPARM command processing.
system_action
    p: A diagnostic record is written to SYS1.LOGREC, and an SVC dump is requested.
operator_response
    div: Notify the system programmer. Collect the following materials listed in
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain the SYS1.LOGREC and SVC dump from the operator.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

**start section**
number
    : 00F30003
msg_text
explanation
    p: An abend has occurred during an attempt to access or modify the caller-provided function request block (FRB) while executing in the caller's PSW key.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: See Problem Determination.
problem_determination
    p: This reason code is placed in register 15 during any access to an attachment-provided function request block (FRB). A subsequent X'0Cx' abend indicates an FRB addressability problem. This abend is probably the result of a logic error in the attachment facility.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.

**start section**
number
    : 00F30004
msg_text
explanation
    p: An abend has occurred during an attempt to access the attachment-provided parameter list while executing in the caller's PSW key.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: See Problem Determination.
problem_determination
    p: This reason code is placed in register 15 during any access to an attachment-provided parameter list. A subsequent X'0Cx' abend indicates a parameter addressability problem.
    p: This abend is probably the result of a logic error in the attachment facility. For call attachment users, the abend may have been caused by a bad parameter address passed to call attachment.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.

url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30004.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00F30005
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error was detected during processing of a request to establish or delete a 'termination ECB'. Either a parameter value was incorrect or an abend occurred while accessing the attachment-provided parameter list.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: See Problem Determination.
problem_determination
    p: For the nonabend case, either the ECB address was zero or the Request Code was not 'Establish' or 'Delete'. If the reason code is in register 15 on an abend, either the parameter list or a parameter value was not addressable in the caller's PSW key.
    p: The error may be the result of an internal error in the attachment facility. Call attachment users should check that the supplied ECB address is not zero and that it is addressable in their PSW key.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30005.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F30006
msg_text
explanation
    p: A failure occurred while processing the 'Subsystem Name' during connection processing. In the abend case, connection processing failed when accessing the 'Subsystem Name' in the caller's PSW key. In the nonabend case, MVS™ was unable to locate a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem with the specified name.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: See Problem Determination.
problem_determination
    p: If the named subsystem could not be found, scan the MVS system log to verify that it was initialized during MVS IPL processing.
    p: If this reason code was specified in register 15 on an abend, check that the subsystem name value is addressable in the caller's PSW key.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken in your recovery routine for abend analysis. If the named subsystem could not be found, verify that the correct subsystem name was specified. Call attachment users should note that the Translate function cannot be invoked for this reason code.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30006.html

explanation

**start section**
number
    : 00F30011
msg_text
explanation
    p: A connection or other work request was received, but the designated
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is not active. If the request was to connect to the subsystem, and the Notify Message/Startup ECB was supplied, it was not accepted.
    p: In some instances, this code may be reported if the application program issued an RRSAF IDENTIFY function request and RRS/MVS™ was not available.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain all dumps taken by the attachment facility or invoking application.
problem_determination
    div: The Notify Message or Startup ECB could not be accepted for one of two reasons.
    div > ul > li: Storage for a buffer could not be obtained, or
    div > ul > li: the length of the Message/ECB parameter was zero.
    p: In the latter case, the attachment facility is probably in error. If insufficient storage was available for a buffer, the size of the CSA in 24-bit storage should be increased.
    p: In some instances, the failure was reported because the application required an RRSAF IDENTITY request and RRS/MVS was not active. Additional checking is needed when RRS/MVS is involved.
user_response
    p: If the failure occurred on a connection request and a Notify Message/Startup ECB was provided, a dump should be taken for problem analysis. Reconnect to
    p > span: Db2
    p: when the subsystem is active again.
    p: If RRS/MVS was not available for an RRSAF IDENTITY request, ensure RRS/MVS is active and retry the request.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30011.html
**end section**

number
    : 00F30013
msg_text
explanation
    p: The requester is not authorized to connect to this
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem. This condition might indicate an attempted security violation.
system_action
    p: The connection request is denied.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the console/SYSLOG output for RACF® messages issued when a request is denied. Refer the user to your security administrator if the user should be granted authorization to a
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem.
problem_determination
    p: During TCB connection processing, Subsystem Support invokes the RACROUTE service (causing a RACF RACHECK) to verify the authorization ID associated with the requester. If the RACF return code indicates the requester is not authorized to connect to this
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem, the connection request is terminated with this reason code.
user_response
    p: Verify that you have specified the correct RACF authorization ID. If necessary, request authorization to access the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem from your security administrator.

number
    : 00F30015
msg_text
explanation
    p: The attachment facility specified an invalid combination of values of FRBRALE and FRBQUAL. No Program Request Handler exists to service the call.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain all dumps taken by the attachment facility and requesting application.
problem_determination
    p: Register 1 contains a pointer to the FRB at the entry to DSNAPRHX. The FRBRALE and FRBQUAL values in the caller's FRB should be examined to determine which one is in error. Not all combinations of valid FRBRALE and FRBQUAL values are supported. Each RALE is supported differently.

    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.

**start section**
number
    : 00F30016
msg_text
explanation
    p: The attachment facility specified an invalid FRBRALE value. The value is outside the limits of those supported for the requesting connection. This can occur in many cases, one of which is when an SQL call is requested with a blank plan name by the requester.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain all dumps taken by the attachment facility and requesting application.
problem_determination
    p: Register 1 contains a pointer to the FRB at the entry to DSNAPRHX. FRBRALE contains the invalid value that was passed. The value passed is not consistent with the resources allocated to the connected application.
    p: If the plan name contains blanks, an SQL call is invalid. The requester should respecify the plan name and issue the request again.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30016.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: An attachment facility issued a Subsystem Support request, but provided too few or too many parameters.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain all dumps taken by the attachment facility or by the requesting application.
problem_determination
    p: This failure is probably the result of a logic error in the attachment facility.
    p: Upon entry to each of the CSECTs listed above, register 1 contains the address of the Function Request Block (FRB).     p: This reason code may be returned during connection processing if the connection name is already in use by another allied address space, but the connection type is different.
    p: This reason code is not normally visible to users or operators, but may appear in
    p > span: Db2®

system_programmer_response
    p: See Problem Determination.
problem_determination
    p: All tasks within an address space connecting to the same
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem must connect with the same connection name and type. Tasks within TSO and batch address spaces using the 'BATCH' connection type may specify unequal connection names. The failure is probably the result of a logic error in the attachment facility.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30024.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00F30025
msg_text
explanation
    p: A request to establish a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: termination ECB has completed successfully; however,
    p > span: Db2
    p: is stopping. The new termination ECB might not be posted.
system_action
    p: Control is returned to the attachment facility.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Since
    p > span: Db2
    p: is stopping, you should attempt to terminate your connection. Next, issue a connect request and provide a Startup ECB. When the Startup ECB is posted, issue the connect request again to re-establish your connection to the restarted
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30025.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F30026
msg_text
explanation
    p: The attachment facility specified an invalid FRBFVLE value. The value is outside the limits of those supported for the requesting connection.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Obtain all dumps taken by the attachment facility and requesting application.
problem_determination
    p: Register 1 contains a pointer to the FRB at the entry to DSNAPRHX. FRBFVLE contains the invalid value that was passed. The value passed must not be zero and it must be consistent with the resource requested by FRBRALE.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30026.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F30027
msg_text
explanation
    p: An error occurred while processing the 'Weighting Factor' parameter. This parameter was provided by the attachment facility on a request to allocate a
    p > span: Db2®
    p: plan to the application.
    p: Either an abend occurred accessing the 'Weighting Factor' or the value of the parameter is out of range.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
operator_response

    p: See Problem Determination.
problem_determination
    p: For the abend case, this reason code is placed in register 15 to identify which parameter was not addressable in the caller's PSW key. The value of the 'Weighting Factor' must be a positive number between zero and 255. The failure is probably the result of a logic error in the attachment facility.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: A dump should be taken for problem analysis.

**start section**
number
    : 00F30028
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code is returned when previous invocations of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: have set the thread into a state such that the only acceptable request that can be made for the thread is ABORT. This could occur, for example, if the ally has issued "Prepare to Commit" and
    p > span: Db2
    p: returned a "No" vote on the call. In this situation, the only acceptable request for the ally to make is ABORT.
    p: This reason code is not normally visible to users or operators, but may appear in
    p > span: Db2
    p: traces. The ally may have produced diagnostics to report this condition, or it may handle this condition internally without requiring outside intervention.
system_action
    p: The current allied request is rejected. The state of the thread is unchanged.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: Collect any diagnostics produced by the allied address space.
problem_determination
    p: Follow the instructions indicated by the diagnostics, if any.
user_response
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30028.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F30050
msg_text
explanation
    p: A
    p > span: Db2®
    p: request has been received after a failure during a previous request and cleanup of the previous request did not complete. This can happen if
    p > span: Db2
    p: recovery was bypassed on a previous request. This bypass occurs if the application has an enabled unlocked task (EUT) FRR active and requested a retry back to the application mainline code.
system_action
    p: The request is not processed.
    p > span: Db2
    p: will terminate the connection when the TCB terminates.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: See Problem Determination.
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data should be examined for prior failures while processing a request for this connection. Users of the call attachment facility cannot retry from an EUT FRR routine if an error occurs during
    p > span: Db2
    p: processing.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: All dumps taken by the attachment facility or requesting application.
user_response
    p: You must terminate your task. Do not attempt further
    p > span: Db2
    p: requests. Do not request terminating the connection. You should request a dump for problem analysis.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30050.html

msg_text

    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem. If this error occurred during a remote connection request, examine the communications database to determine the security controls in effect for a remote connection request.
problem_determination
    p: During remote connection processing, Authorization Services invokes the RACROUTE service using the RACF RACINIT form to verify the authorization ID and password, if supplied, associated with the requester. If the RACF return code indicates the authorization ID or password could not be verified, the connection request is terminated with this reason code.
user_response
    p: Verify that you have specified the correct RACF authorization ID and password. If necessary, request authorization to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem from your security administrator.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30072.html
