msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code is returned because an allied application, or its recovery routine, attempted to issue an SQL request following an abend that could not be retried (that is, CANCEL, DETACH).
system_action
    p: Control is returned to the calling program, either the application program or its recovery routine, so that end-of-task processing can take place.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p: This reason code is issued because an allied application had an MVS™ CANCEL or DETACH issued against it and its recovery routine either retried back to the application, or did itself, try to execute another SQL statement to
    p > span: Db2®
    p: . This call is rejected to help allow the application to be processed through end-of-task processing.
problem_determination

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

    p > span: Db2
    p: problem, notify the system programmer.

    p: The data retrieved using the context_key passed via the CONTEXT SIGNON function of RRSAF is a version not supported by
    p > span: Db2®
    p: .
system_action
    p: CONTEXT SIGNON is not performed.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Determine the version number supported by the
    p > span: Db2
    p: release you are running. This is described in the description of CONTEXT SIGNON in the
    p > span: Db2
    p: Application Programming and SQL Guide. Use CTXSDTA to store the correct version of the context data associated with the current context before invoking CONTEXT SIGNON.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30099.html

    p > span: Db2®
    p: API for an agent that was currently performing syncpoint processing. This could occur if an RRSAF attached application invoked
    p > span: Db2
    p: after another control task had already initiated RRS syncpoint processing for the same
    p > span: Db2
    p: agent.
    p: After syncpoint processing has been initiated on behalf of an agent that is connected by RRSAF to
    p > span: Db2
    p: , the
    p > span: Db2
    p: API may not be used to access
    p > span: Db2
    p: until the syncpoint processing completes.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2
    p: agent.

    p > span: Db2

    p > span: Db2
    p: , another task may not initiate RRS syncpoint processing for the same agent.

    p > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p: A global transaction identifier from RRS could not be extracted for a SIGNON request. The SIGNON request was for a thread that indicated it was part of a global transaction, and that RRS was to provide the global transaction id.
system_action
    p: The application is abended.
operator_response
    p: Collect the SYS1.LOGREC and SVCDUMP, and notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This is probably either an error in
    p > span: Db2®
    p: or in RRS.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    p: If RRS has terminated, restart RRS.
problem_determination
    p: Examine the SVCDUMP to determine the cause of the RRS failure. Register zero contains the return code from the RRS ATRRWID request.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30106.html

    p > span: Db2

msg_text
explanation
    p: The ASCB for the newly created
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem services address space could not be located. The presumption is that the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem has not been started successfully. Further entry of commands to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem results in attempts to start
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_action

operator_response
    p: Retry the command. If the command fails again, notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response

number
    : 00F30217
msg_text
explanation
    p: The console ID for the MVS™ console that entered the current command is not found in the MVS unit control module (UCM) structure. This is a serious error. An internal MVS START command may have been incorrectly issued by an application program that provided invalid input parameters.
system_action
    p: The caller is abended.
operator_response
    p: Retry the -START
    p > span: DB2
    p: command. If the command fails again, notify the system programmer.

problem_determination

    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00F30218
msg_text
explanation
    p: The ERLY block for this
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is in error. The control word that manages command processing is in an undefined state. This is a serious error.
system_action
    div: The current TCB is abended. Two possible reasons are:
    div > ul > li: There is no
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem services address space. Therefore, the initial command state can safely be set in the control word, and the current command can be treated as a 'first' (-START) command. Processing of the command continues.
    div > ul > li: The system services address space ASID is known, but the state of the
    div > ul > li > span: Db2
    div > ul > li: subsystem is uncertain. In this case, the command facility is considered disabled, and message DSN3108I is returned to the issuer of the command.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the ERLY block field ERLYCMST. If the value of ERLYCMST is greater than 2, the field is in error.
problem_determination
    p: The calling TCB may have requested an SVC dump or created associated SYS1.LOGREC entries.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30218.html
**end section**

number
    : 00F30219
msg_text
explanation
    p: The ERLY block for this
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is in error. The control word that manages EOM broadcast processing is in an undefined state. This is a serious error.
system_action
    p: The calling TCB is abended.
operator_response
    p: Cancel
    p > span: Db2
    p: . (End of task processing may still work, and it does a more complete clean-up than end-of-memory processing does.) If this does not work, issue the MVS™ FORCE command for the
    p > span: Db2
    p: address spaces. If the problem is still unresolved, request a stand-alone dump and re-IPL MVS.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the ERLY block field ERLYEMST. If the value of ERLYEMST is greater than 2, it is in error.
problem_determination
    p: The calling TCB may have requested an SVC dump or created associated SYS1.LOGREC entries.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response

**start section**
number
    : 00F3021A
msg_text
explanation
    p: The ERLY block for this
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem is in error. The control word that manages identify processing is in an undefined state. This is a serious error.
system_action
    p: The calling TCB is abended.
operator_response
    p: Stop the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem and reissue the -START
    p > span: DB2
    p: command.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the ERLY block field ERLYIDST. If the value of ERLYIDST is greater than 2, it is in error.
problem_determination
    p: An SVC dump and associated SYS1.LOGREC entries are produced.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f3021a.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F3021B
msg_text
explanation
    p: A return code other than 0, 4, or 8 was received from the MVS™ internal START command processor. The presumption is that the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem has not been started successfully. Further entry of commands to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem results in further attempts to start
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_action
    p: The current -START command processing is abended. Subsequent commands are processed as though this command had not been processed.
operator_response
    p: Retry the command. If the command fails again, request a stand-alone dump and re-IPL MVS.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the SVC dump, LOGREC entries, and the console log for indications of an MVS failure.
problem_determination
    p: An SVC dump and associated SYS1.LOGREC entries are produced.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f3021b.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F3021C
msg_text
explanation
    p: Module DSN3EC0X could not establish an ESTAE during the processing of the first (presumed to be the -START command) command. The caller is abended. This can occur if the MVS™ system address space that is broadcasting the command has insufficient storage. Further entry of commands to the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem may result in a successful start of
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_action
    p: The caller is abended (without ABDUMP). The current -START command processing is terminated. Subsequent commands are processed as though this command had not been processed.
operator_response
    p: Retry the command. If the command fails again, request a stand-alone dump and re-IPL MVS.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the stand-alone dump, LOGREC entries, and the console log for indications of an MVS failure.
problem_determination
    p: A stand-alone dump is necessary.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: MVS stand-alone dump.

**start section**
number
    : 00F3021D
msg_text
explanation
    p: Module DSN3RS0X could not establish an ESTAE during either the initialization or termination of the online
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem. The caller is abended.
    p: This can occur during initialization if the MVS™ system address space that is broadcasting the first command (presumed to be the -START command) has insufficient storage. In this case, further entry of commands to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem may result in a successful start of
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
    p: This can occur during termination if the current address space (usually system services, in case of EOM broadcast, an MVS system address space) has insufficient storage. In this case, after the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem has shut down, further entry of commands to the
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem may result in a successful start of
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_action
    p: The caller is abended (without ABDUMP). The initialization is aborted, but termination proceeds.
operator_response
    p: Retry the command. If the failure persists, a re-IPL of MVS is necessary and the system programmer should be notified. A stand-alone dump should be requested first.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the stand-alone dump, LOGREC entries, and the console log for indications of an MVS failure.
problem_determination
    p: A stand-alone dump is necessary.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
    div > ul > li > span: MVS stand-alone dump.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f3021d.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F3021E
msg_text
explanation
    p: Module DSN3RTR0 could not establish an ESTAE while in the process of routing control to the actual ESTAE routine. The caller (RTM) is abended. This causes the original error to percolate to a higher-level recovery routine and causes this abend to be shown in an RTM recovery environment.
    p: This can occur if the current address space (usually an allied address space) has insufficient storage.
system_action
    p: The caller is abended (without ABDUMP).
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Examine the usage and free areas in the LSQA portion of the current address space private area. If necessary, have the size of the private area expanded.
problem_determination
    p: A SYSUDUMP is requested.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SYSABEND, SYSUDUMP, or SYSMDUMP output.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f3021e.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: Module DSN3RIM0 could not establish an ESTAE during the processing of a resolve-indoubt (RMRQ) request. This can occur if the current address space has insufficient storage. This probably leads to an abnormal termination of the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem.

    p > span: Db2

    p: and this reason code.

    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This is usually caused by a previous error that recorded data on the SYS1.LOGREC data set and requested an SVC dump. The SYS1.LOGREC entries and SVC dumps should be examined to determine the actual cause of the error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem was abended after a failure during processing of an IDENTIFY, COMMAND, or MVS™ HELP subsystem interface broadcast. The recovery routine DSN3SSES attempted to clean up processing and pass the error to the caller, but was unable to do so.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated.
operator_response
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem should be restarted.
system_programmer_response
    p: Scan the SYS1.LOGREC entries for the initial error and subsequent abends encountered by module DSN3SSES. The ESTAE DSN3SSES is established at least three times. Repetitive errors within the ESTAE module ultimately result in a subsystem termination with this reason code.
problem_determination
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response

    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f3040e.html

    p > span: Db2®

    p > span: Db2

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .

    p: This is usually caused by a previous error associated with an allied address space and especially in the case where the allied address space has been forced to an end-of-memory condition.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem was abended, because the end-of-task listening module failed during a must-complete window. End-of-task processing is considered to be in a must-complete state until an ESTAE has been established. The 'user' of this ESTAE routine was the allied end-of-task listening module DSN3EOT0.

    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated.

    p: may be started again after it terminates.

    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The recovery routine DSN3AAES has recorded data on the SYS1.LOGREC data set and requested an SVC dump. The SYS1.LOGREC entries and SVC dump(s) should be examined to determine the cause of the error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem was abended, because module DSN3SSI1 (or its caller, DSN3CL0X) was unable to establish the ESTAEs during the processing of a command SSI call. This is probably an MVS™ problem, because these modules are executing in the MVS CONSOLE address space.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated.
operator_response
    p > span: Db2
    p: may be started again after it terminates. If the failure persists, request a stand-alone dump, and re-IPL MVS.
system_programmer_response
    p: This can occur if the MVS system address space that is broadcasting the command has insufficient storage.
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p > span: Db2
    p: is unable to write a SYS1.LOGREC record or request a dump. The MVS CONSOLE function should have produced these diagnostic aids. Examine the dump to determine whether the problem is in MVS or
    p > span: Db2
    p: . Other unrelated failures in the MVS CONSOLE address space would indicate an MVS problem.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: SVC dump (or system dump), taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, as result of an operator-initiated dump command or SLIP trap exit.

problem_determination
    p: The recovery routine DSN3SSES has recorded data on the SYS1.LOGREC data set and requested an SVC dump. The SYS1.LOGREC entries and SVC dump(s) should be examined to determine the cause of the error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
user_response

msg_text
explanation
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem was abended because a
    p > span: Db2
    p: latch, critical to the Deferred End of Task (EOT) Termination process, was held by an MVS™ dispatchable unit, normally in an allied address space, which was no longer being dispatched and was, therefore, unable to release the latch.

    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem is terminated with an SVC dump.
operator_response

    p: may be started again after it terminates. The system programmer should be notified.
system_programmer_response

problem_determination

    p > span: Db2
    p: call attachment facility language interface module DSNALI. Stored procedures that run in WLM-established address spaces must be link edited with or must load the RRS attachment facility language interface module DSNRLI.

number
    : 00F30599
msg_text
explanation
    p: The allied memory function of the subsystem support subcomponent (SSAM) has attempted to remove an AGNT block (representing a connected allied coordinator task) from the chain of active AGNT blocks before all the dependent AGNT blocks have been removed. This AGNT block would normally be removed only during SSAM terminate processing or during EOT processing for the coordinator task. However, in these cases, dependents are terminated bottom up, and this situation, if it occurs, is a serious one. This message probably represents a logic error in the subsystem support subcomponent's allied memory function (SSAM).
system_action
    p: The requesting SSAM module is abended. The connection name associated with the error is probably unable to continue communication with
    p > span: Db2®
    p: until
    p > span: Db2
    p: is terminated and restarted.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer. If necessary, stop and restart
    p > span: Db2
    p: .
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: This is usually caused by a previous error that has created SYS1.LOGREC entries and requested an SVC dump. The SYS1.LOGREC entries and SVC dumps should be examined to determine the actual cause of the error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.

**start section**
number
    : 00F30905
msg_text
explanation
    p: End-of-task occurred for the job step task in an allied address space.
    p > span: Db2®
    p: would normally attempt to terminate the address space's connection to
    p > span: Db2
    p: , but it was unable to protect its processing by establishing an ESTAE (extended specify task abnormal exit). Insufficient storage might be the reason that the ESTAE could not be established.
    p: This abend code can also be issued when an allied address space is canceled or has gone through abnormal termination and
    p > span: Db2
    p: determines that the address space control element for this allied address space is not deleted or orphaned. In this case, which is not a
    p > span: Db2
    p: error, code 00F30905 is issued to provide documentation for this condition.
system_action
    p: The address space is forced to end-of-memory with this reason code.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
problem_determination
    p: Attempt to determine if any allied address spaces are storage-constrained, are canceled or have gone through abnormal termination. If an allied address space is canceled or has gone through abnormal termination, you can ignore this abend code or suppress the dump from 00F30905.
    p: Examination of the console output for the time period preceding this condition may reveal other messages or indications that the terminating allied address space was storage-constrained.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f30905.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F70407
msg_text
explanation
    div: The member name and member ID do not match in the BSDS, the XCF function data set, or the SCA structure. The following list contains possible reasons of the detected inconsistency (register 0 contains a reason code and a combination of registers 1 through 5 might contain the mismatched values):
    div > dl > dt: 1
    div > dl > dd: The member ID for this member in the BSDS data set is greater than the allowed maximum (248). Register 2 contains the member ID in the BSDS data set.
    div > dl > dt: 2
    div > dl > dd: The member name for this member ID in the SCA does not match the member name in the BSDS data set. Registers 2 and 3 contain the member name in the SCA. Registers 4 and 5 contain the member name in the BSDS data set.
    div > dl > dt: 3
    div > dl > dd: A member name saved in the SCA does not match the name saved in XCF couple data set for the same member ID. Registers 2 and 3 contain the member name in the SCA. Registers 4 and 5 contain the member name saved in the XCF couple data set. Register 7 contains the member ID.
    div > dl > dt: 4
    div > dl > dd: The member ID saved in the BSDS data set does not match what is saved in the XCF couple data set for the starting member. Register 2 contains the member ID in the BSDS data set. Register 3 contains the member ID in the XCF couple data set.
    div > dl > dt: 5
    div > dl > dd: The member ID saved in the BSDS data set does not match what is saved in the SCA structure for the starting member. Register 2 contains the member ID in the BSDS data set. Register 3 contains the member ID saved in the SCA structure.
    div > dl > dt: 6
    div > dl > dd: The starting member name is not found in the SCA entry. Registers 2 and 3 contain the starting member name.
    div > dl > dt: 7
    div > dl > dd: The data sharing group already has 248 members started for it.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem terminates.
operator_response
system_programmer_response
problem_determination
user_response
    p: Review the explanation and compare the information for member names and member IDs in the BSDS data set, XCF couple data set, and the
    p > span: Db2
    p: SCA coupling facility structure.
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f70407.html
**end section**

number
    : 00F90000
msg_text
explanation
    p: A command processor has been invoked via the application program support function while the local lock of the caller's address space was held. CSECT DSN9SCNF tried to obtain the lock in order to obtain a response message buffer, but it was unable to do so. This represents a logic error in the function that submitted the command to the application program support function.
system_action
    p: Command execution was abended. If the command was properly entered, it may have been partially or completely executed.
operator_response
    p: Print the contents of the SYS1.LOGREC data set. If a dump was produced, have it printed. It may be necessary to restart the attachment (
    p > span: IMS™
    p: or CICS®).
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data table (DDT control block) appears in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA). For additional diagnostic information, see
    p > a: X'F9......' codes
    p: .
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f90000.html

msg_text
explanation
    p: A command processor has been invoked via the application program support function. CSECT DSN9SCNF obtained the LOCAL lock of the caller's address space prior to obtaining a response message buffer, but was then unable to release the lock. This condition, if it occurs, is a serious one.

    p: Command execution was abended. If the command was properly entered, it may have been partially or completely executed.

    p > span: IMS™

number
    : 00F90004
msg_text
explanation
    p: The routines of the multiple console support (MCS) service of MVS™ detected a logic error. CSECT DSN9SCN7 received a return code from the command preprocessor (the DSN9CMD service) that indicated an intolerable condition. A return code of X'04' is issued if the DSN9CMD calling parameters are invalid (the command text length is not a positive number or the PHB address is zero).
    p: A return code of X'24' is provided if storage for a tokenized command statement (TCS) cannot be obtained from the global storage pool obtained by CSECT DSN9SCNP. The TCS storage request is the first storage request made using this pool. This is not a user error.
system_action
    p: The command was not executed.
operator_response
    p: Print the contents of the SYS1.LOGREC data set. If a dump was produced, have it printed.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data table (DDT control block) appears in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA). For additional diagnostic information, see
    p > a: X'F9......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

**start section**
number
    : 00F90006
msg_text
explanation
    p: The agent allocation routine was not able to allocate command processing capability to an agent. This failure occurs, because there is a damaged control block in global storage (CSA). The control block is the command global data area (CGDA). The address of the CGDA is in the general command processor RMFTRUSE field. This is not a user error.
system_action
    p: Agent allocation is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Print the contents of the SYS1.LOGREC data set. If a dump was produced, have it printed. It may be necessary to restart the attachment (
    p > span: IMS™
    p: or CICS®) or the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data table (DDT control block) appears in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA). For additional diagnostic information, see
    p > a: X'F9......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f90006.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00F90007
msg_text
explanation
    p: The command parsing routines have attempted to update one of the command statistical counters that are kept in local storage. However, the counter control block validation field is wrong, indicating a damaged control block. The counter control block is located via the 'CGDASTA' address in the command global data area (CGDA) control block. The CGDA address is in the general command processor RMFTRUSE field. This is not a user error.
system_action
    p: The statistical update is not completed. The statistics block address is cleared from the CGDA to prevent future failures. No further command statistical counts are maintained. Processing for the command is retried and should complete normally.
operator_response
    p: Print the contents of the SYS1.LOGREC data set. If a dump was produced, have it printed.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data table (DDT control block) appears in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA). For additional diagnostic information, see
    p > a: X'F9......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f90007.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00F90008
msg_text
explanation
    p: The recovery manager control routine has been called, but register 6 did not contain the address of an execution block (EB) on entry to DSN9SCN9. Because recovery logic requires the address of the EB, CSECT DSN9SCN9 cannot proceed. The EB hexadecimal control block identifier and the block length are compared to known values in order to validate the EB address. This is not a user error.
system_action
    p: The function requesting the recovery management service is abended.
operator_response
    p: Print the contents of the SYS1.LOGREC data set. If a dump was produced, have it printed. It may be necessary to restart the attachment (
    p > span: IMS™
    p: or CICS®) or the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data table (DDT control block) appears in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA). For additional diagnostic information, see
    p > a: X'F9......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f90008.html

**start section**
number
    : 00F90009
msg_text
explanation
    p: This reason code is used to document that CSECT DSN9SCN9 has added information to the SDWA variable recording area (VRA) following the data provided by the DSNWRCRD service. If DSN9SCN9 records a failure in SYS1.LOGREC and the reason code in the VRA is not of the form X'00F9xxxx', the reason code is changed to X'00F90009'. This is done so that anyone examining a SYS1.LOGREC entry can determine, from the reason code, what additional data has been placed in the VRA. The reason code is the first data item in the VRA, as mapped by macro IHAVRA.
system_action
operator_response
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2®
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data table (DDT control block) appears in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA). For additional diagnostic information, see
    p > a: X'F9......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f90009.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00F9000A
msg_text
explanation
    p: The command parsing routines attempted to obtain a descriptor using the DSNZGDE service of the system parameter manager but the expected descriptor was not found (the DSNZGDE return code was X'04'). All descriptors used by the parser are contained in CSECT DSN9SCNA. This failure probably indicates incorrect data in CSECT DSN9SCNA.
system_action
    p: Command execution was abended. The command was not executed.
operator_response
    p: Print the contents of the SYS1.LOGREC data set. If a dump was produced, have it printed. It may be necessary to restart the attachment (
    p > span: IMS™
    p: or CICS®) or the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data table (DDT control block) appears in the SDWA variable recording area (VRA). For additional diagnostic information, see
    p > a: X'F9......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.

**start section**
number
    : 00F9000B
msg_text
explanation
    p: The command parsing routines attempted to obtain storage from the storage pool (PHB) provided on a DSN9SCAN service request. Normally, this is CSA storage in the pool built by CSECT DSN9SCNP. The storage request could not be satisfied, either because no CSA storage was available or because an unreasonably large amount of storage was requested. The amount of storage requested is determined by the length of the command being parsed. Normally, it is several hundred bytes.
system_action
    p: Command execution is abended.
operator_response
    p: Print the contents of the SYS1.LOGREC data set. If a dump was produced, have it printed. It may be necessary to restart the attachment facility (
    p > span: IMS™
    p: or CICS®) or the
    p > span: Db2®
    p: subsystem.
system_programmer_response
    p > span > span: If you suspect an error in
    p > span > span > span: Db2
    p > span > span: , you might need to report the problem.
    p > span > span > span: For information about identifying and reporting the problem, see
    p > span > span > span > span > a: Collecting diagnostic data
    p > span > span > span: .
problem_determination
    p: The diagnostic data table (DDT control block) appears in the subsystem diagnostic work area (SDWA) variable recording area (VRA). Register 8 contains the address of the tokenized command statement (TCS) control block, and register 9 contains the requested storage length. The TCS is the
    p > span: Db2
    p: internal representation of the command text. For additional diagnostic information, see
    p > a: X'F9......' codes
    p: .
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f9000b.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00F9000C
msg_text
explanation
    p: The command preprocessor (GCPC) mainline routine (DSN9SCNP) encountered a validation error when examining the message chains returned from the command processor.
    p: The command processor invoked attempted to return a message formatted for inclusion in an MVS™ Multiple Line WTO.
system_action
    p: Command execution is abended.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: This error reflects a failure identified during
    p > span: Db2®
    p: internal protocol verification. The command in error is identified by message DSN9017I. Register 8 points to the start of the response message chain returned by the command processor. Register 9 points to the message within the message chain that was found to be in error.
problem_determination
    p: The GCPC Diagnostic Data Table (DSNDDDT Control Block) is recorded in the Variable Recording Area of the SDWA associated with the error.
    div > span: Collect the following diagnostic items:
    div > ul > li > span: Console output from the system on which the job was run, and a listing of the SYSLOG data set for the period of time that spans the failure.
    div > ul > li > span: Dynamic dump, taken to SYS1.DUMPxx data set, by
    div > ul > li > span > span: Db2
    div > ul > li > span: (04E and 04F abends).
    div > ul > li > span: Listing of SYS1.LOGREC data set, obtained by executing IFCEREP1.
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f9000c.html
**end section**
**start section**
number
    : 00F9000D
msg_text
explanation
    p: The command preprocessor (GCPC) start-up routine (DSN9SCNE) discovered that the ERLY block is out-of-date. This error indicates that the current early code is not yet compatible with this version of
    p > span: Db2®
    p: ; a required early code PTF is missing.
system_action
    p: The
    p > span: Db2
    p: subsystem start-up is terminated.
operator_response
    p: Notify the system programmer.
system_programmer_response
    p: Check the Program Directory, apply the required early code PTF and re-IPL MVS™.
problem_determination
user_response
sql_state
url
    : https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPEK_12.0.0/codes/src/tpc/00f9000d.html
**end section**
